loans.name: Poreh

texts.en: Poreh sells fresh fish in the town of Kabala.  At 27 years old, she is married with 3 children.  Her husband is a police officer whose income is insufficient to meet the family expenses.  To sell more fish to her demanding customers, Poreh would like to increase her stock and is requesting a loan of Le.1, 000,000. She wants to earn additional income and expand her fish mongering business for the purpose of providing for her children's education. Her future plan is to have the best education for her children.

loans.use: To increase her stock of fish

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is 28 years old and is a married woman with 3 children, ages 10, 6 and 2 years old. Aisha sells firewood. She started in 2007. Every day, she works from 7am to 6.30pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more firewood for her business.

loans.use: To buy more firewood for her business.

loans.name: Maria Jesus

texts.es:
María sold lunch specials in her own café, next to her home. Nonetheless, she stopped working there because her daughter, who had helped her with the business, got married. María has now rented the space to a third party and she receives monthly rent from them. María has used the loans she has received to build her home, but now her goal is to complete construction.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

María vendía menú en un local propio, al costado de su casa. Sin embargo, ella dejó esta tarea, porque su hija, quien la ayudaba en el negocio, se casó. Actualmente, María ha alquilado el local a terceras personas y recibe una renta mensual. María ha utilizado sus préstamos recibidos para construir su casa, por lo que entre sus planes está acabarla de construir.

loans.use: Complete home construction

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Mrs. Chan P. is a farmer in the Prey Vang province of Cambodia. Her husband is also a farmer, and together they earn about one dollar per day. The couple lives with five of their six children; three of whom are garment workers earning around $70 per month.

In order to enrich their farming business, the P.'s are seeking to borrow $1,200 in order to purchase a cow, beans and corn seeds to produce crops. They hope that these additional purchases will greatly help their farm to increase production.

loans.use: To purchase a cow, beans and corn seeds

loans.name: Tania Magally

texts.es:
Tania is 31 years of age and lives in the neighbourhood of Laureles Norte. Her partner is a salesman, and she helps him with the household expenses. She has 3 children of 11, 8 and 5 years of age, and she says that her plans are to finish building their home and to educate her three children. Tania has sold cosmetics for 2 years. It is this business that creates the income necessary to support her family, and this is why she works a great deal to get ahead. The loan she is asking for is to improve the infratructure of parts of her house and in this way to improve it little by little.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne, Kiva volunteer.

Tania tiene 31 años de edad, habita en el barrio Laureles Norte, su compañero de vida es vendedor y le ayuda con los gastos del hogar. Tiene 3 hijos de 11, 8 y 5 años de edad y ella cuenta que los planes son poder terminar de construir su casa de habitación y darles educación a sus tres hijos. Tania se dedica a la venta de cosméticos desde hace 2 años, y es éste negocio quien le da los ingresos necesarios para mantener a su familia, por eso trabaja mucho para sacarlo adelante. El crédito lo está solicitando para hacer mejoras de infraestructura en varias partes de su casa, y así poder ir mejorándola poco a poco.

loans.use: To improve the infratructure of her house

loans.name: Mariano

texts.es:
Mariano Lopez is 44 years old and is married to Constancia Vera. They have five children all of whom are in grade school. They live in their own home. 

Mariano has a motorcycle repair shop and sells parts. He learned the trade when he was young working with his older brother at a mechanic shop. He has had his own business for over 22 years. He wants to acquire a loan which he will use to purchase motor parts as there is a high demand for these products. In Paraguay, the sale of motorcycles has increased considerably in the last few years which makes the sale of parts for these vehicles very productive. 

Hi biggest desire is to provide for the wellbeing of his children who are the reason for his daily efforts.  Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.
Mariano L. tiene 44 años de edad, está casado con la señora Constancia Vera, tienen 5 hijos, todos ellos estudian aún en la escuela primaria de la ciudad. Viven en casa propia.
Mariano posee un taller de reparación de motos y ventas de repuestos para vehículos. Aprendió el oficio desde muy joven, trabajando con su hermano mayor en un taller mecánico. Actualmente cuenta con su propio negocio desde hace más de 22 años.
 El desea poder adquirir un crédito para utilizarlo en  la compra de repuestos para motos, ya que posee mucha demanda de estos productos. En Paraguay, la venta de motocicletas ha aumentado considerablemente en los últimos años lo que hace que la venta de repuestos para este tipo de vehículo sea muy productiva.

El mayor deseo de su corazón es la de brindar bienestar a sus hijos, el dice que son la razón de su lucha diaria.

loans.use: Purchase of various motorcycle parts.

loans.name: Faida

texts.en: Faida, 36 and married with two children aged eight and five, has been a clothing and coconut seller since 1999. Working daily from 7:30 a.m. to 6 p.m., she can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.  Faida is now requesting a loan to buy more clothes and coconuts for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and coconuts for her business.

loans.name: Ydalith

texts.es:
La Señora Ydalith, socia del Banco Comunal “Manos Unidas”, vive en la Región y Provincia D. San Martín, distrito D. Tarapoto. Se dedica a la confección D.  todo tipo D. prendas D. vestir para damas caballeros y niños y a la venta D. comida en el penal D. la ciudad. En época D. fiestas sale a vender ropa usada en los pueblos cercanos.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 1000, el cual será cancelado en 06 meses, comprará productos para la preparación D. sus platos como arroz, azúcar en saco, aceite en galón, condimentos, fideos, entre otros, así como también comprará una máquina D. moler para preparar humitas D. maíz y así surtir sus ventas, además quiere comprar telas, hilos, elásticos y botones para la confección D. las prendas que le solicitan sus clientes.

Ydalith tiene  62 años D. edad, vive con su último hijo porque los demás ya son independientes. Es una mujer positiva y emprendedora, su meta es arreglar su casa para implementar un nuevo negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ydalith, a member of the communal bank "Manos Unidas" (United Hands), lives in the San Martin Region and Province, Tarapoto district. She tailors all types of clothing for women, men, and children and sells food at the city prison. During the party season she goes out to sell used clothing in nearby villages.

With this 1000 Peruvian Soles loan, which will be paid off in 6 months, she will buy products for preparing her dishes, such as rice, sacks of sugar, gallons of oil, condiments, noodles, among other things, as well as also purchasing a grinding machine to prepare humitas D. maiz (a traditional corn snack) and with this stock up her sales. Additionally, she wants to buy cloth, thread, elastic, and buttons for sewing the clothing that her clients request.

Ydalith is 62 years old and lives with her youngest son because the others are already on their own. She is a positive and enterprising woman. Her goal is to set up her house to start up a new business.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Tatman Montgomery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy rice, sugar, oil, condiments, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Jaqueline

texts.es: La  Jacqueline  tiene la  edad 32 años habita en el sector de los ríos ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe junto a su esposo y hijos, el esposo de la señora trabaja como comerciante y agricultor  desde hace 15 años para ayudarle con los gastos de casa al igual su marido. La mayor problemática es no tener ningún apoyo con instituciones lo cual los cultivos carecen de insumos y los resultados no son los esperados. Esta señora solicita el monto C$ 7,000.00 córdobas para compra de insumos y así poder tener mejor producción, venderían a mejor precio y le darían una mejor condición de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Jacqueline is 32 years old and lives with her husband and sons in an area close to several rivers in the municipality of Ticuantepe. She works with her husband, who is a farmer and merchant since 15 years, in order to help with the house expenses. However, their biggest problem is that they do not receive any type of support from external institutions. Therefore, their crops do not get the necessary agricultural supplies and yield a meager harvest (in terms of quality and quantity). That is why Mrs Jacqueline requests C$ 7,000.00 to buy agricultural supplies (such as fertilizers and pesticides) in order improve the harvest and sell it at a higher price. This will improve their revenues and give her family a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy agricultural supplies, such as fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es: Esperanza tiene 37 años, vive con  su esposo y sus 2 hijos en la casa de sus  padres. A ella siempre le gustó el arte de tejido, lo que practicó junto a su madre , y es ahora su actividad económica, con la que ya lleva 10 años, con mucho esmero elabora diversas chompas y ropones para bebé que son muy hermosos, y cuando no tiene  pedidos de tejidos sale a vender a las ferias de su ciudad  ambulatoriamente, lo cual es muy difícil porque no tiene un puesto estable y tiene que caminar largas cuadras  para vender algo de tu mercadería. Es la primera vez solicita un préstamo con MFP, es nueva en el grupo del banco comunal. El dinero solicitado se invertirá en materia prima, para elaborar mayor cantidad de  chompas y diversos tejidos para aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Esperanza is 37 years old, she lives with her husband and 2 children in her parent's house. She has always liked the art of weaving, which she practiced together with her mother, and now it's been her economic activity for the past 10 years. With pains, she makes varied jackets and clothes for babies that are very beautiful, and when she does not have any orders for weavings, she goes to sell at the markets of her city as a traveling salesman, which is very difficult because she does not have a stable stall and she has to walk long blocks to sell some of her merchandise. It's the first time requesting a loan with MFP, and she's new in the community bank. The money requested will be invested in raw materials, to make a large quantity and diverse weavings to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Cara Gutterman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wool to make her weavings

loans.name: Faitau

texts.en: Faitau M., 34, is married with 6 children.  She has 2 years of experience in the taro plantation business. She sells to the village people and public 1 day per week. Faitau is requesting a loan of $275 to expand her plantation.  SPBD loans are Faitau’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To expand her taro plantation

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
La señora Alicia es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Brisas del Rio Blanco”, reside en la Av. 19 de Setiembre, distrito de Pilcuyo, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 24 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente y tiene un hijo, asimismo posee estudios de secundaria completa.
Trabaja desde hace tres años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, sed dedica a la compra y venta al mayor de cereales (habas, quinua, chuño) en las ferias de Ilave y Puno; su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que destinó a la compra de mas mercadería y su comercialización en la ferias de Ilave y Puno.
Con este préstamo de S/. 3000.00 Nuevos soles que le servirá como capital para poder adquirir un Molino más y dedicarse al negocio de molido de cereales (habas, quinua, cebada, etc.) asimismo ella piensa mantener su negocio de venta de cereales en las ferias de Ilave y Puno; las ganancias de su negocio lo viene invirtiendo en la educación y alimentación de su menor hijo; agradece a Manuela Ramos por su confianza y apoyo y se compromete a pagar puntualmente su préstamo en cinco cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Alicia is a member of The White River's Breezes Community Bank. She lives on 19th of September Avenue in Pilcuyo, Peru. She is a 24-year-old mother with one son and lives with her partner. She has a high school degree and has worked with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for the past three years. She makes a living buying and selling cereals (broad beans, qunioa, potato flour) wholesale at the flea markets in Ilave and Puno. Her first loan was for 300 soles, which she used to purchase more supplies and improve her business in Ilave and Puno. The current loan of 3,000 soles she is requesting will be used to acquire another mill for her cereal business, and her earnings she will used to feed and educate her young son. She thanks Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for its confidence and support, and she promises to repay her loan punctually in five months.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase another mill for her cereal business

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en: Sabina S. is married and has 3 children. She has received schooling through primary level. Sabina sells soaps at Abura, which she has done for about 3 years ago. Her husband is a mason. Sabina uses her income to pay for housekeeping expenses since her husband takes care of the family’s financial needs. Sabina will use the loan as additional capital to enable her to increase the sale of soaps to meet the increase in demand by her costumers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Sabina plans to reinvest back for the expansion of her trade.

loans.use: Sabina will use the loan as additional capital to enable her to increase the sale of soaps to meet the increase in demand by her costumers.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary O. sells akamu (pap) on a wholesale and retail basis to her customers. Akamu (pap) is a local delicacy that can be eaten with beans and bean cake. Akamu (pap) is made from corn.

She hopes for the loan amount of N70,000 to purchase more bags of corn to make akamu (pap) to sell. She also hopes to purchase one grinding machine. Mary is 48 years old and is married with eight children. She lives in Warri, Delta state, Nigeria. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of corn to make akamu (pap) and a grinding machine

loans.name: Enyonam Afi

texts.fr: Dame Afi enyonam est une résidente du quartier d’agoè assiyéyé, elle est divorcée de son mari et à 03 enfants, pour subvenir convenablement à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants elle s’est lancée dans le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale en 2007, elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé, la qualité de son accueil fait qu’elle conquiert  tous les jours de nouveaux clients. Voulant agrandir son stock elle sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 02 cartons de lait, 04 cartons de pâtes alimentaires, 02 sacs de riz, 06 bidons d’huile et divers produits d’alimentation générale.
texts.en:
Mrs. Afi Enyonam lives in the Agoè Assiyéyé neighborhood. She is divorced from her husband and has 3 children. To support herself and her children adequately, she began selling groceries in 2007. She buys her merchandise in the big open-air market in Lomé. Her warm welcome allows her to win more customers every day. Wishing to expand her inventory, she is requesting her first loan from WAGES to buy 2 cases of milk, 4 cases of pasta, 2 sacks of rice, 6 jerry cans of oil, and various other grocery products.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of groceries for re-sale

loans.name: Taiwo

texts.en: Taiwo A. is 34 years old and married with one child. He has a provision shop where he sells noodles, milk, sugar, etc. He is requesting the loan amount of 100,000 Nigerian Naira to purchase more provisions to sell. He says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
El señor Luis Alberto vive con su esposa la señora Juanita, ellos son una familia estable y unida.
El labora para una empresa en el área de mantenimiento desde hace 2 años, la señora Juanita tiene un negocio propio de abarrotes, y cuentan además con el apoyo de su hija la señorita Judith Verenice que contribuye para el pago de los gastos familiares. 
Ellos tiene un proyecto para mejora de su hogar, ya que le han ido construyendo un cuarto para ampliarse, pero solo les esta haciendo falta el techo y es por lo que solicitan este crédito.
texts.en:
Luis Alberto lives with his wife, Juanita. They are a stable and united family. He has worked for a maintenance company for two years. Juanita has her own grocery business. They also count on support from their daughter, Judith Verenice. Judith helps with the family’s expenses. They have a project to improve their home. They have been constructing a room to make the house bigger. The only thing they are lacking is the roof. That is why they are asking for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Putting a roof on the front of their house

loans.name: Diego

texts.es:
El Sr Diego M. es soltero y vive con su madre. Eel se dedica a la compra y venta de mercaderia como sabana, toalla, calzado deportivo, y accesorios de merceria.

El credito que se le otorga la Fundacion sera utulizada en la compra de los productos que el vende.  Diego sueña con abrir su local propio y dar fuente de trabajo.
texts.en:
Diego M. is single and lives with his mother. He buys and sells merchandise like sheets, towels, athletic shoes, and sewing supplies. The loan from the Foundation will be used to buy the products he sells. Diego dreams of opening his own place and providing a source of work.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sheets, athletic footwear, towels, etc.

loans.name: Muzafar

texts.ru:
Музафар Мусоева очень добрая и отзывчивая женщина. Торгует на рынке. Она замужем, имеет 3 детей: сына и 2 дочерей. Ее муж Одил Мусоев тоже микропредприниматель, он продает сухофрукты на рынке. 
 Музафар имеет небольшой ассртимент товара, это носки и мужское нижнее белье. Музафар хочет разнообразить свой ассортимент, и закупить дополнительно к своему товару женское нижнее белье. Для этого она подала заявку, чтобы получить кредит.
 Стаж ее работы в сфере микропредпринимательской деятельности 15 лет. В этом бизнесе, ей помогает дочь Дилноза. На снимке сама Музафар и ее дочь Дилноза, возможно уже будующая предпринимательница. Похожа на свою маму, не так ли?
texts.en:
Muzafar M. is a very kind and caring woman. She is involved in sales at a market. She is married and has 3 children: a son and 2 daughters. Muzafar’s husband, Odil, is also an entrepreneur. He sells dried fruits at the market. Muzafar has a small assortment of merchandise that includes socks and men’s undergarments. She wants to vary her merchandise by adding women’s underwear to her assortment. This is why Muzafar requested a loan. Muzafar has been an entrepreneur for 15 years. Her daughter, Dilnoza, helps her with the business. The photograph shows Muzafar and her daughter, Dilnoza (possibly the future entrepreneur). Doesn’t she resemble her mother?

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of women's underwear

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es: La Sra. Esperanza P. Q., tiene como actividad económica la fabricación de azas para ollas, cacerolas, sartenes y otras, las cuales distribuye a las diferentes fabricas de ollas, actividad que realiza juntamente con su hija y un empleado que le ayudan en dicha actividad, que es la fuente de ingreso para ella y su familia; se encuentra separada de su esposo.
texts.en:
Esperanza P. Q.’s economic activity is making handles for pots, saucepans, frying pans, etc., which she distributes to different kitchenware factories. She performs this activity together with her daughter and an employee who helps them. This business is the source of income for her and her family; she is currently separated from her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing a compressor and tools for her workshop

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn O. is from the village of Panta-on, Ozamiz City. She is 34 years old. Jocelyn is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Jocelyn owns & operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. Jocelyn has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Jocelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jocelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Jocelyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children and for family needs. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops

loans.name: God's Gift Group

texts.en: Jenefer is a 54-year-old mother of five children who has been involved in the retail sale of dry goods (rice, oil, onions, various seasonings, etc.) for the past 25 years now. Her greatest challenge has been financial. She’s progressing gradually in the business and dreams of buying more goods to be added to her business inventory to enable her to educate all of her children.

loans.use: buying rice, oil, etc. for resale

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 32 years old and married with three children. She lives in Warri, Delta State, Nigeria. She sells tailoring materials. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 70,000 NGN to purchase more tailoring materials to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials to sell

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: S., age 24, is garment worker living in the best territory of Phnom Penh. She is married to Thear, age 25, who is a local farmer. He climbs palm trees as well as cultivates rice. They have one young child who is enrolled in school. The rice growing season is coming and S.’ husband lacks some of the farming tools that could ease his hard labor on the farm. Therefore, S. requests a loan of $600 to help buy a cow for her husband which he can use to plow the farmland.  Then they will raise its offspring. S. and her husband are pictured.

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Mrs. Felicidad S. is 57 years of age. She live in Tabon, Jose Dalman and has four children. One of her children is married and the other three are already working.

Mrs. S. is a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative, which could be described as PAGLAUM DEVELOPMENT PROGRAM FOR LANDLESS PEOPLE. She has been a member for two years now.

She is happy to be a member of this program because it can help her raise additional capital for her business. It can also help with life insurance and savings deposits. She is already on her third cycle of loans.

She deeply wishes that her little business will succeed.

loans.use: Additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John has been in the welding business for the last 20 years and he operates his welding shop in Naivasha town.  

He is 50 years old, married and has four school going children.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan.  He plans to buy a new welding machine with the proceeds of this loan.

In future, he sees himself operating a big workshop and also venturing into selling welding supplies.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: Buy a new welding machine

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela M. is from the village of Poblacion Manticao, Misamis Oriental. She is 57 years old. Adela is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Adela owns and operates a tailoring business where she providers alterations and tailoring services to local community members. Adela has been engaged in her business for over 25 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Adela joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Adela is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fabrics and materials. This will be Adela's first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fabrics & materials

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen H. is from the village of Panduma, Tukuran Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 50 years old. Carmen is married and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Carmen operates a specialized retail store and her main source of income from the business comes from selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. Carmen has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Carmen joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation with the ability to engage in business. Carmen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional fish to sell. Carmen is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Carmen from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Yasmina

texts.es:
La socia YASMINA pertenece al banco comunal “HATUN S.”. El nombre del banco comunal es de origen del idioma Quechua, “HATUN” significa “Grande” y “S.” significa “Corazón” que traducido al español significa “Corazón grande”.

La socia tiene 30 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene un hijo varón de un año y ellos viven en la ciudad Imperial del Cusco. La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el pequeño negocio de lavandería, nuestra socia tiene un convenio con hoteles de la ciudad, los hoteles llevan a su lavandería de la socia a lavar sabanas, cubre camas, manteles y ropa de los turistas que se hospedan en los hoteles. Ya son varios años con esta actividad y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo, nuestra socia es una mujer luchadora y emprendedora pues con mucha voluntad se dedica al negocio y piensa en aumentar su capital de negocio comprando más productos como detergente para lavar más ropa.     
 
La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Yasmina belongs to the community bank "Hatun S.", which means "Big Heart" in the Incan language of Quechua. Yasmina is 30 years old, is in a common law marriage, and has a one year old son. They live in the imperial city of Cusco. Yasmina balances the running the household with the responsibilities of her small laundry business. She has an arrangement with the hotels of the city in which the hotels bring their laundry and she washes the sheets, bed covers, blankets and clothes of the tourists staying in the hotels. She has done this work for several years and it has gone very well thanks to all of the effort she has put into her work. She is an enterprising woman who has fully devoted herself to the business and now wants to increase her business capital in order to buy more products like detergent so that she can wash more clothing. She is grateful for the opportunity offered through these loan services and commits to paying back the loan on time.

Translated from Spanish by Colleen Godfrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital by buying more products like detergent

loans.name: Zarofat

texts.en:
U. Zarofat is 54 years old. She and her husband have raised two children who are already married and living independently. For more than 12 years, Zarofat has been selling jewelry. As a rule she works in a store, however she also has a sales point in the local market.

Zarofat sells jewelry items in the oriental national style. She has her customers and those clients who sell their jewelry to her. People trust Zarofat, knowing that she is very honest when assessing the prices and quality. The business of Zarofat is the main source of income for her family.

Zarofat has been working with IMON for more than 4 years. She has proved herself an honest and reliable borrower. Today she requests 2500 US Dollars. With the loan Zarofat plans to purchase new items of jewelry like earrings, rings and bracelets in the oriental style. She thanks all for support and promises to repay the loan on time.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing new items of jewelry in the national style

loans.name: Vidal

texts.es: Don Vidal vive en la Comarca La mascota junto a su familia compuesta por su esposa Angelica y su hijo Vidal de 12 años el que va a 1er año de secundaria, trabaja como albañil en la Alcaldia de Juigalpa desde hace 7 años, esta solicitando su 2do credito y espera ser beneficiado con con el fondo Kiva para lograr construir un cuarto en su casa para su hijo Vidal, pues solo cuenta con uno y lol comparte con su hijo, y al construir este cuarto logrará tener privacidad tanto su hijo como ellos.  son una familia muy humilde y trabajadora, pues doña Angelica a pesar que no cuenta con un trabajo se encarga del cuido de su esposo y su hijo.  El mayor sueño de don Vidal es poder mejorar su casa y darle a su familia las condiciones basicas para que vivan en un ambiente comodo y agradable, ademas desea que su hijo estudie y sea un hombre de provecho.
texts.en:
Vidal lives in the La Mascota area with his wife Angelica and his 12-year-old son Vidal, who is in his first year of high school. For the last seven years, he has been a construction worker in the city of Juigalpa.

He is requesting his second loan and hopes to receive assistance from Kiva to build a room in his house for his son Vidal, since the house currently has only one, which the family shares. With another room, everyone in the family will have more privacy. They are a family of very modest means, but are very hardworking. Angelica does not have a job, so she takes care of her husband and son.

Vidal's greatest dream is to be able to make improvements to his home and to provide his family with a comfortable and pleasant living environment. He would also like his son to continue his studies and become a good man.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a bedroom

loans.name: Sda Primary School Group

texts.en:
These are teachers of the SDA (Seventh Day Adventist) Primary School, Makeni. SDA Primary School, Makeni was founded in 1978 by the SDA Mission to use education as a vehicle for spreading the Adventist message. They train young boys in the morals and ethics of the Adventist Mission.

SDA Primary School suffered a lot of setbacks over the past years. However, with the intervention of Mr. Benjamin K. as the new headmaster at the school, the school has experienced vast improvements. The new administration under the leadership of Benjamin K. has been able to buy benches for classes five and six through school fees subsidies and development funds. The school has also been able to hire two security guards to keep thieves at bay. And for the first time in the history of the school, it has been able to organize athletics for the pupils. This has added popularity and fame to the school.

This will be the second loan SDA Primary School will be accessing from SMT/Kiva. (See their journal update through the following link: http://partners.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=96443.)

Teachers from this institution, like many other teachers within SMT’s operational areas, come to SMT to apply for loans. With the help of these loans, they can accomplish certain tasks that they would otherwise not have been able to accomplish with their mere salaries alone. But with the help of this loan, some can pay school fees for their children; others can use the loan to buy pieces of furniture, a plot of land, house-building materials, or to invest in business. At the end of each month, these teachers can repay the loan out of their monthly salaries. The institution’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and pays SMT on their behalf.

Benjamin M. K. is the head teacher at the school. Thirty-eight-year-old Benjamin (left) is married to a student and they have one child who is still not of school-going age. Benjamin was born in Makeni city. With his share of the loan, he will buy house-building materials – cement, rods, iron, corrugated tin, etc.

loans.use: Buy house-building materials

loans.name: Chengly

texts.en:
Mrs. Chengly M. (pictured with her grandson) and her husband, Mr. Son Tit, live along national road number one approximately 20 km from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1975 and have five children: three sons and two daughters. Two of the children are married and live in separate homes, one drives a Tuk Tuk taxi and the other one is a garment factory worker.
 
Mrs. Chengly M. and her husband have been raising pigs for more than 30 years. They also created another business producing rice wine. Chengly  asked for a Kiva loan once already. Now she is asking for her second loan of $1,200 to purchase food for pigs and to continue her rice wine production business.

loans.use: To purchase food for her pigs

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria C. is from the village of Malinao, Gingoog City. She is 35 years old. Gloria is married and has seven school-aged children. To make a living, Gloria owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Gloria has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities. (Gloria chose to remain at the 5,000 level for her ninth loan).

In 2003, Gloria joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gloria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Gloria is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the ninth loan taken out by Gloria from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Ileana

texts.en:
Ileana C. T. is a 44-year-old single mother who lives with her 3 children in Paraiso de Cartago, located in the central valley of Costa Rica. Ileana provides beauty services for both men and women, from her home in Paraiso. She has been working under the business name ¨Unas Ili, ¨ which translates roughly as Ili´s Nails, over the past 8 years. Ileana says she opened her business to earn an income for her children and because she likes the work. 'Ili´s Nails' was opened with an initial investment of 25,000 colons.  In a good month, Ileana can expect to earn 390,000 colons, in a bad month, only 238,000. 

Ileana is a hard-working entrepreneur. She dedicates the hours from 10 am to 6 pm (7 days a week) to her business. Ileana´s specialty and passion is working with nails. Nail painting, applying decorative (fake) nails and giving manicures and pedicures represents the majority of Ileana´s workload. She has employed her two daughters who work roughly 12 hours a week and earn 25,000 colons each (per week). One of her daughters specializes in cosmetics and the other works with hair. As a team, they can provide a range of beauty services including hair, nails and cosmetics.

This will be Ileana´s first loan with Fundación Mujer. She plans to use it to make general investments in the expansion of her beauty business. Specifically, she would like to purchase a hair-washing machine, a hair straightener, nail polish and fake nails, among other nail maintenance products. 
Ileana´s goal is to improve the services she offers her clients and expand her business, little by little, every day. She is well aware of the highly competitive market that exists for beauty services and products in her community. 

Ileana´s revenues have been affected by competitors under-cutting each other’s prices for services in an effort to attract new clients and to keep old ones. Ileana is confident that she will maintain the loyalty of her clients because she uses high quality products and is not willing to compromise that quality in exchange for profits.

loans.use: To purchase equpiment and products necessary to the provision of beauty services

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
La señora Antonia es madre soltera, que emigró de Villarrica a Cuidad del Este para dar una mejor vida  sus hijas. 
La señora Antonia fue capaz de montar un pequeño local Comercial, donde ella vende  artículos de primera necesidad y otros artículos varios. 
Ella se inicio con un pequeño capital que su padre le había regalado y así fue creciendo poco a poco su negocio, hoy día ella ya cuanta con local propio y un buen ingreso para poder educar a sus hijas que están cursando el nivel medio.
Sin embargo, ella necesita este préstamo para  aumentar su inventario de mercaderías, ya que se encuentra en un lugar muy concurrido por la gente. 
A demostrado ser una persona muy responsable con sus compromisos y trabajadora.
texts.en:
La señora Antonia is a single mother who emigrated from Villarrica to Ciudad del Este to give a better life to her daughters. La señora Antonia was able to obtain a small site, where she sells necessities and other items. She began with a small amount of capital given to her by her father, and her business has been growing little by little. Today she has her own site and a good income. She is able to educate her daughters, who are in middle school. Nevertheless, she needs this loan to increase her inventory of merchandise, for her store is very busy. She has demonstrated that she is very responsible regarding her obligations and her work.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of various merchandise:  sugar, rice, noodles, assorted soaps, and other items

loans.name: Abra Emma

texts.fr:
Cette femme a appris le métier de la couture en 1990, plus tard  elle n’avait plus assez de demandes, ses recettes  ont donc baissé. Pour remédier à cela elle s’est lancée dans le commerce de pagnes. Ce nouveau commerce lui a bien réussit et lui a permis de réaliser de meilleures recettes. Elle veut agrandir le commerce de vente de pagnes , ayant déjà  obtenu un prêt de WAGES qu’elle a bien remboursé, elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit qui lu permis d’acheter 30 pagnes de hautes et moyennes qualités .
Elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants
texts.en:
This woman learned to be a seamstress in 1990. Later decreasing orders caused her earnings to drop. She reacted to the situation by starting a business selling pagnes (colorful West African cloth). This new venture met with success and gave her better revenue. She now wants to expand her pagne-selling business. She has fully repaid a first loan from WAGES, and is now requesting a second loan to buy 30 pagnes of medium to high quality. She is married and the mother of three children.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing fabric (pagnes)

loans.name: Larry

texts.en:
Larry M. is from the village of Puntod Lopez Jaena. He is 31 years old. Larry is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Larry owns & operates a fishing business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling fresh fish in the local community. Larry has been engaged in his business for over 9 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Larry joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Larry has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6000 PHP from GDMPC. Larry is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used purchase spare parts for the the pump boat he uses for fishing. This will be the second loan taken out by Larry from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the daily needs of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase spare parts for the his pumpboat

loans.name: Franca

texts.en:
Franca is a native of Edo State, Nigeria. She is into the business of tailoring and sales of sarongs and tailoring materials. She has been in this business for long. She has been able to care for her family with the proceeds from her business. She is married and blessed with a child. 
Franca needs the loan amount of NGN 80,000 to purchase more tailoring materials and sarongs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials and sarongs

loans.name: Believe In God Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are the members of the “Believe In God” group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are small-business women who have come to SMT, a Kiva partner, in order to seek a loan of SLL 500,000 each. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profit and consequently improve on their living conditions.

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Umu S., pictured on the left. She was born in Makeni about 45 years ago. She is married and has five children. Her husband is a teacher and three of her children are attending primary schools.

Umu sells mints, sugar, chewing gum, butter, bread, etc., in a small shop; she has been in this business for four years now. With her share of this loan, she will buy more mints, sugar, chewing gum, butter and bread wholesale to add to her business.

loans.use: To buy more mints, sugar, chewing gum, butter and bread wholesale to add to her business

loans.name: Daler

texts.ru: Хусейнов Далер проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Возраст, 23 года. Женат, детей не имеет. Жена, преподает в средней школе. Сам Далер имеет среднее образование. Более 6 лет занимается растениеводством. Имеет небольшой участок земли, где сеет пшеницу, овощи для перепродажи. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений.
texts.en:
Daler H. lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. He is 23 years old, married and has no children. His wife teaches at a secondary school. Daler has a secondary education. He has been involved in agriculture for over 6 years. He has a small plot of land, where he sows wheat and vegetables for resale. He is requesting this loan for the purchase of mineral fertilizers.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah P. is from the village of Iligan City. She is a 30-year-old married mother of two who sells snacks & other delicacies in the local community to earn an income. Leah has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

Leah has just joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services that will help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting her first loan from HSPFI, in the amount of 5000 PHP, to purchase raw ingredients needed to make more products for selling and expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients to make more products to sell.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
This is Yolanda T., 53, resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Jose T., a pensioner, and mother of five children, four of whom are already working and are settled down with their own families, while the youngest is still in college. By the grace of God, Yolanda has managed to support her older children's schooling up to college level. At this time, she is working hard to send her youngest to college. A dream for most Filipino parents like Yolanda, as she herself has been a college undergraduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children.

Yolanda operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go for to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Juanita earns by getting supplies at wholesale price and selling at a piece rate. Yolanda’s store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP400 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 9,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 
 
Yolanda dreams to be able to give her all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work at her business. She also hopes to have her house renovated by the end of the year.

loans.use: To buy more quantities of products like groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Thy's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Thy M., 53, is the leader of this group loan, having been selected by its four members who are located in Roluos village, Kandal province. The members will use their portion of the loan to buy equipment, supplies and other items for their individual purposes.

Mr. Thy M. is a farmer who owns a plot of land that he uses to cultivate rice for a living. For this farm, he will use the loan from AMK/Kiva to buy fertilizer to cultivate rice. His wife, Mrs. Soeun Toem, is a seamstress in a garment factory and with both of these occupations, they are able to earn a small income to supP. their family.

This couple has four children: two are seamstresses in the garment factory and the other two are students in the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to cultivate rice

loans.name: Hope To God Group

texts.en:
Ellen G., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Hope To God. She is 43 years old, married, and has four children who range from 16 to 23 years old. She cares for two children.

She was not able to attend school due to poverty. All of her children are attending school. 

For three years, she has been selling fish at Redlight Market, Paynesville, outside of Monrovia, Liberia.

She plans to use her 6,000 LRD portion of this 30,000 LRD group loan to buy more cartons of fish to sell. She describes herself as a jovial woman.

Her dream is to grow her business, build a house and continue to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of fish to sell

loans.name: Emmy

texts.en:
Emmy A. is thirty two years old, married and has four children aged between twenty three years and ten years old. Her business is located at Serem, a busy market in Kakamega. She has been selling fruits and vegetables for the last ten years to the local people. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is that there are many people in the area doing the same kind of business as hers so customers are spoilt for choice. 

However, she works very hard from early morning to late evening to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy tomatoes and potatoes to meet customer demand. She hopes to have many business outlets and supply her vegetables in wholesale. She sees herself owning a bungalow in which she will live comfortably in the future. She describes herself as honest and hardworking.

loans.use: purchasing tomatoes and potatoes for resale

loans.name: Renne

texts.en:
Renne T. is from the village of Brgy. Payawan, Lamut, Ifugao. He is 27 years old, married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Renne owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. Renne has been engaged in his business for over seven years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Renne joined Kiva partner, ASKI, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be his first from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Melma

texts.en:
Melma D. owns a small hectare of rice farm. The purpose why she grows rice is for family consumption and livelihood. She sells most of her harvest to her neighbors and because of that, she is able to earn enough income for her family. One thing she would like to do in her life is to send her children to school. With her current business, which is a rice farm, it’s a challenge for her to fulfill her plan.

She would like to ask for a loan of Php 7,000. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies to grow her harvest. She is also interested in some other business opportunities so that she will be able to supplement their income.

loans.use: farm supplies

loans.name: Constantina

texts.es: La señora Constantina V. M. cuenta con un negocio de la venta de ropa usada desde hace 2 años todos los fines de semana, este es su fuente de ingresos al cual desea invertir en el; para seguir generando mas ganancias. Constantina se intereso en el apoyo que se brinda en esta institución es por eso que quiere un crédito para surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
For two years Constantina V. M. has had a business selling used clothes every week-end.  She wishes to invest in this source of her income in order to generate more income.  

Constantina  became interested in the help this institution offers because she wants a loan to stock her business.

loans.use: To stock her business

loans.name: Puth

texts.en:
Puth Y., 48, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. Y. sells rice, earning an income of USD 3.30 per day. Her husband raises pigs, earning an income of USD 5.30 per day. Y. has to spend USD 35 on food and USD 110 on other necessary expenses every month.  

Y. is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase more rice to stock for sale when the price is good. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy more rice to stock for sale

loans.name: Luis Felipe

texts.es:
Luis de 46 años, es vendedor de ropa y accesorios personales en el suburbio de Guayaquil. Vive en una zona  caracterizada porque la mayoría de sus habitantes son comerciantes.  

Hace 10 años atrás comenzó su negocio de venta de ropa y artículos personales, desde ese tiempo hasta ahora ha trabajado con dedicación para tener su negocio surtido. Trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 13h00pm todos los días vendiendo camisas, pantalones, blusas. Tiene de venta ropa desde $ 3.00 en adelante. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar camisas, pantalones y blusas para surtir más la ropa que tiene. En el futuro quiere tener los dos locales fijos uno solo de ropa y otros de accesorios personales.
texts.en:
Luis, age 46, sells clothing and personal accessories in Suburbio de Guayaquil. He lives in an area where most of the residents are merchants.

Luis has been selling clothing and personal accessories for ten years. From the time he started until now, he has worked diligently to ensure that his business is well-stocked. Luis works every day from 8am to 1pm selling shirts, trousers, and blouses. Articles of clothing in his inventory are priced at $3.00 and up.

Luis wants to use this loan to buy shirts, trousers, and blouses to increase his inventory of clothing. In the future, he wants to have two established locations where he will sell only clothing at one and personal accessories at the other.

loans.use: Purchase shirts, trousers, and blouses

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es: MARIA DEL ROSARIO P. U. tiene 2 hijos  se dedica a la venta de joyería de fantasía  desde hace 14 años  por 8 años,  vendió en forma ambulante en muchos pueblos,  y desde hace 6 años alquila un Local, para la venta de  Joyería  de Fantasía.  Como también se dedica a la venta de Ropa Típica y a la vez  borda  cortes Típicos, todo lo ha hecho  con la  apoyo económico de su esposo,  y su mayor deseo es tener una gran venta  en ropa Típica, por ello solicita este crédito para compra de ropa típica ya que su negocio requiere de mucho capital, su deseo como madre es  enseñarle  a sus hijos un oficio, brindarles educación, y seguir adelante juntamente con su esposo.
texts.en: MARIA DEL ROSARIO P. U. has 2 children.  She has been selling costume jewelry for 14 years; for 8 years she sold it by traveling to many villages, and for the past 6 years she has been renting a location.  She also sells authentic clothing and embroidery.  Everything has been done with the financial support of her husband, and her greatest wish is to have a big sale on authentic clothing.  She is requesting this loan to purchase clothes as her business requires a lot of capital.  She wants, as a mother, to teach her children a profession, providing them an education and continue moving ahead with her husband.

loans.use: Clothing Sales

loans.name: Newton

texts.en: Newton S. K. is thirty two years old, married to a business lady. They have one child, aged six, who they hope to educate to university level. His business is located at Kinanie and he is served by the Kitengela Branch. He has been selling keg beer and soft drinks to local men, both young and elderly, for eight years. He has had his business for three years and has one employee. Newton says that his business is profitable and his major challenge is harrasment by the local administration who want a bribe to allow him to continue selling beer. However he works very hard to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more beverages to meet the demands of his customers. He hopes to grow his business, buy a plot of land, and build a house to live in. He is very hardworking.

loans.use: Beverages

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret is forty-eight years old, a single mother of four children, living in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda. She has a retail shop and a bar with an experience of five years in such business, Margret needs the loan to purchase beers and sodas for sale.

loans.use: Purchasing sodas and beers for sale

loans.name: Majeda

texts.en:
Majeda F. is a young woman from Bethlehem. Majeda takes care of her own family, which consists of three sisters and one brother who are in school and at college.

Majeda owns a kindergarten in Bethlehem. She started her school nine years ago in one of the rooms in her family's house so she would have a nice, big space for the kindergarten. She is always striving to make her kindergarten the best in the city.

Majeda requested a loan from FATEN to replace the old carpeting and purchase educational and recreational toys, as well as other items needed for the children.

Majeda and the children in her kindergarten appear in the picture above.

loans.use: To purchase carpets, children's toys and other items

loans.name: Batzorig

texts.en: Batzorig is 24 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in Hentii province in Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His wife stays at home taking care of their infant daughter while Batzorig supports his entire family by operating a welding service in his town. He started his business in 2007 and has since built a stable operation with many permanent customers. Over the many years, he has gained a lot of experience as a welder who is very popular among his customers. With his business earnings, which are the only source of his family income, he has improved his family's standard of living. Batzorig is a hardworking and honest person. He is requesting an 830,000 MNT loan to purchase a new welding machine for his business.

loans.use: To purchase a new welding machine

loans.name: Colere Jack

texts.fr:
jeune commerçante de 25 ans, célibataire sans enfant,il se lance dans le commerce des ventes des habits homme il y a 7 ans, comme il n'avait pas pu continuer ses etudes a cause des moyens avec la somme de 50000frs.
 A l'octroi de son premier prêt il renforce avec l'achat des marinières,body et des maillots de corps.Il a eu a faire des ventes considérables et a beaucoup epargne.

Pour le second prêt , il  veut refaire la même chose en changeant de stratégie de vente, aller acheter aux grossistes qui reviennent de Kinshasa ou de Cotonou .
Tres pragmatique , il veut devenir un homme d'affaire de renommé nationale et avec les benefices il veut se marier dans peu de temps et fonder une famille.
texts.en:
This is a young merchant, aged 25, who is single and without children. With 50,000 francs, he started a business selling men's clothing seven years ago, since he was not able to continue in his studies due to a lack of means. 

With his first loan awarded to him, he bolstered his business by buying long-sleeve T-shirts, bodysuits, and jerseys. He had to make significant sales and to save a lot of money. For the second loan, he wants to do the same thing but change his sales strategy and go to wholesalers from Kinshasa or from Cotonou to buy goods. 

A very pragmatic man, he wants to become a renowned businessman nationally.  Using the profits, he wants to get married soon and start a family.

loans.use: Buying jeans, jumpsuits, T-shirts, etc.

loans.name: Roland

texts.en:
Roland Y. is a 32-year-old man from the town of Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. He is married with two school-aged children. Roland owns and operates a business in the service sector providing transportation services. The main source of income for the business comes from operating jeep transportation in the local community. Roland has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Roland joined Kiva partner, Alalay sa Kaunlaran, Inc. (ASKI), to access financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He requests a 5000 PHP loan to repair his existing vehicle so he can provide better service. This is Roland's first loan request from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from his business to support his family. 

About Alalay sa Kaunlaran, Inc. (ASKI):

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherpeople and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair current vehicle to provide better service

loans.name: Deysi Beatriz

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “TERCER MILENIO”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, provincia de Urubamba, Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Deysi; La socia tiene 31 años de edad, la socia es soltera; y tiene a pequeño hijo, de 6 años de edad; la socia tiene una tienda de abarrotes, la socia también con la ayuda de su padre y su propio esfuerzo más el banco comunal y este modo de trabajo le permitieron comprar dos autos de segunda para hacerlos trabajar en la ruta Cusco Urubamba  y Urubamba Ollantaytambo; como colectivo, la socia desea el crédito en esta oportunidad para comprar llantas para sus autos y hacerles el mantenimiento respectivo, la socia también invertirá un restante en la compra de mercadería para la tienda de abarrotes, la socia apoya a su familia y ellos a ella, ella nos demuestra que el trabajo en equipo y la perseverancia dan frutos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar llantas para sus dos autos y un poco de mercadería para implementar la tienda de abarrotes.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Deysi belongs to the “Tercer Milenio” (Third Milenium) Communal Bank.  This bank is located in the Urubamba district, Urubamba province, Cusco department.

Deysi is 31 years old, single, and has a little six year old son.  She has a grocery store.  Also, her father’s help, her own hard work, her communal bank, and her grocery business have allowed her to buy two second-hand cars.  She puts the cars to work as taxis on the Cusco Urabamba and the Urubamba Ollantaytambo route.

She wants the loan to buy tires for her cars and to perform maintenance on the cars.  She will use the remainder of the loan to buy merchandise for her grocery store.  She supports her family, and they support her.  She shows us that working as a team and perseverance pays off.

She is requesting the loan to buy tires for her two cars and a bit of merchandise for her grocery store. 

She is happy about the loan that was granted, and she pledges to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy tires for her two cars and a bit of merchandise for her grocery store

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 22-year-old single man from Lebanon. He is living with his parents. He started his career at a very young age working as a freelance home painter.  He cooperates with his father to provide better financial support for his family. He obtained his first Kiva loan and he was very satisfied with the results.

Today, he is requesting to borrow $2000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to renew his business tools and purchase paint for a new project. He needs to be prepared to serve the clients and make a good business reputation. In the future, he hopes to continue the growth of his profession and be able to take  on construction projects in order to expand his business operation.

loans.use: to renew his business tools and purchase paint.

loans.name: Aurelia Esperanza

texts.es: Aurelia Esperanza se dedica a la venta de calzado y ropa. Tiene más 7 años con este negocio. Su mercadería la compra en Managua en donde le resulta mucho más favorable ya que los productos están a precios más accesibles. Las motivaciones de Aurelia son de seguir en el negocio, está muy agradecida ya que podrá invertir y aumentar su productividad. El financiamiento es destinado para la compra de sandalias, zapatillas, zapatos deportivos, camisetas, pantalones, faldas y trajes. Los sueños de Aurelia son de seguir adelante cada día más con su actividad y brindarle a su familia el sustento diario.
texts.en: Aurelia Esperanza sells clothing and shoes and has been doing so for seven years.  She buys her merchandise in Managua, where she can get it at better prices.  Her motivations are to continue with her business and she is very grateful to be able to invest into her business and improve her productivity.  She will use the money from this loan to buy sandals, slippers, shoes, sneakers, polo shirts, pants, skirts, and suits.  She wants to continue moving forward each day and provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy inventory for her clothing business

loans.name: Kong

texts.en: Kong N., 52, is married and resides in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. She produces traditional cakes to sell, earning an income of about $6 per day. Her husband buys cows to resell, earning an income of $1.50 per day. Each month, the family has to spend $65 on food and $35 on the other necessary expenses. She is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase chickens to resell. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy chickens to resell.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia C. T. is 43 years old.  She is married and is a mother of four children.  Sophia has been a mixed farmer for the last fifteen years. 

Sophia was introduced to KADET LTD by a registered client.  She has applied for her first loan which she is planning to use to buy farm inputs and  animals for fattening. She hopes to use the profit from this loan to reinvest back into her business. 

Her hopes and dream is to become a great farmer. She is a brisk woman who is dedicated to her work and who can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: to buy inputs for her farm

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a 32 years old, married, has two children and makes a living selling electrical appliances and working as an electrician. He has been in business for only one year but is committed to expand his company and acquire more items to sell. Through Faulu Kenya he has been able to share ideas with other businesspeople and get other kinds of help. He has applied for a loan for 40,000 Kes to buy new items to sell to his customers and also buy a new testing kit.

loans.use: to buy a new testing kit and more items to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Afiwa Enogandé

texts.fr: Femme dynamique de 48ans, Mme Afiwa est mariée à un ingénieur. Ils ont 05 enfants en charge et est à son premier prêt. Elle est revendeuse de gâteau (un aliment fait à base de farine de blé qui accompagne la bouillie). Elle a démarré l’activité depuis 1993 et sollicite ce prêt pour acheter de la farine de blé, de l’huile et du sucre au grand marché de Lomé pour satisfaire sa demande croissante, et participer à la charge de la famille.
texts.en: A dynamic 48-year-old woman, Ms. Afiwa is married to an engineer. They have 5 children in their care and she is on her first loan. She sells wheat cakes (a wheat flour-based food that accompanies the West African "bouillie" dish). She has run this business since 1993 and is seeking this loan to buy wheat flour, oil, and sugar at the grand market in Lomé in order to satisfy the increasing demand and to contribute to her family's care.

loans.use: To buy wheat flour, oil, and sugar.

loans.name: Elmer Eduardo

texts.es:
Elmer  tiene 29  años de edad, el es soltero y  vive en casa de sus padres, no tiene carga familiar, su  vivienda está ubicada en el distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz a pocos minutos dela ciudad de Chiclayo en una  comunidad es urbana en vías de crecimiento cuenta con luz y agua propia.

Elmer se dedica a ofrecer sus servicios como maestro construcción oficio en cual lleva aproximadamente 02 años de experiencia en dicho servicio, razón por la cual se genera ingresos semanales, Elmer posee 01 trompo (mezcladora), cisayas,  01 taladro y demás herramientas, que le facilitan su trabajo.

Actualmente Elmer esta solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3000 nuevos soles para invertir en la compra de madera y andamios puesto que posee mayor demanda de obras.

Elmer es una conocido por su trabajo y por su esfuerzo que desea salir adelante y apoyar a sus  padres en todo lo que el pueda.
texts.en:
Elmer is 29 years old.  He is unmarried and lives at home with his parents.   He has no family responsibilities.  His home is located in the district of José Leonardo Ortiz, a few minutes from the city of Chiclayo.  It is a growing urban community and has its own water and electricity.  

Elmer is a professional in the construction field.  He has approximately two years of experience in this field and this enables him to generate weekly income.  Elmer has one spinning top (cement mixer), wire cutters, a drill, and other tools that facilitate his work.

Since his work is in higher demand, Elmer is currently applying for a loan of 3000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to invest in the purchase of wood and scaffolds. 
Elmer is known for his work and his effort.  He wants to get ahead and support his parents any way he can.

loans.use: to purchase wood and scaffolding

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy 3 sacks of beans, 2 sacks of rice, a jerry can of gasoline, and a dozen rolls of toilet paper and to pay for labor

loans.name: Evangelista

texts.en:
Evangelista is an ambitious 37-year-old business lady. She is married and blessed with two children aged three and one. 

She has been operating a beauty salon since 2007 to meet the needs of her family. She wants in the next five years to have her own premises to do her business. Her dream is to expand her business and take it to greater heights. 

She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to renovate her premises and to buy equipment and hair products. Thanks to Faulu Kenya she has now become good at saving.

loans.use: to renovate her premises and to buy equipment and hair products

loans.name: Jiovanni

texts.es: Jiovanni es una mujer de 37 años, pujante y trabajadora vive en casa de su madre junto a su esposo y 10 personas más, entre ellos hermanos y sobrinos. El trabajo que ella realiza consiste en la compra y venta de madera, en el proceso ellos realizan el corte y empaquetado para poder enviarlos a la ciudad de Lima a un comprador que tienen como cliente. Esta actividad lo realiza en los diferentes aserraderos de la ciudad junto a su esposo quien es conocido en el negocio ya que trabaja en un aserradero.  Lo que mas le gusta de su trabajo es poder invertir y recuperar rápido su dinero, lleva ya 2 años en este negocio y lo que no le agrada es que tiene que quemarse del sol pero vale la pena por que al final se ve los resultados con las ganancias, espera poder seguir trabajando con la institución ya que se siente cómoda. Este es el quinto crédito con MFP y espera poder seguir yendo como hasta ahora, siendo responsable y sobre todo cumplida con el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1700 soles solicitados, comprará madera.
texts.en:
Jiovanni, 37, is vigorous and hard-working, and she lives in her mother’s house along with her husband and 10 others, including brothers and sisters, nieces and nephews.  She buys and sells wood and also cuts and packs the wood to be able to send it to Lima to a buyer that they have as a customer.
She patronizes different sawmills in the city with her husband, who knows the business because he himself used to work in a sawmill. What she likes most about the work is the ability to invest and recover her money quickly.  She has been in this business for 2 years but what she doesn’t like is that she gets very sunburned.  However, she says it’s worth it since at the end, she sees her earnings and she hopes to continue working with the institution now that she feels comfortable.  This is her fifth loan with MFP and she wishes to continue borrowing as she does now, being responsible and especially reliable with her payments.  She will use the 1700 sols to buy wood.

loans.use: to buy more wood.

loans.name: Fany

texts.es:
Fany tiene 39 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con sólo servicio de luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande, que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona la actividad que desarrollan es la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.

Fany desde hace algunos años se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado vacuno (vaca), su corral se encuentra en la parte externa de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos naturales para que tenga una buena producción de leche, la que ofrece a los mismos pobladores de la zona o lo lleva a vender al mercado de Tambogrande, cuenta con clientela fija por la buena calidad de leche que tiene, con sus ingresos solventa sus obligaciones familiares.  

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar más alimentos balanceados para que se incremente la producción de leche y así podrá ofrecerlo aun mejor precio para poder cubrir su crédito otorgado y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.  Fany es una mujer trabajadora, dedicada y muy responsable que lo único que quiere es que su negocio crezca para que sus hijos tengan otras oportunidades académicas.
texts.en:
Fany is 39 and lives with her husband and children in her own home. She has only electrical service and is located in a rural area in Tambo Grande district, in Piura department. This area is devoted to agriculture, cattle raising and handicrafts.

Fany has worked raising and selling livestock (cows) for several years. She keeps them in a  corral outside her house and feeds them natural feed and on natural pastures so they produce a good supply of milk.
