She provides milk to the inhabitants in the area or carries it to the Tambo Grande market to sell. She has steady customers because of the high quality milk she sells. She uses her income to settle her family’s obligations.

She has requested a loan of 1000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy more feed to increase milk production so that she will be able to offer even better prices. Thus, she will repay the loan and improve her family’s quality of life. 

Fany is a hardworking, dedicated and responsible woman who wants only for her business to grow so that her children will have more academic opportunities.

loans.use: to buy more feed for her cattle.

loans.name: Ola

texts.en:
Ola is a 35-year-old woman who is married and has four sons and two daughters. She lives in Jenin city located in Palestine. Her husband is employed and earns a decent salary in addition to his work in the cafe. Ola wants to improve this project by purchasing a new refrigerator, chairs, tables. etc. Since she hasn't enough money to pay for these items she needs to take out a loan of $1,500 from FATEN. 

As Ola gets the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, she will help to improve the image of the cafe and the increase number of customers, which will lead to increased income and let the family live in better conditions. 

Ola is a conservative woman, so her husband is photographed instead in the cafe.

loans.use: to equip her cafe by purchasing a new refrigerator, chairs, tables, etc.

loans.name: Dédé

texts.fr:
Dédé est une femme âgée de 58 ans. Elle est veuve. Elle a 06 enfants, dont un à l’école. Le premier a 35 ans et le dernier a 17 ans.  
Dédé travaille comme revendeuse depuis 1986. Elle achète et revend du charbon de bois à Lomé. Elle travaille  seule dans son commerce
Dédé a requis son deuxième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter du charbon de bois et des céréales pour la revente. Elle veut profiter pour développer son commerce. 
Dans les prochaines années, Dédé voudrait agrandir son stock de marchandises.
texts.en: Dédé is a 58-year-old woman. She is a widow. She has 6 children, including one in school. The oldest is 35 years old and the youngest is 17 years old. Dédé has been working as a reseller since 1986. She buys and resells charcoal in Lomé. She works alone in her business. Dédé has requested her second loan from WAGES in order to buy charcoal and grain for resale. She wants to profit in order to develop her business. In the coming years, Dédé would like to grow her supply of goods.

loans.use: to buy charcoal

loans.name: Ronald

texts.es: El sr. Ronald  es  cliente nuevo en la institución vive en la zona de pacata baja barrio,  tiene casa propia es soltero se dedica al transporte publico en una empresa radio taxi desde muy joven es su principal fuente de ingreso para sustentarse, saco el crédito para comprar repuestos para su movilidad ya que esta presentando algunas fallas y esto no le permite realizar una buena atención a su pasajeros ya que la movilidad se para siempre que esta con pasajeros  y esto le ocasiona mucho malestar, el cliente se fue muy satisfecho con el crédito y agradecido con la institucion.
texts.en: Ronald is a new customer with this institution.  He lives in the Pacata Baja neighborhood, has his own home, and is single.  He works in public transportation for a radio taxi company.  Since he was very young, this has been his main source of income to support himself.  He took out this loan to buy parts since some have been faulty and they keep him from offering his passengers good service as the car always stalls when he has passengers, which is very distressing for him.  This customer was very satisfied with the load and appreciative of this institution.

loans.use: to buy parts

loans.name: Franci Marilu

texts.es: La Sra. Franci es una mujer trabajadora, muy creativa y con muchas ganas de superarse cada día mas, ella es casada, tiene un hijo de 24 años de edad; la Sra. Franci se dedica a confeccionar vestidos, trajes y también a la venta de los mismos, la señora Franci lleva 5 años en este negocio, la solicitante estudio confección es por eso que puso el negocio, empezó con una maquina y poco a poco supo salir adelante, gana aproximadamente S/ 250 nuevos soles semanales. El crédito otorgado lo va invertir en la compra de telas y ropa para la venta. Sus metas de la  Sra. Franci  es tener su propia casa y también exportar la ropa que confecciona al extranjero. Ella esta muy agradecida por el crédito otorgado.
texts.en:
Sra. Franci is a hardworking and creative woman who has tremendous desire to succeed with each passing day. She is married and has a 24-year-old son. Sra. Franci makes and sells dresses and suits. She has been in this business for five years.

Franci studied sewing, which is why she established this business. She started with a sewing machine and has gradually been able to get ahead. Franci earns approximately 250 PEN each week. The loan being provided will be invested in the purchase of fabric and clothing for sale. Sra. Franci’s goals are to have her own house and to export the clothing she produces to other countries. She is very grateful for the loan that has been provided.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, thread, and sewing accessories.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 44-year-old businessman and married. His wife is not working. They are blessed with two children. He has been selling electrical devices for the past three years with a monthly income of KES 5,500, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan term with KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Peter will use the loan to buy electrical machines to add to his shop. With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. His hope and dream is to open a wholesale shop, which will help him improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To buy electrical machines to add to his shop.

loans.name: Norman

texts.en:
Norman is a businessman living in Masindi, Uganda. He is in the clothing business mainly selling used clothing which most people in his area wear. He says he hopes to improve on the business's current status from being at a  market stall to a modern boutique. 

Norman adds that prices are constantly changing whenever he buys the products he sells, something he says is a big challenge for him as he finds it difficult to pass on the price increase burden to his customers. Norman wants a loan to buy second-hand clothes to sell at his market stall.

loans.use: To buy second-hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Sairagul's Group

texts.en:
Sairagul is the leader of this group. She is 43 and married. Her spouse works in construction. Five years ago with an initial investment of 20,000 soms she purchased cattle, and since that time she has engaged in cattle breeding. By selling dairy products, Sairagul earns about 2000 soms to meet family needs. In case they need money to cover daily expenses she can sell some cattle. With money received from the loan Sairagul plans to purchase hay for feeding cattle during the winter season. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase hay

loans.name: Monica

texts.es:
Mónica de 28 años, hace 2 años convive con Ronald, su pareja. Ambos tienen 2 hijos menores de 4 y 2 años; y habitan un hogar precario pero propio y acogedor en la comunidad nativa San Pablo de Shaoriato. Mónica es una madre y ama de casa ejemplar. Nos abrió las puertas de su casa para confiarnos su vida y actividades.
Cuenta con terrenos propios en las faldas de montañas ubicadas en su zona. En esas parcelas siembra y produce café y kión. Estos frutos los comercializa en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Pichanaki. “Trato de equilibrar mi producción para que mis ingresos me cubran las necesidades para todo el año, y nos va bien con los 2 productos”. A su vez, Mónica abrió un pequeño negocio de abarrotes, el que descuidó por dedicarse íntegramente al campo, pero que piensa equipar más adelante, puesto que, la falta de capital significó un obstáculo para su implementación. Mónica anhela contar con más sembríos de café, para ello deberá arrendar terrenos e invertir en abonos, plantas y mano de obra. Con este plan concretizado podrá otorgar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Gracias a su ayuda, sería la primera vez que obtendría un préstamo de MFP, por tanto se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas. En cuanto a su banco comunal muestra predisposición para ser participativo en cuanta actividad se organice. De obtener el dinero, Mónica invertirá en la compra de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad para ofrecer en su negocio.
texts.en: Monica, age 28, has been living with Ronald, her partner, for the past two years. Together they have 2 young children, ages 4 and 2. The live in a humble but welcoming home that they own in the native community of San Pablo de Shaoriato. Monica is an exemplary mother and homemaker who opened her doors to us to confide in us about her life and activities. She owns crop lands in the local foothills on which she cultivates coffee and ginger. She sells her crops at the wholesale market in the city of Pichanaki. "I try to balance my production so that my income can cover my necessities all year long, and we have prospered with both crops," Monica states. At the same time, Monica opened a small general store, which she has neglected because she needed to dedicate herself fully to agriculture. However, she hopes be able to restart that business in the future as a lack of capital was the obstacle that prevented its launching. Monica yearns to increase her coffee crop, but to do so, she must rent land and invest in fertilizer, plants, and labor. Once this plan becomes concrete, she will be able to offer her family a better quality of life. Thanks to your help, this will be the first time that she obtains a loan from MFP, which is why she commits to being punctual in making her repayments. Regarding her communal bank, she demonstrates a predisposition to become a member as soon as it is organized. Once she obtains the money, Monica will invest it in purchasing basic need items and other goods to sell in her business.

loans.use: to purchase basic need items.

loans.name: Radnaabazar

texts.en: Radnaabazar is 61 years old and lives with her husband in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Arhangai Province, Mongolia. Her husband is a retired old man, and her kids are all independent. She started her business in 1998 by renting a counter in a market. Her product range is broad, and she is well respected in the market. Now that her kids are grown, she wants to concentrate on her business. She already rented an additional counter in a market. However, her supplies are not sufficient to run a whole business. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says, "My business served me well. My kids are educated and my family is healthy. However, my income has been the same since I started, so I want to expand it." She is requesting 1,200,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) to purchase more curds.

loans.use: To purchase more curds

loans.name: Shushan

texts.en: Shushan is engaged in an agricultural business. She keeps cattle and cultivates land. The current number of livestock doesn't allow Shushan to meet her family's needs and cover the educational costs for her children. With the requested loan, Shushan plans to purchase livestock and forage. This loan will help Shushan to develop farming and ensure a sustainable future for her family. Shushan lives together with her husband and children. Besides her household and agriculture, Shushan is also an active member of her community. She is engaged in a group supporting women with their activities and main problems.

loans.use: to pay for livestock and forage

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is aged sixty-five and has been in active farming for over twenty years in her home area of Murang'a, Kenya, producing and selling eggs and milk to the local market.  She is a widow with six grown-up children.

Teresa has requested a loan of KES 50,000 from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry birds and boost her poultry business.  She says the income will help her in maintaining her five orphaned grandchildren.  She adds that the income will also help her improve her dairy farming by buying more dairy cows.

She is however concerned with poor market prices and notes the farmer's limitation of the inaccessibility of external markets.

loans.use: to buy poultry birds for her farm.

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en: Yaa operates a grocery shop. She also sells soap at the village of Akotokyire near Abura. She has been selling soap for 13 years now. Her husband is a pensioner, and they have 4 children who are in school. Yaa uses her income to support her husband in paying their children’s school fees. She needs this loan to purchase boxes of soap and a variety of groceries to sell. With the new profit, Yaa will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase boxes of soap and a variety of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 6 children.

Fe has a shop that sells vegetables like string beans and baguio beans. She has had this business for 4 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy vegetables to sell.

Fe has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Gnarisso Benkadi 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les  membres du groupe  Gnarisso Benkadi  2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans, 6 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à  Soké, un des villages de San, 4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide  avec    SITAN , 1ere assise  en écharpe noirâtre  sur  la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et au marché de San, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 155.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the group "Gnarisso Benkadi 2" are married women averaging 39 years of age and six children each all living in traditional families in Soké, a village in San (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their second loan with the institution. The past loans have indeed been paid back. 

The crop grown is peanuts, as is the case with SITAN, the first one seated and wearing a dark scarf in the photo. With her loan, she intends to buy farm inputs and seeds and to cover the cost of plowing for maintaining one hectare.

The produce will be sold in the village and at the San market after the harvest. The customer base is composed of men and women. 

She expects to make an average profit of 155,000 francs CFA per planting season. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and also to help her husband to cover day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to cover the cost of plowing and to buy farm inputs and some seeds

loans.name: Delta Alicia

texts.en:
Delta Alicia is a young woman who is 35 years old. Four years ago, she lost her husband and was left in charge of the education and expenses of her children. With few resources, the first thing that she thought to do was to sell food. So, with a small investment she started to sell food between her neighborhoods.

With the passage of the time, she was able to obtain a little food store restaurant in front of her house. Now she wants to purchase live animals, like turkeys and pigs, to prepare and sell for Christmas and New Year's dinners. This investment will allow her to maintain her income level through the rest of the year as this season the food she commonly sells must be offered cheaper. She comments that her experience of previous years has helped her to learn to take advantage of the opportunity of this season and, for that reason, she needs a credit of US$ 550 hopping to repay this loan in 6 months (at least).

**This text has been translated from the original business description.**

Delta Alicia es una mujer joven de 35 años que en el 2002, sufrió la perdida de su esposo, quedando a cargo de la manutención y educación de sus 3 hijos menores. Con pocos recursos, lo primero que se le ocurrió fue el vender comida, y así con una mínima inversión comenzó a vender alimentos preparados entre sus vecinos, con buena aceptación. Poco a poco fue avanzando en la actividad hasta tener una pequeña lonchería en la entrada de su casa. Por estas fechas Delta esta interesada en comprar animales en pie: Pavos y Cerdos, los cuales piensa vender ya preparados para la cena de navidad y de año nuevo. Esta inversión le permitirá solventar sus principales gastos económicos pues en estas fechas las ventas normales bajan. Comenta que la experiencia de años anteriores le ha enseñado a sacar ventaja de la oportunidad que se le presenta, es por lo anterior que esta solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US$ 550 a 6 meses, para estar preparada y poder aprovechar la temporada con alimentos diferentes a lo que habitualmente ella vende.

loans.use: Alive animals purchase

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.en:
This young woman was born in 1979 in Salyan region Yenikand village. She is married and has a child.
She has run this business for 10 years.
Now she needs a loan of $600 to buy 10 sheep in order to improve her agricultural business.

loans.use: To buy 10 sheep

loans.name: Ludivina

texts.en:
Mrs. Ludivina has had her business for two years. "Across the street from my shop is a kindergarden and many people come in looking for school supplies to buy but I have to turn them away. I'm losing customers. I'm asking for $1000 to buy school supplies to sell in my shop."

Translated by Kiva volunteer Alexis Hult

La Sra. Ludivina tiene 2 años con su negocio. “Enfrente de mi negocio hay un Kinder así es que me gustaría comprar material escolar ya que me lo piden mucho y tengo que decirles que no vendo nada de eso, se me están yendo muchos clientes a compra a otra parte debído a eso” Solicito $ 1,000.00 dlls para comprar material escolar para vender en mi negocio.

loans.use: To purchase school supplies for resale.

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es:
Maria is married and has three daughters. Her husband works in a car paint business. She initially had a little grocery store that allowed her to help her husband with the costs of living. The store she had gave her a little income. She also sold natural products there and this gave her a better income, so she decided to dedicate herself just to selling these natural products. The year before, her husband was sick and he used these products, which helped him get better. Now she distributes these same products, and they have improved her income, so she wants to continue to offer the same products.

Maria is requesting a loan of $750 to purchase more products because she has a lot of orders to cover due to the great demand for these products. She is offering to repay this loan in 6 months. She and her family thank you very much for your support because it enables them to continue growing in her business and also obtain a better quality of life.

Translated from the original Spanish by Admic Nacional staff

María esta casada y tiene tres hijas mujeres, su esposo trabaja como pintor en un taller de carros, ella inicialmente tenía una pequeña tienda de abarrotes, con la cual podía ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. La tienda que tenía le daba ingresos pequeños y tenía también la venta de productos naturales y eso le daba un mejor margen de ganancia por lo que decidió dedicarse a ello. En una época su esposo estaba enfermo y consumía estos productos que lo ayudaron a mejorarse y ella ahora es distribuidora de los mismos, con lo que ha mejorado sus ingresos y desea continuar con el mismo.

María está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 750 para poder comprar más productos ya que tiene muchos pedidos que entregar debido a la demanda que tienen estos productos, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 6 meses. Ella y su familia te agradecen mucho el apoyo que les brindas para continuar creciendo con su negocio y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

loans.use: To buy natural products to meet the high demand from her clients

loans.name: Gladis

texts.en:
Gladys is 26 years old and was married just 6 months ago. She has been a member of Pro Mujer in the city of El Alto for several years. She started out with a small loan of about $100, which allowed her to buy small quantities of goods to stock her small grocery stand. Over the years she was able to secure larger loans, which have allowed her to get to the point today where she is able to open a well-stocked grocery store in a commercial space.

Today Gladys lives with her brand new husband in a small apartment in the Cosmos 79 area. Her plan is to find a store to rent in a commercial area of El Alto that will guarantee a higher income for the couple.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Gladys M. de Torrez , tiene 26 años y esta casada hace 6 meses, pertenece a la asociación Rocío de la Mañana de Pro Mujer del Centro Focal de Villa Adela en la ciudad de El Alto. En sus inicios como socia, Gladys consiguió un pequeño crédito de aproximadamente 100 $us, con lo que inicio su negocio, comprando víveres por unidades y tratando de abastecer su tienda. Con el paso de los años y continuando en los ciclos de la organización, ella logra acceder a créditos algo más grandes con lo que por fin consolida la apertura de un almacén bien surtido.

Actualmente Gladys vive junto a su flamante esposo, en un pequeño departamento en la Zona de Cosmos 79, y su intención es conseguir una tienda en Anticrético por la ceja de El Alto, zona netamente comercial y que garantiza un mayor ingreso para ella y su pareja.

loans.use: To open a grocery store

loans.name: Rajab

texts.en: Rajab is a 31-year-old father of three. He runs a multi-faceted business in the Vituka area of Dar Es Salaam. For the past 8 years Rajab has done a little bit of everything. He is a camera man, sells sweet and Irish potatoes and has a restaurant which is open every evening, serving chips, chicken, and eggs. He would like to buy a modern camera and other studio equipments, and set up his own photo studio. Also, Rajab would like to upgrade his restaurant so that it provides services all day long. Rajab is in need of a loan of $450 to expand both of these businesses.

loans.use: To upgrade his restaurant so it can be open all day, and buy photographic equipment for an adjacent photo studio

loans.name: Clemena

texts.en: Clemena is 20 years old and has three sons (ages 4, 2 and 1).  For over two years, she has been in the business of selling cake and natural fruit juice. Her weekly profit is $60.00. Her biggest overhead expense in this business is buying ice for the drinks. She is requesting a loan of $250 so she can purchase a used freezer, which will enable her to chill more beverages cheaply and earn more profit from her sales. It will also help her raise the income to take care of her sons and allow the eldest to begin school next year.

loans.use: To purchase a used freezer to keep drinks iced.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es:
Ever since she was a little girl, Mrs. Emilia has been a very diligent woman, who has known how to suffer with thankful patience through many difficult situations, with the sole objective to support her young daughter. She learned to contribute in each one of the necessities of her household due to the shortages that exist in her house, and because of that she found she had to devote herself to many activities until she was able to begin a grocery store. This small business has permitted her to contribute to the development of her household and overall assist her husband who has an infirmity of the liver and recently has begun an expensive treatment to alleviate it. Due to this, she considers that the increase in capital for her freeing from debt in the little store will generate important sums of money. For this reason a loan to impel forward her little business, with the objective of aiding in the re-establishment to health of her beloved husband. Let us help this good mother who wants to offer a better future to her family.

Translated from Spanish by Pax Bobrow, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Emilia, desD. niña fue una mujer muy diligente que ha sabido sobrellevar gracias a su constancia muchas situaciones difíciles, con el único objetivo D. apoyar a su hija menor. Ella aprendió a contribuir en cada una D. las necesidades D. su hogar debido a las carencias que existían en su casa, razón por la que tuvo que dedicarse a múltiples actividades hasta que pudo iniciar un negocio D. venta D. abarrotes. Este pequeño comercio le ha permitido contribuir con el desarrollo D. su hogar y sobretodo ayudar a su esposo quien tiene una enfermedad en el hígado y hace poco ha iniciado un tratamiento muy costoso para aliviarse.Por lo que ella considera que el incremento D. capital para su desempeño en la pequeña tienda, le generará sumas D. dinero importantes. Por esta razón un préstamo para impulsar su pequeño negocio, con el objetivo D. ayudar en el restablecimiento D. la salud D. su querido esposo. Ayudemos a esta gran madre que desea brindarle un futuro mejor a su familia.

loans.use: Injection of capital to a small grocery store - Inyección de capital al pequeño negocio de abarrotes

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Đình, 55 years old, has been a member of the TYM Fund since 1995. She lives with her husband and 5 children in Tiên Dược, Sóc Sơn. Her husband and the oldest son practice veterinary medicine in the area. She is an active women with a good sense of business. She invested her first loan of 20USD into a flock of egg laying hens and ducks. The year after she had more loan and invested in raising pigs and cows. Since 2000 she has a banquet furniture renting business and a waste, scrap materials business on the side. She has 3 three employees with salary of 80USD a month each. Her monthly income is 350USD. She would like to take out a loan of 1200USD to expand her businesses.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Nguyễn Thị Đình, 55 tuổi, là thành viên tham gia Quỹ năm 1995. Chị đang sống cùng chồng và 5 người con tại Tiên Dược, Sóc Sơn. Chị là một người phụ nữ năng động và sử dụng vốn rất linh hoạt. Vòng 1 chị vay 20USD nuôi gà, vịt đẻ trứng. Sang năm thứ 2 chị vay vốn mua bò, lợn giống. Từ năm 2000 gia đình chị chuyển sang làm dịch vụ cho thuê phông bạt bàn ghế, bát đĩa phục vụ đám hiếu, hỷ trong thôn ngoài xã, ngoài ra chị còn mở thêm cửa hàng thu mua phế liệu. Chồng chị và con trai lớn làm dich vụ thú y với địa bàn khá rộng. Hiện tai chị thuê 3 cộng nhân phục vụ các công việc kinh doanh của gia đình, mức lương cho 1 công nhân là 80USD/tháng. Thu nhập hiện tại của chị Đình là 350USD/tháng. Chị đang dự định xin vay tiếp 1200USD để mua thêm bàn ghế, bát đĩa phục vụ nhu cầu ngày càng nhiều của người dân.

loans.use: Buy tables, chairs, chopsticks, bowl for rent

loans.name: Suriya's Group

texts.en:
My name is Suriya A. from a small town Kot Radha Kishan, Pakistan. I moved to this town 40 years ago from Pakistan’s second largest city Lahore. I am married and a mother of seven: three boys and four girls. Three of my daughters and two of my sons are married and live separately from us. My husband and one of my son sells pesticides and medicines used to kill white ants. They have set up their shop within our house. They now need to buy these medicines in bulk for their shop.

The other women who also need loans are:

Koser B., who runs a lumberyard, Shahida B., whose husband sells ladies' shoes,

Shahida H. needs this loan to help with her family's poultry farm,

Parween B. will invest this loan in her family's breakfast cafe,

Suriya B. wants to buy a dairy cow with her share of loan;and

Suriya B. is borrowing to help her family's fruit business.

loans.use: To buy more pesticides

loans.name: María

texts.es:
Maria is hardworking and trustworthy. With the help of your husband, in a short time she has transformed a small area of her home into a tile and brick workshop. Every morning she starts early in order to create mixtures and fire up thhe bricks, so that she has time to spend with her pets while, little by little, the bricks take shape and consistency. Both she and her husband have the same ambition to increase the business capital investment in order to cover the recent customer demands.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

Maria, es muy empeñosa y trabajadora. En sociedad con su esposo hace poco tiempo ha instalado en un pequeño espacio de su domicilio su taller de fabricación de tejas y ladrillos. Todas las mañanas desde muy temprano se listan para realizar las mezclas y cocción de los ladrillos a fin de retirarse a pastar a sus animalitos mientras estos poco a poco van tomando forma y consistencia.Ambos tienen el noble deseo de incrementar su capital de inversión para cubrir las recientes demandas de sus clientes.

loans.use: To increase capital in order to increase production

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles A. is forty years old and a refrigerator repairman. He works very hard to meet the demands of his various clients. However, Charles is constrained by capital to acquire the needed equipment and raw materials like dryers, copper rods, compressors, etc., to improve the business. He wants to use the loan to buy more dryers, copper rods, compressors, etc., to enable him serve his customers. Charles has seven apprentices under his training, to enable them also to learn the trade to earn a living. He has a personal guarantor to repay the loan in case of default. Charles is the one wearing a gray round-neck shirt in the photo, with one of his apprentices.

loans.use: To buy more copper rods, dryers, compressors, etc.

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 43 year-old Rukia R., who is single and has three children aged 7, 15, and 18. She has one other dependent who lives with her because she is an orphan. In 2005, Rukia established her small general store. Working seven days a week, 13 to 16 hours a day, assisted by one employee, she earns about $100 every month from this business. Rukia now requires a loan to purchase additional stocks of soda, water, cooking oil, and candy. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately $65. In the future, Rukia plans to increase the quantity and range of her stock. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of soda, water, cooking oil, and candy in bulk.

loans.name: Francisco Tomás

texts.pt:
Francisco is 51 years old and a native of Manjacaze, a district of Gaza in the south of Mozambique. He is married and the father of 5 children, 2 are already adults, and the the 3 younger ones live with him. Two are in school and are 15 and 5 years old respectively. The youngest is 3. Besides his family he supports two stepchildren and his mother who lives in the province of Gaza.

Francisco studied until the 7th grade and did not continue because there were no more classes in the district where they lived. As soon as he stopped his schooling he was submitted to obligatory military service that lasted from 1974 through 1987. Francisco married for the first time in 1983 and separated in 1987 with 3 children. He married again and has 2 children with his second wife.

Francisco works for the Olympic Committee. He lives in his own home. He has worked for the Olympic Committee since 1999 as security and works 16 hour days with 2 days off. Francisco learned the security service while in the army. He has a monthly salary of 2,151MT and an army pension of 3,258MT. He is not saving any money because he is investing in the construction of a house. He has given himself the challenge of finishing his house.

This will be his third loan through Hluvuku and his first loan with Kiva which he intends to use to purchase construction materials for his home. The first two loans were also used to buy materials for construction since only one did not allow him to finish.

Francisco says thank you for the loan that is going to help him realize his dream. In the future he intends to build a home for his children and improve the condition and well being of his family.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

Francisco tem 51 anos de idade e é natural de Manjacaze um distrito da província de Gaza no sul de Moçambique. Casado e pai de 5 filhos, sendo dois ja maiores os três últimos vive com eles e os dois mais velhos já vão a escola de 15 e 5 anos respectivamente e o menor de 3 anos. Para alem da sua família sustenta mais dois enteados e a sua mãe que se encontra na província de Gaza. Francisco estudou até 7ªClasse e não continuou por que no distrito que vivia não tinha as classe seguintes. Logo que ficou sem estudar foi submetido ao serviço militar obrigatório que durou desde 1974 até 1987. Francisco casou-se pela primeira vez em 1983 e veio a separar desta mulher em 1987 e tiveram 3 filhos e casou-se novamente e tem com esta nova esposa 2 filhos. Francisco trabalha no Comité Olímpico. Francisco vive numa casa própria. Francisco é trabalhador do Comité Olímpico desde 1999 como segurança e trabalha 16 horas e sujeito a folgas de 2 dias. Francisco aprendeu o serviço de segurança na tropa. Francisco tem um salário mensal de 2151,00mt e pensão reforma de tropa de 3258,00mt e não poupa nenhum dinheiro porque está investindo na construção da casa. Francisco coloca como desafio a conclusão da casa. Este será o terceiro empréstimo do Francisco na Hluvuku e primeiro no Kiva, o qual pretende comprar material de construção para sua casa. Os dois primeiros também usou o dinheiro para compra de material de construção uma vez que uma só vez não seria capaz de concluir. Francisco diz graça ao empréstimo que está vendo o seu sonho a realizar-se. Francisco pretende futuramente construir uma casa para seus filhos e melhorar as condições de bem estar da família.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Sebastiana

texts.es:
Sebastiana is 42 years old, attended school until second graD., speaks both Aymará and Castellano and is maried with two children who are currently students at school. Her house is located in the Marquiri sector of the Centro Poblado of Caritamaya, in the Acora District and the Puno Province.

She has been dedicated to the sales of cows and sheep in the markets of Llave and Acora since a very young age. She is a member of the Communcal Bank "Nuevo Horizonte" in order to increase her resources; with the initial loan of S/. 300.00 Peruvain Soles she invested in and purchased six sheep. With this loan of S/. 500.00 Peruvian Soles ($ 200) which will be repaid in four months, she will purchase three young sheep (in order for them to grow) and the remaining money will be used to purchase sheep to sell on a weekly basis.

She explains that is very pleased to have learned how to administer her payments and little by little increase her economic gains. Her vision for the future is to purchase more land for the small farmhouse, purchase more livestock and in this manner increase her economic gains in order to proviD. her children with an education so they may become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Chloé Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

Sebastiana tiene 42 años D. edad, estudio hasta el segundo año D. primaria; habla el idioma aymará y castellano es casada y tiene dos hijos quienes estudian en la escuela y colegio, su casa esta ubicada en el sector Marquiri del Centro Poblado D. Caritamaya, Distrito D. Acora, Provincia D. Puno. Se dedica a la compra y venta D. vacas, ovejas que los adquiere en las ferias D. Ilave y Acora y son vendidas en las mismas ferias, a esta actividad se dedica desD. muy joven, ingreso al Banco Comunal “Nuevo Horizonte” para incrementar su capital; donD. tuvo un crédito inicial D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles que lo invirtió en la compra D. seis ovejas; Con este crédito D. S/. 500.00 nuevos soles el cual lo cancelarà en cuatro meses, comprarà 3 ovejas para criarlas y con el resto del dinero lo utilizarà para la compra D. ovejas que las venD. semanalmente. Ella manifiesta que siendo socia aprendió a ser trabajadora administrar su dinero e incremento un poco mas su ingreso económico. La visión futura que ella tiene es comprar más terrenos para la chacra, comprar más ganado y D. esa manera incrementar su ingreso y lograr hacer estudiar a sus hijos para que sean profesionales.

loans.use: Purchasing livestock (sheep)

loans.name: Rene

texts.es:
Mr. René Gámez is applying for a loan to make slab for a spare room. He works as a truck driver all day as his parents are in his care; they are of age and not able to work anymore. (His mother is shown in the photo as the applicant was working).

Mr. Gámez has had a loan with FVP which was punctually repaid and now he is requesting one from KIVA to build a room for his parents as their present room is very small and they need more space and comfort to make it more accessible.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

El Sr. René Gámez está solicitando un préstamo para la elaboración de la losa en un cuarto que le esta haciendo falta. El trabajo de chofer de un camión de carga trabajo todo el día ya que está a su cargo sus papás que son personas mayores de edad y no pueden ya trabajar. (En la foto aparece su mama porque el solicitante se encontraba trabajando).

El ha tenido préstamo en FVP el cual pago puntualmente y esta solicitándole uno a KIVA para la elaboración de una losa en un cuarto que es para sus papás ya que la habitación que están habitando es muy chica y necesitan mas espacio y acondicionarla a una manera que sea más accesible para ellos.

loans.use: Laying of concrete slab in a room.

loans.name: Saul Alcides

texts.es:
hola mi nombre es Saul H. tengo 31 años de edad, estoy casado y tengo 4 hijos, los cuales los hemos sacado adelante luchando junto a mi esposa con la venta de pescado, negocio que tenemos hace 5 años y que distribuyo en disferentes lugares como ser restaurantes y casas particulares.
tomamos la decision de crear este negocio ya que tenemos el proyo de unos familiares que son los que producen el pescado y ellos nos los venden a un precio muy comodo, asi tenemos mas ganancias.
yo creo que el credito es una buena opcion para el desarrollo de mi negocio.
texts.en:
Hello, my name is Saul H.. I am 31 years old, I am married and I have 4 children. My wife and I have managed to care for them together by selling fish, a business we have been running for the past 5 years, distributing to different locales such as restaurants and private homes.

We decided to start up this small business because he have the support of our family members, they are the producers fo the fish and they sell the fish to us at a very good rate, just so that we can have better earnings. This loan will be a good way to help my business grow.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fish.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es: Magdalena tiene 47 años, vive muy feliz con su esposo y una de sus hijas.  Por más de 12 años, ella y su esposo se han estado dedicando a la fabricación de zapatos, que cada vez es en mayor escala, su esposo desde muy joven trabajaba en una zapatería y todos  estos conocimientos los volcó en su negocio, es de ahí que Magdalena aprendió a confeccionar zapatos de todo tipo de diseño, básicamente en material de cuero, en todas sus variedades y tallas. Su taller, con el paso de los años ha ido creciendo, hoy puede fabricar alrededor de 100 pares de zapatos, con estos años de trabajo, Magdalena y su esposo han logrado comprar su propio terreno para su casa, pudo educar a sus 3 hijos, dos de ellos ya son profesionales que pueden valerse por si mismos, por ello se siente muy satisfecha de este trabajo independiente que desempeñan en familia. Todos los fines de semana va a las ciudades de Ayacucho y Huanta para vender sus zapatos, a veces para ella, lo más difícil es cuando los clientes que sacaron al crédito no  devuelven el dinero a tiempo.  Magdalena se esfuerza para poder cada día superarse y ayudar a su última hija que está estudiando en la universidad.  Solicita este préstamo, con el que podrá comprar más cuero e implementos para fabricar sus zapatos y hacer crecer su producción, el gran anhelo de Magdalena, es exportar lo que produce, para lo cual su última hija se está preparando con sus estudios para asumir ese reto.
texts.en:
Magdalena is 47-years old and is happily living with her husband and one of her daughters. For the last 12-years, she and her husband have dedicated themselves to the art of shoe making. At a very young age, her husband worked for a shoemaker and gained a lot of knowledge which he eventually used to start his own business. And from there, Magdalena learned to make shoes of all designs, using basic materials in leather for all shapes and sizes. Their shop, with the passage of time has been growing, and today they make about 100 pairs of shoes. With these years of working, Magdalena and her husband have managed to purchase the plot of land where their house is, put three kids through school with two of them now as professionals who are able to fend for themselves.

For Magdalena, she feels that she gets the most satisfaction performing her job for her family. Every weekend they go to the city of Ayacucho and Huanta to sell their shoes. Sometimes, for Magdalena it is very difficult when customers don’t repay their debt on time. Magdalena strives each day to succeed and to help her youngest daughter get a college education. She requests a loan to buy more leather and tools to make shoes and to increase their production. Magdalena’s great desire is to be an exporter of their products, for which they are preparing their youngest daughter to take up the challenge.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy leather and more tools for shoe making.

loans.name: Virgen De Lourdes Group

texts.es: EL GRUPO VIRGEN D. MARÍA LOURDES REPRESENTADO POR LA SEÑORA YOLANDA TODOS LOS MIEMBROS PERTENECE AL BARRIO LOURDES CONFORMADO POR 15 SOCIOS, ELLOS HAN DEMOSTRADO EN SUS ANTERIORES FINANCIAMIENTOS SER RESPONSABLES SOLIDARIOS Y CUMPLIDOS, TODOS SON VECINOS Y EN SU MAYORÍA PROPIETARIAS D. SUS VIVIENDAS. ALGUNAS SOCIAS VENDEN COMIDAS, OTRAS SE OCUPAN D. GUARDERÍAS, Y LAS DEMÁS SOCIAS TIENE SUS TIENDAS D. BARRIO, LOS SOCIOS VARONES SON TAXISTAS A EXCEPTO D. UN SOLO SOCIO QUE TIENE UNA DESPENSA EN LA CUAL VEND. CARNE VERDURAS Y D. MAS ALIMENTOS. EL DESTINO D. CRÉDITO D. ESTOS SOCIOS ES PARA CAPITAL D. OPERACIONES Y COMPRA D. INSUMOS Y MATERIALES O PARA HACER CRECER SUS PEQUEÑOS PUESTOS D. VENTA PARA EL SUSTENTO Y MEJORAMIENTO D. LA CALIDAD D. VIDA D. SUS FAMILIAS.
texts.en:
The group "Virgen D. Maria Lourdes" is represented by Yolanda. The 15 members of the group live in the Lourdes neighborhood; most of them own their homes. As recipients of past loans, they all have proven to be responsible, caring and reliable. Some of the female members sell food out of their homes, others proviD. child care and others run small corner stores. The male members are taxi drivers, except for one who runs a grocery store. The loan will be used as work capital, and to purchase materials and foodstuffs to restock and make their businesses grow, and ultimately improve their and their families' way of life.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: work capital

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Phạm Thị L. năm nay 43 tuổi. Chị tham gia Quỹ thương từ năm 2003. Vòng vốn đầu tiên chị xin vay 1.000.000đ để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi và buôn bán nhỏ. Qua 5 năm sử dụng vốn vay hiệu quả  hiện nay chị đã là chủ một cửa hàng chuyên kinh doanh quần áo.Hàng  tháng ngoài nguồn thu nhập từ chăn nuôi, kinh doanh gia đình chị còn có thêm nguồn thu từ lương của chồng nên kinh tế rất ổn định.
 Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để đầu tư cho công việc kinh doanh quần áo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Phạm Thị L. is 43 years old. She's been participating in the TYM Fund since 2003. She put her first loan of 1,000,000 VND towards raising livestock and a small business. She has had success with the borrowed funds and now is the owner of a clothing store. The family's income from raising livestock and the family business is supplemented with her husband's salary each month. Therefore, the family's financial situation is steady. For this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 10,000,000 VND to invest further into her clothing store business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in her clothing retail business

loans.name: Nuuao

texts.en: Nuuao M. is a 66 year old women who is married and cares for 9 children. She sells her products to the village people and public 2 days a week. She has received one loan in the past from SPBD. SPBD loans are Nuuao’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase expand the plantation

loans.name: Dora

texts.en: Dora A. is a 39-year-old woman who resides in Abeka Lapaz, a suburb of Accra, with her husband and 5 children. They live in a rented apartment. Currently, 4 of her children are in school. The last born is yet to start school. Dora owns and operates a cosmetics and fabrics shop in the local market. She believes she can make her business grow bigger and brighter with loan support and wants to use the loan to buy more assorted cosmetics to increase her stock of goods. Dora’s photograph was taken during her group meeting. She says she wants to work harder to support her children in school.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and fabrics

loans.name: Sin

texts.en: R. is 35 years old and a resident of the Kompong Tom Province in Cambodia. He has two children, both of whom are single and students. R. is married to Sina who sells sweets in the market. He earns his living by burning wood into charcoal and selling them to the markets. R. gets up every morning to go to his field and comes back home in the late afternoon in his bare feet. He pulls with his strong body, a cart between his field and home, and then to the market. Recently, R. requested a loan to buy a pair of buffaloes to pull his cart. He dreams of having a good living, a good house, and degrees for his children. R. was not available during the photograph, so his wife is shown instead.

loans.use: To buy a pair of buffaloes to pull his cart

loans.name: Efe

texts.en:
Efe O. sells rechargeable phone cards and accessories. She wants to expand this business; therefore, she is asking for a loan of N60,000 to purchase more rechargeable phone cards and accessories.

Efe is 32 year old mother of two children. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more rechargeable phone cards and accessories

loans.name: Fati

texts.en:
Fati S. is a 35-year-old divorcee with two children. Her husband was playing around. She could not bear it and thought it best to get on without him. She lives with her children at Eguase, a suburb of Moore in the central region of Ghana. Fati belongs to a village bank called “Kronkronye Name” which literally means “God’s Holiness”.

Times have been very tough for Fati but she decided not to give up. Fati learned a trade to earn a living. She now runs a food vending stand and sells cocoa drink with pastries. She prepares those pastries with flour, sugar, margarine, eggs etc. She normally sells in the morning between 6:00 am and 11:00 am. After that, she quickly switches to her slipper sales, hawking throughout the community.

Prices of the ingredients have gone up making it difficult to buy more from the market. Fati has insufficient working capital to scale up the business. This loan will enable her to purchase good quality supplies in large quantity to upgrade her stores. Fati is grateful for the assistance.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for pastries and slippers for resale

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace A. is 45 years old and a widow with 5 children. She produces soap locally for washing. She also produces cellophane. She is requesting a loan of N50,000 to purchase more materials to produce more soap and cellophane to sell.  She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more materials for producing soap and cellophane to sell

loans.name: Iv

texts.en:
Iv O. is 56 years old and lives with her husband in the Takeo province. She works as a rice farmer, weaver and also raises pigs. On average, she is able to make US $1 per day. Her husband sells mangoes in the local market and earns approximately US $12 per day. This family is also supported by two children who work as taxi drivers.

To make more money, Iv would like to take out a loan for her husband to purchase mangoes from a grower to sell at the market. (Iv O. is pictured with her husband at home)

loans.use: To purchase mangoes to sell.

loans.name: Hilarion

texts.es: Hilarión tiene 49  años, vive con su  esposa y sus 4 hijos en su casa propia. Desde su niñez se ha dedicado a las tareas del campo, las cuales realiza de manera incansable, todos los días, al lado de su esposa y sus hijos. Cultiva principalmente la papa, ya que este tubérculo es un producto principal de abasto para los mercados de las ciudades aledañas a su comunidad donde las comercializa. Una vez que cosecha vende tanto al por mayor, como en menores cantidades, es por ello que se da el trabajo de seleccionar su cosecha en calidades y tamaño, para que de acuerdo a ello, ponga los precios a sus productos. Para el futuro, Hilarión quiere seguir con esta actividad, e ir poco a poco incrementando su producción. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con su banco comunal, donde tiene muchas expectativas de emprender un trabajo solidario con el resto de integrantes de su grupo. El dinero que solicita será para comprar semillas mejoradas de papa y abono para fortalecer  sus tierras de cultivo.
texts.en:
Hilarión is 49 years old. He lives with his wife and their four children in their own house. Since he was a child he has worked in the fields; today he continues to do so tirelessly every day along with his wife and their children. He He mainly grows potato, since this tuber is a main ingredient supplied to the markets in nearby cities. Once he harvests, he sells his harvest both wholesale and retail. For this reason he has to separate his harvest by quality and size and price them accordingly.

In the future, Hilarión wants to continue with this activity and gradually increase his production. This is the first time that he has borrowed with a communal bank. He has many hopes of working collaboratively with the rest of the members of his group. The money that he requests will be to buy higher quality seeds for potatoes and fertilizer for his land.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Chong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet R. is from the village of Bay-bay, Balatacan, Tangub City. She is 36 years old. Juliet is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Juliet operates a family member's business selling shrimp and seafood products in the local community. Juliet has been engaged in her business for over 9 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Juliet joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Juliet is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Juliet from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seafood to sell.

loans.name: Arceli

texts.en:
Arceli manages a general store in their village in Research Minante 1, Cauayan City. She is 53 years old and married to Danilo, a driver. The couple is blessed with four children. According to Arceli, people in their community are hard-working and are doing their best to surpass the hardships of life. 

Arceli wants to borrow PHP10,000. She is positive that this amount can improve her store and also increase her income. She wants to develop her business so she can assist her husband in providing for the needs of their family and, most important, the needs of their children. She wants her business become productive and for this, she is patiently doing her best.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Mary Dale

texts.en:
Mary Dale L. is from the village of Barangay Poblacion, Iligan City. She is 48 years old. Mary Dale is married to Benito and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Mary Dale owns and operates a specialized retail business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling electronic loading and from a dealership of different products for the local community. Mary Dale has been engaged in her business for more than 7 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In July 2009, Mary Dale joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Dale is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Mary Dale from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to the family's income of the family and to support her children's education. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand the business

location.town: Poblacion, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Marcelline

texts.fr: Marcelline est née le 25/04/1981 à Cotonou, Capitale Économique de la République du Bénin. Marcelline est mariée à HOUNWEDO Richard, un menuisier. Marcelline n'a pas encore eu d'enfant. Il y a trois ans que Marcelline a ouvert son salon de coiffure au domicile conjugal à ZOGBO, un quartier de Cotonou. Mais avant, alors qu'elle était en congé de fin d'apprentissage, Marcelline a, pour quelques mois, vendu la pâte de maïs localement appelée l'akassa avec du poisson frit. Depuis qu'elle a ouvert son salon de coiffure, Marcelline se consacre uniquement à coiffure. En plus de la coiffure, Marcelline vend également les produits et articles de coiffure(mèche, défrisant, shampoing, etc.). Pour mieux servir sa clientèle, Marcelline sollicite son premier crédit de ALIDé pour équiper encore plus son salon de coiffure.
texts.en:
Marcelline was born on April 25, 1981 in Cotonou, the economic capital of the Republic of Benin. She is married to HOUNWEDO Richard, a furniture maker. Marcelline has not yet had children. It’s been three years since she opened her hair salon in her conjugal home in ZOGBO, a district of Cotonou. But in the past, while she was on leave finishing her apprenticeship, she sold for a few months cornmeal mash, locally called “akassa”, with fried fish. Since she opened her hair salon, she has been devoting herself to hairdressing only. In addition to hairdressing, she also sells hair products and goods (hair extensions, straighteners, shampoos, etc.) To server her customers better, she is requesting her first loan from ALIDé to equip her hair salon even further.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 50 dozen hair extensions and 9 boxes of cosmetic products

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma M. is from the village of Naawan, Iligan City. She is 48 years old. Elma is married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Elma owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Elma has been engaged in her business for over 25 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Elma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Elma is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product selection. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Elma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product selection.

loans.name: Dambe Group

texts.fr:
Les dix femmes du groupe Dambe (7 mariées et 3 célibataires), avec une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans ont en moyenne 3 enfants et vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygames à Sanoubougou 1,  un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative  de la république du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur deuxième  prêt de groupe. Le prêt précédent a  été bien remboursé. 
Elles font  comme activités  la vente de  médicaments, de tissus, de condiments alimentaires,  des fruits, de l’huile etc.
 Avec leur nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 4 emballages de médicaments, 5 emballages de condiments alimentaires, 4 sacs d’oranges, 2 cartons de pommes, 2 sacs d’ananas,  3 bidons de 20 litres d’huiles alimentaires et 4 balles de tissus. Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Sikasso ville et dans les villages avoisinants.
  Elles vendent à Sikasso ville dans les  différents marchés  de façon fixe et dans les  quartiers de façon ambulante, au comptant, souvent à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel de 31.500 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille, l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
Certaines d’entre elles comptent acheter un lot à usage d’habitation à Sikasso ville et d’autres  ouvrir un magasin de vente.
texts.en:
The ten women of the group Dambe (7 married and 3 unmarried) have an average age of 35 and an average of 3 children.  They live for the most part in polygamous families in Sanoubougou 1, one of the districts of the city of Sikasso (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  The group members are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso to satisfy the needs of their customers and are now on their second group loan.  The previous loan was repaid.  Their work involves selling medicines, cloth, condiments, fruit, oil, etc. With their new loan, they intend to buy 4 packages of medicines, 5 packages of condiments, 4 sacks of oranges, 2 boxes of apples, 2 sacks of pineapples, 3 drums of vegetable oil (20 liters each), and 4 bales of cloth.  Supplies are gotten at the grand marketplace of Sikasso City and in neighboring villages.  Sales are made in Sikasso City in the different marketplaces from fixed spots and throughout the districts by hawking the goods.  Cash is accepted, and sometimes credit, from customers composed of men and women.  The group members each envision realizing a monthly profit of 31,500 francs CFA.  A portion of it will go towards savings and family needs, and the other portion will be invested in business.  Some of the group members intend to buy a plot of land on which to live in Sikasso City and to open a sales store. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various goods

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 43 years old and married with five children between 14 and 27 years. Two of her children still go to school and she also takes care of additional family members. Alice rents a two room house, with electricity and piped water, where she is staying with three people. The family gets three meals a day. Alice resides and works seven days a week in a semi-urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala in Kawala.

Alice owns a meat store in Kawala which sells beef and receives at least 30 customers a day. She buys the meat from the Kampala city abattoir which she reaches by public transport. Alice pays 40000/= a month rent for her business premises. She sells retail and wholesale to all categories of people. Alice has been in this business for five years. She has been with Kiva partner MCDT for two years, is servicing her fourth loan and working with the same group mates. She plans to use this loan to buy more meat for resale. Alice aspires to see her business grow and employ other people.

loans.use: To buy meat.

loans.name: Grover

texts.en:
Grover is 24 years old, single, and lives in a small, humble home with his mother. He is a dairy cow farmer and spends his days tending to his livestock, which he has been doing for over 12 years now.

With this loan from Kiva partner CIDRE, Grover will invest in more cattle so he can produce a greater quantity of milk. With the extra income, Grover hopes that he can help his elderly mom and improve their standard of living. As he is his mother's only son, he had to leave his studies in order to help her tend to the difficult and laborious work on the farm.

In the future, he hopes to finish high school and build a career for himself. Above all, Grover wants to make sure that his elderly mother has enough money to be able to retire. He also hopes to help her expand her home, as a way of repaying her for all the help she has given him over the years.

loans.use: To purchase livestock for milk production

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en: Mrs. Beverly A. is a very industrious mother of 5 children. She is 37 years old and a resident of P3 Minsubong, Tangub City. She is married to Mr. Eugenio A., a laborer with an average income of P200.00 a day. The income of her husband is not enough to support her 4 dependent children especially with their school needs. To help her husband, she decided to engage in the business of selling bananas, firewood and other products. With an initial capital of P1,000.00 for bananas and P200.00 for firewood, she has been able to sustain her business for 10 years. Presently she is earning an average net income of P3,500.00 a month which is a great help with supporting her family. With excellent character and loyalty in our co-op, she has been able to avail her 2nd cycle loan under the PDP-LP Program in the amount of P10,000.00. This will add to her capital for bananas and firewood. Her future plans are to repair her house and be able to continually support her children, especially for their college education.

loans.use: Additional capital for bananas and firewood for resale

loans.name: Yaqueline

texts.es:
La socia YAQUELINE pertenece al banco comunal “MINIBANK”, es natural de la ciudad del Cusco.

La socia tiene 27 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene una hija de 6 meses de nacida. 

Ella tiene una pequeña agencia de viajes y turismo que brinda servicios turísticos que ofrece la ciudad Imperial del Cusco como el Valle Sagrado de los Incas, Machupicchu, Salkantay, etc.   

Ella requiere el préstamo para implementar sus equipos de viajes como equipos de camping, carpas, menajeria (utensilios de cocina) para brindar mejor los servicios para los turistas que llegan a la ciudad del Imperial del Cusco. 

La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Yaqueline belongs to Minibank community bank. She is from Cusco. She is 27 years old and has a 6-month old daughter with her live-in partner. Yaqueline has a small travel agency that provides tourism services from Cusco, such as the Sacred Valley of the Incans, Machupicchu, Salkantay, etc. She needs a loan to obtain travel equipment, such as camping gear, tents, and cooking utensils, in order to provide better service to the tourists that arrive in the imperial city of Cusco. She is grateful for this opportunity and is committed to repaying the loan as scheduled.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase additional travel gear.

loans.name: Noemi

texts.es:
La socia NOEMI pertenece al banco comunal “HATUN SONCCO”. El nombre del banco comunal es de origen del idioma Quechua, “HATUN” significa “Grande” y “SONCCO” significa “Corazón” que traducido al español significa “Corazón grande”. ( please click here Quechua)

La socia tiene 22 años de edad, es conviviente, en sus brazos tiene a su hijo que tiene un año de nacido y ellos viven en la ciudad Imperial del Cusco. La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el pequeño negocio de venta de papas y verduras que lo trae de la ciudad de Abancay del departamento de Apuricma. Ya son dos años y medio con esta actividad y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo, nuestra socia es una mujer joven, luchadora y emprendedora pues con mucha voluntad se dedica al negocio y piensa en aumentar su capital de negocio comprando más verdura y papas.  
 
La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
NOEMI, 22, is a member of the "HATUN SONCCO" communal bank. The name of the bank is from the Quechua language. "HATUN" means "Big" and "SONCCO" means "Heart" so, translated into Spanish, it means "Big Heart." She lives with her life partner and carries their son, who is a year old, in her arms. They live in the imperial city of Cusco. She alternates her household chores with a small vegetable and potato selling business. She brings the merchandise from the city of Abancay, Apuricma department. She has had this line of work for the last two-and-a-half years and has done very well thanks to all the effort she puts into it. She is a young, hard-working, enterprising woman who, with much dedication, sees to her business and intends to increase her working capital buying more vegetables and potatoes. She is grateful for the opportunity this means offers her and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vegetables and potatoes.

loans.name: Roland

texts.en:
Roland is 37 years old; he is married and has a child. His wife is a trader. His child is still dependent upon him and goes to school.  Roland mills palm fruits into cooking oil to sell. Cooking oil is essential in the preparation of soup in Nigeria. With this business, he supports his wife in meeting the basic needs of their home.

The Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa, and Roland is a committed LAPO client. He is requesting a loan of 100,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more palm fruits to mill into cooking oil to sell, in the hopes of expanding his business. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more palm fruits to mill and sell.

loans.name: Nimia

texts.es:
La señora Nimia tiene 61 años de edad, esta casada hace varios años, su marido es jubilado, tiene 3 hijos todos mayores e independientes.
La Sra. Nimia posee una mercería hace más de 14 años, se dedica a la compra venta de artículos de ropería, mercería y lencería, tiene una clientela clasificada ya que sus prendas son de marcas exclusivas de Argentina y Brasil, tiene clientela formada por la facilidad de pago que ella ofrece. 
Se inició con la venta ambulante con unos ahorros, luego vio la necesidad de tener un puesto fijo por la educación de sus hijos y habilitó en su sala una pequeña parte de sus mercaderías y con el tiempo fue aumentando su stock de mercaderías hasta lo que es en la actualidad.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de mercaderías tales como: remeras, vestidos, blusas, polleras, lencerías y otros.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nimia is 61 years old, has been married for several years, and her husband is retired. She has 3 children, all adults and independent. For more than 14 years Mrs. Nimia has had a haberdasher's shop. She buys and sells clothing, haberdashery and lingerie. She has a classified clientele because her garments are of exclusive brands from Argentina and Brazil. She has a steady clientele because she offers payment options. She started as a street vendor with some savings. Then she saw the need to have a fixed locale for her children's education and she set up a a small part of her merchandise in her living room and with time she increased her merchandise stock until what it has become now. She requests a loan to buy merchandise such as t-shirts, dresses, blouses, skirts, lingerie, and others.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy merchandise such as t-shirts, dresses, blouses, skirts, lingerie, and others

loans.name: Mercedes Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Mercedes G. a la edad de 27 años posee una pulpería que esta ubicada en su casa de habitación en la que ofrece productos perecederos así como granos básicos, gaseosas, leña entre otros, de este modo puede solventar los gastos y educación de sus tres hijos menores.
Solicita el crédito con CEPRODEL ya que quiere agrandar un poco más su negocio para darle una mejor estabilidad económica a su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Mercedes G. is 27 years old and manages a grocery store in her home. She offers perishable products, as well as basic grains, soft drinks, firewood, and other items. This enables her to cover her household expenses and pay for the education of her three dependent children.

Mercedes is requesting a loan from CEPRODEL so that she can expand her store a little bit and provide her family better economic stability.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase inventory for her store

loans.name: Miraluna

texts.en:
Miraluna L. is from the city of Carmen Annex Ozamiz City. She is 26 years old and single.

To make a living, Miraluna operates a family member's business planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables such as "kangkong" string beans, okra, and squash for sale. Miraluna has been engaged in her business for one year and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Miraluna joined GDMPC to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Miraluna successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. She is requesting her eighth loan, for 15000 PHP, which she will use to expand the business and improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Note

To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in her vegetable business.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda C. is from the village of Guinles. She is 57 years old. Luzviminda is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Luzviminda owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Luzviminda has been engaged in her business for more than 30 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP on average a month for these activities.

In 2007, Luzviminda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luzviminda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Luzviminda is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which also will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be her fourth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Niyamaddin

texts.en:
Niyamaddin R. is 37 years old. He buys and sells bulls from different markets and has been in business for the past eight years, when his salary as a school teacher wasn’t enough even for a loaf of bread. His main customers are butchers and livestock farmers. Niyamaddin is married and the father of three children. With the loan he requested, he plans to purchase more bulls for trade and this, he says, will increase his turnover. 

His dream is to have his own farm one day. Lets do our best to help Niyamaddin approach his dream.

loans.use: Purchase three bulls

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
La señora Maria Elena M. B., tiene 44 años de edad, vende ropa y tiene una discomóvil, ella es casada y tiene una hija, ellos viven en el Barrio Laureles Norte.

Ella dice sentirse agradecida con los Fondos Kiva, por que poco a poco ha podido edificar su vivienda, ahora ella solicita para la compra de  ropa y para cubrir unos gastos y e invertir en el negocio, dentro de los problemas a los que se ha enfrentado, esta el desequilibro económico, por el cual atraviesa el país, pero no pierde las esperanzas, ni las fuerzas de trabajar duro y mejorar su estilo de vida y el de su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Elena M. B. is 44 years old; she sells clothing and has a mobile disco/disc jockey service. She is married and has 1 daughter; they live in the Barrio Laureles Norte.

Maria is grateful to Kiva funds, because little by little she has been able to improve her home. Now she needs a loan to buy clothing, cover some expenses and to invest in the business. Some of the problems that she has faced are the economic problems that the country is going through, but she does not loose hope or the determination to keep working hard and to improve her way of life and that of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy used clothing.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan, 52, is married to Felix.  She operates a general shop, selling food items like cooking oil, flour, matchboxes etc.  This is her primary business for two years now.  She stays in the Kirigu trading center near Kikuyu town.  Joan is also into  dairy farming.  She keeps cows for milk production. 

This area is a very favorable environment for livestock and crop farming.  Her clients are mainly residents who buy items on a retail basis.

She has previously borrowed from ECLOF before joining KADET.  This is her first loan with KADET.  She hopes to expand her shop and add at least four more dairy cows for more milk production.

loans.use: Buy more stock for her general shop.

loans.name: Sann

texts.en: This modest villager of 30 years, Mrs. Sann L., resides in Siem Reap Province. She is currently a pig seller in the local market. She normally sells all the pigs to slaughter when they come to maturity, around six months after breeding. She is the mother of four school-aged children who live with her in the home. Sann L. has a life partner in her husband, who is a rice farmer. Sann L. requests the money for her husband to cultivate rice crops.

loans.use: To cultivate rice crops
