loans.name: Abiodun

texts.en: Abiodun is a LAPO client with good  repayment records. She is 35 years old, married with 5 children. Her children are doing well at school and this gives her joy as a mother. She sells female clothes to make a living. Yusuf is very determined and wants to expand the size of her business in order to make more profits. She is requesting for a loan amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more female clothes to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more female clothes to sell

loans.name: Elva Mercedes

texts.es:
Elva de 59 años, vive en el suburbio de Guayaquil, tiene tres hijos de 18, 17 y 15 años, ella es vendedora de mejillones (son moluscos que viven formando comunidades más o menos numerosas, fijados a las rocas en la costa del Ecuador. Se sirven en varios platos típicos) y otros mariscos, los vende en el mercado de “San Vicente” del suburbio. 

Con esfuerzo y dedicación Elva tiene un puesto en el mercado y vende los mejillones a $ 1.50 la funda, conchas a $ 3.00 la funda etc. Trabaja desde las 08h00 hasta las 12h00 todos los días. Con el préstamo quiere comprar mejillones, conchas y pescado para vender en su negocio. 

En el futuro quiere tener un local para su negocio de mariscos.
texts.en:
Elva, 59, lives in El Suburbio, Guayaquil; she has three children who are 18, 17 and 15 years of age. She sells mussels (mollusks living in more or less numerous colonies attached to rocks along Ecuador’s coast, they are served in a variety of typical dishes) and other seafood in El Suburbio’s “San Vicente” market. Elva invests effort and dedication into her stall in the market. She sells mussels for $1.50 a bag, conchs for $3.00 a bag, etc. She’s open for business from 8-12 daily. She will use the funds to buy mussels, conchs and seafood to sell in her stall. She’d love to have a fish market in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shellfish.

loans.name: Villa Concepción Group

texts.es:
El comité “Villa Concepción” tiene  más D. 2 años D. formación y trabajo con la Fundación Paraguaya, la mayoría D. sus integrantes ya  realiza actividades productivas, pero incluyen entre sus integrantes a 4 señoras que emprenderán actividades. 
Incluyen entre las actividades realizadas la venta D. frutas y verduras, venta D. comestibles artesanales como empanadas D. carne, empanadas D. pollo, empanadas D. jamón y queso, venta D. mercaderías varias como: fideo, azúcar, harina, aceite, jabón, entre otros artículos, venta D. ropas, venta D. remedios etc. 
Anhelan un futuro mejor para sus hijos es por eso que se esfuerzan el doble para facilitarles los materiales para su desarrollo y formación.
Una D. las integrantes es la señora Margarita M. quien se dedica a la venta D. ropas en un salón que posee en su casa. .
Ella atienD. su salón y además se ocupa D. su casa, es una señora muy trabajadora y procura mucho para que sus hijos salgan delante D. la mejor manera posibles culminando sus estudios. .
Ella comenta que el sueño que tiene es ver a sus hijos todos profesionales y por ella seguirá trabajando para luchar por sus objetivos. .
Agradece por el apoyo que encuentra  en la Fundación Paraguaya y solicita el crédito para la compra D. remeras, pantalones, jeans, camperas, buzos, calzados y otros.
texts.en:
The group Villa Concepción was founded over two years ago and has been working with Fundación Paraguaya. The majority of its members already have their own businesses, but the group also includes four women who will be just starting out. The members are engaged in various retail activities which incluD.: sales of fruits and vegetables, sales of homemaD. empanadas (filled with chicken, meat, ham and cheese), sales of general merchandise such as pasta, sugar, flour, cooking oil, soap as well as sales of clothing and medicines. All the members desire a better future for their children, and for this reason they make twice the effort to be able to proviD. them with everything necessary for their education and development. One of the members is Margarita M.; she sells clothing from a vending post that she maintains in her home. Her dream is to see her children grow up to become professionals, and for this reason she will continue to work hard to proviD. them with everything they need. Margarita appreciates the support that she receives from Fundación Paraguaya and is requesting a loan which will be used to purchase T-shirts, pants, jeans, jackets, sweatshirts, footwear, and other inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Andrei Vazhnov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of T-shirts, pants, jeans, footwear, jackets, sweatshirts, and other items

loans.name: Dessa

texts.en:
Dessa L. is from the village of Mnadulog Iligan City. She is 36 years old, married and has two children. To make a living, Dessa owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from the buying and selling of bananas in the local community. Dessa has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5000 PHP per month for these activities.

In 2010, Dessa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Dessa is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Dessa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Seui

texts.en: Mrs. Y., 36, is a villager who has been a rice farmer since 1979. She owns a plot of land next to her house where she raises crops. She was married, but divorced her husband years ago, and has two children. Y. needs money to plant rice in this rainy season and is asking for a loan in order to hire a laborer to plow the farmland and then to grow rice.

loans.use: To hire a laborer to plow the farmland and then to grow rice.

loans.name: Sophon's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan is made up of 14 villagers from  Chrouy Pisei village in Kandal province. Each member of this group will use their portion of the loan to support their different businesses.

Mrs. Sophon C., 40, has been selected as the village bank president by the other members. She is a farmer who owns one hectare of land for cultivating rice. She will use the loan to buy a grass-cutting machine for cutting vegetation on her farm.  Aside from being a farmer, she also sews clothes for sale, while her husband, Mr. Sambok Kong, is a teacher in the local school. With their occupations, they are able to earn a small income to support their family. The couple has six children; two are at home and support their mother farming, while the other four are students in the local school.

loans.use: To buy a grass-cutting machine for her farm

loans.name: Juan Ramón

texts.es: El  Sr. Juan Ramón S. C.   él es Trabajador de la Alcaldía Municipal San Rafael del Sur  desempeñándose como Operario de Carga tiene  un año de trabajar para esta empresa. Ha tenido  dos créditos con CEPRODEL y los ha realizado para comprar materiales de construcción para mejorar su casa de habitación los cuales le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera él ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan Ramón S. C. has been employed by the city of San Rafael Sur for the past year as a lift operator. He has had two loans with CEPRODEL that were used to buy building materials and supplies for home improvements. The loans were of great benefit to him in that they brought about improved living conditions for himself and his family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies like: sand, cement, stone and gravel.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expanding his arable land

loans.name: Sokhoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhoeun S. is a silk weaver. Her husband, Mr. Sothorn Soem, is a policeman. They have been married since 1986 and have four children – one son and three daughters. One of them is married and lives outside the family home and the others attend school. The family lives in a village across the Mekong River, about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.
One of Sokhoeun's daughters is attending university and is in the second year. Sokhoeun hopes to support her child's further education, so is therefore applying for a loan of $900 to pay her daughter's school fees and purchase silk materials for continuing her weaving business.

loans.use: To pay her daughter's school fees and purchase silk materials

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
43-year-old Lina is from the town of Sta. Josefa in Agusan Del Sur. She is a farmer. Together, with her husband, she plants and harvests rice crops on their land. She says the farm is very helpful to her family because it helps provide for their needs. She hopes to increase her yield so she can also earn better. Lina has children who go to school and she works hard to sustain their education. For her, education is one of the best things she could give to them.

Lina currently needs inputs for her rice farm. She needs seeds, fertilizers and other farming materials. She is applying for a loan of PHP 8,000. This loan will truly help Lina in her farming.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a fifty-two-year-old man, married to peasant farmer with five children ranging from four to twenty-two years old, all living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He lives in his own permanent house with his family and his family dream is to educate his children and increase his household income. Stephen has been operating a carpentry business for the last twenty years though he is facing a challenge of delayed payments from customers, but this has not stopped him from hoping to progress further in future. He needs the loan to purchase hand saws for his carpentry workshop.

loans.use: Buying hand saws for his carpentry workshop

loans.name: Rafiqaan's Group

texts.en:
Rafiqaan belongs to the city of Depalpur, which is in Pakistan. She has been living with her family in a two room brick house for many years. 

Her husband has been involved in medicine selling business for over 10 years and runs a medical store in the community. She is the mother of six children but only three of them are able to get education and the others are free and don’t do anything.  

Rafiqaan herself is a housewife. She stays at home and does her household responsibilities. She is a very active and supportive lady and always ready to help her family in difficult times. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. Her husband will invest the loan in purchasing of medicines to sell through his store. She is confident that taking a loan and investing it in her husband’s business will be a profitable step for her family and is hopeful that her family will enjoy the better standard of living soon. 

She is a new loan user of Asasah and this is her first loan application. 

Note: In the photo, the lady who has holds the book (called the Asasah Passbook) in her hands is Rafiqaan.

loans.use: To buy medicines for medical store

loans.name: Fernando Jose

texts.es: El señor Fernando se dedica a una brindar el servicio de carpintería. Hace más de 3 años que se dedica a esta actividad donde le va muy bien por los numerosos pedidos que tiene. Su familia la conforma su esposa y sus 3 hijos menores de edad que están a su cargo cuenta con una familia. Inicio el taller porque necesitaba ingresos para su hogar.  Este crédito le ayudara al señor en compra una herramienta, Madera, clavos entre otras cosas para mejorar su trabajo.
texts.en: Fernando works as a carpenter. He has done this activity for more than 3 years and it is going well for him because of the numerous orders that her has. His family is made up of his wife and 3 minor children who are under his care. He opened the workshop because he needed income for his home. This loan will help him buy a tool. wood, and nails, among other things, to improve his work.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LLANKACHINAPAC”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia D. Urubamba  y departamento D. Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Gregaria; ella tiene 60 años D. edad, casada  y tiene 5 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio D. tienda D. abarrotes donD. venD. productos D. primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar y leche y también golosinas como chocolates,dulces,galletas entre otros más ,la socia es una persona muy emprendedora y D. esta forma saca a su familia adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la implementación D. productos para su tienda D. abarrotes.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte D. este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en: Ms. Gregaria, 60 years old, is married and has 5 children.  She belongs to the community bank "LLANKACHINAPAC", located in the District of Urubamba, Urubamba province, Cusco district.  She alternates her daily activities with her business, a grocery store that sells staples such as rice, sugar and milk, and also sweets like chocolate, candy and biscuits amongst others.  She is a very enterprising person and her family gets ahead through the grocery store.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more products for her grocery store.  She is grateful to those who are part of this dream through KIVA and promises to comply with the repayment schedule.

loans.use: To purchase products for her grocery store.

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PATRON DE SANTIAGO”; El banco está ubicado
en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Adela; ella tiene 33 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La
socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de verdura y
fruta siendo el mercado de Huancaro donde ella distribuye su mercadería y al público
en general, la socia también distribuye a una ONG URPIWASI ya lleva tiempo en este
negocio.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de más insumos para su negocio.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se
compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Adela belongs to the “Patron de Santiago” community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Adela is 33 years old.  She lives with her common-law husband and has two children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business buying and selling fruit and vegetables.  She sells her produce in Huancaro market, to the general public.  She also supplies her produce to a low-cost, low-income, children's day care center.  She has been in this business for some time.

Adela is requesting her loan to buy more supplies for her business.  She is grateful to those who will take part in her dream by funding her loan and she pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her business (fruit and vegetables)

loans.name: Srey

texts.en: Srey L., 19, is a cook, earning an income of 3 USD per day. L. is married and resides with her husband and two children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for the Angkor Wat Temple. The family has to spend 45 USD on food, 5 USD on electricity, and 25 USD on other necessary expenses every month. L. is requesting a loan of 1000 USD to purchase a motorbike to commute to work. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. L. appears in the photograph with her mother.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to commute to work

loans.name: Hem

texts.en: Hem S. is a single woman and mother. Hem S. is a professional teacher in her village, Banteay Meanchey province. She currently generates an income of approximately $5 per day by teaching at local school. She has no life a partner because she divorced from her husband for a few years ago. She has five kids, two of whom are single, and the three are married. Two of her children are working in various occupations, and they often contribute their income with her to use for daily expense. Currently, Hem S. says that she wants to buy a piece of land which it is the good location for building new house. She also expresses that her kids who have married already, they did not have their own house for living yet. So she wishes to buy this land for her kid to build new house. Because of this reason, Hem S. would like a loan from Kiva.

loans.use: To buy a piece of land for building new house.

loans.name: Hajiri

texts.en:
Hajiri is a married woman with three children, two of whom attend school while one is still too young for school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

She has operated a food-stall business for the past three years, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Hajiri faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to increase sales and get more income in the future. 

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, rice and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her livelihood.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, rice and sugar

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
Jose Luís trabaja como chofer en el sindicato Eduardo Avaroa; el crédito  lo necesita para comprar el motor y caja de su vehiculo. Este negocio es la fuente de ingreso que tiene el para su familia. 
Jose Luis  desea mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y a un futuro adquirir una movilidad nueva. Está casado y tiene un  hijo;  vive en anticretico en un departamento ubicado en la Ciudad de El Alto. Es primer crédito con Impro.
texts.en:
Jose Luís is a driver for the Eduardo Avaroa group. He needs a loan to buy an engine and gearbox for his vehicle. This business is the income source for his family.
Jose Luís wants to improve his family's quality of life and in the future to buy another vehicle. He is married and has one son. He lives in an apartment that is rented through a mechanism unique to Bolivia, in a neighborhood in the city of El Alto. This is his first loan from Impro.

loans.use: To buy an engine and gearbox for his  passanger transport business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: For 3 years, Elizabeth M. has been selling gari (made from cassava), and bags of charcoal at Nkroful, near Takoradi. She is showing the gari she sells. Elizabeth lives with her husband and assists him in taking care of the home. The loan will be used to expand her gari business and also to purchase extra bags of charcoal to sell.  She plans to reinvest her new profits.

loans.use: to expand her gari business and also to purchase extra bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Yenis

texts.es:
En su casa del barrio la Manga de Barranquilla,  Yenis O. tiene un pequeño almacén  de productos variados, entre cosméticos, papelería ropa, calzado y accesorios,  llamado: “Productos Yennys”.  Su idea emprendedora data de hace cuatro años, cuando observando el gran despliegue comercial del día de las madres en el mes de Mayo, la cantidad de tiempo que la gente gasta en la compra de detalles para obsequiar a las mujeres y el dinero que significa este ejercicio a las familias, decidió iniciar un negocio. aprovechando las oportunidades ofrecidas por cada  temporada comercial; Yenis comenzó con un capital proveniente de prestamistas informales a un alto costo, que hoy ha podido pagar, pero dejando de generar mejores utilidades netas y oportunidades de inversión en su negocio. 
Después de un trabajo disciplinado y persistente, Yenis cuenta con un capital de trabajo muy pequeño, que quiere ampliar mediante el financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y por eso está aplicando a un credikiva, para invertirlo en útiles escolares porque es la mercancía que más se mueve en esta temporada y le representa una buena rotación de productos y una pronta utilidad. Con su negocio está muy satisfecha porque ha logrado generar ingresos para resolver  necesidades básicas de su familia conformada por ella y sus  3 hijos que hoy se encuentran en las edades de 17 a 23 años. Su sueño y gran desafío es lograr aumentar sus ingresos para responder a los gastos, que genera el mejoramiento de las condiciones de vida de sus hijos, como las adecuaciones de su vivienda, educaciòn de calidad entre otros  y tambie lograr el crecimiento de su negocio, que se ve afectado por que solo trabaja con el capital personal que ella ha conseguido con sus propios esfuerzos.
texts.en:
Yenis O. has a small store in her home which is located in Manga neighborhood, in Barranquilla.  There she sells a variety of products, including cosmetics, stationery products, clothes, footwear and accessories.  Her business is called "Productos Yennys". 

Yenis had the idea of setting up her business four years ago when she observed the great commercial display that took place around Mothers' Day, in the month of May.  She saw the amount of time and the money that people spent buying little gifts to give to women.  As a result, she decided to start her own business, taking advantage of the opportunities offered by each commercial season.

Yenis started out with some capital that she acquired from informal lenders at a high cost.  She managed to pay this money back but she lost out on making better net profits and missed opportunities to invest in her business.  Through disciplined and persistent work, however, Yenis now has a very small amount of working capital that she would like to increase through this loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She is applying for a Kiva loan so that she can invest in buying school supplies because they are the merchandise that sells at this time of year and they will represent a good product turnover and a quick profit.

Yenis is very satisfied with her business because it has enabled her to make income to cover the basic needs of her family.  Her family consists of herself and her three children who are currently aged between 17 and 23.  Yenis' dream and greatest challenge is to increase her income so that she can respond to the expenses that come from improving her children's living conditions, adapting her home and providing her children with a good-quality education.  She also hopes to grow her business which has been affected by the fact that, up until now, she has worked solely with the personal capital that she has managed to make from her own efforts.

loans.use: to buy school supplies to sell

loans.name: Senovia

texts.es:
Senovia es socia del banco Comunal La Kantuta, tiene 35 años y 3 hijos de 18, 14 y 13 años
Senovia se dedica a la venta de zapatos. Antes se dedicaba a la preparación de jugos pero era muy cansado y ajetreado, por ello decidió cambiar de negocio y se dedicó a la venta de zapatos, ahora tiene un puesto en el Mercado Chorro y le va bien. 
Senovia solicita un préstamo para invertir en su negocio para la compra de zapatos de variados modelos para surtir su mercadería.
Senovia está en Finca Perú desde hace tres años, ingreso por la invitación de un amiga, le gusta porque le prestan capital para que trabaje y sobre todo puede ahorrar ya que en casa no se puede.
Ahora está ahorrando para mejorar su casa. Su sueño es poder abrir una fabrica de zapatos y construir su casa.
texts.en:
Senovia is a member of the La Kantuta communal bank.  She is 35 years old and has three children, ages 18, 14, and 13.  Senovia sells shoes.  Before that she used to make juices, but that was very hard and tiring work so she decided to change her business.  She has a stall in the Chorro market and things are going well for her.  Senovia is asking for this loan in order to invest in various types of shoes so that she can carry a wider assortment in her business.

She has been with Finca Perú for three years and joined after being invited by a friend.  She enjoys it because she is able to get working capital so that she can continue to work and also save some money.

She is saving up to make improvements to her home.  She hopes to be able to open a shoe factory and have a house built.

loans.use: to buy shoes for resale

loans.name: Wazo Tageta Group

texts.en:
Rozi S. is in her late twenties and is married. She has had a food sales business for one year. She works from 6:30 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Rozi's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her stock and to pay school fees for her brother's sister. Rozi has successfully repaid her loans. She hopes for a new loan to buy a sack of rice, half a bucket of cooking oil and a sack of wheat flour. Her dream is to one day open a moderate restaurant.

Rozi will share this loan with her loan group "Wazo Tegeta" which has a total of 17 members, who will hold each other accountable in repaying their loans. In the picture, Rozi is in the middle of the front row wearing a green and white blouse.

loans.use: To buy rice, cooking oil and wheat flour.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.ar: فاطمه عمرها 60 سنة هي ام متزوجة ولها 5 اولاد  تعيش في منطقة في البقاع اللبناني تعمل في حياكة السجاد ولها في عملها 15 سنة تحب عملها تحب ان تعلم اولادها هذه المهنة حيث انها تقول ان هذه المهنة معرضة للأنقراض في بنات الجيل الجديد لذلك تريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء مواد اولية لدعم هذه المصلحة وتطويرها حيث انها من التراث تواجه من بعض الصعوبات المادية التي تعيق تطوير هذه المصلحة فهي نشيطة ومتطورة ودائمة العمل حتى تتمكن من تأمين العيش الجيد لها ولعائلتها
texts.en: Fatima is 60 years old and married with five children. She lives in the Lebanese Beqaa region where she weaves carpets for a living. She has been doing this for 15 years. She loves her works and loves to teach her children the skill, saying that the art is in danger of becoming extinct in the new generation. With this loan she wants to purchase primary raw materials to support her work and develop it. She is part of a heritage that is facing financial difficulties thereby hindering the development of her business. She is energetic and is always seeking to develop her work so that she may secure a good standard of living for herself and her family.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for carpet weaving.

loans.name: Justo Marcial

texts.es:
Justo, originario de la comunidad Los Cocos ubicado en Telica, municipio de León, de oficio carpintero, tiene 37 años de edad, el fabrica  muebles, esta casado, es padre de dos hijos, de 14 y 8 años respectivamente. El inicio sus actividades en 1990, su papa le enseño el oficio de carpintero, fabrica camas, roperos, comedores, cunas ofrece sus productos en la parte central de León  y en su propia comunidad, tiene otros ingresos posee una camioneta la cual utiliza como acarreo de arenas, incluso hace mudanzas. 
Solicito el préstamo para comprar madera, pintura, clavos, tornillos, materia prima para trabajar. Con esta inversión espera poder producir mas, a mayor cantidad, para así aumentar sus ventas y mejorar sus ingresos, hacer nuevos clientes. En sus planes futuros esta comprar maquinaria para producir más  y ampliar su negocio para brindar trabajo a otras personas
texts.en:
Justo is from the Los Cocos community, which is located in the Telica municipality in León.  He is a 37 year old carpenter, and he makes furniture.  He is married and has two children, ages 14 and 8.  

He started his business activity in 1990.  He father taught him the carpentry trade and how to make beds, wardrobes, dining room sets, and cradles.  He sells his products in the central part of León, in his own community.  

He has other income from a van that he uses for hauling sand and also for removals.

He is requesting the loan to buy wood, paint, nails, screws, and raw material for work.  With this investment he plans to be able to produce more.  By producing a greater quantity he will increase his sales, improve his income, and make new customers.  

His future plans are to buy more machinery in order to produce more, to expand his business, and to provide work for other people.

loans.use: to buy wood, paint, nails, screws, and raw material for work.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 51-year-old widowed mother of one child. She is from Lebanon. She has been running a clothing store since 2009. She sells different types of clothes and always presents the new collections to her customers in order to satisfy their demands. Despite her age, she works hard in cooperation with her son to be able to pay the family expenses. Today, she is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to expand her store’s inventory. She says that the loan will help her diversify her merchandise selection. In the future, she is hoping to sell shoes also in her store.

loans.use: to expand her store’s inventory

loans.name: 28 De Noviembre Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “28 DE NOVIEMBRE” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Germán Busch.  Está compuesta por ocho integrantes, la asociación comunal está dirigida por una mesa directiva a la cabeza de la señora  Alison.   Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: comercio, producción, cultivo, venta de comida y servicios
 
La señora Alison indica que es la primera vez que integra una asociación comunal en Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida que aprendió de su familia.

El crédito que sacará ahora es para la compra de mercadería (compra de fideo, arroz, aceite, etc.) insumos que utilizará para la elaboración de la comida, que posteriormente lo venderá en su puesto de la ceja. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene tres hijos.
texts.en:
The '28 de Noviembre' community bank is about to start its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Germán Busch regional office.  The group has eight members and is run by a board of executives which is led by Alison.  The businesses that the members of the bank carry out are varied and include: commerce, production, farming, selling meals, and services. 

Alison tells us that this is the first time she has belonged to a Pro Mujer community bank and she joined through an invitation from a friend.  She currently has a business selling food which is something she learned from her family.

Alison will use her loan to buy merchandise (noodles, rice, oil, etc.) which she will use to make her food that she will then sell on her stall in La Ceja.  This work enables Alison to make money with which to support her family.  She lives with her common-law husband and has three children.

loans.use: to buy noodles, rice, oil, etc.

loans.name: Jackeline Del Pilar

texts.es:
Jackeline es socia del Banco Comunal Morenita Huamanga, tiene 29 años, es soltera, se dedica a la venta de regalos, el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en surtir su mercadería.
Jackeline se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de regalos en la tienda de su mamá. Es estudiante de Ingeniería Química. Está en FINCA Perú hace tres años le gusta porque se inculca los valores, se práctica la solidaridad entre las socias. Su sueño es llegar a trabajar en una empresa en el área de Control de calidad.
texts.en:
Jackeline is a member of the Communal Bank “Morenita Huamanga”. She is 29 years old, single, and sells gifts. This loan she is requesting will be invested in more merchandise.

Jackeline sells all types of gifts at her mother’s store. She is a chemical engineering student. Jackeline has been with FINCA Peru for three years and likes the values that are promoted and the unity among its members. Her dream is to work for a company in the field of quality control.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Kyajura Tweyambe Group, Kihihi

texts.en:
Francis is the leader of the Kyajura Twekambe group in Kihihi. He is a very hard-working man who takes no chances when it comes to ensuring the prosperity of his business. He is a trader at market, dealing mostly in cereals and other produce. He has been engaged in his business for four years. His endeavor is located by the roadside where he is able to attract a good number of customers, particularly those from the local community. 

Francis is also involved in tea harvesting as his other business, and this supplements his monthly income. Francis says that previous loans have enabled him to have enough stock for his customers as well as to ensure that he saves on the transport costs of buying in small quantities. The tea leaves he sells are always fresh from his tea plantation and he has a dream of expanding his business further. 

He is reaquesting a loan to be able to buy more cereals for resale.

loans.use: to buy more cereals to offer for sale

loans.name: José Luis Raúl

texts.es: José Luis de 27 años de edad, reside en casa familiar con su esposa y su pequeña hija de 3 años. José se dedica a la fabricación y venta de pan dulce y francés. Hace ya varios años que logro establecer el negocio de panadería y hasta el momento es su principal fuente de ingresos. Gracias a su carisma ha logrado ganarse la confianza de muchas personas  por lo que cuenta con muchos clientes fijos que lo prefieren por ofrecer calidad, buen precio y deliciosos panes. Últimamente ha notado un aumento en la demanda de sus ricos panes y como es un hombre emprendedor no quiere dejar ir esta oportunidad. Ha decidido aumentar la oferta de sus productos pero para esto necesita invertir un poco más en la materia prima necesaria para la elaboración del pan. Esto lo ha impulsado a solicitar este crédito para comprar los principales insumos como: harinas, huevos, manteca, canela, azúcar, etc. De esta manera espera ver florecer su negocio asi como mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Jose Luis is 27 years old and resides in his family home with his wife and small daughter, aged 3 years. Jose Luis is dedicated to making and selling sweet buns and French bread.

Some years ago he established his bakery business and at present, it is still his principal source of income. Thanks to his charisma, Jose Luis has been able to gain the confidence of many people and, as a result, he has many fixed customers who prefer his products for their quality, good price, and delicious flavor.

Lately, he has noted an increase in demand for his rich breads and since he is an enterprising man, he doesn't want to let this opportunity go by. Jose Luis has decided to increase his offered products but for this, he needs to invest a little more in the primary ingredients used in making bread. This has motivated him to solicit a loan to buy the principal ingredients, such as flour, eggs, lard, cinnamon,  sugar, etc.

In this manner, Jose Luis hope to see his business flourish and the quality of life improve for him and his family.

loans.use: to buy the principal ingredients, such as flour, eggs, lard, cinnamon, sugar, etc., for baking bread.

loans.name: Marcelino Federico

texts.es:
Marcelino de 47 años, es un hombre trabajador que tiene muchas proyecciones con su trabajo diario ya que conduce una mototaxi (medio de transporte que utiliza la gente para trasladar su mercadería). Todos los días recorre las calles del “Fortin” dando una tarifa en su recorrido de $ 0.25 por persona. 

Poco a poco ha incrementado su capital de trabajo con recorrido extenso y peligroso ya que el “Fortin” es una zona periurbana con caminos de tierra y montañas empinadas. Trabaja desde las 07h30 hasta las 16h30 todos los días. Tiene muchas esperanza con su moto taxi por eso quiere seguir trabajando para darle más estabilidad económica a su familia. Para ello quiere un préstamo y comprar cemento, varillas, bloques y mejorar así su casa.
texts.en:
Marcelino is 47 years old and is a hardworking man with many projections for his business, as he drives a mototaxi (a mode of transportation used by people to transport their merchandise). Every day he travels the streets of El Fortin, charging 25 U.S. cents per person.

He has increased his working capital little by little through extensive and dangerous travel, as El Fortin is a periurban area with dirt roads and steep hills. He works every day from 7:30am to 4:30pm. He has many hopes for his mototaxi, which is why he wants to continue working to provide his family with greater financial stability. For this reason, he wants a loan to buy cement, rods, and blocks to make housing improvements.

loans.use: to buy cement, rods and blocks.

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati  is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a grocery-selling business, selling retail to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her biggest dream is to expand and establish a shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, onions and green vegetables. She decided to work with Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, onions and green vegetables.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a hardworking businesswoman. She is married and blessed with two children. She has been managing a tailoring business to make a living. She has another source of income in farming. Previously, she had a grocery store. In the next five years, she wants to have a big business. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy fabric.

loans.use: To buy fabric.

loans.name: Benito

texts.es:
El señor Benito se dedica a la comercialización de granos de maíz y venta de refrescos, Benito vive con sus cuatro hijos y su esposa, don Benito se levanta muy temprano a vender el maiz y al terminar la jornada,  trabaja por las noches como guardia de seguridad en un centro educativo.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de leña, en esta epoca, la leña seca es un producto que se vende muy bien. 
Su meta es tener un buen negocio en su casa, en el cual pueda ofrecer varios productos a sus clientes, las ganancias las necesita para cubrir los gastos de su hogar.
texts.en:
Benito sells corn, and he sells soft drinks.  He lives with his four children and his wife.  Benito gets up very early to sell the corn.  When he finishes his work day he works at night as a security guard at an educational center.

He will use the loan to buy firewood.  During this season dried wood is a product that sells very well.

His goal is to have a good business at his house.  In this business he would be able to sell various products to his customers.  He needs the income to cover the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy firewood.

loans.name: Juliana Betzabe

texts.es:
En la parroquia Andrés De Vera de la ciudad de  Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen  cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal 4 De Agosto.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Juliana, tiene 29 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de  6 y de 3 años de edad, el  mayor estudian en escuela y el menor está en una guardería. Su esposo es chofer.

Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora ya que además de ser comerciante también trabaja en un bar restaurante en la ciudad por lo cual recibe un sueldo mensual. También se dedica a la venta de joyas de plata, relojes, productos Oriflame y Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja desde las 6h00 hasta las 18h00 en el restaurante de lunes a sábado, por las noches y domingos ella realiza sus ventas aunque también aprovecha para  vender en su lugar de trabajo a personas que la conocen y a quienes les da facilidades  de pagos.
 
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos, joyas de plata, relojes, etc. Este es el tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los intereses son más bajos que en otras instituciones de crédito.
 
Su sueño es tener su propio restaurante o un bazar.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the '4 de Agosto' community bank meet in Andrés de Vera parish, in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí province.  This city has been known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarind Trees.

Here we meet Juliana.  She is 29 years old, married, and has two children from her marriage who are 6 and 3.  Her eldest is in elementary school and her youngest is in daycare.  Her husband is a driver.

Juliana is a very hard-working woman who, in addition to selling products, also works in a bar-restaurant in the city, for which she receives a monthly wage.  She sells silver jewelry, watches, and Oriflame- and Yanbal-brand products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and ladies' accessories).  She works from 6.00am to 6.00pm in the restaurant, from Monday to Saturday, and sells her products in the evenings and on Sundays, though she also sells them at work to people that she knows and to whom she provides credit terms.

Juliana will use this loan to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, silver jewelry, watches, etc.  This is her third loan cycle as a member of her community bank which she likes because the interest rates are lower than with other loan institutions.

Juliana's dream is to own her own restaurant or general store.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, silver jewelry, watches, etc.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a 30-year-old married woman. She has 4 children with ages ranging from 1 to 10 years. She describes herself to be committed and humble. She operates a clothing sales business where she sells clothes to the local people. She has been involved in this business for 9 years. Her business is located near the country bus station in Nairobi. She describes her biggest business challenge to be weather challenges. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to add to her clothes inventory. Her business goal is to improve her business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will own a big hardware shop and also own a residential house.

loans.use: To add to her clothes inventory

loans.name: Anara's Group

texts.en:
Anara is the leader of this group. She is 42 and she is a widow. She has a nineteen-year-old daughter who is handicapped. In order to earn money, two years ago Anara started to sell dishes. She earns 5000 soms per month. The profit made it possible for her to purchase furniture for her home and to improve their living conditions. At the moment, Anara wants to start to sell hosiery, but she needs financial funds to start this business. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase hosiery products for resale. In the future, she wishes to save money to purchase an apartment.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious, and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase hosiery products for resale

loans.name: Cholpon's Group

texts.en:
Cholpon is the leader of this group. She is 35 and together with her husband, she is bringing up three children. 

In order to earn money to live, Cholpon takes orders and sews Kyrgyz national caps and hats. With the profits gained from this activity, Cholpon buys livestock for breeding. Her husband has been engaged in livestock breeding for about ten years. 

With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase a variety of caps and hats to increase the assortment of goods that she sells. In the future Cholpon wants to open her own sewing workshop.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase caps and hats.

loans.name: Sanlo Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Sanlo   esta integrado por personas artesanas trabajadoras llenas de sueños con ganas de salir a delante  y triunfar en un futuro.
Sus integrantes  decidieron ponerle así por que se caracterizan con su localidad y su cultura ,la mayoría  se dedican a la elaboración de bolsas  y servilletas.

Una de sus integrantes es la señora Leticia  de veinte siete años de edad quien esta felizmente  casada con el señor  Pablo de  veinte ocho años de edad , con quien tiene  tres hijos una mujer de  once años de edad y dos varones  por quien la señora Leticia trabaja ya que desea darle una mejor vida a sus hijos  para que puedan estudiar fuera ya que en su pueblo no  hay  una escuela donde pueda estudiar una licenciatura.

Doña Leticia se dedica a la venta de artesanías como son: bolsas tejidas y servilletas y hipiles , tiene con su negocio aproximadamente diez años lo que mas le gusta de su negocio es bordar ya que desde muy pequeña le gustaba borda , su madre fue quien le ensayo a bordar  y a combinar los colores para que sus servilletas  se vean alegres.

Uno de los sueños de doña Leticia es  tener una escuela de corte y confesión donde pueda ensayar  a las  personas a elaborar ropa ya que es otra de las cosas que mas le gustan y la llenan  de vida.
 
Pidió el préstamo para comprar mas  material para la elaboración de bolsas y servilletas como son: hilos de diferentes colores  , manta blanca y manta de color , agujas  y aros para apretar la tela y gancho para bordar.

Le da las gracias a fundación por el apoyo que le ha ofrecido para poder cambiar sus vida y brindarle un mejor futuro ya que lo  necesitan para que puedan vivir mejor.
 Gracias fundación par ayudar a las familias padres de comunidades necesitadas.

Las otras integrantes que conforman el grupo son:
Valentina-se dedica a la elaboración de huipiles ,batas , servilletas y manteles.
José M.- se dedica a la elaboración  de  quesos y a la venta de leche.
Antonacia- se dedica a la elaboración de huipiles ,servilletas y batas.
Beatriz- se dedica a la elaboración de servilletas, batas y huipiles.
Bufemia- se dedica a la elaboración de servilletas y batas y huipiles.
Virginia- se dedica a la elaboración de  servilletas y manteles.
María - se dedica a la elaboración de servilletas y manteles.
María  Lourdes- se dedica a la elaboración de servilletas y manteles.
María Inés – se dedica a la elaboración de  servilletas y manteles.
 

Gracias fundación por su apoyo y por preocuparse por nosotros  que deseamos  vivir mejor.
texts.en:
The name of this group is Sanlo, and it is made up of a group of craft workers who are full of dreams and desire to progress and succeed in the future. The majority of members make bags and napkins, and they chose their group name as it characterizes their area and culture. 

One of the group's members is 27-year-old Leticia who is happily married to Paul, 28. They have three children - one daughter (age 11) and two sons. Leticia works hard to give her children a better life, so that they can study away from home as there is no college where they could obtain a degree in their town. 

Leticia sells handicrafts such as woven bags, napkins and traditional tunics. She has had this business for about ten years, and what she likes best about it is embroidery, which she has enjoyed since childhood. Leticia's mother taught her how to embroider, and how to combine cheerful colors to make her napkins look attractive.

One of Leticia's dreams is to have a dressmaking school where she can teach people to embroider clothes, which is another of her passions that enriches her life.
 
Leticia has asked for this loan to buy more material for producing bags and napkins, such as colored threads, bleached and colored cotton, needles and rings to tighten the fabric, and embroidery hooks.

She thanks the foundation for the support they have offered to help change her life, provide a better future and enable her family to live better. Thanks to the foundation, families in needy communities have received help.

The other members that make up the group are:

Valentina, who makes traditional tunics, bathrobes, napkins and tablecloths.
Jose M., who makes cheese and sells milk.
Antonacia, who makes traditional tunics, towels and bathrobes
Beatrice, who makes napkins, bathrobes and tunics.
Bufemia, who makes traditional tunics, towels and bathrobes
Virginia, Mary, Maria Lourdes and Mary Agnes, who make napkins and tablecloths.
 

They thank the foundation for the support, and for caring about those who want to make better lives for themselves.

loans.use: to purchase thread, cotton, rings, needles etc., for producing woven bags and napkins

loans.name: Charito

texts.en:
40-year-old Charito earns a living selling dried fish and also dealing in Avon and Natasha products in her community. She is married and has school-aged children. Charito runs her business in Baclayon, Bohol. She works hard to support her family.

Charito has requested this loan to buy more dried fish and personal products to sell. She hopes to acquire her own vehicle someday so transporting dried fish would be easier.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish and personal products to sell.

loans.name: Bokoli Shg Group

texts.en:
Benard is the facilitator of the Bokoli SHG group. Benard and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Benard takes care of five children at home. He joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for his family and later educate them. In the recent 2011 season, Benard had a very good maize yield harvesting 9 bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  Benard was only able to harvest 4½ bags of maize on ½  acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Benard and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Benard will invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Bokoli SHG group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John has been in farming for over 25 years. His farms in Murang'a produce tea for the Kenya Tea Development Authority and coffee for the local market. He says he relies fully on farming for his upkeep. He is married and has two children, ages 8 and 12.

John has requested a loan of 53,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow and venture into dairy farming, as well. He says the income from dairy farming will be used to pay for the education of his children. He hopes to expand the farm to four cows in five years. John mentions the high costs of feed as the major challenge in farming.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Safia's Group

texts.en:
Safia has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her animal selling business. With the loan investment, she will buy sheep and goats in larger numbers. She will raise them up and eventually sell them to butchers for profit.
She is confident that her business will get more successful as a result of a loan investment. She is very experienced in her business and has good business contacts.
Her husband is a property dealer and deals in property.
She has given birth to two sons and a daughter. Her eldest son is a driver while the younger one is a laborer. Her daughter stays at home and helps Safia in her routine tasks.
In the picture, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Safia.”

loans.use: To buy goats and sheep for the animal selling business.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice is 36 years old, married and has six children aged from one to sixteen. She describes herself as a visionary woman. She runs a retail shop and sells items such as sugar, baking flour, cooking fat, rice etc. She has been in this business for the last three years. Eunice describes her business challenge to be high cost of items sold. She will be using the KES 20,000 loan to buy more sugar and baking flour. In the future, Eunice hope and dream to run wholesale shop.

loans.use: To buy more sugar and baking flour.

loans.name: Gnarisso Benkadi  7 Group

texts.fr:
Les  membres du groupe  Gnarisso Benkadi  7 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à  Soké, un des villages de San, 4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est le riz  avec      MAYAMA , 1 ere assise de la gauche vers la droite sur  la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter, des petits matériels agricoles, des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,75 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et au marché de San, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 110.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en: The members of the Gnarisso Benkado 7 group are all married woman, on average 33 years old with 4 children, all living in traditional families in Soké, a village near San, the 4th largest administrative region of Mali. They collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to ensure continuity of their agricultural activity during the winter season. They are asking for their second loan from the institution after having successfully paid back the first loan. Mayama, seen in the photo as the woman sitting in the far left position, grows rice. She is planning to user her loan to purchase fertilizer, grains and small agriculuture materials, in addition to paying labor costs associated with maintaining a farm of 0.75 acres. The produce is sold in the village as well as the market in San to a customer base comprised of both men and women. The shopes to earn 110,000 FCFA in profits (approximately 210 USD). These profits will go to repaying her loan as well as supporting her husband in taking care of the daily family needs.

loans.use: Labor costs, purchasing fertilizer, grains and small agricultural products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Veronica wants to buy a donkey and a cart

loans.name: Nadir

texts.en: Nadir J. owns a small clothing store in the town of Devechi, just south of Khachmaz, located in the North Eastern part of Azerbaijan. Nadir wants to increase the quality and diversity of his inventory so that he can increase his client base.

loans.use: To increase the quantity and quality of his inventory.

loans.name: Proak

texts.en: Proak S. is 37 years and lives with her husband and three children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia.  S. sells rice and traditional Khmer food at a food stand outside her house and can make about $7 on an average day.  Her husband is a tuk-tuk (a passenger carriage attached to a motorcycle) driver and can also make about $7 per day (not including costs of gas and renting the tuk-tuk).  The family hopes to use this loan to purchase a tuk-tuk so that S.'s husband no longer has to pay rental fees.  In the future, the couple hopes to send their three children to university.  Also, they hope to repair their house to make it stronger for the rainy season.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle tuk-tuk to drive passengers

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.es:
Business Description

Adelaida has 15 years of experience in the business of selling fish. She started out with her own savings, selling in one corner of her home. At present, Adelaida sells fried fish with rice and vegetable stew on Thursdays, Fridays, Saturdays, and Sundays from 5 p.m. to 9 p.m. Adelaida works by herself. She is a single mother, but she considers herself a fighter. Adelaida has seen development in her business, since thanks to her fish sales she has directed part of her capital toward buying yogurt in 2 or 4 liter containers which she delivers every 15 days and at the end of the month to the crew of a shrimp boat on the peninsula.

Loan Use

Adelaida is requesting this loan in order to increase her business. The demand has grown for her yogurt and fish sales. She also indicates to us that she has thought of investing in the purchase of milk, coconut, and sugar to make homemade ice cream. She could deliver it to 2 people who would sell it and she would earn a percentage of the sales. Adelaida wants to continue improving her home to give greater safety to her family.

Personal Information

Adelaida is 48 years old and has 1 son. Her home is made of concrete with an earth floor, and it is under construction.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Descripción del Negocio

Adelaida tiene 15 años con su negocio de venta de pescado. Empezó con ahorros propios vendiendo en esquina de su casa. Adelaida actualmente vende pescado frito con arroz y menestra los días jueves, viernes, sábados y domingos. Desde las 17 PM a 21 PM. Adelaida vende sola es madre soltera, pero se considera una mujer luchadora. Adelaida ha visto desarrollo en su negocio ya que gracias a la venta de pescado parte de su capital lo dirige también a la compra de yogurt de 4 y 2 litros los mismos que los entrega cada 15 días y fin de mes a personal de una camaronera en la península.

Uso del Préstamo

Adelaida solicita el crédito para incrementar sus negocio. Su demanda ha aumentado en la venta de yogurt y pescado. También nos indica que tiene pensado invertir en comprar leche, coco, azúcar porque ella elabora helados caseros. Y entrega a 2 personas que le venden y ganan un porcentaje por helados. Adelaida tiene como anhelo seguir adecuado su vivienda para dar una mejor seguridad a su familia.

Información Personal

Adelaida tiene 48 años 1 hijo su vivienda es de cemento y piso de tierra y esta en construcción.

loans.use: To invest in new products to sell and maybe make ice cream

loans.name: Makalita

texts.en: Makalita is married to a farmer from the village of Siumu, quite far from town. He is unemployed and she was looking around for ways to earn money to support her children toher than depending on her husband’s farming skills to bring in food for the family. When she got word about SPBD Program and how it has managed to help women that were in the same situation, she decided to give it a try. She got a loan out of the program and invested it into their plantation giving her husband encouragement to work harder while she sells their products at the market. She delivers 2-3 bags of taro to the market once a week and she gets $250.00-$300.00. This money is being used to support her family witheir daily needs and her taro plantaion.

loans.use: To buy more chemicals, knives fertilizers

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
"I believe if the loan of US$1,175 is given to me, I will be able to buy more goods for sale. Business is better right now as Christmas is around the corner. The Christmas period is a time people buy more lengths of cloth, shoes, and bags for the celebration. This will help me to improve my family's standard of living," says Mrs. Juliet O. who lives in Benin City.

Juliet is 38 years old, married with 4 children. She is a member of LAPO as a leader of her union and has been in this business since 1995.

loans.use: To buy more lengths of African print cloth, shoes, and bags for resale in her little shop

loans.name: León Hoover

texts.es:
“Responsible fatherhood” is a term that has been converted into concrete fact in León’s life. He has always responded satisfactorily to his role as provider for his eight children, for whom he cares with much love, in the company of his wife, who is always supportive of him. León works in agricultural activities and has some cattle. He cultivates potatoes and cereal grains. He raises animals while waiting for the harvest. In addition to these two occupations, he also does masonry work and is an expert at giving the finishing touches to houses.

At the moment, he is working intensively at his agricultural activities and taking care of his fields. His wife is helping take care of the cows and also sells their milk. They do all this hard work because they want to give an education to each of their eight children. They would also like to open a small business some day; until then they will continue working in their fields. To do this, León is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers. Let’s support León in his continuous efforts to provide for the wellbeing of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La paternidad responsable es una palabra que se ha convertido en un hecho concreto en la vida de León, siempre ha respondido satisfactoriamente a su rol de velar por el sustento diario de sus ocho hijos, a los que cuida con mucho amor en compañía de su esposa ,quien siempre está atenta a apoyarlo.León se dedica a las actividades agricolas y ganaderas, tanto al cultivo de papa y cereales asi como a la crianza de animales, cuando las actividades agricolas aún no dan frutos. Adicionalmente a estas dos ocupaciones se dedica a realizar trabajos de albañilería y se ha convertido en un experto al momento de dar los cacabados finales a las casas.Por el momento está intensamente dedicado a las actividades agricolas y al cuidado de sus campos de cultivo, su esposa por su parte le ayuda con el cuidado de las vacas y también vende leche. Todos estos esfuerzos son realizados por que quieren otorgarle educación a cada uno de sus ocho hijos y esta fuerza que los impulsa también los motiva a desear abrir un pequeño negocio más adelante; mientras tanto seguirá trabajando en sus campos de cultivo y para ello solicita un préstamo que los invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes.Apoyemos a León en su continua lucha de generar bienestar a su familia.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Dora

texts.es:
Doña Dora, who grew up in a home whose principal work was and is agriculture, learned how to do this work when she was very young from working with her parents. This has become her principal source of income, and she dedicates most of her time to the attention and care of her agricultural products. Through her daily work, she looks to give her family security and economic realiability. However, due to unexpected difficulties, she cannot cover all of her expenses, and she needs a loan to improve her products and increase her sales with the objective of constructing her house on land that she acquired a little while ago. All of this can be possible with your help.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Doña Dora, desde muy pequeña creció en un hogar cuyo trabajo principal era y es la agricultura, del desempeño diario de sus padres ella aprendió desde muy niña y ahora la actividad que desempeñaban sus padres, también se ha convertido en su principal fuente ingresos económicos por ello es que dedica el mayor tiempo a la atención y cuidado de sus productos agrícolas. A través de su desempeño diario busca dar a su familia seguridad y solvencia económica más con las inesperadas dificultades no puede solventar algunos gastos y requiere de un préstamo para mejorar sus productos y aumentar sus ventas con el objetivo de construir su casita en el terreno que adquirió hace muy poco. Todo esto puede ser posible con vuestra ayuda.

loans.use: Increase in capital to increase her production

loans.name: Murodali

texts.ru:
Murodali S. is 41 years old, has a high school diploma, is married and has 5 children. He is a professional construction worker but has been raising and selling cattle for the last 16 years. He is planning to use this loan to purchase two calves. After he has fattened them, he will sell the animals every 40-45 days. Murodali will use the money he makes from sales to purchase additional animals. He will use the profits from his business to support his family, since this is his main source of income. Murodali is planning to pay back the loan in the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Сайдалиев Муродали, возраст – 41 год, образование – среднее, по специальности строитель, женат, имеет 5 детей. Сайдалиев Муродали занимается разведением и продажей крупного рогатого скота уже в течение 16 лет. На полученный кредит он планирует приобрести двух молодых бычков. После их откормки он будет продавать их через каждые 40-45 дней. На вырученные деньги он будет приобретать новый скот, а полученную прибыль он будет использовать на содержание своей семьи, так как это является его основным источником дохода Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: purchase of cattle

loans.name: Zareena's Group

texts.en:
I am the leader of a group of 4 other women who also require loans to invest in their businesses:

Rani B. is borrowing to help with her family’s sheep trading business,

Parween A. will invest her loan in her tailoring business,

Shamim A. is borrowing to help her son, who is a welder; and

Nazia N. plans to invest her loan in her husband’s electronic store business. For myself, I am 48, married and a mother of ten: six boys and four girls. I am borrowing for my son who runs a musical band. He will use the loan to buy some new musical instruments.

loans.use: To buy musical instruments

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Beatriz has loved making clothes since she was very young thanks to the passion and example of her loving mother. She has five children and now lives in a humble home with only her beloved husband. Her execution and excellent products have made her well known in her city and she receives many orders a day. Her wish is to acquire a larger quantity of supplies and enlarge her small shop, and she is requesting a loan to fulfill these goals.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Beatriz, manifestó su amor por la confección de prendas de vestir desde muy pequeña debido a la gran pasión y desempeño de su amada madre. Tiene cinco hijos y ahora habita su humilde morada sólo en compañía de su querido esposo. La práctica y los excelentes acabados de sus bellas prendas la han hecho muy conocida en su ciudad y a diario recepciona muchas peticiones. Su deseo de adquirir mayor cantidad de materia prima y de ampliar su pequeño taller la conducen a solicitar un préstamo para llevar a cabo a este propósito.

loans.use: Purchase large quantities of sewing supplies and enlarge her shop / Compra de mayor cantidad de materia prima y ampliación de su pequeño taller de costura.

loans.name: Happiness's Hiari Ya Moyo Group

texts.en:
Happiness is 38 years old and is a married woman with 3 children, ages 14,10 and 9 years old. Happiness owns a small grocery store that she started in 2006. Every day, she works from 7am to 12pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $190 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, Ester and Adventina, who have livestock businesses.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Eneta

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 35-year-old Eneta K., who is married and has four children aged between 9 and 15. In 2006, Eneta established her barber shop and scrap metal business. Working seven days a week, 9 to 12 hours a day, assisted by her husband and one employee, she earns about $170 every month. Eneta now requires a loan to purchase additional stocks of scrap metal, a machine for charging car batteries, and electric clippers and shavers. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately $95. In the future, Eneta plans to increase the quantity and range of her stock. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of scrap metal in bulk, a machine to charge car batteries, and electric clippers and shavers.

loans.name: Flor De Retama Group

texts.es:
The Comunal Bank of Flor D. Retama is a bank recently started with 17 members. Some of them are friends, some only recently met, but all are very happy about starting their Comunal Bank. The members have different business such as the sale of groceries, cheese, clothes, pottery, glassware, drinks, plastic products, haberdashery, candy, food and also offer cosmetic services.

The members need different loan amounts, some of 300 soles (around $102 USD), some of 600 soles, making a total of 9,600 soles in loans for the Comunal Bank.

They will use their loans to purchase sugar, rice, vegetable, milk, meat, cheese, sodas, beer, noodles, sweaters, shirts, jackets, bags, candy, dyes and cosmetics. The members dream of having a fixed premises, expanding their businesses, of their children becoming professionals and of owning their own homes..

Translated from Spanish by Inês Teles, Kiva volunteer.

El Banco Comunal Flor D. Retama es un banco que recién inicia con 17 socias, algunas D. ellas son amigas, otras recién se conocen, pero todas están con mucha alegría D. iniciar su Banco Comunal.

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como L. venta abarrotes, quesos, ropas, locería, cristalería, bebidas, productos plásticos, mercería, golosinas, comida, también brindan servicios D. cosmetología.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. préstamos, algunos montos son D. 300 soles, 600 soles, haciendo un total D. 9,600 soles D. préstamos en el Banco Comunal.

Los préstamos lo invertirán en L. compra D. azúcar, arroz, fideo, verduras, leche, carnes, quesos, gaseosas, cerveza, chompas, camisas, casacas, bolsas, galletas, caramelos, tintes, cosméticos.

Los sueños D. las socias es tener un local estable, ampliar sus negocios, sus hijos sean profesionales y tener una vivienda propia.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, rice, vegetable, milk, meat, cheese, sodas, beer, noodles, sweaters, shirts, jackets, bags, candy, dyes and cosmetics

loans.name: Hortense Faster

texts.es:
Mrs. Faster D. B. is from the city of Bluefields and is 57 years old. For the past 39 years Mrs. D. has baked puddings and cookies. Her clients are the visitors and residents of the neighborhood who prefer her homemade products. Mrs. D. does not have the capital required to purchase the ingredients in bulk so it is necessary to buy: 5 pounds of butter at $2.00 a pound, 3 boxes of eggs at $4.00 a box, 25 pounds of flour at $ 1.00 a pound, 50 pounds of sugar at $ 0.42 per pound, 5 pounds of lard at $2.00 a pound and 1 box of milk at $ 22.00. With this investment it will be possible to increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Hortense Faster D. B. es originaria de la ciudad de Bluefiedls, tiene 57 años de edad. Hace 39 años la Sra. D. horna pudines y galletas, sus clientes son los transeúntes y habitantes del barrio que la prefieren por ofrecer productos caseros. La Sra. D. no cuenta con el capital necesario para comprar en grandes cantidades los ingredientes de sus productos, por eso necesita comprar: 5 libras de Mantequilla a $ 2.00 dólares la libra, 3 cajillas de huevo a $ 4.00 dólares la cajilla,25 libras de harina a $ 1.00 dólar la libra, 50 libras de azúcar a $ 0.42 centavos dólar la libra,5 libras de manteca a $ 2.00 dólares la libra y 1 caja de leche a $ 22.00 dólares la libra con esta inversión podrá aumentar su ganancia.

loans.use: To buy butter, eggs, flour, sugar, lard and milk.

loans.name: Judith Jaqueline

texts.es:
Ms. Judith R. is building bedrooms in her home, but they need paving stone. She currently does not have the necessary funds because she is a single mother of 3 school age children. She does not have enough money to pay cash for the paving stone materials for her children’s new rooms. There is currently only one room for all three children in the house. 
Ms. R. works in a restaurant in downtown Nuevo Laredo. This job is her source of income that helps her to move forward and to offer her children the best. 
She is requesting this loan from Kiva for home improvements so that her children can have a better place in which to live.
 Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.
La Sra, Judith esta construyendo unos cuartos los cuales le esta haciendo falta la losa y por el momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario ya que es madre soltera y tiene 3 hijos que están estudiando y por el momento no cuenta con el dinero para pagar de contado el material para poner la losa en los cuartos los cuales son para sus hijos y que en la casa donde viven solo hay un cuarto para los tres niños.
La Sra. Judith trabaja en un restauran en el centro de la ciudad de Nuevo Laredo este es su ingreso para poder salir adelante y darle los mejor a sus hijos.
Es por eso que solicita un préstamo a Kiva para poder realizar las mejoras a su vivienda y que sus hijos tengan un mejor  hogar donde vivir.

loans.use: Install paving stone

loans.name: Grimaldina Rosmeri

texts.es:
La señora Grimaldina Rosmeri G. F. tiene treintaicinco años,  vive en el caserío la Primavera en el distrito de Mache provincia de Otuzco, departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Estudió primaria completa pero no continuo estudiando debido a la falta de apoyo económico de sus padres.
Se casó a los dieciséis años con el señor Francisco Medina con tienen cuatro hijos, dos de ellos ya trabajan independientemente y los otros dos están estudiando.
Empezó a negociar con animales pequeños para carne ahora compra reses y las vende en las plazas pecuarias de Otuzco y Julcán.
Hace dos años recibió su primer préstamo de Manuela Ramos que fue de 300 soles, con los que compró cuyes y gallinas, el préstamo fue devuelto en cuatro meses.
Con este préstamo de S/. 2000 soles, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas,  comprará una vaca de 1500 soles y una cerda de 300 soles. Los 200 soles restantes los utilizará en comprar  balanceado para el alimento de sus animales.
Pertenece al Comedor Popular Corazón de Jesús de la Primavera y al Banco Comunal Mujeres de Trabajo.
Tiene un gran sueño y es el de comprar una linda casa en Trujillo para que sus hijos continúen educándose.
texts.en:
Mrs. Grimaldina Rosmeri G. F. is 35 years old and lives in the La Primavera farmhouse in the Mache District of Otuzco Province, in the La Libertad Department of Peru. Grimaldina completed primary school, but could not continue her studies due to the lack of economic support from her parents. When she was 16 years old, she married Mr. Francisco Medina. They have four children, two of whom work and are independent, while the other two are still studying.

When she first started her business she worked with small animals, but now she buys beef and sells it in the livestock plazas of Otuzco and Julcán.

Two years ago, Grimaldina received her first loan from Manuela Ramos for 300 soles (slightly more than $100), which she used to buy guinea pigs and hens. She repaid this loan in four months. With this loan of 2000 soles (about $700), she will buy a cow for 1500 soles and a pig for 300 soles. The remaining 200 soles will be used to buy animal feed. Grimaldina belongs to the Corazon de Jesus Comedor Popular (an eatery for low-income families) and is a member of the Mujeres de Trabajo Communal Bank (a group loan). Her dream is to buy a nice house in Trujillo so that her children can continue their studies. .

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a cow, a pig and animal feed

loans.name: Laura Esthela

texts.es:
Laura inicio el negocio para contar con recursos para solventar los gastos de sus estudios ya que ella estudia en la Escuela Normal Superior, donde se prepara para ser maestra y su mama no podía pagar todos los gastos de colegiaturas y materiales que a diario utiliza, por lo que hace 2 años puso un snack y dos computadoras para que sus mismos compañeros las utilizaran con una mínima cuota y a la ves consumieran sodas y comida rápida.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $325 que pagara en 4 meses para poner más variedad en sus productos y obtener más ganancias y continuar con sus estudios.
texts.en:
