Laura began her business to gain financial resources for settling her school expenses since she is studying in the "Escuela Normal Superior", where she is preparing to be a teacher; her mother could not pay all the expenses of tuition and materials used daily. This is why two years ago she opened up a snack bar with two computers that her peers could use for a minimum price while they drank sodas and ate snack food at the same time. She needs a loan for $325, which she will pay back in four months, to add a greater variety of products and obtain greater earnings to continue with her studies.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy merchandise

loans.name: Nora Ysabel

texts.es:
La señora Nora pertenece al Banco Comunal Pastaza, ubicado con la Av. Aviación Mz. B Lt. 1, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 38 años de edad, es madre de 2 hijos menores de edad que aún dependen de ella, es casada y su esposo es independiente en su trabajo. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de comida. Tiene 5 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de productos de bellezas (EBEL) y a la venta de comida. Ahora se encuentra delicada de salud, motivo por el cual ha dejado unos días la venta de alimentos. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,500, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará 2 docenas de colonia, 6 cremas de manos, 8 lápices labiales y otros.  

Gracias a Manuela Ramos la estabilidad económica de su familia ha mejorado, y por ende tendrá la oportunidad de apoyar a sus pequeños hijos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nora belongs to the Pastaza Community Bank, located at Av. Aviación Mz. B Lt. 1 in the Callería district of the Coronel Portillo province in the department of Ucayali. Nora is 38 years old and the mother of two young children who depend on her. She's married and her husband has his own business. Nora used her first loan of 300 soles that she received from Manuela Ramos to invest in a food sales business. She has been working with the Community Bank for five years. Now Nora sells beauty products (EBEL) as well as food. Because she has recently had some health issues, Nora has decreased the number days that she sells food. With this loan of 2,500 soles, Nora will buy two dozen bottles of cologne, six hand creams, eight lip pencils, and others. Thanks to Manuela Ramos, Nora's family's economic stability has improved, and she'll have the opportunity to support her small children.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She'll buy two dozen bottles of cologne, six hand creams, eight lip pencils, etc.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Poverty is not a hindrance to having a big and happy family. Lucia C., who is a mother of eight, proves it. Her family lives in Brgy. Sisim Alto, a peaceful place with lots of agriculture.

Lucia's husband is a farmer, and she sells vegetables in their village, which helps support her family, including three grandchildren. Despite her age, Lucia is motivated to expand her business, so she is requesting a loan to buy a wider variety of vegetables and add other foodstuffs (meat, fish, snack foods) to the items she sells. The loan will enable her to have her own vegetable booth in front of their house, a dream Lucia has been dreaming so she no longer has to go "house-to-house" to sell her products.
 
Time is golden, says Lucia. So she lives her life to the fullest and treasures every moment she still has.

loans.use: To expand her food-selling business

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Sam S. was born in 1957 and is a widow. She currently lives in Siem Reap Province. She has two children, both of whom are employed and earn money to help meet with family's living expenses. 

Since 2004, Sam has run a business selling fish in local Kompong Kdei Market, and is currently earning an average of $2 each day. She uses her own old bicycle for her business activities. Because fish selling is the main way for her to earn money, to make her business transportation easier, S. is applying a loan to purchase a second-hand motorcycle to replace her old bicycle. The motorcycle will be used to transport fish and to bring the family to work.

loans.use: To purchase a second-hand motorcycle to replace her old bicycle

loans.name: Herminia

texts.es:
La señora Herminia es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Brisas del Rio Blanco”, resiD. en el sector Uno, comunidad D. Sucano, distrito D. Pilcuyo, Provincia D. El Collao, Departamento D. Puno; tiene 48 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada y tiene seis hijos, asimismo posee estudios D. secundaria incompleta (primero D. secundaria).
Trabaja desD. hace tres años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, se dedica en su negocio D. engorD. D. ganado menor (ovinos y porcinos); su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que destinó a la compra D. porcinos para su engorD. y venta como carne en las ferias Ilave y Puno.
Con este préstamo D. S/. 3000.00 Nuevos soles le servirá como capital para poder adquirir mas ganado; además piensa dedicarse a su anterior negocio D. compra D. ropas para niños y su venta en las ferias D. Tacna y Arequipa; los ingresos surgidos D. su negocio lo viene invirtiendo en la educación superior D. sus hijos; espera que Manuela Ramos siempre les brinD. este tipo D. apoyos y agradece por su confianza y apoyo; finalmente se compromete a pagar puntualmente su préstamo en cinco cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Herminia is a member of the communal bank "Las Brisas del Rio Blanco". She lives in sector Uno, Sucano community, Pilcuyo district, El Collao province, Puno department. She is 48 years old, is married and has six children. She did not complete her high school education. Herminia has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for three years. She dedicates herself to the business of fattening small livestock (sheep and pigs). The first loan she received was in the amount of $100 which she used to purchase pigs for fattening and to sell their meat at fairs. The loan she is requesting in the amount of $950 will be used as capital to acquire more livestock. She also wants to dedicate herself to her previous business which was the purchase and sale of children's clothing at fairs in Tacna and Arequipa. She invests the income obtained from her business in the higher education of her children. She hopes that Manuela Ramos will always be able to proviD. this type of support and she is thankful for her confidence and support. Finally, she promises to pay her loan on time in five monthly payments.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acquire more livestock.

loans.name: Sor

texts.en: N. is 51 years old and sells Khmer desserts for neighbors in the village. She currently earns an income of approximately $2 per day, and has been running the business since 2001. She is widowed and has given birth to five children; three of them are employed and the others are students. They live together in the rural area of Kompong Tom Province. To help with the family's food needs, one of her employed sons sells firewood. N. hopes to buy a cart for her son to use to transport firewood to sell directly at clients' houses; thus, she is applying for a loan to purchase a cart, and will use the remainder of the loan to repair her house.

loans.use: To purchase a cart

loans.name: Ana Valente Mazive

texts.pt:
Ana nasceu em gaza,tem 51 anos de idade e casada e mae de 12 filhos com idades comprieendidas entre os 5 aos 33 anos de idade dos quais 8 são rapazes e 4 são raparigas, os 7 mais velhos são empregados e os restantes 5 encontram se a estudar.

Ana perde  seu pai logo apos a nascencia,  sendo assim a sua mae junta se com o segundo esposo e teve que deixa la sob cuidados do seu irmao mais velho. Mais este a maltratava e ela so consegue fazer a 1 classe do antigo sistema. Quando tinha 10 anos esta foge com a sua amiga para maputo a procura de emprego onde vem a trabalhar como empregada domestica durante 5 anos, sai de maputo a namaacha uma vila na fronteira da swazilandia  quando juntou se com seu esposo que era trabalhador da petromoc em namaacha. Este da lhe um fundo e ela inicia com a criacao de pintos,e criadora a mais de 10 anos tem metido no maximo 300 e no minimo 200 pintos  gasta 20.000.00mt e tem um lucru  de 7.000.00mt mensalmente consegue poupar 2.000.00mt e 1.000.00mt aluga capoeira, pois para alem dos seus filhos responsabiliza se pelo seu sobrinho que e orfao de pais.

Este e o primeiro emprestimo de ana na hluvuku e kiva. Estes 15.000.00mt ,para compra e criacao de pintos  e tem a certeza que vai reembolsar antes do tempo determinado pois para alem dos frangos conta com a ajuda do seu esposo. Tem como objectivo construir a sua propria capoeira e tornar se uma grande criadora de frangos.
texts.en:
Ana was born in Gaza, Mozambique. She is 51 years old, and is married with 12 children between 5 and 33 years of age -- 8 sons and 4 daughters Her 7 oldest children are working, and the other 5 are in school. Ana's father died after she was born, so her mother married a second time and had to leave her in her older brother's care. But he abused her and she only managed to get through what was called first grade in the old system. When she was 10 years old, she ran away with her friend to Maputo to look for work. She worked as a domestic servant there for five years, and then left Maputo for Namaacha, a village on the border with Swaziland, when she met her husband, who worked for Petromoc in Namaacha. He gave her funds for her to start raising chickens. She's been raising them for more than 10 years. She has between 200 and 300 chickens. She spends 20,000 mt, and earns 7000 mt a month. She manages to save 2000 mt and rents a hencoop for 1000 mt, so that in the future her two children will be able to take care of her nephew, whose parents are dead. This is the first loan Ana will receive from Hluvuku and Kiva. These 15,000 mt will be used to buy and raise chickens, and she is certain she will repay the loan early because besides the chickens she also has her husband's help. Her goal is to build her own hencoop and become a large poultry producer.

Translated from Portuguese by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chicks to raise poultry

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: La sra. Teresa se dedica a la venta de joyas como aretes, anillos, sombrereras, topos, por la zona, vive con su esposo, que trabaja como chofer asalariado, tienen tres hijos en edad escolar, ambos se ocupan de los gastos de la casa, con el apoyo de sus suegros cuando ellos salen a trabajar. El crédito será invertido en la adquisición de más joyas ya que tiene mas pedidos por  la cercanía de la fiesta de Jesus del Gran Poder. La Fiesta  de Jesus del Gran Poder, es una fiesta pagano-religiosa floclorica, que atraviesa todo el centro de la ciudad de La Paz, es muy popular entre los turistas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Teresa L. C. sells jewelry such as earrings and rings, as well as hatboxes, in the area. She lives with her husband, who works as a wage-earning driver. They have three school-age children. Both parents look after household expenses, and their parents help out when they go out to work.

The loan will be invested in acquiring more jewelry, as there is higher demand due to the celebration of Jesus del Gran Poder. This is a pagan-religious celebration that crosses through the whole downtown area of La Paz and is very muy popular with tourists.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Chong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investing in the purchase of jewelry

loans.name: Ibodullo

texts.ru: Ибодулло 52 года, женат и имеет троих детей.Ибодулло и его жена арендуют небольшой магазин в центре города. Кроме них в этом же магазине торгуют еще несколько предпринимателей. Сам Ибодулло является координатором местного общественного объединения занимающегося проблемами трудоустройства работоспособного населения. Эта работа постоянная и занимает большую часть времени Ибодулло. А по выходным дням он помогает своей жене торговать, а также выезжает на оптовые рынки за товаром. Кроме Ибодулло и его жены в этом бизнесе также работает их племянница (на фото), которой он платит заработную плату. Ибодулло подал заявку на КИВА и собирается выехать на оптовый рынок в соседний Кыргызстан  за товаром.
texts.en:
Ibodullo is 52 years old; he is married and has three children. Ibodullo and his wife rent a small store in the center of the city. In addition to them several other entrepreneurs sell their products in the store. Ibodullo is the coordinator of the local public association focused on employment placement of the able bodied population. This job is constant and takes up a large portion of Ibodullo’s time. On the weekends he helps his wife to sell and also travels to wholesale markets to purchase products. In addition to Ibodullo and his wife, his niece (in photo) also works in the business; he pays her a salary. Ibodullo has turned an application in to KIVA and plans to travel to a wholesale market in neighboring Kirgizstan for products.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a wholesale quantity of products

loans.name: Ni Wayan Pori

texts.en:
Ni Wayan Pori (DNR.M-0662) is 54 years old and lives in the town of Manistutu, Melaya. She is married and has one school-aged child. To making a living, Ni Wayan Pori raises livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Ni Wayan Pori has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 300,000 - 400,000 IDR a month from these activities.

In 2007, Ni Wayan Pori joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ni Wayan Pori has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,000,000 IDR from DINARI. This previous loan was used to build shelter for her livestock. Ni Wayan Pori is now requesting a new loan of 1,500,000 IDR which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. The loan will be her fourth from DINARI. Ni Wayan Pori plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her child's tuition fees.

About DINARI:

The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Ni Wayan Pori - (DNR.M-0662) merupakan 54 tahun wanita. Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Manistutu - Melaya. Dia (perempuan) menikah dan memiliki 1 anak usia sekolah. Untuk membiayai hidup, Ni Wayan Pori memiliki & menjalankan usaha. Bisnis beroperasi di sektor pertanian. Tujuan utama bisnis tersebut adalah memelihara ternak. Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual. Ni Wayan Pori sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 5 tahun. Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Wayan Pori menghasilkan sekitar 300,000 - 400,000 IDR sebulan.

Dalam 2007, Ni Wayan Pori bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. Ni Wayan Pori meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari DINARI. Pinjaman sebelumnya ini digunakan untuk membangun tempat berteduh/kandang bagi ternak peminjam. Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 1,500,000 IDR. Pinjaman saat ini akan digunakan untuk untuk membeli bibit ternak untuk dibesarkan & dijual di masa mendatang. Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 4th pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI. Ni Wayan Pori berencana untuk menggunakan pendapatan tambahan yang dihasilkan dari bisnis untuk membayar biaya sekolah anak-anak peminjam.

Tentang DINARI:

Misi DINARI adalah memperjuangkan kelestarian lingkungan, memberdayakan kaum miskin, dan menyediakan kesempatan pembangunan sosial ekonomi bagi pemilik usaha kecil.

*Catatan: Untuk memaksimalkan efisiensi & menurunkan biaya, pinjaman ini ditempelkan menggunakan templat sehingga dapat diterjemahkan otomatis oleh Kiva. . Mengingat bahwa terjemahan manual atas profil memakan biaya besar, Kiva menciptakan templat ini untuk Mitra Lapangan untuk memungkinkan mereka terus menempelkan pinjaman dalam Bahasa sambil memberikan informasi yang bermutu & akurat kepada para pemberi pinjaman Kiva."

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future.

loans.name: Sonia Del Carmen

texts.es: Sonia del Carmen S. D. C., resiD. en San Luís Talpa, vive junto a sus tres hijos los cuales dependen exclusivamente D. ella. Sonia posee una venta D. ropa, así también posee una cafetería la cual la abre únicamente en la noche, ya que en el día se dedica a vender ropa para damas. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora la cual se esfuerza el doble para obtener todo lo necesario para su familia, es por ello que Sonia solicita un préstamo, con el fin D. poder comprar más ropa y materia prima para su cafetería.
texts.en:
Sonia del Carmen S. D. C. lives in San Luís Talpa with her three children who are economically dependent on her. Sonia sells women's clothing during the day and she also has a cafe which is only open at night. She is a very hardworking woman who gives twice the effort to get what she needs for her family. That's why Sonia is requesting a loan with the goal of being able to buy more clothing and supplies for her cafe.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies for her businesses.

location.town: San Luis Talpa,  departamento de La Paz.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort, who is a 63-year-old mother of eight children, rears poultry. She also has a fish pond.  She hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more poultry. Comfort says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more poultry.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Wanting to have a store in their village, Luisa M. of Nabbotuan Solana, Cagayan is requesting the amount of PHP16, 000 to start up a village store to help her husband earn their daily living. With the loan she hopes that she will be able to purchase many products for her to earn more income. Through that, she knows that she will help her husband uplift their lives.

Luisa is 60 years old and married to Condrado who is a local farmer. They have five children who are living independently from them.

loans.use: Business capital to open a village store

loans.name: Ulambayar

texts.en:
Ulambayar P. is 34 years old and lives with her husband and two children in the Bayanzurh district of  Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her son is 14 years old and goes to a local secondary school and her 4-year-old daughter stays home. 

Ulambayar has a small business in shoe retail. She rents a small stall in the Hantalst shopping mall, one of the large indoor shopping centers in Ulaanbaatar. She sells women's and men's shoes that she brings from Ereen, China, a  border town, where many inexpensive Chinese products are imported to Mongolia. Because Ulambayar chooses the
cheapest shoes, her shoes are sold fast and easily. Besides shoes, she also sells dried fruit at the market, which shoppers purchase as snacks. 

Ulambayar says that she would like to continue building a small house that she has already started on the plot of land that her family owns. She would like to expedite the building process with profits from her business. She requests a loan to purchase more shoes for her business.

About XacBank:

Founded in 1998, XacBank is a community development bank and microfinance institution in Mongolia, and is headquartered in Ulaanbaatar.  It currently serves approximately 16,000 microfinance clients at 76 branches in all 21 aymags (provinces) in Mongolia, making it the largest microfinance institution in the country.

XacBank's mission is to contribute to sustainable development of Mongolia that can come only from educated and skilled people and competitive and dynamic businesses concerned equally about Planet, People, and Profit. The Bank will provide equitable access to transparent, reliable and responsive banking products and services to the Bank’s clients, including its traditional micro-entrepreneurs as well as small and medium businesses.

Your loan enables XacBank to expand its microloan capacity and return a portion of the interest back to the borrower at the end of the loan term

To learn more, please visit the XacBank website at: www.xacbank.mn.

loans.use: To purchase spring and autumn shoes for her business

loans.name: Savina

texts.es:
Savina es socia del Bancomunal Unidas Triunfaremos
Savina es separada tiene 49 años, tiene un hijo de treinta años que trabaja y es independiente. 
Savina se dedicaba a  cuidar a su hijo y a su casa ella no sabia leer ni escribir pero se matriculo en una escuela nocturna a la edad de veinticinco años, para poder ayudar a su hijo con las tareas de la escuela, ella termino toda la primaria completa, la necesidad la obligo a trabajar en la calle con la venta de golosinas y gaseosas, ella vende en una esquina por mas  de veinte años   
Desde que Savina esta en Finca  ella aprendió a invertir, aprendió a trabajar, a ser cumplida y responsable, con los prestamos que recibe.
Savina necesita un préstamo de 800 soles, para la compra de golosinas, galletas, chocolates, chicles.
El sueño de Savina es  tener en su casa un negocio de bodega.
texts.en:
Savina is a member of the Communal Bank “Unidas Triumfaremos”. She is 49 years old and separated from her spouse. She has a 30 year old son who lives on his own. Savina spent many years taking care of her son and was not able to read or write. At the age of 25, she enrolled in night school and was soon able to help her son with his homework. She completed an elementary school level education, which helped her start a business as a street vendor selling candy and soft drinks. Savina has been selling from her corner vending post for more than 20 years.

Since joining FINCA, Savina has learned how to invest, work responsibly, and complete her obligations on the loans that she has received. She is currently requesting a loan of 800 soles to purchase candy, cookies, chocolates, and chewing gum. Savina hopes to open a grocery store from her home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase candy, cookies, chocolates, and chewing gum

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn A. resides in the small vicinity of Delusom, Leon B. Postigo. She is 35 years old and currently manages a small grocery store. She is married to a motorcycle driver and they don't have any children yet. She works hard and hand with her husband to raise income in their family.

She has been a good member since her membership in the cooperative last August 2008. She is already having an extension of her small sari- sari store. She is enjoying her third cycle loan already and manifests a good repayment records.

She is very hopeful that by availing loan, she can continue to generate more income in their family and uplift their economic status.

loans.use: Additional Capital on her Sari- sari Store

loans.name: Gloria Cándida

texts.es: Gloria Cándida I. H. reside en Lourdes, municipio dentro  del departamento de La Paz.  Como muchas mujeres del país, Gloria es madre soltera de un hijo menor de edad, a quien cría y mantiene por sí sola. El negocio que Gloria maneja es una pequeña tienda, donde  vende productos de uso básico y diario. Gloria solicita un préstamo para surtir de nuevos productos su negocio y hacer crecer su tienda.
texts.en:
Gloria Cándida I. H. lives in Lourdes, a town located in the district of La Paz. Like many women in her country, Gloria is a single mother of a dependent child that she has to raise and support by herself. She manages a small grocery store where she sells basic products for everyday use. Gloria is requesting a loan so that she can restock her store with new products and grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Restock her business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth B. is from Gango, Ozamiz City. She is 46 years old, married to Efren B., and blessed with five adult children.

Elizabeth owns and operates a “sari-sari” (variety) store selling a variety of products to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for almost thirty years since she married her husband. She earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In December 2005, Elizabeth joined Paglaum MPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC.

Elizabeth is now requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to purchase more products to sell. This loan will be her 9th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: María De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
La señora María De Los Ángeles R. está muy agradecida por su cooperación en el anterior crédito el cual pudo surtir su negocio.
Nuevamente está solicitando un préstamo, ya que necesita pagar el hospital donde están internando su papá que esta enfermo, Doña María De Los Ángeles no cuenta con el dinero necesario para pagar la atención y los medicamentos que su padre necesita para aliviarse es por eso que esta solicitando su cooperación para poder pegar el hospital y el medicamento.
Ella planea pagar este crédito con su pensión que recibe y los gastos familiares serán con las ganancias del negocio.
texts.en:
María De Los Ángeles R. is very grateful for your cooperation with the previous loan, which she used to stock her business. Once again she is asking for a loan because she needs to pay the hospital her father is in. Her father is sick. María De Los Ángeles does not have the money needed to pay for his care and the medication he needs. That is why she is asking for your help to be able to pay the hospital and for the medication. She plans to repay this loan with his pension. She will pay family expenses with income from the business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay her father's medical expenses

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 40-year-old single mother of three children who has run a grocery store for the last eight years. Her business is strategically located next to a busy bus stage (station). She has a frequent overflow of customers and is able to employ one person. She is requesting a loan of Kes. 40,000 to purchase onions and potatoes. 

In the future, she hopes to be able to purchase a vehicle for her business and a plot of land on which to build. She describes herself as hardworking and says that she loves her work.

About Faulu Kenya:
Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To purchase onions and potatoes.

loans.name: Dina

texts.es: La señora Dina, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Patrón San Roque”, Distrito D. Sacanche, Provincia D. Bellavista, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 48 años y es madre D.  02 hijos, 01 que aun depenD. D. ella. Motivada por ella misma emprendió un pequeño negocio D. venta D. abarrotes, hace 05 años atrás y con su primer crédito D. S/. 300.00 se implemento mucho mas obteniendo buenos resultados desD. un inicio, por la calidad D. sus productos, sus precios cómodos y la buena atención al cliente.En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio ubicada en su propia casa, donD. sus principales clientes son los vecinos D. su barrio.Con este préstamo D. S/. 3,000.00, comprará  más productos para surtir su negocio como arroz y azúcar en kilos, huevos en javas,  insumos para el aseo personal y limpieza del hogar, gaseosas en paquetes, golosinas  y otros productos para mantener contenta a su clientela.Se siente una Mujer fuerte, con ganas D. salir adelante aun y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por apoyar a personas como ella que quieren trabajar y salir adelante, espera que sigan así por mucho tiempo y ayuden a muchas familias y mujeres emprendedoras.
texts.en:
Sra. Dina is a member of the Communal Bank “Patrón San Roque”, which is located in the District of Sacanche, Bellavista Province, Department of San Martín. She is 48 years old, married, and the mother of two children of whom one is still a dependent.

Five years ago, Dina was motivated to start a small business selling groceries. She received her first loan of 300 soles to start her business. Dina achieved good results from the beginning as a result of the quality of her products, low prices, and providing good service to her customers. She continues to manage her business from home to this very day. Her main customers are neighbors from the area.

With this loan of 3000 soles, she will purchase more products to restock her business such as rice and sugar by the kilo, crates of eggs, personal hygiene products, household cleaning supplies, sodas by the pack, sweets, and other items to keep her customers happy. Dina feels she is a strong woman capable of moving forward. She thanks Manuela Ramos for helping people like her who want to work and get ahead. She hopes to continue working for a long time and help other families and women entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to increase her inventory

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es:
La señora Hermelinda, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Corazón D. Jesús”, Distrito D. San José D. Sisa, Provincia del Dorado, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 36 años y es madre D. 03 hijos, los 03 que aun dependen D. ella y están estudiando.

Su impulso y empeño D. ver a sus hijos profesionales, le motivaron a emprender su propio negocio D. venta D. abarrotes, se encuentra ubicada en su misma casa, un local muy bien acondicionado para atender a sus clientes. 

Las ganancias que genera ayuda al ingreso económico D. su familia. En la actualidad, es muy querida por sus clientes fijos que a diario acuden a su bodega a comprar, porque ella cuenta con todo los productos  que el ama D. casa necesita y es ella, quien les brinda su atención con el carisma que le caracteriza.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,000.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos, fideos en paquetes, leche y conservas D. pescado en cajas y en variedad D. marcas, huevos en javas y artículos D. higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Hermelinda, se siente con mucha fuerza para continuar trabajando, día a día agradece a la vida, por brindarle una gran oportunidad D. salir adelante como mujer, igualmente al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por   iniciarla a convertirse en una mujer empresaria.
texts.en:
Ms. Hermelinda belongs to the Corazón D. Jesús [heart of Jesus] Communal Bank, located in the District of San Jose D. Sisa, Province of El Dorado, Department of San Martin. She is thirty-six years old, married, and a mother of three children, all of whom are dependents and studying.

Her drive and desire to see her children become professionals motivated her to start her own business selling groceries. Her business is located in her house, which is very well equipped for attending to her customers.

Her earnings contribute towards her family’s income. Nowadays, she is greatly loved by her regular customers, who frequent her shop daily because they can count on her to have all of the products that a housewife needs and for her captivating character and charisma.

With this loan of S/.1,000.00, she will be able to purchase sacks of rice and sugar , packets of noodles, milk, and a variety of different brands of boxes of fish preserves, "javas" of eggs, and personal hygiene products in order to continue to proviD. the best service to her customers.

Hermelinda is enthusiastic about continuing her work. Every day she is thankful for her life for giving her the amazing opportunity to move forward as a woman, and likewise for the Manuela Ramos Movement (“Movimiento Manuela Ramos”) that pushed her to become a business woman.

Translated from Spanish by Tracy Quan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase grocery items to increase merchandise.

loans.name: Romina

texts.en:
Romina sells cooking oil at retail prices to her customers. Cooking oil is very essential in the preparation of soup in Nigeria. She makes a good profit because the demand for her cooking oil is high. She hopes to expand her business, but the challenge she is faced with is insufficient funds. She is requesting a loan amount of 70,000 NGN to purchase more cooking oil to sell.

Romina is 40 years old and married with four children. Her children are still dependent upon her and go to school. She is a committed LAPO client. LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and Africa. 

She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Nery De Las Mercedes

texts.es:
Nery B. de 26 años de edad, vive en la zona periurbana de Paraíso de Guayaquil, vive en la casa de su ex suegra la cual es de cemento con dos servicios básicos agua y luz sin alcantarillado, Nery es soltera pero tiene 1 hijo que tiene 6 años de edad y estudia en una escuela particular.

Nery comenzó con una pequeña tienda en su casa para pasar más tiempo con su hijo, ahora ella atiende la tienda desde las 06h30 hasta las 22h30, vende aceites, arroz, fideos, una de sus mayores dificultades es el peligro que hay en su sector por los ladrones.

Con el préstamo Nery quiere comprar arroz, dulces, fideos, aceites, para agrandar mas su negocio, en el futuro quiere ampliar su negocio y así tener capital para comprar su propia casa.
texts.en:
Nery B. is 26 years old, she lives in the area surrounding Paraíso de Guayaquil. She lives in her ex-mother-in-law’s house, which is a cement house with the basics: water and electricity without a sewer system. Nery is single but she has one son who is 6 years old and attends a private school.

Nery started out with a small store in her in order to spend more time with her son. Now she works in the store from 6:30am to 22:30pm, selling oils, rice, noodles. One of her greatest difficulties is the danger that there are thieves in the area.

With the loan, Nery wants to buy rice, sweets, noodles, oils in order to expand her business more. In the future, she wants to expand her business and then have the finances to buy her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy rice, sweets, noodles

loans.name: Patron De San Jeronimo Ii Group

texts.es:
Nuestros socios pertenecen al banco comunal “PATRON DE SAN JERONIMO II” situado en la ciudad del Cusco, en el distrito de Huanchac a 15 minutos de la plaza central de esta ciudad. 

Nuestros socios son 14 miembros dentro de este banco comunal, ellos alternan sus diferentes actividades con el comercio, la mayoría de los socios se dedica a trabajos independientes,  una socia trabaja en un hostal es recepcionista y también tiene en casa un pequeño negocio ella vende leña al por mayor, otra socia tiene una tienda abarrotes y solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería y así poder implementar su tienda, otro socio es mecánico y solicita el préstamo para comprar herramientas para su taller, otro socio hace hornos de arcilla y barro, el solicita el préstamo para comprar su materia prima, otra socia vende en un pequeño puesto en la esquina de su barrio todos los días anticucho (trozos de carnes y papa, estilo parrilla), ensartados en palos, otra vende queso, otro socio tiene una librería y otro trabaja como ayudante de cocina en la municipalidad, otra socia vende cosméticos por catálogos, todos ellos solicitan el préstamo para poder reinvertir en sus diferentes negocios y otros para comprar productos y vender algo extra a parte de sus respectivos trabajos.

Nuestros socios agradecen y les hacen llegar  un enorme abrazo y un cordial saludo y los mejores deseos para este nuevo año y se comprometen n cumplir con los pagos de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members all belong to Cusco's “PATRON DE SAN JERONIMO II” communal bank, which is in Huanchac neighborhood, 15 minutes from Cusco's main square. There are 14 members, each with his/her own commercial activity; most of the members are independent businesspersons. For example: one member works as a receptionist in a hostel but also has a small firewood sales business at home. Another member has a small grocery store and requests funding to buy stock items for it. Another member is a mechanic and needs funds to buy tools for his shop. Another member has clay and mud ovens and needs funding to buy raw materials. Another member has a small, corner stand where she sells anticuchos (skewered grilled meats and potatoes). Another is a cheese merchant, one has a bookstore, and another works for the city as a kitchen assitant; another member sells catalogue cosmetics. All of them need funding to invest in their various commercial activites and some to buy products to sell as a source of extra income besides their regular jobs. The members are grateful and send an enormous hug and warm greeting to everyone for the New Year and pledge to repay the loan in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients, supplies, and merchandise for their various commercial activities.

loans.name: Choeng

texts.en:
Mrs. Choeng S. T., 29, is a professional farmer who has worked in her farming business for more than ten years. She also sells a few cooking ingredients to make extra profit. She has been married for many years to Sok Som, 43, who helps support the family by working in construction. The couple has three school-aged children who are dependent on their income.
Choeng S. T. lives in an old house that often requires repairs, and her living situation is affected by this. To solve the problem, she is applying for a loan to repair and decorate her house. She will use any remainder of the loan to purchase more inventory for her grocery store.

loans.use: To repair and decorate her house

loans.name: Naimanchuluun

texts.en:
Naimanchuluun is 29 years old and lives with his wife and two sons in Arhangai province, Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His son, aged 5, is in kindergarten and his youngest, 1, has not reached school age yet.

Naimanchuluun operates a taxi service in his town. He transports people to and from Arhangai province and Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He started his business in 2001 and, with years of business operation, he has managed to establish himself in the business community and become well known for his excellent driving skills.

With his business earnings Naimanchuluun bought one more car which helped him to earn more money than before. He is a very careful driver who constantly maintains his car in order to provide a safe service to his customers. He says, “I want to expand my business in order to save enough money for my children's future.”

Naimanchuluun is requesting a 700,000 tugrug loan to purchase machinery parts for his business.

loans.use: To purchase machinery parts

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita S. L. is 58 years old and married with four children. All of her children have finished their education and hold degrees through the support of educational loans form ASHI. She lives with her family in the province of Rizal in the Philippines. Her husband, Eulogio, works as partner in her business. To supply additional income for her family, Teresita is expanding the family's primary business of farming, which has been in operation for almost ten years. 

For supplementary income, Teresita would like to receive a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase an additional computer for her secondary business of operating computer rentals, and remaining loan monies will be used to support their farming business. As a dedicated member of Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a Kiva microfinance partner in the Philippines, since 1995, Teresita is thankful for secured access to capital and loans to support her entrepreneurial dreams.  
 
With the support of ASHI and Kiva, she is hopeful that both businesses will generate steady income to improve her financial stability and her family’s quality of life. She hopes to diversify her revenue in the long term by launching a larger computer cafe, and to support the educational needs of her grandchildren.

About ASHI: Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) has the distinction of being the oldest existing replication of Grameen Bank Approach (GBA) to credit delivery to the bottom poor in the Philippines. With its outstanding achievements over the years, it has become one of the role models in credit delivery to the poor in the country.

loans.use: To purchase an additional computer for her computer rental business; the remainder of the loan will support her existing farm business

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras De Micaela Bastidas Group

texts.es:
La  alcancía comunal denominado “MUJERES EMPRENDEDORAS D. MICAELA BASTIDAS”  en el distrito D. Ate Vitarte, se encuentra  representado por la señora  Diana Lourdes y conformada por 10 socios que radican en dicha zona.
La señora Diana tiene 44 años D. edad, es soltera, tiene 1 hijo D. 23 años, quien en la actualidad trabaja para apoyar a su madre. El negocio al cual se dedica es el fotocopiado y tipeos en un local alquilado cerca a su vivienda, se inicio con una fotocopiadora desD. hace 13 años. Mujeres emprendedoras D. Micaela Bastidas; trabaja con EDAPROSPO – Prosperidad desD. hace 2 años, nuestros socios se dedican a diferentes actividades como la elaboración D. peluches y  el comercio minorista; con el reciente préstamo otorgado, por ejemplo la señora Diana, comprará mercadería para su negocio, todos los demás miembros incrementarán su capital para así obtener una mayor producción, mejor posesión en el mercado y captar mayor cantidad D. clientes. Los socios tienen grandes sueños y metas y se encuentran muy agradecidos con la institución por todo el apoyo brindado y se comprometen a cumplir con los pagos y seguir trabajando para sus ahorros.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank named “Mujeres Emprendedoras D. Micaela Bastidas” is in the District of Ate Vitarte. The group consists of ten members from this area and is represented by Sra. Diana Lourdes.

Sra. Diana is 44 years old, single, and has a 23 year old son who currently works with her. She manages a photocopy and typing center from a rented location near her home. Diana started her photocopy business thirteen years ago.

The “Mujeres Emprendedoras D. Micaela Bastidas” Communal Bank has been working with EDAPROSPO – Prosperidad for two years. The members are involved in different activities, such as making plush toys and operating informal retail businesses. Sra. Diana, for example, will use this current loan to buy merchandise for her business. All of the other members need additional capital to achieve greater production, get a better share of the market, and attract more customers. They have great dreams and goals and are very grateful to the Institution for the support that has been provided. In addition, they commit to completing their payments and continuing their work toward their savings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acquire merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy equipment such as buckets and baskets for delivering milk.

loans.name: Lauben

texts.en:
N. Lauben is a 50-year-old married father of seven boisterous schoolchildren. To shoulder his responsibility of providing for them he has, over the course of the last six years, been operating a coffee produce shop in Rwerere Trading centre, Rukungiri District.

Lauben’s business has not been without setbacks since he began; he has had to bear a myriad of challenges, such as the lack of steady income. In a way, however, his business has remained active. This principally he attributes to the good working chord he has struck with his clientele.

In a week, Lauben says he makes more than 50,000 Ugandan shillings, a figure he admits will not substantively make his business see the light of day in the near future. He is therefore seeking a loan to lend countenance to his business.

loans.use: To purchasing more bags of coffee from farmers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cloth

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es: Guillermo, de 44 años, es un padre de familia muy trabajador y respetuoso, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Gregoria (50) y sus 3 hijos, a quienes desea brindar un mejor futuro.Desde muy pequeño Guillermo aprendió a trabajar en la chacra junto a sus padres, quienes le enseñaron todo lo necesario  para lograr un buen cultivo. En la actualidad  tiene sus propias tierras, las cuales cultiva y cuida con mucha paciencia. Siembra alverja y papa, productos que posteriormente lleva a vender al mercado mayorista de su ciudad .Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus cultivos, ya que siente que su arduo trabajo brinda sus frutos, ya  lleva 25 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de las plagas que pueden afectarlos. Su mayor deseo es comprarse un auto, con el que  pueda trasladar sus productos hasta el mercado donde comercializa. Este es el tercer préstamo de Guillermo  con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas puntualmente y esta dispuesto a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es un socio muy alegre.Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará un toro, para que le ayude con el arado y así pueda preparar mejor sus tierras para el cultivo.
texts.en:
Guillermo, 44 years old, is a very hardworking and respected father. He lives in his own home with his wife Gregoria (50) and their 3 children, to whom he wants to offer a better future. When he was very young, Guillermo learned to farm with his parents, who taught him everything he needs to know to produce a good crop. He now owns his own land, which he cares for and farms with great patience. He sows peas and potatoes, which he later brings to his city's wholesale market to sell. What he loves most about his work is harvest time, which is when sees the fruit of his arduous labour. He has been farming for 25 years and his greatest challenge is protecting his crops from pests. His greatest wish is to buy a car, with which he would be able to transport his produce for sale in the market. This is Guillermo's third loan with MFP—he knows the necessity of paying installments on time, and is prepared to do so. He is a very cheery member of his communal bank. With the requested loan, he will buy a bull to help him with ploughing in order to better prepare his lands for cultivation.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a bull for ploughing his land

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se encuentra, en su primer ciclo actualmente se encuentran desarrollando las capacitaciones del primer ciclo.

En el grupo se encuentra  la Sra. Olga B. que con sus 40 años tiene 1 hijo, ella tiene una pequeña panadería en su domicilio, además vende quiniela (juego de azar) en su casa por pedidos de sus clientes.

Su marido es el encargado de preparar con ella los panificados y ella luego atiende al cliente. Tiene  una casa no muy grande en el barrio Zeballos Cue de Asunción, motivo por el cual esta ahorrando para poder construir una pieza más para su negocio. 

Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de herramientas para su panadería una mezcladora y amazadora.

Nota: Hay algunas personas extras en la foto porque algunas señoras estaban con sus hijas el dia que se sacó la foto.
texts.en:
This group is in its first cycle: essentially, they are following the steps to qualify for the first cycle. Ms. Olga B. is a member of this group. She is 40 years old and has one son. She runs a small bakery in her house, on top of selling quiniela (football pools) in her house at the request of her customers. Her husband works with her: his task is to prepare the bakery products she then serves to their customers. Her house, located in Zeballos Cue, is not very big, therefore she is saving in order to succeed in building an extra room for her shop. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy tools for her bakery: a mixer and a kneading machine. Note: There are several extra people in the photo since some of the women were accompanied by their daughters the day the photo was taken.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a mixer and a kneading machine

loans.name: Tsendee

texts.en:
Tsendee D. is 41 years-old and lives with his wife and four children in Uvs province in western Mongolia. His three children attend a local middle school and his wife works as a typist in the local Meteorology Office. 

Tsendee operates a coal selling business in his town.  He purchases coal directly from local mines in the winter time and transports it between towns. Tsendee has operated this business since 1990 and has gained much experience over the years. He has a large customer base with many loyal clients and he plans to purchase an economical car to keep up with the growing demand. 

He also operates a meat trading business in order to further improve his quality of life. He said, “the old Russian trucks are very outdated. People with newer, larger, fuel efficient trucks have higher earnings than I. My wish is to have one of these trucks.” Tsendee is requesting a 4,000,000 MNT loan to purchase sheep and sell them in Darhan, the third largest city in Mongolia.

loans.use: To purchase livestock to sell.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria M. is from the town of Trento. She is 50 years old and married. To make a living, Gloria owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector planting and harvesting rice for sale. Gloria has been engaged in her business for over 30 years.
Gloria joined Kiva partner, CEVI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Gloria is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. This loan will be her third from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About CEVI
Community Economic Ventures, Inc. (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over recent years. Based in Bohol, it has numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but also savings, insurance and training, which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase general farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Delia

texts.en: Delia P. is a 46-year old married woman who supports her family by operating 3 business ventures: farming, a general store and pig fattening. She lives in Hacienda Panidlan, Barangay Payao, Binalbagan, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1998 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her farming, general store and pig fattening businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average income of 3,000 PHP. Delia is now borrowing 12,000 PHP so that she can have additional working capital for her farming activities and her general store. This will be her 13th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 12,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Delia aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the Dungganon way. Delia is shown in the picture with her sugarcane crop in the background. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by visiting the NWTF lending team page and become a part of our team.

loans.use: For additional working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more rolls of gara cloth for her business.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.es:
Gabriel es un joven padre de familia, tiene 21 años de edad, reside junto a su esposa y a su menor hijo en casa de su padre ubicada en el distrito agrícola de Chepén, una ciudad con bastante movimiento comercial. La zona pertenece a la provincia del mismo nombre y se encuentra ubicada a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros en una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado consistente en una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina para realizar actividades de transporte) el brinda este servicio dentro de la ciudad de Chepén, la actividad goza de buena acogida ya que estos medios de transporte son accesibles a todo publico debido a su bajo costo. Con los ingresos que el percibe se hace cargo del mantenimiento de su familia. Su esposa trabaja en un locutorio, con el dinero que ambos ganan tratan de salir adelante. Actualmente tienen pensado trabajar arduamente para obtener su casa propia. 

El contínuo uso brindado a su unidad móvil ha hecho que esta empiece a sufrir algunas fallas que requieren de urgente reparación para garantizar su correcto funcionamiento, Gabriel ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a realizar las reparaciones y mantenimiento que requiera su vehículo.

Gabriel es un joven luchador y que dia a dia lucha por darle a su familia lo mejor, las personas que le conocen le consideran alguien bastante reponsable y de confianza.
texts.en:
Gabriel is a young father, 21 years old, who lives with his wife and their young son in his father's house, located in the agricultural district of Chepen, a city with a substantial amount of commercial activity. This area is part of the province of the same name, and is located an hour from Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. He provides cargo and passenger transport services with his mototaxi (a motorized vehicle that consists of a motorcycle that has an attached cabin where he can transport people and cargo.) He provides this service in the city of Chepen, and his business enjoys a good reception from the public, since these means of transportation are accessible to the public due to their low cost. With the income he earns, he is in charge of supporting his family. His wife works in a call center, and with the money that they both earn they try to get ahead. He is now working very hard to get his own house. As he is continually using his vehicle, it is starting to have some mechanical problems that require urgent repair to guarantee its proper functioning. Gabriel is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for the first time for 1,000 Peruvian soles to help him carry out these repairs and do the maintenance on his vehicle that is needed. Gabriel is a young person who strives each day to give his family the best. The people who know him consider him to be a responsible and reliable person.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to pay expenses for the repair and maintenance of his mototaxi that he uses to provide transportation services

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita G. is from the village of Brgy. Baresbes, Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 33 years old. Perlita is married and has 3 school-age children. To make a living, Perlita owns & operates a business venture in the transportation sector. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating tricycle transport services. Perlita has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 6,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Perlita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Perlita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase tires and other accessories. Perlita is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to repair the same vehicle for better service. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Perlita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair her vehicle for better service

loans.name: Bazirengedde Development Group-Mukono

texts.en:
“Men have sight--Women have insight”- This is an adage firmly embedded in 33-year-old K. Grace. K. belongs to Bazirengedde group. Because she has been able to solve deeply entrenched financial adversity on her own with no support, she now has a deeper perspective and understanding of how to handle a crisis situation in business. Notwithstanding the relatively short period of time she has had her food snack and soft drink restaurant business, she has given a good account of herself as a business woman. 

Lady luck has shone on Grace’s married life. She and her husband have three highly spirited kids who she says take after both of them in many ways. 

Running this business has struck a deep chord with clients who flock to her restaurant. Like her name, K. Grace is truly gracious. She began her business journey selling charcoal and firewood. Grace credits her sister with giving her the inspiration to begin this business. With this loan, she says she is going to buy more furniture for her restaurant.

loans.use: To purchase furniture for her restaurant

loans.name: Ruddy

texts.es: El Señor Ruddy  es soltero vive  solo  en un anticrético que lo a adquirido con su trabajo, es una persona responsable, trabajadora. El cliente solicita el crédito para compra herramientas para la actividad de mecánica, tiene bastante experiencia en el rubro su especialidad es arreglo de camiones grandes, comenzó trabajando de ayudante de mecánica y ahora ya tiene su propio taller , el se siente muy orgulloso ya que para el es un logro muy grande tener su propio taller y así poder ayudar a sus padres con los gastos del hogar, esta muy agradecido con la institucion por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Ruddy is single and he lives alone in a living space that he acquired through his work. He is a very responsible person and he is very hard working. He requests a loan to purchase tools to use in his business as a mechanic. He has significant experience in this field of work. He specializes in heavy machinery. He started out working as an assistant but now he has his own shop. He is very proud because getting his own shop and be able to help support his parents is a great achievement. He is very grateful to the organization for their support.

loans.use: To purchase tools.

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia, 57, works from home as a seamstress to support her family financially. She mainly receives work from neighboring clients. She started this business after her husband’s death a few years ago. Her husband had been the only breadwinner of the family and after his death all responsibilities came onto her shoulders and she worked day and night to improve the financial condition of her family.

Razia is mother to two sons. Her elder son works in a brick furnace manufacturing brick and the younger is the janitor of a private company. They both contribute to the family financially. The family live in Gujranwala, a city located in Punjab and famous in Pakistan for its sweetmeat.
 
Razia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her elder son to start a driving business, as his current work doesn’t give him enough money to cover the family's financial needs. He will use the loan to purchase a rickshaw with which he will provide transportation services to passengers and earn income for the family.

Razia is hopeful that after this loan investment her family’s life will improve and she will be able to marry her elder son very soon. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. In the previous loan year, she built good credit behavior and attended every meeting.

loans.use: To buy a rickshaw to start a driving business

loans.name: Santos De La Cruz

texts.es:
Santos tiene 31 años de edad, es soltera y tiene un hijo dependiente, reside junto a su madre en el distrito de Santa Rosa, una zona cuya economía depende principalmente de la pesca, se encuentra situada a veinticinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la confección y tejido de manteles, mantas, pañuelos y fundas, ella elabora estos artículos de modo artesanal y debido a la buena calidad con la que los prepara se ha convertido en una de las artesanas mas solicitadas de la zona. El negocio es una fuente importante de ingreso para su familia por lo que siempre trata de brindar lo mejor de si para mantenerlo.

Santos desea adquirir material para seguir elaborando productos de modo que pueda cumplir con algunos pedidos con los que actualmente cuenta, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Santos es una mujer bastante creativa y empeñosa, ella desea seguir ampliando su taller para percibir mas ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Santos is 31 years old.  She is single and has one child who is dependent on her.  She lives together with her mother in Santa Rosa district, an area whose economy depends mainly on fishing.  It is twenty-five minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

She works making and weaving tablecloths, blankets, scarves and covers.  She makes these articles by hand and, owing to the good quality of her work, she has become one of the most requested craftswomen in the area.  Her business is an important source of income for her family which is why she always tries to provide her best work so that she can maintain her business.

Santos would like to acquire material so that she can continue making products and thereby fill some orders which she currently has.  For this reason she is requesting her first loan from Edpyme Alternatia for 2,000 nuevos soles which will help her to achieve her objective.

Santos is quite a creative and determined woman.  She would like to continue expanding her workshop so that she can make more money and improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: To acquire material to continue making products

loans.name: Hjiadi Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama HJIADI, se encuentra ubicado en la comunidad de Lerma, Estado de México, las señoras se basaron en una palabra de origen Otomi, que signifaca  Sol y Luna. El grupo está integrado por 9 clientas, en el se encuentra la señora Remedios S. P., quien fue la persona encargada de reunir a las integrantes del grupo en su domicilio, la señora Remedios tiene 54 años de edad, nos platica que estudió la educación secundaria, se encuentra casada con el señor Miguel Angel Guzman desde hace ya 34 años, comenta que al principio la unica fuente de ingresos a su hogar era el sueldo de su esposo quien trabajaba como ayudante general en una empresa que se encuentra ubicada en el D.F, pero que las ganas de salir adelante con su familia la obligaron a buscar más alternativas llevándola a desempeñar varias actividades desde la siembra de maiz y haba hasta las ventas por catálogo, recientemente la  invitaron a formar parte de un grupo de mujeres que al igual que ella tienen la misma inquietud de salir adelante. Quiere el crédito para la compra de dulces. La ilusión que siempre ha tenido la clienta es que sus hijos  y nietos puedan tener acceso a una educacion de calidad, también sueña con algun dia tener una Fuente de Sodas, ya que su negocio se encuentra ubicado cerca de la secundaria de su comunidad.
texts.en:
This group is called HJIADI and is located in the community of Lerma, in Mexico. These women based their group’s name on an Otomi word that means Sun and Moon.
The group is made up of 9 members, including Remedios S. P. who is in charge of holding group meetings at her home. Remedios is 54 years old, attended high school and has been married to Miguel Angel Guzman for 34 years.
At first her husband’s salary, from his work as a general assistant at a company in Mexico City, was their only source of income. Her hope to improve her family’s situation required her to take on various jobs ranging from growing corn and beans to catalogue sales. Recently she was invited to join a group of like-minded women.
She is requesting a loan to buy sweets for her business. She has always hoped that her children will have access to quality education. She also hopes to one day have a soda fountain because her business is located near the community’s high school.

loans.use: To invest in their businesses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary K. is 27 years old.  She operates a restaurant business in Tala market. She is a single mother of one son, John Mutisya, who is nine years old and is in class three. Mary's food pleases her customers a lot since its well-made, so she has many customers. Mary was introduced to KADET by the credit officer in charge of the Tala office.

Mary has been running this business for a period of three  years.  Her monthly profit is Kshs 15,000.  This loan for Kshs 10,000 is her first loan from KADET LTD.  She intends to use it to buy chairs, tables, and cereals for cooking. If this loan boosts her business, Mary will use the profits to pay school and tuition fee for her child.  She dreams of having a catering school. She describes herself as hardworking.

loans.use: To buy chairs, tables, and cereals for cooking.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny M. is from the village of San Vicente Bajo, Oroquieta City. She is 60 years old. Jenny is married and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, Jenny owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Jenny has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Jenny joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jenny has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Jenny is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Jenny from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Naomi Wanjiku

texts.en:
Naomi has practiced mixed farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last four years. She is 21 years old, married to Ezekiel N. and they have two children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend and this will be her second loan. She paid for her 1st loan of KES 10,000 well and in good time. She plans to use the loan amount to buy a dairy cow.

In future, Naomi hopes to be supplying milk in Ndunyu Njeru in large quantities. She also is planning to buy a lorry to help her in milk supply.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace N. lives in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has three children, and all her children go to school. Grace owns and operates a restaurant.  She has been in this business for seven years, and she works seven days out of every week. 

Grace has requested a loan of 800,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO.  She wants to use this loan to buy more bunches of bananas, cassava, potatoes, beef and rice. The main business challenge for Grace is transportation.  Her goal is to eventually build her own home. Now she lives in a home that she rents. She has access to electricity but doesn’t have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses are school fees, food and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bananas, beef, rice, cassava and potatoes

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia C. is from the village of Namnama, Ilagan, Isabela. She is 48 years old. Ofelia is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Ofelia owns & operates a business planting & harvesting vegetables for sale. Ofelia has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 2500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Ofelia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Ofelia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to pay for services to increase crop yield. Ofelia is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Ofelia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, such as manure.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Divorced with six children, Efua B. has been selling palm oil and food items such as garden eggs (as shown in the photograph) at Jukwa Market near Abura, Cape Coast, for six years now. Being the sole provider for her family, she is keen to expand her business to grow her income. She plans to use the loan to purchase more food items to sell, as demand for them has increased. The extra profits she is aiming to earn will be saved up for her family’s future.

loans.use: to purchase more food items to sell

loans.name: Amos

texts.en: Amos is a member of Urafiki Development Group in Kiva partner, Faulu Kenya. He supplies water to earn a living. He employs one person to help him in his tasks. He was previously farming to make a living. Through Faulu Kenya, Amos has learned how to manage his business well. He hopes to grow his business so as to increase his monthly income. He has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to buy water containers, a donkey and a cart.

loans.use: to buy water containers, a donkey and a cart

loans.name: Paulita

texts.es: La Sra. Paulita vive en la localidad de la Guardia, su esposo se dedica al transporte de personas(taxi) desde la localidad a la ciudad de Santa Cruz, ella se dedica a la venta de comida, en su propio domicilio, hace unos dos años, tiene tres hijos, es nacida en el departamento de santa cruz, el destino del crédito es para comprar una heladera para su negocio, sus deseos es poder terminar de pagar su casa, ya que la esta pagando en cuotas, es cliente antigua de la institución por lo que se siente agradecida por el apoyo económico.
texts.en: Paulita lives in the town of Guardia. Her husband is a taxi driver, driving people from their town to the city of Santa Cruz. Paulita has been selling food from her home for the past two years. She has three children. She was born in the region of Santa Cruz. The loan she requests will be used to buy a refrigerator for her business. She wants to be able to finish paying off her house. Paulita is a long-time client of her community bank and she very grateful for its financial support.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Agée de 43ans, Mme Afi est veuve et mère de d’un(01) enfant. Elle réside à Adéhui  et est revendeuse d’œufs. En 2008 elle a démarré l’activité en s’approvisionnant à Zanguéra et en revendant à Adéhui  dans sa maison. Elle a payé ses 02 derniers prêt sans difficultés et sollicite ce troisième prêt pour acheter des œufs pour revendre  pour accroître du bénéfice afin de mieux s’occuper  de son seul enfant  vu qu’elle est veuve.
texts.en: Ms. Afi is 43 years old, widowed, and has one child. She lives in Adéhui and is a retailer of eggs. In 2008, she began this business by supplying herself in Zanguéra and re-selling her goods in Adéhui at her home. She repaid her two previous loans without difficulty, and is seeking this third loan to buy eggs for resale in order to increase her profits and thus be able to better take care of her only child, given that she is a widow.

loans.use: to buy and re-sell eggs.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein S. is 40 years old and lives in the town of Masindi in the Hoima region of Uganda. He is married and has three children, all of whom are currently in school. Hussein has a bricklaying business, which he has run for five years. He also has a second business running a retail shop.
To help expand his business, Hussein has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase a machine that mixes soil to make bricks for resale. With the help of his loan from BRAC, Hussein hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. In the future, he hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase a machine that mixes soil to make bricks for resale.

loans.name: Manuela De Jesus

texts.es:
Manuela de 43 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Suburbio de Guayaquil, es unida y tienen 2 hijos de 20 y 15 años el mayor estudia en colegio y el menor es fallecido.

Comenzó hace tres años en su negocio de taller de sandalias trabaja con un a persona que realiza los zapatos de caballeros. Labora con su ayudante de 8H30 am a 6H00 pm de lunes a sábados. Su esposo trabaja independiente como cerrajero. Con la ayuda del préstamo desea comprar mas productos para la elaboración de calzados como plantillas $200 correas $100 fibras de yutes $300 para incrementar su capital.

En un futuro quiere tener un local para exhibir sus productos.
texts.en:
Manuela is 43 years old and lives in an urban area of Suburbio de Guayaquil.  She is married and has two children aged 20 and 15.  Her eldest is in high school and her youngest is deceased.

Manuela started her business (a workshop where she makes sandals) three years ago.  She works with another person who makes men's shoes.  She works with her assistant from 8.30am to 6.00pm, from Monday to Saturday.  Her husband is self employed as a locksmith.  With the help of this loan, Manuela would like to buy more products for making footwear such as insoles ($200), straps ($100) and jute fiber ($300).  This will increase her capital.

In the future, Manuela would like to have premises where she can display her products.

loans.use: to buy insoles, straps and jute fiber

loans.name: Jekabara Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les Six membres du groupe  JEKABARA III  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans, 5  enfants et vivant la plupart dans des  familles polygames à ZANGABOUGOU, un des villages de la commune de LOULOUNI dans la sous préfecture  de LOULOUNI, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est :  le pois sucré avec  ADIARATOU .
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants et les petits matériels. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché du village de DALLEN et au marché de LOULOUNI après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 110 500FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The six members of Jekabara III Group are married women who, on average, are 36 years old and have five children. Most of them live in polygamous families. They live in Zangabougou, one of the villages in the municipality of Loulouni in the sub-prefecture of Loulouni (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).
