They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to finance their agricultural business during the winter season. This is their fourth loan with the institution, the previous loans having been repaid on schedule.

Adiaratou, one of the group members, cultivates sweet peas. She intends to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs and farming tools. After the harvest, she sells her peas in her village and at the village markets in Dallen and Loulouni to a clientele made up of men and women.

Adiaratou expects to make an average profit of 110,500 CFA francs per season, which she will use to repay her loan and help her husband to cover household expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and seeds.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
TERESA
Esta socia quien es una pequeña comerciante, se dedica  a la venta de producto medicinal natural muy conocida de la empresa OMNILIFE, desde ya hace 8 años, ella manifiesta que gracias a este negocio ha podido salir adelante en la educación y mantención de sus 6 hijos, ya que hace varios años su esposo abandono su familia, pero se ha esforzado bastante y ha contado con  la ayuda de FAPE. Para  la compra de sus productos. Hace poco empezó con otra actividad que es la destaza de pollo con la que obtiene un ingreso mas para sus hijos, a quienes les brinda educación y les desea sean personas preparadas para el futuro ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de medicina natural.
texts.en:
Teresa is a small businesswoman who sells a well-known brand of natural medicinal products made by OMNILIFE. She has been in business for eight years. Thanks to this venture, Teresa says that she has been able to get ahead so that she can support her six children and provide them with an education. Several years ago her husband abandoned the family, but she has strived to move forward with the help from FAPE by being able to buy her products.

Just recently, Teresa started another business butchering chickens so that she could earn additional income for her children. She wants to provide them an education so that they can be prepared for the future. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy natural medicines.

loans.use: to purchase natural medicines.

loans.name: Sebastiao

texts.pt:
Nasceu na povincia de Gaza ao sul de Mocambique casado e pai de 3 filhos de idades entre 15 e 19 anos de idade. Fez a 4ªclasse e parou por falta de condições financeiras. vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta os seus pais enviando dinheiro para ajudar nas despesas alimentares.
Saiu de Gaza para Maputo a procura de emprego,e carpinteiro a mais de 20 anos e tem um rendimento de 7.000.00mt por mes que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Fez um emprestimo no BCI para compra de material da carpintaria. Conheceu Hluvuku atravez de um amigo que tambem e cliente e este e o seu primeiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 9.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material para a sua obra (ferro, tabua, prancha,cimento, e outros ).
Sonha em e ampliar a sua obra e a sua carpintaria, e para ampliar o seu negocio e para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Sebastiao was born in the province of Gazo in southern Mozambique.  He is married and the father of 3 children who range in age from 15 to 19.  He studied through the fourth grade and stopped due to the lack of financial resources.  He lives in his own home with his family and also supports his parents by sending them money to help with their food costs.

He left Gaza for Maputo in search of employment.  He has been a carpenter for more than 20 years and makes 7,000 a month which he puts towards his home's expenses.  He also saves some in his bank account in the BIM bank.

He had a previous loan with BCI to buy carpentry materials.  He became familiar with Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of the institution.  This is his first loan with Hluvuku in the amount of 9,000 meticals, which he will use to buy materials to finish his home (iron, boards, cement, etc.).

His dream is to expand his home and his carpenter's shop to expand his business, for which he plans on requesting more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to buy materials to finish his home (iron, boards, cement, etc.)

loans.name: Mzimuni Group

texts.en:
Zaina, who is in her early twenties, is single. She has been running a cosmetics business for one year now. She works from 8:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Zaina’s first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. As leader of the loan group "Mzimuni," she will share this loan with fifteen other members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

Zaina wants to use her portion of the loan to buy more cosmetics to sell. Her dream is to one day open another cosmetics shop.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.en:
Jose Antonio is 76 years old and married. He has five children. 

He was born in Sicuani and now lives in the city of Cusco. He is a retired lawyer and is happy to be spending time with his family. 

He is asking for a loan in order to invest in his personal health by purchasing vitamins and medications. In addition, he will use the loan to pay for household necessities such as the water and light bills. Lastly, he plans to purchase animals such as chickens and guinea pigs to raise so that he can eventually eat them. 

He is committed to making all of the necessary loan payments on time.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and medication to maintain his health.

loans.name: José Augusto

texts.es:
José de 48 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio de agua y luz, ubicada en la zona urbana del distrito de Ferreñafe que pertenece a la provincia de Chiclayo.  Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y turismo.

José se dedica a la venta de balones de gas que se utiliza para que las cocinas funcionen, actividad que viene realizando desde hace varios años, la cualno tien mucha competencia en la zona donde vive, cuenta con clientela fija que le realiza pedidos a los 30 días que es lo que normalmente dura un  balon de gas y con los ingresos que adquiera podrá solventar sus obligaciones familiares.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar más gas para abastecer los pedidos de sus clientes y satisfacer su necesidad y con esas ganacias podrá cubrir su crédito y mejorar su calidad de vida.  José es un hombre responsable que con muchoesfurzo y sacrificio saca adelante a su familia porque como todo padre quiere que sus hijos sean profesionales en un futuro y puedan lograr lo que se propongan.
texts.en:
José is 48 years old and lives with his wife and children in their own house. The house is connected to water and electricity, and is located in the built-up area of the district of Ferreñafe in the province of Chiclayo. The area is known for farming, cattle rearing and tourism.

For several years José has been selling bottled gas for cooking. There is not much competition in his area. He has a loyal clientele which places orders at 30 days' intervals (the expected duration of a gas cylinder). He spends his income on family expenditures.

José came to the microfinance institution Edpyme Alternativa and applied for a loan of 1000 new soles to buy more gas to meet the demand of his customers and thus provide for his own needs. The profit will enable him to pay the loan installments and improve his quality of life. José is a responsible man who with much effort and sacrifice supports his family. Like any father he wants his children to become professionals in future and that they achieve what they set out to do.

loans.use: to buy bottled gas for cooking.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a married woman with eight children, all of whom graduated from school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 12 years, she has operated a bags selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbors and passersby. In addition, she also owns real estate houses, which contributes to her source of income. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation while moving from door to door selling bags. She dreams of establishing a shop to sell bags in the future.

With the 10,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase bales of bags for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bales of bags for resale.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last six years.  He is 28 years old, married to Beatrice, and they have two school-going children.  

He was introduced to KADET Ltd. by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, Moses hopes to become one of the leading farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Amos

texts.es:
El señor Amos es de la ciudad de Santaní, tiene casa propia, está casado, es propietario de un pequeño Almacén en su propio domicilio, también trabaja como macatero, recorre por toda la zona de Bertoni. Según comenta empezó su almacén con su esfuerzo y sacrificio, tiene una camioneta, en la cual se moviliza fácilmente y moviliza los productos para su almacén.
Su sueño es de tener un local mas amplio para poder surtir más su negocio y así obtener más clientes y satisfacer las necesidades de los mismos. Es una persona muy responsable, honesta y trabajadora, que lucha día a día para salir adelante y solventar los gastos de la familia.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de comestibles, bebidas, lácteos y otros para el abastecimiento de su negocio. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que le da, pues de obtener el crédito le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Amos is from the city of Santaní. He has his own house, is married, and is the owner of a small store in his own home. He also works as a street merchant traveling throughout the area of Bertoni. He says that he began his store with a lot of effort and sacrifice. He has a truck in which he can easily organize the products for the store.

His dream is to expand his business in order to have more items to sell so that he can get more customers and satisfy their needs. He is a responsible person, honest and hard working who fights day after day in order to get ahead and meet the family expenses.

He is asking for this loan in order to buy food, drinks, dairy products, and other necessities for his business. He is grateful to the Foundation for the support they have given him in that the loan is going to be very helpful.

loans.use: to buy food, drinks, dairy products, and other necessities

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is 33 years old and lives in Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with two school-aged children. 

To earn a living, Lina owns and operates an eatery. She cooks at least four to eight classes of viands in her business site and also offers coffees, milk, cereals, and other snacks to eat. She has sustained her business operations for over five successful years. Each month, she earns an approximate total of PHP 3,500. She borrowed PHP 5,000 from GDMPC to purchase cooking materials for the business. She believes that work will be much easier and faster if all the necessary cooking stuffs are present. 

In the future, Lina would like to widen the area and add more tables and chairs to provide a conducive place for her customers.

loans.use: To purchase cooking materials for the business.

loans.name: Rufus

texts.en: Rufus is a hardworking businessman, age 21 and married. For over two years, he has been running a butchery to make a living. Along with the butcher shop, he roasts and cooks meat for extra income.  Rufus has been able to retain his business because of his good reputation with his customers. In the next five years, he wants to expand his business.  He is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy a cow to slaughter.

loans.use: To buy a cow to slaughter

loans.name: Goharik

texts.en: Goharik works at the local kindergarten. Unfortunately, her salary is too low to make ends meet, so she is also engaged in agriculture. Goharik grows fruits and vegetables and keeps them in the freezer to sell for the coming winter season. Goharik would like to sell more fruit. For this reason she plans to purchase fruit. Goharik has to keep the fruit in a rented freezer. Increase of sales will allow her to construct her own freezer in the future. Goharik will soon have her first child, so this will help her to get additional income and ensure a sustainable future for her child. Goharik lives together with her husband, mother-in-law and father-in-law.

loans.use: to pay for fruit

loans.name: Banguka I Group

texts.fr:
Rose est une commerçante âgée de 62ans qui habite la localité de Kwibuka de la Province de Gitega au centre du pays. Elle vend des articles divers dans sa boutique (haricot, riz, huile de palme, savon, pétrole, biscuits,…) depuis 30 ans, un métier qu’elle commence alors qu’elle était cultivatrice. Elle n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Elle est mariée a David et ont ensemble 10 enfants dont 4 déjà maries et tous les autres étudient même a l’Université. 
 Le crédit Kiva  de 250,000 francs burundais qu’elle obtient lui permet d’augmenter son capital pour acheter une grande quantité d’articles divers pour sa boutique(  haricot, riz, huile de palme, savon, pétrole, biscuits,…) à revendre  afin de réaliser de grands bénéfices et accroitre ses économies. 

Elle est membre  du groupe  communautaire «GARUKIRABAKENYEZI»
texts.en:
Rose is a 62 year old merchant who lives in the town of Kwibuka of the province of Gitega in the centre of the country. For 30 years, she  has been selling various items in her shop (beans, rice, palm oil, soap, gasoline, biscuits, ...). She started this job when she was a farmer. She did not attend school. She is married to David and together they have 10 children, four of them are already married and all the others are in school even studying at the University.

Kiva’s loan of 250,000 Burundian francs allows her to increase her capital to purchase large quantities of various items for her store (beans, rice, palm oil, soap, gasoline, biscuits, ...). She resells them in order to make large profits and increase her savings.

She is a member of the community group "Garukirabakenyezi”.

loans.use: to increase her capital to buy a large quantity of various items for her shop (beans, rice, palm oil, gasoline, biscuits ...) and resell them to make large profits and increase her savings.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
María, de 55 años de edad, habita en la ciudad de Estelí, madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos que son mayores de edad, son independientes, ella se dedico parte de su vida a dar clases en las escuelas primarias fue con esta profesión que logro criar  a sus dos hijos, pero el salario era muy bajo entonces decidió poner su propio negocio para ayudarse con los gastos del hogar, comenzó vendiendo oro después puso una mini tienda de ropa y así poco a poco ha venido levantando su negocio surtiéndolo de nuevos productos para  vender, es por ello que requiere el préstamo para comprar frutas tales como manzana, uvas, peras , mandarinas ya que se acerca la temporada en el que este tipo de frutas son muy buscadas por los clientes y no quiere perder la oportunidad de dejar de vender. 
Ella es siempre busca la manera de surgir en la vida, nos expresa que una de sus expectativas es poner una pulpería con bastantes productos para ofrecer, debido a que hay pocas pulperías en la zona donde ella vive.
texts.en: María is 55 years old and lives in the city of Estelí,. She is a single mother who has 2 children who are both adult and independent. She has spent part of her life teaching primary school and doing this she managed to raise her 2 children. However, the salary was very low and so she decided to set up her own business to help her with the household expenses. She started off selling gold and then set up a ministore selling clothes and thus litlle by little she has grown her business stocking new products to sell. This is why she wants the loan to buy fruit such as apples, grapes, pears and mandarin oranges as the season is approaching when these fruits are much sought after by customers and she doesn't want to miss the opportunity to make sales. She is always looking for ways to succeed in life. She tells us that one of her expectations is to set up a grocery store with enough products to offer, as there are few grocery stores in the area where she lives.

loans.use: to buy fruit such as apples, grapes, pears, mandarin oranges.

loans.name: Dely Jasmin

texts.en:
Dely Jasmin is a married woman with three children. She is 52 years old and resides at Panaon, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Dely Jasmin owns and operates a farm, planting and harvesting rice to sell to earn a living. She has been in this business for ten years. Each month she earns 8,000 PHP doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. Dely Jasmin has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Green Light Group

texts.en:
Agrinah is 63 years old and a tailor.  She lives in Machipisa with three dependents that she cares of. Her children are all grown up now and have left home.  She is a widow.

Agrinah has been in this business for five years and she concentrates on making school uniforms, chair covers and bedspreads.  She has no employees and no other sources of income.

She will use the loan to buy more clothing materials and hopes that she will be able to improve her family's standard of living.  She would like to broaden her product range.

loans.use: to buy clothing material

loans.name: Eliza

texts.es:
Eliza de 25 años convive con Rubén, con quien tiene 2 hijos de 8 y 6 años. Elisa y su familia viven en la casa de sus padres en el anexo de Kivinaki, distrito de Perené, provincia de Chanchamayo. Eliza ha visto en la agricultura su forma de ganarse la vida y el sustento de su familia.
Es por eso que cuenta con 4 parcelas de terrenos de cultivos, donde siembra café y naranjas. El café lo tendrá listo para los meses de abril y mayo, mientras que las naranjas ya las está cosechando en los meses de noviembre y diciembre. La venta de estos cítricos le trae buenos ingresos.
Por su parte su pareja, se dedica al trabajo de campo para otras personas y al día obtiene de 20 a 60 soles por los diversos servicios que realiza. Asimismo la apoya en la jornada del campo, además de otros operarios a quienes contrata. El trabajo es cansado, arriesgado, dedicado pero a la vez gratificante.
Con el pasar del tiempo, espera construir su propio hogar y equiparlo para así vivir más cómodamente. Es una de sus primeras metas. Sería éste su primer préstamo que obtendría gracias a su ayuda de MFP. Por eso se compromete en ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas. Se siente contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal “Las Semillitas de Kivinaki”. Con el dinero podrá comprar 3 bolsas de abonos cuyo precio oscila entre 110 y 120 soles, para 2 parcelas de café. Asimismo contratará operarios para que lo ayuden en la fertilización.
texts.en:
Eliza is 25 years old and lives with Rubén, with whom she has two children aged 8 and 6. Elisa and her family live in her parent's house in the small village of Kivinaki, Perené district in the province of Chanchamayo.

Eliza sees agriculture as her way of earning a living and supporting her family.

For this reason she has 4 plots of cultivated land where she sows coffee and oranges. The coffee will be ready for the months of May and April, while she harvests the oranges in the months of November and December. The sale of these citrus fruits brings in a good income.

Rubén works in the field with other people. He earns 20-60 PEN a day for the various jobs he carries out. In the working day in the field, he counts on his partners support as well as the other workers that they hire. The work is tiring, dangerous, time consuming, but satisfying.

As time passes, she hopes to build her own home and furnish it so they can live more comfortably. This is one of her first goals.

This is her first loan, obtained thanks to the help of MFP. For this she is committed to being punctual with her payments. She is happy to belong to the Communal Bank "Las Semillitas de Kivinaki". With the money she will be able to buy 3 bags of manure, the price of which varies between 110 and 120 PEN, for the 2 coffee plots. She will also hire day laborers to help her with the fertilization of the coffee plots.

loans.use: to buy two bags of organic manure and hire day laborers

loans.name: Sokly

texts.en:
Sokly (in the photo) is 44 years old and her husband Chuon is 54 years old. The live in a village about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have four sons and three daughters; three children are married and live outside the family home, three are construction workers and another one attends school.   

Sokly sells grocery items, while her husband is a construction worker. Sokly is asking for a loan in the amount of $1,000 to purchase a motorcycle for her son, who is in construction, to get work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her son to get to work.

loans.name: Wilson Paulino

texts.es: El sr. Wilson es cliente antiguo que retorna después de un descanso en su crédito vive la  zona de Cota Cota, El Sr. Wilson costura edredones los entrega por mayor como también por unidad la mayoría de sus clientes son las mayoristas que venden por la calle Tumusla y las que venden en los locales comerciales,  las entregas los hace semanalmente que oscilan entre dos a tres docenas por semana. El requiere el préstamo para la compra de telas por rollo y fibras por rollo ya que la venta incrementa estas épocas  de fines de año y tiene muchos pedidos que entregar, el Sr. Wilson es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz y agradecido por la oportunidad que siempre le brinda la institución ya que gracias a su apoyo creció su negocio.
texts.en:
Wilson is a longstanding client who is returning after taking a break from loans.  He lives in the Cota Cota zone.  He sews comforters that he sells at wholesale and by the unit.  Most of his customers are wholesalers that live around Tumusla Street and that sell them in commercial locales.  He makes his deliveries weekly and he oscillates between two and three dozen per week.

He needs the loan to buy bolts of fabric and filler because sales increase during the end of year and he has many pending orders to fill.  Wilson is a very hardworking person who feels happy and grateful for the opportunity the institution always provides since thanks to its support his business grew.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher sells spare auto parts to earn a living. He had previously acquired a loan of 20,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) which helped him to buy shocks, springs and oil for his business. This helped him to grow his business and he was able to make more profits.

He dreams of expanding his business in the future. He has requested another loan of 40,000 KES to buy spraying machines and springs.

loans.use: To buy spraying machines and springs.

loans.name: Rosa Argentina

texts.es: La Sra. Rosa Argentina se dedica a la elaboracion y ventas de artesanias de barro desde hace mas de 22 años elaborando adornos muy atractivos, tambien es profesora de una escuela publica donde imparte las primeras letras a mucho niños entre  7- 9 años de escasos recursos, la Sra. Rosa necesita este credito para invertir en la compra de barro, moldes de figuras, pinturas y otros materiales necesarios para la elaboracion de figuras de barrios (artesanias) y pago de matricula de su hija que estudia en la universidad

loans.use: Pago mensualiada e inversion en negocio

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For acquiring a school van

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy fertilizer and animal feed

loans.name: Vong

texts.en: Vong S. is a 45-year-old widow who lives in Phnom Penh with her four children.  Two of her children work at a small private company and earn $240/month combined.  S. sells sno-cones (incredibly delicious on a hot day!) along the street in Phnom Penh.  She will use this loan to buy a new machine because there is such high demand for her treats!  In the future, S. would like to build a new home for her family.

loans.use: To buy a new sno-cone machine

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: A client of LAPO who has been with LAPO for 5 years, Joy is married with four children. She hails from Benin City, Edo State of Nigeria and sells bags of pure water to her community.  She wishes to borrow the above amount for business expansion.

loans.use: To buy more bags of water for sale

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr:
Born in 1971 in Gapé, Togo, Mrs. Adjo B. is a seamstress. Married to a farmer who has difficulty supporting the family, she manages daily to come up with her share of financial input for their family’s needs.

Adjo is illiterate since she lacked the financial means to attend school. Instead, she became an apprentice. At the end of her apprenticeship and in view of her rather difficult situation, she has been obliged to rent a sewing machine to use in order to practice her trade.

With all this in mind, Adjo is asking for a loan of US$ 1000 which she plans to use to buy a sewing machine and set up a workshop where she can do her work in proper fashion. This will allow her to improve her socio-economic condition and live life more fully.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Née en 1971 à Gapé, Madame B. Adjo est couturière. Mariée à un cultivateur qui arrive difficilement à supporter la famille, elle se débrouille quotidiennement pour supporter les charges du ménage.

C’est une femme analphabète parce qu’elle n’a pas eu les moyens d’aller à l’école. A la fin de son apprentissage, compte tenu de sa situation difficile, elle se voit obliger de louer une machine à coudre afin d’exercer son métier.

Vu les difficultés qu’elle endure, elle sollicite un crédit de $1000 afin de se doter des machines à coudre et aménager son atelier de couture pour exercer pleinement ses activités. La réalisation de ce projet lui permettrait d’améliorer ses conditions de vie socio économiques.

loans.use: buying a sewing machine and setting up a workshop

loans.name: Norma Liliana

texts.es:
Approximately 15 years ago doña Norma decided to start a family with her beloved husband, Beato, and four children were born from this great love, and all of them bring joy to the lives of their parents. With the arrival of each new member the income received by the head of the family was insufficient and did no cover the basic needs of his home, and therefore his wife decided to start her own business selling food in the street, sometimes helped by her inseparable husband and their beloved children. It is Norma´s wish to buy ingredients in large quantities to lower the cost of the preparation of each of the dishes she offers daily in the streets of her hometown. and therefore she is asking for a loan of $275 to fulfill her dream. She plans to repay the loan in 6 months." Norma is awaiting your prompt reply."

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer

Norma hace aproximadamente 15 años decidió formar una familia con el que actualmente es su querido esposo, Beato, fruto del gran amor que se tienen nacieron 4 niños, quienes son la mayor alegría de sus vidas. Poco tiempo después al observar que con la llegada de cada uno de sus miembros el ingreso económico que percibía el jefe de familia era insuficiente y no cubrían las necesidades básicas de su hogar, decidió apoyarlo e incursionó en el negocio de venta de comida en forma ambulatoria, en ocasiones con ayuda de su inseparable esposo y sus adorados hijos.El deseo que tiene Norma es comprar víveres al por mayor para disminuir el costo en la preparación de cada uno de los potajes que ofrece a diario por las calles de su ciudad para llevar a cabo este hecho está solicitando un préstamo de 275 dólares, comprometiéndose a hacer la devolución del préstamo en un lapso de 6 meses. “Norma espera tu pronta respuesta”

loans.use: to buy ingredients for the preparation of food

loans.name: Claret

texts.es:
Claret is a loving mother who works very hard selling a large quantity of diverse products in her small shop at home. She has been doing this for several years and this activity gives her optimism and happiness, since she can provide for her home income and her children. She really would like to increase the quantity and variety of the products she buys from Lima. By increasing the quantity of her products she will increase her profits and she could give a better quality of life to her small children. This is why Claret is asking for a loan, so she can continue contributing to the family income.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Escalante, Kiva volunteer

Claret, es una amorosa madre que arduamente trabaja a diario vendiendo gran cantidad y diversidad de productos en su pequeña bodega instalada en las inmediaciones de su hogar. Esta labor a la que se dedica desde hace muchos años atrás, le está otorgando optimismo y alegría, debido a que le permite suplir satisfactoriamente las necesidades de su hogar.El deseo de esta afanosa madre es aumentar la cantidad de productos que comercializa a través de una mayor inversión para traer productos desde Lima, con el que obtendrá mayores ingresos económicos, para brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a sus dos menores hijos.Para ello Claret solicita un préstamo que le permitirá cumplir con su intención y de esta manera seguir colaborando con el desarrollo de su familia.

loans.use: Incremento de capital para adquirir mayor cantidad y variedad de productos de primera necesidad para ofertarlos en su pequeño establecimiento.

loans.name: Vilma Mirna

texts.es:
Vilma is a dedicated teacher who focuses on teaching early education to small children between the ages of newborn to five years old. This vocation is her passion, given that she has always enjoyed teaching and taking care of kids. At the same time, she and her husband grow citrus and other fruits that they sell in the city of Pichanaki. She and her two daughters, ages 13 and 15, want to open a small store in their home where they can sell cold beverages to the community. For this reason, she works hard as a teacher and farmer in order to reach her goals. Regardless, the season to produce the most crops is approaching and they need additional fertilizers and tools to grow and harvest their fruits. Vilma is seeking your collaboration and support to increase her citrus crop with the objective of meeting the demands of the next crop selling season.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Vilma, es una noble profesora que se desempeña como promotora de niños en servicio de un PRONOEI que otorga estimulación temprana a los pequeños de 0 a 5 años de edad, esta labor es su pasión puesto que siempre le encantó enseñar y cuidar a niños; a la par ella y su esposo se dedican al cultivo de cítricos y demás frutas que comercializan en la ciudad de Pichanaki.Ella y sus dos hijas de 13 y 15 años desean implementar en su domicilio una pequeña bodega a fin vender bebidas heladas a su comunidad; es por ello que su ardua labor de profesora y agricultora le ayudaran a alcanzar sus metas; sin embargo el tiempo para producir a mayor cantidad se acerca y la campaña de marzo para le venta de frutas esta próxima; por esa razón requiere mayor cantidad de abonos y demás herramientas para cosechar sus terrenos de cultivo. Ahora Vilma requiere de vuestra colaboración y apoyo para elevar la producción de su chacra de cítricos con el objetivo de abastecer la demanda de la campaña próxima de venta de frutas.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers and tools for harvesting crop.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.ru:
Ahmad N., 27, is married and has 2 children. For 2 years, Ahmad has been engaged in cattle farming. This loan he plans to use to purchase a pair of young bulls. Ahmad will raise the animals and then re-sell them with a profit. Ahmad’s wife helps him to tend the farm. Ahmad N. plans to repay this loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Набиев Ахмад, возраст – 27 лет, образование – среднее, женат, имеет 2-х детей. Он занимается разведением крупного рогатого скота. Этим видом деятельности он занимается уже в течение 2 лет. Полученный кредит он хочет использовать на приобретение нескольких молодых бычков, которых после откормки он собирается продать. На вырученные деньги он планирует приобретать новых бычков, откармливать и продавать. Данный кредит поможет ему вести этот вид деятельности, так как в этом ему помогает жена. Таким образом они вместе зарабатывают на жизнь, жена ухаживает за бычками, а он продаёт. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase and sale of cattle

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr:
Born in 1950, Mrs. Akouvi Agathe G. is married and has three children. A seamstress by profession, she runs her business out of a straw hut as her means are too limited to have a workroom worthy of this title. She is requesting a loan to rent a workroom, buy some sewing machines and improve her set-up so that she will have a workplace that is more agreeable to her clientele, which keeps growing. Achieving this project will enable her to be financially independent.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1967, Madame G. Akouvi Agathe est mariée et mère de trois (3) enfants. Couturière de profession, elle exerce son activité sous une paillote car ses moyens sont très limités pour avoir un atelier digne de ce nom. Elle sollicite un financement pour louer un atelier, acheter des machines et mieux s’installer afin de rendre plus agréable son lieu de travail à sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter. La réalisation de ce projet lui permettra d’avoir une autonomie financière

loans.use: To rent a workroom and buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Juan Ramon

texts.es:
Juan Ramon V. is a gentleman originally from the Villanueva area, and since he was a young boy he has dedicated himself to the business of raising cattle, having his own farm which he has called “El Coyol” farm. He is the father to 4 school-aged children of whom is he very proud because they are excellent students and have stood out as the best students in their classes.

Today Mr. V. is asking Ceprodel for a loan that will enable him to buy young milking cows to raise, taking advantage of their milk by selling it. It is necessary to note that he has worked with Ceprodel for 5 years and his loan history has enabled him to improve his economic situation and improve his family’s standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Juan Ramon V. es un caballero originario del municipio de Villanueva el cual desde su niñez se ha dedicado al negocio de la ganadería teniendo su propia finca a la que ha nombrado finca “El Coyol”. Es padre de 4 hijos en edad escolar el cual se siente muy orgulloso por ser excelentes alumnos habiéndose destacado como mejores alumnos.

Hoy en día el caballero V. acude a Ceprodel para obtener crédito que le permita la compra de vaquillas para criarlas y aprovecharlas para obtener leche y comercializarla. Es necesario destacar que desde hace 5 años ha venido trabajando con Ceprodel obteniendo créditos que le han permitido mejorar su situación económica y salir adelante junto con su familia.

loans.use: Buy calves and invest in crops

loans.name: Abbass

texts.en:
Abbass is a 37 year old man. He has one child. He lives with his family in southern Lebanon, in Nabatieh.

Abbass is a car blacksmith. This is the sixth time he has asked for a loan from Al Majmoua. With the loan, he is planning to develop his business by starting to sell cars, in addition to doing his work as a blacksmith.

loans.use: To develop his business by starting to sell cars

loans.name: Rydia

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 25-year-old Rydia A.. She is married and has three children aged from 5 to 10 years old. In 1999, Rydia opened a grocery store. Working six days a week, and nine to 12 hours a day, she earns about $60 every month from this business. Her husband helps her run the store. Rydia has applied for a loan to buy additional stocks of fish, oil, and rice in bulk. In the future, Rydia plans to increase the quantity and range of items she has to sell, and she wants to thank you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To buy additional stocks of fish, rice, and oil.

loans.name: Villa Dolores Group

texts.es:
The association Villa Dolores is at the center of Villa Tejada. With the help of their loan assistant they work very responsibly in all their group activities.

Almost all of the women are married, with numerous families and they tell us that their daily household expenses surpass the income they receive from their businesses, especially since their children's needs are growing as they get older.

Most of the group sells various goods, primarily as traveling salespeople. They sell, for example, a variety of cosmetics, condiments and sweets amongst other products. They say that in traveling sales, the products are often damaged and have to be cast away. This means they need a reinforcement of capital to enable them to secure a fixed location in markets or on main streets where they will have guaranteed sales and can maintain their products in good condition.
This will lead to improved revenue and a more stable quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Inês Teles, Kiva volunteer

La asociación Villa Dolores pertenece al centro focal de Villa Tejada, con la ayuda de su asistente de créditos trabajan muy responsables en todas sus actividades de grupo.

Casi todas casadas, con familias numerosas nos cuentan que los gastos diarios que tienen en sus hogares sobrepasan al ingreso que obtienen en sus negocios ya que sus hijos van creciendo y necesitan mayores necesidades.

La mayor parte del grupo se dedica a comercio, de distintos productos, venta que la realizan de forma ambulante, por ejemplo, venden variedad de cosméticos, venta de condimentos, venta de dulces y otros. Afirman que este tipo de venta, por el movimiento, maltratan los productos y en ocasiones deben desecharlos por lo que ellas necesitan un refuerzo en su capital para poder obtener puestos fijos en mercados o en principales calles donde obtengan ventas seguras y mantengan sus productos en optimas condiciones. Luego mejorarían sus ingresos y su estabilidad de vida.

loans.use: Capital in order to obtain fixed locations from which to sell their products

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga is 29 years old and she completed her education up to primary school level. She has two daughters and one son, is married and lives in the El Collao province of the Puno region.

She is an active member of the communal bank “22nd of September” in M.. With the first loans she received, she started a business buying and selling sheep at the street market in Ilave. With later loans, she and her husband decided to also raise livestock. In addition, they began buying and selling regional products such as potatoes, potato flour, geese, and tunta (derived from potatoes) at the weekly markets in the cities of Camiachi and Punto.

They would use half of this loan of 2,000.00 soles, to be repaid in 4 installments, to buy a young bull. The other half would be used to buy regional products such as potatoes, chuño and tunta (potato derivatives) to sell at the Puno market on Saturdays. They hope to increase their sales and, therefore, generate greater income to help them financially. The loan would be repaid over a period of four months.

Her dream is to augment her income enough to buy a house in the city of Ilave and start up a workshop making skirts/petticoats and to continue raising livestock. Her goal is for her children to continue their studies and become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Olga tiene 29 años de edad, su nivel educativo es primaria completa, es madre de dos hijas y un varón, es casada y domiciliada en la parcialidad de Alpacuyo del Centro Poblado de Camicachi, del distrito de Ilave, provincia El Collao y Región de Puno. Ella es socia activa del Banco Comunal de 22 de Setiembre de la parcialidad de M., con los primeros créditos que recibió emprendió el negocio de compra y venta de ovinos en la feria dominical del distrito de Ilave, después con los posteriores préstamos decidieron junto con su esposo realizar el engorde de ganado y además realizar la compra y venta de productos de la zona como: papa, chuño, oca y tunta en las ferias semanales del Centro Poblado de Camicachi y Puno. Con este crédito de S/. 2,000.00 nuevos soles, el cual serà pagado en 4 cuotas, la mitad serà utilizada para comprar 01 torete y con la otra parte adquirirá productos de la zona como: papa, chuño, tunta y oca para vender en feria del día sábado en la ciudad de Puno, ya que de esa manera garantiza mayores ingresos económicos para incrementar su capital. El préstamo estará pagando durante cuatro meses. Su sueño mayor es incrementar más su capital, para comprar una casa en la ciudad de Ilave para poner el taller de confección de enaguas, continuar con el engorde de ganado vacuno y que estudien sus hijos y sean profesionales.

loans.use: Purchase of a bull as well as other regional products.

loans.name: Thi Hoa's Group

texts.vi:
chị Nguyễn thị Hoa MS 11020014, năm nay 27 tuổi chị là người rất nhanh nhẹn tháo vát. Trước đây chị đã đi chợ sắt vụn, làm ruộng, cùng đi làm thuê cùng chồng để nuôi 2 con nhỏ. Nay chị mới đi học được nghề làm bún, nên chị đã đầu tư mua sắm máy móc để sản xuất mỳ. vì vậy chị đã tham gia vay vốn của chương trình ở mức 2.006.000 VND để bổ sung thêm vào mua gạo làm bún bán. Hiện tại mức thu nhập bình quân của gia đình từ 150.000 VND đến 200.000 VND / ngày. Trong nhóm của chị có các thành viên sau :

  • chị Nguyễn thị Mai MS 11020015 vay mức 3.186.000 VND mua máy đầu tư làm mộc
  • chị N. thị Chín MS 11020016 vay mức 3.186.000 VND mua gỗ để làm mộc
  • chị Ngô thị Hằng MS 11020017 vay mức 3.186.000 VND để đi buôn trứng
  • chị Nguyễn thị Ước MS 11020018 vay mức 3.186.000 VND để mua cám vịt
texts.en:
Mrs. N. Thi Hoa (ID Number 11020014), 27 years old, is very hardworking. Before this, she used to buy and sell scraps, perform agricultural tasks and work as hired worker with her husband to raise her two children. However, she learned to make rice noodles, so she has purchased machinery to produce noodles. Therefore, she would like to borrow 2,006,000VND to invest in buying rice to make noodles. Currently, her family's average daily income is from 150,000VND to 200,000VND (about 9.40USD to 12.50USD). Her group also consists of:
  • Mrs. N. Thị Mai (ID Number 11020015), borrows 3,186,000VND to purchase machinery for her carpenter shop.
  • Mrs. Nghiem Thị Chin (ID Number 11020016) borrows 3,186,000VND to purchase wood for her carpenter shop.
  • Mrs. Ngo Thi Hang (ID Number 11020017) borrows 3,186,000VND to buy and sell eggs.
  • Mrs. N. Thị Uoc (ID Number 11020018) borrows 3,186,000VND to purchase duck feeds.

    • Translated from Vietnamese by Yen Thanh Pham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing rice to make noodles

loans.name: Saroeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Saroeun N., 46, is a primary school teacher who also raises pigs. Her husband, Mr. Savy Et, 48, a farmer, earns about US$2.00 per day. Saroeun has seven children, one of whom is married. Her other children live at home and go to school. She also has a nephew who lives with the family and help with their businesses. The family lives in Ptasrong Commune, Pursat Province, Cambodia.

Rice crops and raising pigs are the main source income for Saroeun's family. Because her farmland is infertile, she would like to request a loan of $500 USD. She willl buy pig food to fatten her pigs so that she can sell them on time at a high price. With the rest of the loan, she will buy fertilizer to use on her rice crop.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her rice crop and pig food to fatten her pigs

loans.name: Soeng

texts.en:
Mrs. Soeng N. was born in 1967 and she now lives in Ta Saom Village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer and her husband, Mr. Yuos Koy, is a construction worker. In his business, he now faces a problem because his workplace is too far from their house and he spends a lot of money on transportation. Thus, Mrs. Soeng N. has decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to buy a motorbike for her husband to use to go to work.

Mrs. Soeng N. has five children, one of whom is a monk while three others are attending the local school. The youngest one is too young to work or study because that child is five years old. Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: to add to her savings to buy a motorbike for her husband

loans.name: Sum

texts.en: Sum N., 36, is married and lives with four children and her husband in the Kampong Cham, Cambodia. She and her husband together are cow dealers and make approximately US$5 each day. Her husband, Som Sokreun, also runs a motor-taxi around the market for extra profits to help support his family. Sum N. would like to take out a loan of US$500 to include with her savings to purchase more cows for sale.

loans.use: To purchase more cows

loans.name: Vanna

texts.en:
Mrs. Vanna H., 43, and her husband, Mr. Sokha Kong, 45, live on an island of the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1983 and have six sons. One of their sons is married and lives outside the family home; three sons attend school.
 
Vanna has been has been raising pigs since 1984. Her husband is a taxi driver (Tuk Tuk) in Phnom Penh and assists his wife in her pig-farming business. Now, Vanna would like a loan of $ 1000 to purchase a motorcycle for her son to drive as a taxi and to carry pig feed.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her son to drive as a taxi and to transport pig feed.

loans.name: Akou

texts.fr: Agée de 49 ans, Mme K. Akou est née à Atakpamé et a neuf (09) personnes à charge. Elle est seule à subvenir aux besoins de la famille par son commerce de produits alimentaires et articles de ménage. Souvent confrontée aux manques de moyens, elle n’arrive pas à combler l’attente de ses clients. Pour s’approvisionner en marchandises et mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, elles sollicite un financement. Les bénéfices tirés de son activité lui permettront de bien prendre soin de sa famille et surtout veiller à la réussite de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs. Akou K., 49, was born in Atakpamé and is responsible for 9 persons. She is the sole breadwinner for her family, drawing her income from her little general store, selling groceries and household goods. Often confronted by a lack of capital, she is not able to satisfy the demand of her customers. In order to stock up on merchandise and better satisfy her clientele, she is requesting a loan. The profit from her business will allow her to take good care of her family and especially, to make sure her children succeed.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: stocking up on merchandise

loans.name: Lidez

texts.es:
Lidez es socia del Banco Comunal Kantuta.
Lidez  es casada, tiene 39 años y 3 hijos, Lidez tiene un puesto en el mercado Playa Grau en donde vende comida, prepara desayuno y almuerzo que vende a los comerciantes del mercado, actividad que realiza todos los días. Además junto a su esposo se dedican a la compra y venta de ganado vacuno.
Lidez necesita un préstamo de 2100 soles dinero que será invertido en el negocio de su esposo para la compra de ganado.
Los sueños de Lidez son comprar un terreno para construir su casa.
texts.en:
Lidez is a member of the communal bank Kantuta. Lidez is married, 39 years old and has 3 children. She has a market stall in Playa Grau where she sells food, prepares breakfast and lunch that she sells to the traders in the market, an activity that she does every day. In addition, together with her husband she is dedicated to buying and selling cattle. Lidez needs a loan of 2100 soles that will be invested in her husband's business to purchase cattle. Lidez dreams of purchasing land to build a house.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Girah

texts.id:
Pada periode ke dua Pinjaman dipergunakan untuk melanjutkan usaha warungnya yang terletal diaeral Dermaga ikan pengambengan.Usaha warung sudah diekuni sejak lama dan pelangganpun sudah ada.Girah menfaatkan keramain dermaga dengan membuka warung makanan. Pelanggannnya adalah para awak kapal yang baru pulang dari berlabuh setelah semalaman mencari ikan dilaut.

Untuk menjalan usaha ini girah harus berjualan selama 24 jam nonstop,sebab warung terletak di daerah dermaga. Asbullah suaminya tetap menemani Girah di warungnya siang dan malam sekaliyan berjualan bensin didepan warungnya.Semua kegiatan untuk menjalan usaha baik memasak dan istirahat dapat dilakukan diwarungnya.Keuntunagn bersih dalam setiap harinya mencapai Rp.50.00 s/d Rp.100.000,-. Hasil dari keuletan inilah Girah dapat memperbaiki warung sehingga layak untuk ditempati.
texts.en:
Girah plans to use this second loan to continue her food kiosk business. The kiosk lies in Pengambengan fishing pier. She has been running this business for years with steady client base who are mostly sailors and fishermen coming back from night at sea to fish. Girah needs to run the business 24 hours non stop to keep up with her sailor clients hour. Asbullah, her husband accompanies her in her kiosk night and day. He also sells diesel fuel in front of Girah's kiosk. They also live in the kiosk. The kiosk earns about $5-10 profit per day. She plans to repair the kiosk to improve her living condition.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair kiosk

loans.name: Khujakul

texts.en: K. Khujakul lives in the B.Gafurov region of Tajikistan. He is married and has four children. Khujakul works in the school but the general family income depends on the livestock business that Khujakul has worked in for 40 years. He applied to KIVA for a business support loan of 3800 TJS for 9 months for the summer cow barn building. He thanks KIVA for its support.

loans.use: summer cow barn building

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: Nelly tiene 29 años, vive en casa de un familiar, con su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Hace 4 años vende artículos para el hogar de manera ambulante, ayudada por su esposo, llevando a ofrecer su mercadería a lugares lejanos de la zona rural de su localidad. La facilidad que otorga Nelly es que da al crédito y 15 días después regresa para cobrar y volver a vender. Lo que ofrece es de acuerdo a la ocasión, en esta época de frío le solicitaron frazadas, en época escolar le solicitan uniformes escolares, y otros diversos artículos. Para Nelly este trabajo es rentable, porque de cada producto que vende obtiene una ganancia razonable que justifica el esfuerzo que hacen ella y su esposo. Para le futuro Nelly desea ampliar su mercado, viajando a otros lugares a ofrecer su mercadería. Es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella está muy contenta de continuar un trabajo unido con su banco comunal, su deseo es que se siga con este trabajo solidario a pesar de las circunstancias difíciles que se puedan presentar. El dinero que viene solicitando es para abastecerse de más artículos para el hogar, que son su capital de trabajo; en esta ocasión le solicitan útiles escolares, uniformes y ollas para la cocina.
texts.en:
Nelly is 29 years old and lives in a relative's home with her husband and three children. For four years she has been selling household products on foot, assisted by her husband, offering her merchandise in far off places in her rural area. The benefit that Nelly grants is that she gives credit and, 15 days later, she returns to collect and sell again. What she offers to her customers depends on the occasion: in this cold season, her customers request blankets. In school season, they request school uniforms and other various articles. For Nelly, this work is profitable because she earns a reasonable profit with each product that she sells so it justifies the effort she and her husband put forth. For the future, Nelly wishes to grow her market, traveling to other places to offer her merchandise. This is the second time that she has taken a loan with MFP. She is very happy to continue a joint effort with her community bank. Her wish is that she continues this work despite difficult circumstances that might crop up. The money that she is requesting is to stock up on more household products which are her working capital. At this time, she is being asked for school supplies, uniforms and pots for the kitchen.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise.

loans.name: Vida

texts.en:
Vida D. is forty years old. She is the mother of two children and is still married. Her kids attend school in the primary and junior high schools. Vida lives with her family in a family apartment at a community called Oda. Oda is in the Eastern Region of Ghana. A sizeable number of the inhabitants are engaged in the farming activities. However, many are also involved in trading and other business activities. 

Vida is a hair dresser by profession. She does both plaiting and perming. She says she started her solon five years ago and has since trained five young ladies in hair dressing who have started their own businesses in other communities. Apart from hairdressing, she also trades in groceries. She has her grocery kiosk attached to her beauty saloon. 

This loan would enable her to buy hairdressing equipment, fashion accessories, artificial human hair, pomades and other material that she will need to serve her clients satisfactorily. She hopes to increase her income to allow her to save more to support her childrens education. Vida is a member of the Charity Trust Bank group. Members in this group guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loans and provide support in repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To buy hairdressing materials and fashion accessories.

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.en:
Y. Pham Thi (719020621) is a 35-year-old female living in the town of Vinh Phuc. She is married and has two infant-aged children. Y. raises cattle for sale and has been engaged in this business for over four years, earning approximately 6,000,000 VND a month.

In 2002, Y. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell.

Y. is now requesting a new loan of 20,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. The loan will be her 6th loan from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Ida

texts.es: Ida es madre soltera, tiene 52 años, es técnica laboratorista y trabaja en un hospital desde hace 23 años, vive junto a sus dos hijos, quienes cursan estudios universitarios y su casa es propia. Como especialista en el arte de las manualidades elabora muñecos de peluche, bordados en tela, adornos en diversos materiales, entre otros. Actividad que viene realizando desde hace 9 años y cuenta con un pequeño taller dentro de su casa donde también capacita a un grupo de madres solteras en diferentes estilos de manualidades para que puedan solventarse económicamente. A Ida le gusta mucho su trabajo porque se relaciona con todo tipo de personas, además le es lo suficientemente rentable para solventar los gastos de su hogar. Para más adelante, Ida quiere tener una empresa de elaboración de insumos de limpieza, adicional a su negocio de manualidades. Este es su 5to préstamo con MFP, y le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal porque son todas mujeres trabajadoras y con ganas de superación. Con el dinero que solicita comprará materiales (telas, pedrerías, hilos, etc) e insumos para empezar  a preparar lo que aprendió, como líquidos desinfectantes, ambientadores y limpiadores.
texts.en:
Ida, a single mother, is 52, is a laboratory technician, and has worked in a hospital for 23 years. She lives with her 2 children, who study courses at university, and her house is her own. As a specialist in the art of handicrafts, she makes plush dolls, bordered in material, adorned with diverse material, among others. She has done this activity for 9 years and has a small workshop in her house, where she also trains a group of single mothers in different styles of handicrafts, so that they can be covered economically. Ida really likes her job because she meets every type of person, and it is also profitable enough to cover the expenses of her home. For the future, Ida wants to have a cleaning product business, additional to her handicraft business. This is her fifth loan with MFP, and she likes to work with her communal bank because they are all working women with the desire to overcome their problems. With the money she is seeking she will buy materials (fabric, precious stones, threads etc) and consumables to begin to prepare what she has learned to start her cleaning business, such as disinfectant liquids, air fresheners, and cleaning products.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials and consumables for business

loans.name: Zayat

texts.en:
Zayat B. is 52, married and the father of one son and two daughters. He lives with his daughters and wife on a plot of land he owns in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. Zayat's spouse, Munhtsetseg, has worked as an assistant teacher at a kindergarten for her entire life. His eldest son, Tumenjargal, is 25 years old and has his own family, which lives on a nearby plot of land. 

Zayat worked as a driver for his entire life. After retiring, he started a retail business selling small electronic items. Besides this business, Zayat repairs TVs in a small room at the local market. Zayat is a hard-working person, and is applying for this loan to buy TV accessories and small electronic items in Ereen, a city near the Chinese border.

loans.use: To buy TV accessories and small electronic items

loans.name: Elena Rutilia

texts.es: Elena Rutilia E. D. C. D. 34 años D. edad resiD. en el departamento D. La Libertad junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos Alexander D. 15 años D. edad y Wilfredo 10 años D. edad ambos niños estudian. Elena posee un chalet ubicado en una escuela D. Sonsonate donD. venD. variedad D. productos para el consumo D. los estudiantes y docentes, el destino del crédito que solicita Elena es para surtir el chalet, D. esta manera ella aprovecharía las ventas con más variedad D. productos dentro D. su negocio.
texts.en:
Elena Rutilia E. D. C. is 34 years old. She lives in the department of La Libertad, along with her husband and two children, Alexander, who is 15 years old, and Wilfredo, who is 10. Both boys are students. Elena has a kiosk located in the Sonsonate school, where she sells a variety of products to the students and teachers. The purpose of the requested loan is to stock the kiosk so that she can have better sales by having a greater variety of products available at her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock her business

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en: Roseline owns a bakery where she bakes and sells bread. She is 35, married, and has 5 children. Roseline is requesting a loan of N80, 000 to purchase more flour, sugar, and yeast. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more flour, sugar, and yeast

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Bancomunal  Mi Buen Pastor.  
Maria es casada tiene 55 años, cinco hijos que son mayores y trabajan.
Maria empezó en los negocios vendiendo pollos hace veinte años, un vecino la animo el tenia un puesto cerrado  en el mercado y  se lo dio en alquiler, le gusto el negocio y  continuo hasta  el día de hoy, por otro lado su cuñado la animo a que entre en la venta al por mayor de agua mineral, su cuñado le consiguió todos los contactos, ella vende en su casa, y también ella se dedica a la venta de productos por catalogo, es directora de un grupo de vendedoras.  
Desde que Maria esta en Finca, ella ha encontrado un gran apoyo, por la facilidades con los créditos  
Maria necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles, los invierte en productos de belleza
El sueño de Maria es  tener una avícola grande y tener un local de eventos
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Communal Bank Mi Buen Pastor (My Good Shepherd). She is 55 years and has 5 adult children who are working.

Maria began selling chickens twenty years ago when a neighbor had a vending post available for rent in the market. She enjoys working every day to keep her business going. Her brother-in-law urged her to start selling mineral water wholesale since he has several contacts. Maria sold her house and is also selling beauty products by catalog. She is a director who supervises a group of saleswomen.

Since joining FINCA, Maria has found a great deal of support by taking advantage of its credit services. She needs a loan of 3000 soles to purchase beauty products. Maria dreams of having a large poultry farm and starting an events business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beauty products

loans.name: Rosa Matilde

texts.es: Rosa Matilde Hernández M. tiene 61 años. Ella es cliente de Fundación León 2000, por lo que es una mujer que siempre se ha preocupado por sus pagos y es muy responsable.  Su actividad económica es un bazar. Es una mujer que le gusta trabajar y mantener a su familia. Inicio este negocio por su hijo que le ayudo a establecer la venta en donde ofreciera botones, hilos, tijera entre otras cosas. Su mayor desafío fue mantener a sus clientes ya que como ella no tenía el suficiente capital para compra de todo un poco perdió clientes. Pero con el paso del tiempo fue recuperándolos. Rosa necesita este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima botones, hilo, encajes, cintas, papel entre otras cosas. Su sueño es de proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Rosa Matilde Hernández M., 61, is a client of Fundación Leon 2000. She is a woman who has always been conscientious about her payments, and she is very responsible. She has a bazaar. She is a woman who likes to work and support her family. She started this business with her son, who helped to set up selling buttons, threads, scissors, and other things. Her biggest difficulty was keeping her customers. She did not have enough money to buy a little bit of everything, so she lost customers. But, with the passage of time she has been getting them back again. Rosa needs a loan to buy materials like buttons, thread, lace, ribbons, paper, and other items. Her dream is to make improvements on her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: María Julia

texts.es: María Julia H. D. L. resiD. en la capital del país, junto a su esposo y sus dos. María se dedica a la elaboración  D. comida y platillos típicos, los cuales cocina y prepara desD. su casa. Al iniciar el negocio, María Julia ni siquiera podía cocinar, pero la necesidad y el esfuerzo, la han convertido en una exitosa cocinera y administradora. María Julia solicita un préstamo para comprar materia prima y así reinvertir en su negocio que tanta alegría le ha brindado  a ella y a su familia.

loans.use: Compra de materia prima

loans.name: Goreth Nalule ‘S Group

texts.en: Goreth is 40 year married with four children aged between 13and 20 years.All her children go to school Goreth also takes care of additional family members .She resides and rents a one roomed house where she is staying with two people The family has access to electricity.Goreth works seven days week and sells to all categories of people.. Goreth has been in this business for five years while with MCDT for six months servicing her second loan She uses public transport to and from shopping in Nakulabye. She wants to use this loan to buy more beer soda and local Gin

loans.use: To buy more crates of soda and beer

loans.name: Las Palmeras Group

texts.es: El grupo “Las Palmeras” esta  representado por la señora Viviana Rocío es un grupo que aperas de ser su primer ciclo ha demostrado responsabilidad en cada una de sus reuniones previas. Todas las socias son muy dinámicas y siempre buscan nuevos negocios para poder llevar el pan de cada día a sus hogares; un gran mayoría se dedica a la venta de diferentes productos como la venta de cosméticos, comida, refrescos, empanadas, celulares y ropa interior de forma ambulante. La competencia es amplia en el mercado por lo que las socias requieren de un mayor capital para la adquisición de mercadería para poder vender a más bajos precios y poder así mejorar sus ingresos y la calidad de vida de sus familias. A pesar de ser su primer ciclo las socias ya cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios gracias a financiamientos con otras instituciones; por lo que conocen la modalidad de trabajo y saben como cumplir con sus obligaciones de forma puntual.
texts.en:
The Las Palmeras group is represented by Viviana Rocío. This group has just started its first cycle, and it has demonstrated responsibility in each of its previous meetings. All of the members are very dynamic. They are always looking for new businesses to be able to bring home their daily bread. The majority of them are street vendors who sell different products like cosmetics, food, soft drinks, empanadas, cell phones, and underwear. There is a lot of competition in the market. The members need more capital to get merchandise to be able to sell at lower prices and improve their income and the quality of life of their families. Even though this is their first cycle, the members have experience with supportive groups thank to financing with other institutions. Therefore, they know the way it works and how to meet their obligations in a punctual manner.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Djibiline

texts.fr: D. Djibiline est née en 1970 à Bassila dans le Département de la Donga. Djibiline est mariée à ADAM Abasse, un chauffeur. Le couple a cinq enfants tous scolarisés. La famille vit depuis douze ans à Sègbèya à Cotonou. C'est le mari de Djibiline qui assure les dépenses de la famille. Djibiline utilise les revenus de son activité pour mieux développer celle-ci. En effet, Djibiline vend de façon ambulante des savons de toilette fabriqués au Ghana, pays voisin du Bénin. C'est au Ghana que Djibiline achète ses produits. Djibiline est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. Djibiline sollicite ce crédit-ci pour augmenter la quantité de son stock de savons.
texts.en:
D. Djibiline was born in 1970 in Bassila in Donga County. She is married to ADAM Abasse, a chauffeur. The couple has five children who are all in school. The family has been living for a dozen years in Sègbèya in Cotonou. Djibiline’s husband is the one ensuring that family expenses are covered. Djibiline uses her revenues to develop her business further. Essentially, she goes door-to-door selling bath soaps made in Ghana, a country near Benin. Ghana is where she purchases her goods. Djibiline is a former ALIDé client who repays her loans. She’s requesting this loan to increase the quantity of soaps in her inventory.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soaps

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
La señora Ana María R. y su esposa el señor Manuel Paz, están muy agradecidos por su cooperación en el crédito anterior el cual les ayudo mucho a su negocio y obtener un ingreso más a su familia.
Nuevamente está solicitando un préstamo para poder invertir en mercancía de temporada de invierno ya que sus clientes se los están pidiendo. 
Planean pagar el crédito con los ingresos que obtiene de uno de los locales y el otro ingreso será para los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Sra. Ana María R. and her husband, Sr. Manuel Paz, are extremely grateful for the assistance they received through their previous loan. This helped them tremendously with their business and in obtaining more income for their family.

Sra. Ana María is requesting another loan to invest in winter merchandise because her customers are requesting these products. She plans to repay the loan using the revenue she generates from one her vending locations. The rest of the money she earns is dedicated to family expenses. (Click HERE to view the previous loan.)

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase winter merchandise

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
Javier E. V., tiene la edad de 23 años, vive en union libre, y tiene un hijo que es su mayor prioridad. El hijo tiene 3 años. El quiere comprar fertilizantes y otros qumicos para los cultivos.  Este credito va a aumentar la calidad de los productos y así tener mas ingresos.  Además, su finca es de 2hectáreas, y tiene maiz y frijoles. Tiene varios años que se dedica a su finca y quiere crecer. El no tenía problemas en su propiedad, pero si tiene el deseo de sea una finca productiva. Es el primer préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. No ha tenido creditos en otras entidades financieras ya que no cumple con los requisitos. FUDECOSUR le brindó el préstamo con mayores facilidades. Finalmente, él tiene el deseo de tener mayores cosechas para tener mas ingresos y así poder mandar a estudiar a los hijos y poder tener una vivienda mejor. 

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Javier E. V., 23, lives with his common-law wife and his 3-year-old son, who is his highest priority in life. He wants to buy fertilizers and other chemicals for his crops. This financing will increase the quality of his products thereby producing higher earnings. He grows corn and beans on his 2-hectare farm. He has farmed for several years and wants to expand. He had no problems with his property but does want to see his farm be productive. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR. He hasn't had any loans with other financial entities because he didn't meet requirement to qualify. FUDECOSUR granted the loan with better terms. Finally, he wishes to have larger crop yields so that his earnings will increase in order to be able to send his children to school and have a better dwelling. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is a 52 year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon with his wife and their child. Since 1991, Khaled has been selling old and used metal and aluminum. When he first started his business, he didn’t have enough products to sell. Khaled is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to purchase aluminum for his work. This is his second cycle and he has always paid on time.
In the picture, we see Khaled and his pick up which allows how to carry his products from one place to another.

Khaled is special in his work because of his experience in sales. His clients are traders. Khaled decided to begin his business because he wanted to have independent work and because he likes his work. In the future, he plans to improve his business.

loans.use: To purchase aluminum.

loans.name: Fátima Del Rosario

texts.es:
En el municipio de Somotillo en el departamento de Chinandega, la señora Fatima R. ha iniciado a mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda que por muchos años había estado en malas condiciones a raíz de los fenómenos naturales. Es por este motivo que ella ha decidido muy firmemente reconstruir su vivienda porque así le será de mucho provecho a ella y a sus dos hijos que aún dependen de ella y están estudiando.
Ella se siente muy satisfecha porque logrará su meta de tener una casa que preste las condiciones para vivir y por esta razón se apoya en Ceprodel solicitando un crédito para la compra de los materiales de construcción para así continuar mejorando su vivienda.
texts.en:
At the town of Somotillo in Chinandega, Nicaragua, Mrs. Fatima R. is working to improve the conditions of her house, which has been in deterioration for many years due to natural phenomena. For this reason she has decided to rebuild her house, so she and her children (who are her dependents and go to school) can live with more comfort. She feels very glad for having the chance to have a better house and is asking for a $300 loan in order to buy construction supplies and rebuild it.

Translated from Spanish by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Construction Supplies

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Luisa tiene 49 años, vive con su esposo y sus hijos en su casa propia.
Desde hace más de 10 años se dedica a la venta de carne. Para ello, trabaja junto a su esposo en un camal cercano a su casa, donde matan los animales y cortan las partes para su venta, la cual realizan (al por mayor) en el mercado mayorista de su localidad.
Todos estos años de experiencia le han servido para brindar una mejor calidad de su producto y expandirse a nuevos lugares de venta. 
Luisa y su esposo seguirán trabajando arduamente en esta tarea, porque es rentable y porque les proporciona el sustento económico familiar.

Este es su crédito número 13 con MFP y se siente muy contenta de ser parte de un banco comunal, donde persevera por un trabajo solidario. El dinero que ahora solicita lo utilizará para la compra de más animales como toretes y ovejas para la venta de su carne.
texts.en:
Luisa is 49 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and their children. For more than 10 years she has been selling meat. To do this, she works with her husband in a slaughterhouse close to their house, where they kill the animals and cut the parts for sale. The meat is then sold (wholesale) in the wholesale market in their area. With all of these years of experience they can provide a better quality product and expand to sell in new places. Luisa and her husband will continue to work hard at this trade, because it is profitable and because it provides the family's economic livelihood. This is her 13th loan with MFP and she feels very content to be a part of a communal bank where the members persevere and work in solidarity. The money that she requests now will be used to buy more animals such as bulls and sheep in order to sell their meat.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy animals

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Mrs. Marilou R. is from Culo, Molave, Zamboanga del sur. She is 35 years old and married with three children. She manages a food-vending business at Molave public market. Her husband is a farmer. Each of them earns an income every month. Marilou has managed her business for more than three years and earns about $135 a month. 

She successfully repaid her previous loan of 8,000 PHP. Now, she is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP. This will be her 3rd loan from PMPC.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.
 
*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: additional capital for her food vending business

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
La Sra. Blanca está casada  con el Sr. Roberto hace varios años tienen 4 hijos menores que aún están en la escuela primaria.
Juntos montaron una despensa en su casa que esta ubicado  en un barrio muy poblado de la zona, se iniciaron con un pequeño capital que consiguieron con otros trabajos que han realizaron anteriormente como asalariados.
Gracias al trabajo que están realizando están educando a sus hijos y comprando todas las necesidades de su hogar.
El Sr. Roberto además se la despensa trabaja como Moto taxista en su propio vehículo para ayudar a la Sra. Con los gastos de la casa.
Ella a demostrado ser una persona muy responsable y honesta en sus compromisos
texts.en:
Blanca has been married to Roberto for several years; they have 4 minor children that are still in elementary school. Together, they set up a grocery store in their home, which is located in a densely populated neighborhood of the area. They started out with a small capital investment that came from savings from prior salaried jobs. Thanks to their work, they are educating their children and buying what their household needs. Roberto, in addition, provides public transportation services with his own mototaxi in order to further help his wife with household expenses. She has shown herself to be a responsible and honest person with respect to the commitments she takes on.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy assorted merchandise:  sugar, rice, pasta, baked good, dairy goods.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en: In her years of experience in farming, Nenita learned that extra care is essential. She said that to be able to achieve quality produce, enough time and attention should be spent at the farm. “Enough financing is also a must in having abundant harvest”, she added.
