With her husband’s approval, she applied to CEVI to avail of its financial program. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000, which she will use to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs she needs.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Yin

texts.en:
Mrs. Yin R., is 29 years old. She sells brooms that she buys in bulk from a broom-maker who lives near her house. She sells her products at retail in the local market and earns around $3 per day.

Her husband, Horm Vet, 34, is a motorbike taxi driver as well as a wooden house builder. Yin R. has two teenage children who are school age and depend on her income.

Yin R. planned to build a new house and has been saving up some housing tools for construction. But this process has still not started due to the need for more essential accessories. In order to start building, Yin R. is applying for a loan to buy the required articles.

loans.use: To buy the required articles to build their home.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith is a single mother of five children.  All her children go to school. She owns a two-room house where she stays with eight people. The family has access to electricity and piped water. Edith takes care of additional family members. Monthly expenses for Edith include medication, school fees and feeding the family. 

Edith owns a wooden store near her home where she sells charcoal. She sells to all categories of people both using retail and wholesale selling methods. She works seven days a week. During this time, she usually receives at least 20 customers a day. She has been in this business for 10 years and her business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. 

Edith has been with MCDT for many years servicing her 24th loan.  She wants to use this loan to buy more bags of charcoal. She hopes to see her business grow bigger and go directly to producers. She also wants to educate her children up to the university level.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy weed-killers and peanut seeds

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en: Blessing is 40 years old, married with 4 children. Her husband is a commercial driver and he also supports their home. She sells steamed beans cake popularly called moi-moi in Nigeria. She loves this business because of the opportunity to interact with her customers. She has been in this business since 5years. She hopes to expand her business in order to make more profits. She hopes for a loan amount of NGN 80,000 to purchase more beans to cook more steamed beans cakes to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more beans

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es:
Emilia sueña con tener casa propia y una tienda surtida, Emilia es casada, tiene 49 años y 1 hijo D. 28 años, se dedica a L. venta D. queso, carne que venD. a sus clientes, productos que adquiere en las feria D. Sachabamba que esta a dos horas D. L. ciudad D. Ayacucho a donD. viaja semanalmente, además venD. ropa que le hacen pedido sus clientes. Emilia inicio ente año con L. venta D. golosinas en L. puerta D. un colegio, actividad que realiza D. manera ambulatoria.
Emilia necesita un préstamo D. 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. queso y carnero.
texts.en:
Emilia dreams of having her own home and a well stocked store. She is 49 years old, married, and has one 28 year old son. Emilia sells cheeses and meat. She travels weekly to the Sachabamba fair, two hours from the city of Ayacucho, to buy her products. She also takes orders for clothing. This year Emilia also started selling soft drinks on foot at the entrance to a school. Emilia needs a loan of 1,200 PEN ($425), which she will use to buy meat and cheese.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Meat and cheese for resale

loans.name: Anita

texts.es: Anita tiene 38 años, vive cerca de una de sus dos hijas, pues la otra tiene su propia casa a unas cuadras más, es independiente y tiene su propia familia. Desde muy joven ha trabajado arduamente para sacar adelante a sus hijas, es así que vio en un trabajo rentable,  la confección de prendas. Hoy continúa con esta labor, pero sin preocupación ya que ambas hijas son independientes, el verlas con sus propias familias le reconforta, ya que ella les enseñara como salir adelante por sus propios medios. Ahora trabaja para solventar sus propios gastos, pues un trabajo que la dignifica y la mantiene ocupada e independiente.Este es su primer crédito con MFP y se compromete a ser muy puntual con los pagos como lo viene siendo su hija, quien es un cliente muy puntual. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará mayor cantidad de materiales para la elaboración de sus prendas y así cumplir con sus pedidos.
texts.en:
Anita is 38 years old and lives near one of her two daughters. The other daughter has her own home located a few blocks away, lives independently, and has her own family. As a young woman, Anita worked extremely hard so that her daughters could get ahead. She discovered making clothes was a profitable way to earn a living. Today she continues in this same line of work, but she no longer worries about her daughters since both of them are independent. Seeing them with their own families provides her comfort since she taught them how to succeed by themselves. Anita now works to pay for her own expenses. In addition, working is a dignified way for her to stay busy and remain independent.

This is her first loan with MFP. Anita promises to be prompt with her payments just like her daughter, who is also a punctual client. The loan she requested will be used to buy a large quantity of materials for making clothing so that she can fulfill her orders.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for making clothing

loans.name: Saijmaa

texts.en: Saijmaa T. is 50 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Uvs province in western Mongolia. Her youngest son attends a local middle school, while the elder two children are also students. Saijmaa and her husband make wooden furniture in their town; Saijmaa decorates the items that her husband makes. Saijmaa wants to one day own a small cattle farm where she can expand her business's operations and further improve her family’s finances. She is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to buy a plot of land where the family can build a small cow pen and purchase some milking cows.

loans.use: To purchase a plot of land for cattle.

loans.name: Prum

texts.en: Shown in the photo are S. and her husband who have spent their life cultivating crops. This is a skill they learned from their grandparents. This couple was married years ago and they have three school-aged kids. Growing crops is an annual action with which they have had great success for several years. The family is able to plant the crops at least twice a year by following both rainy and dry seasons. The coming rainfall is good for growing; however, the family doesn’t have capital to use on their farm. So S. discussed this with her husband and decided to seek a loan to use towards purchasing fertilizers, insecticides, a pump machine, and seeds for planting.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, insecticides, a pump machine, and seeds

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida P. is from the village of Tuburan Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years old. Aida is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Aida owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Aida has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Aida joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Aida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Aida is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This will be the third loan taken out by Aida from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Simon

texts.es: Simón tiene 52 años, vive con su esposa en su casa propia. Casi toda su vida se ha dedicado a la agricultura sembrando papa, con la ayuda de sus hijos mayores  y su  esposa que cada día esta  al pendiente de que sus cultivos  estén libres de plagas y enfermedades que puede afectar seriamente su cosecha. Afirma  que le  gusta  mucho esta labor porque puede desarrollarla  con mucha tranquilidad aunque es algo sacrificada, sin embargo su recompensa llega en cada cosecha cuando logra vender su producción de manera directa. En adelante desea sembrar otros productos como la oca para aumentar sus rentas. Es su primer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono para su próxima campaña de siembra.
texts.en:
Simón is 52 years old and lives with his wife in his own home. For nearly all of his life he has worked in agriculture sowing potatoes with the help of his older children and his wife. Each day he is responsible for the crops, making sure they are free of plagues and diseases which can seriously affect the harvest. Simón really likes his work because he can do it in peace, and although it is self-sacrificing without a doubt his reward arrives in each harvest when he sells his product. In the future Simón wants to sow other products such as ocra to increase his earnings. This is his first loan with MFP and he is very happy to know that he has financial support, and also is thankful to be part of a communal bank as all the members are responsible people and very supportive. He is thankful that these people will support the loan that he is seeking as it will be very useful in the progress of his business. With the loan he is seeking Simón will invest in the purchase of sacks of fertiliser for the next sowing season.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sacks of fertiliser

loans.name: Juan David

texts.es:
Juan David C. es  de la ciudad de Luque, tiene 26 años y  está cursando el 2° año de la carrera de Técnico en electrónica I.P.T. (Instituto Panamericano de Telecomunicación)
El es el tercero de cuatro hemanos.
Su madre es comerciante junto con su padre.
Juan actualmente trabaja en una casa de ventas y reparación de celulares desde hace ya cinco años, donde se encuentra adquiriendo experiencia y al mismo tiempo obtiene un ingreso para sus estudios.
Su deseo es terminar esta carrera para trabajar y comenzar con la carrera de INGENIERIA EN ELECTRONICA ya que su deseo es ser un ingeniero en esa área. 
En la actualidad es solicita el préstamo para el pago de la mensualidad de su facultad y también para la compra de libros que está necesitando para estudiar.
texts.en:
Juan David C., 26, is from the city of Luque. He is enrolled in the second year of I.P.T’s (Panamerican Telecommunications Institute) Electronics Technician career. He is the third of four brothers. His mother and father are both merchants. Juan currently is employed by a cell phone sales and repair store; he’s been there for 5 years already. He is acquiring experience and at the same time earns income for his schooling. His wish is to finish his career and start work as an Electronics Engineer because he wants to be this kind of an engineer. He is asking for the loan in order to pay the monthly tuition fee to his college and also to buy the textbooks he needs for his courses.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay monthly tuition fees and buy school supplies like textbooks.

loans.name: Jinny

texts.en: Jinny R. is from the village of Sto. Niño, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 38 years old. Jinny is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Jinny sells seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Jinny has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Jinny joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jinny is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Jinny from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Beat Art And Craft Group-Jinja

texts.en: Beat Art and Craft is the name of the group that 40-year-old B. Musa belongs to. This pleasantly approachable man, who is also the father of three, has been in charge of his agricultural products sales business in Jinja market for the last twenty years. His business story goes all the way back to the time when he began selling second hand clothes. It’s with capital from this business that he started his current business. Being a go-getter in business is one sure way of achieving success. $45 is what he makes in a week. With this loan, he wants to purchase more bags of agro products to resell. He is looking at buying more maize, beans, cassava, coffee and pumpkins.

loans.use: The purchase of more maize, beans, cassava and pumpkins for resell

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
Rosario es un padre de familia de 32 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y a tres hijos en edad escolar en el caserío Annape Barrio San Antonio, una zona rural que se encuentra situada en el distrito de Mórrope, provincia de Lambayeque. El lugar se encuentra ubicado a mas de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde a la crianza y venta de animales menores como ganado ovino y caprino. El los cría en algunos ambientes de su domicilio alimentándolos de granos y pastos naturales. Cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona. El  utiliza los ingresos que le brinda esta actividad como una fuente importante de ingresos para sostener la economía de su familia.

Rosario desea realizar algunas mejoras en su domicilio, específicamente desea enlucir el interior de su vivienda. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles con los cuales planea adquirir el material que necesita para lograr su objetivo.

Rosario es alguien bastante trabajador y entregado a su familia, las personas que le conocen le consideran un hombre tranquilo y honrado.
texts.en:
Rosario is a 32 year old father who resides with his wife and three school-age children in the village of Annape Barrio San Antonio, a rural area situated in the District of Mórrope, Province of Lambayeque. This place is located more than an hour away from the city of Chiclayo.

Rosario raises and sells small animals, such as sheep and goats, from home and feeds them grain and natural grasses. Once they have reached the proper stage of development, the animals are sold to merchants who visit the area. The earnings he generates from this activity provide an important source of income to maintain the family finances.

Rosario wants to make some improvements to his home, specifically plaster the interior walls of his house. He is requesting his first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1500 PEN so that he can acquire the materials needed to accomplish his goal.

Rosario is a hard worker who is devoted to his family. The people who know him consider him to be a peaceful and honest man.

loans.use: Purchase materials to plaster the interior walls of his house

loans.name: Annabell

texts.en:
Annabell B. is married to Leonardo B. Jr., who is 44 years old, works as a fisherman and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have two children who are fifteen and fourteen years old. They live in Polacion 1 of Tinago Barangay, a part of Dumaguete City in Negros Oriental province of the Western Visayas islands. Annabell runs a general store and has a food vending business.

Annabell joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired to something better for her family. With the help of her past four loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Annabell has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 8,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 5,000 PHP, lifting the family's standard of living.

This time, for her fifth loan, she is borrowing 10,000 PHP, which she intends to use to buy stock for her general store and food to sell so that she can continue to save for the education of her children. Annabell B. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through its alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a dollar a day to achieving realities beyond their dreams. They are on a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon—a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To buy stock for her general store and more food to sell

loans.name: Andres Roberto

texts.es: Andrés Roberto M. N. con el apoyo de su esposa cuentan con un negocio de venta de ropa usada y artículos para el hogar al que desea invertir para incrementar sus ganancias y así ofrecer a su familia estabilidad y un mejor patrimonio.
texts.en: Andrés Roberto M. N., with the support of his wife, has a business selling used clothing and articles for the home.  He would like to invest in his business to increase his profits and thereby be able to offer his family stability and better family assets.

loans.use: To stock his business

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en: Hassan is a 49-year-old married man from Nabatieh and father of four children. He has owned a car wash/garage for 10 years. With his payback record in good standing, Hassan is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua for the third time. This loan will enable him to add new merchandise to his business, such as car accessories, oils, and lubricants. His previous loans had a big effect on his business and provided financial and social improvement for his family. In the future, Hassan hopes to expand his business by adding the ability to deal with all car issues.

loans.use: To add new merchandise to his business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more wood

loans.name: Elizabeth Wanza

texts.en:
Elizabeth N. Ndalani is 46 years old and is married to Charles who contributes to the family income. She has a butchery which she has been operating for a period of nine years, generating an income of Kshs 30,000 per month. 

This is her third loan from KADET LTD. She successfully repaid her previous loans. She hopes to have a big butchery that will supply meat to a larger customer base. She hopes to give her children a quality education and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To buy 10 goats for slaughter

loans.name: Dong

texts.en:
Dong M. is a sewing worker in the province of Kompong Chhnang. She has been working in this sector for a year. She has a life partner in her husband who is good at making baskets. He sells them in various places, earning a profit of about $2.50 each day. This couple is blessed with two children, and they don’t go to school yet because they are still too young. 

Recently, Dong M.’s husband ran out of essential materials from his stock supply, and he hopes to acquire more raw materials to continue making baskets. Dong M. will use her loan to help her husband buy more necessary materials in order to continue making his baskets for sale.

loans.use: To buy more essential materials in order to make baskets for sale.

loans.name: Hoar

texts.en:
Hoar H., 59, is married and lives with her husband in the Kampong Cham province. To earn a living, she buys and sells cashew nuts in her village and is able to make about $1 each day. Her husband works recharging batteries. On average, he is able to make about $19 in revenue per day. 

This couple has two children; one is in school and one is employed.

loans.use: To buy cashew nuts to sell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 28 and is happily married with four children, aged 1, 2, 4, and 6. Trained as a hairdresser, Grace works in a salon and employs two others there. She works from 8AM until 11PM every day of the week. 

This is Grace's first loan, and she hopes to use this loan to cover rent costs. With any profits earned after the loan, she hopes to grow her business.

loans.use: to cover rent costs

loans.name: Lorn

texts.en: Lorn T., 53, resides with her family in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for it pre-Angkorean temples. T. is a tailor, earning an income of USD 3 per day. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of USD 3 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 66 on food, and USD 55 on other expenses. T. is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase a truck to provide services in transporting dirt to fill out the land. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a truck for transporting dirt.

loans.name: Odalia Alexandra

texts.es:
Odalia Alexandra tiene 22 años, Es soltera vive con los padres y los con el  hijo.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. SAN JOSE DE LOS AMARILLOS se dedican a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz.

Odalia se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en Comercial Murillo y los vende en la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de insumos y fertilizantes para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es ampliar la casa.

Le gusta ver la televisión.
texts.en:
Odalia Alexandra, 22, is single living with her parents and a son.

The members of the “SAN JOSE DE LOS AMARILLOS” communal bank are short cycle corn and rice farmers.

Odalia farms corn and rice.  She buys her products at Comercial Murillo and sells them there as well.

She is requesting the loan to plant corn and rice, to buy farming supplies and fertilizer for her crops.   Support from the loan will help her economically to meet her needs.  The challenges she faces are infestations, illnesses and the variations in the weather.  

Her dream is to enlarge her house.  She enjoys watching television.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies and fertilizer for the crops.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a member of Mumo group in Faulu Kenya. She runs a retail shop, and it's been ten years since she started the business. She also does farming to supplement her income.

Being a member of Faulu Kenya, she has benefited from her previous loans. She has managed to improve her business and she is now happy because she makes more profit. She hopes to expand her business into wholesale in the future. She has requested a loan of 50,000 Kes to buy crates of soda, biscuits, juice and sugar.

loans.use: to buy crates of soda, biscuits, juice and sugar.

loans.name: Alfa Y Omega 2 Group

texts.es:
El grupo Alfa y Omega 2 está conformado por tres personas trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras; una de ellas es la joven Judith Isabel C. López de 20 años quien tiene una fritanga de platanitos, enchiladas y yucas. 
C. desde la edad de 8 años empezó a trabajar junto con sus hermanas y madre, ellas iniciaron con la venta de tortilla, luego vendieron elotes, yoltamal, tamal, atol etc. y después empezaron a realizar platanitos primeramente los vendían en la calle en la actualidad reparten en los colegio.
Ella con el crédito invertirá en plátano, aceite, repollo, yuca, queso… etc.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son María Soledad L. de 28 años se dedica al comercio de frutas y verduras y Johanna C. de 34 años tiene una fritanga, restaurante popular que se basa en comida frita.
texts.en:
The group “Alfa y Omega 2” (Alpha and Omega 2) consists of three hardworking, determined, and enterprising individuals. One of them is a young woman named Judith Isabel C. López. She is 20 years old and manages a “fritanga” (an establishment that sells fried foods) where she serves plantain chips, enchiladas, and cassava.

Judith began working at the age of 8 with her sisters and her mother. They started selling tortillas and later sold corn on the cob, dessert tamales, tamales, “atol" (a corn beverage), and other food products. Afterwards, they began making plantain chips to sell on the street. Their business is currently located across from a school. Judith will use her loan to invest in plantains, oil, cabbage, cassava, cheese, and other products.

The other members of the group are María Soledad L., a 28 year old fruit and vegetable vendor, and Johanna C., who is 34 years old and also manages a “fritanga” that sells popular fried foods.

loans.use: To purchase plantains, oil, cabbage, cassava, cheese, and other products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay to repair her vehicle

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 42-year-old single woman from Lebanon. She is living with her parents and two siblings. She has owned a bakery since 2008. She produces delicious pies, pizza etc. and  her freshly prepared goods are enjoyed by members of her village and neighboring towns. She has one employee helping her with the work. Her bakery is an important source of income for her family. 

Today, she is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to buy gas, flour and additional equipment needed for her business. She says that the loan will help her increase her productivity, her sales and thus her income. 

Lebanon has many pastry shop and bakeries and it is easy to buy fresh goods in one’s village or neighborhood. In the future, this borrower is planning to develop her business operation by opening a restaurant.

loans.use: to buy gas, flour and additional equipment.

loans.name: Luz De La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Nilda  es integrante de la nueva Alcancia Comunal “ Luz de la Esperanza” que esta conformada por 7 vecinos  de la zona denominada La ronda en Chosica. Se formo gracias a la nueva esperanza que crecio en ellos al recibir el mensaje de lograr adquirir un capital de trabajo y fomentar el habito del ahorro en el programa de Alcancias Comunales de Edaprospo. Nilda junto a su esposo han logrado adquirir una casa en la capital, pues ellos provienen de la sierra de Lima. Su esposo se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno y ella a la comercializacion de queso en diferentes mercados de la ciudad. En ocasiones y estacionalmente vende frutas y tambien cocina para terceros. El reciente prestamo sera invertido en materiales de construccion como: cemento y arena para su casa. Nilda desea comprar un auto propio para trasladarse y comercializar sus productos.
 La Alcancia Comunal “ Luz de la Esperanza” recibe este prestamo para mejorar sus condiciones como micro empresarios y estan comprometidos a responder puntualmente cada mes.
texts.en:
Nilda is a member of the “Luz de la Esperanza” (Light of Hope) communal bank which is made up of seven neighbors from an area called La Ronda in Chosica.  It came together thanks to the new hope that grew in them when they received the message that they had acquired working capital and would be able to start to encourage the habit of saving in Edaprospo’s communal bank program.

Nilda and her husband have managed to acquire a house in the capital because they come from the mountains in Lima.  Her husband raises cattle and she sells cheese in the city’s various markets.  Occasionally and seasonally she also sells fruit and cooks for third persons.  The current loan will be used to buy building materials like cement and sand for her house.  Nilda wants to buy a car of her own to get around in to sell her products.

The “Luz de la Esperanza” communal bank received this loan to improve their conditions as micro entrepreneurs and they are committed to make their monthly installment payments on time.

loans.use: to buy cement.

loans.name: Felicien

texts.en:
Felicien is 38 years old and married. He has two years experience in his business selling various goods such as lotion, soap, biscuits, candles, etc. His business is well-organized and he currently employs one person to help him. The hours of his business are from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day of the week.

Felicien has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more of the above mentioned goods to sell. He will use the profit generated from this loan to reinvest in his business and save for his future.

loans.use: To purchase various goods such as lotion, soap, biscuits, candles, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba sells tubers of yams, onions and watermelons. She is single. She wishes to increase the quantity of yams, onions and watermelon sales. A loan of 1,000 GHS will help a lot.  Aba uses her income to pay utility bills. With the new profits from her expanded business, Aba plans to invest in the sale of other fruits.

loans.use: to purchase more yams, onions and watermelons to sell

loans.name: Iman

texts.en:
Iman is a 42-year-old artistically-gifted married woman, who is very handy when it comes to embroidery.

She adds embroidery to head covers, dresses, table covers, and she even makes embroidered wall hangings as shown in the picture.

Now Iman wants to buy an embroidery machine that can help her produce her pieces faster to be able to serve all her customers on time.

loans.use: To buy an embroidery machine.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a 35-year-old married man with four children. He lives in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. Paul has the responsibility of looking after the family and his dream is to educate his children. He deals in the harvest of grasshoppers and rides a motorcycle for a living, which has enabled him to provide for the children.

Paul has a challenge of limited equipment during the harvest season. His desire is to ably maximize the harvest of grasshoppers as they have a ready market. Paul needs this loan to buy grasshoppers to sell.

loans.use: To buy drums from which grasshoppers are harvested

loans.name: María Dolores

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal Unión Progresista, vive por la parroquia de Santa Ana,  en esta parroquia se puede admirar hermosos paisajes, desde su centro se puede observar gran parte de la ciudad de Cuenca, su gente es muy amable y cálida, mantienen su cultura y tradiciones de sus padres, se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería.

La Señora. María tiene 56 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 11 hijos, 5 de sus hijos son casados e independientes, 4 de sus hijos trabajan y le ayudan económicamente y sus dos últimos hijos uno le ayuda en la casa y la otra  estudia en una escuelita de la ciudad. También cuida a tres nietos que están estudiando en la escuela. Su esposo trabaja como guardia de seguridad, la casa en la que habita es de su propiedad.

Doña María se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y al cuidado de su familia, ella se da tiempo para criar ganado, cerdos, cuyes y gallinas los que los vende en su propia comunidad.
 
En el banco comunal se encuentra hace 10 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir para la compra de abono para mejorar sus potreros.
 
Su meta es terminar su casa ya que aun le hacen falta algunos acabados.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the communal bank "Union Progresista", meaning "Progressive Union". She lives in the Parish of Santa Ana. Beautiful scenery can be admired from this Parish and the population is kind and welcoming. They maintain the culture and traditions of their ancestors and they are agriculturists and farmers.

Maria is 56 years old and she is married. The fruit of her marriage is her 11 children. Five of her children are married and independent, 4 of them are working and contribute financially. Of her two youngest children, one helps with the household chores, and the other attends primary school in the city. She also has three grandchildren in her care and they are in high school. Her husband is a security guard and the house in which they live is their own property.

Maria spends her time handling the household obligations and taking care of her family. She takes the time to raise cattle, pigs, guinea pigs, and poultry which are sold within her own community. 

She has been with her communal bank for 10 years and her new loan will be invested in the purchase of fertilizer to improve her pastures.

Her goal is to finish building her house, especially because some finishing touches are still left to be done.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Gloria Marlene

texts.es:
Gloria Marlene tiene 32 años de edad, es casado vive con el esposo e hijos, en el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar.

Los miembros de la V.R.C NUEVA ESPERANZA, se encuentra en el sector La capilla, comunidad cuatro esquinas Cantón Guaranda, a una distancia de 25 minutos, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura, comercio, construcción y ganadería.

Gloria Marlena se dedica a la agricultura siembra papas y maiz ademas a la comercializacion de legumbres. Compra y vende sus productos en la ciudad de Guaranda, Guanujo.

Solicita el crédito para, compra de abonos, semillas y dinero para pagar el transporte de las legumbres. El  crédito le servirá de apoyo para suplir sus necesidades económicas y mejorar sus actividades agrícolas. Enfrenta desafíos como la competencia,  daños en los cultivos. Su sueño es comprar un vehiculo para trasladar los productos que vende al mercado.

Le gusta salir de paseo junto a la familia.
texts.en:
Gloria Marlene is 32, married, and lives with her husband and children in the canton of Guaranda, in the province of Bolivar.  The members of  Nueva Esperanza (New Hope) village bank live in the "Four Corners" neighborhood of La Capilla sector, in the canton of Guaranda, 25 minutes from town. The members of this bank work in farming, retail, construction and the raising of livestock.  

Gloria Marlena is a farmer, and grows potatoes and corn. She also sells vegetables. She buys and sells her products in the city of Guaranda, and in the town of Guanujo. She is applying for the loan in order to buy fertilizer, seeds, and money to pay for transporting her vegetables.  The loan will help her meet her financial needs, and make improvements in her farming. 

She faces challenges such as competition and crop damage.  Her dream is to buy a vehicle to transport the produce she sells to market. She likes to go out walking with her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seeds, and money to pay for transporting vegetables to market.

loans.name: Maria Amelia

texts.es:
La Señora Maria tiene 27 años de edad, está casada con el Señor Bernardo de 26 años, ellos tienen 1 hijo pequeño de 2 años 7 meses.
La señora Maria se dedica a la venta de teléfonos celulares, como así también de accesorios para los mismos. Empezó este negocio aproximadamente hace un año y medio, anteriormente trabajaba en una importante entidad financiera; al salir de la empresa con la ayuda de su marido logró montar un negocio que fue creciendo de a poco y que hoy cuenta con una clientela importante.
Comenta que la venta de celulares y accesorios le trae muy buena ganancia, ya que los mismos son muy solicitados, además de eso dice también que es un mercado muy competitivo. Su meta es poder seguir creciendo y ampliando su local, o de ser posible abrir otras tiendas más.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de accesorios para teléfonos, como ser estuches, colgantes carcazas, teclados y otros, para la posterior venta. Ella agradece por la oportunidad que la Fundación le está dando.
texts.en:
Maria is 27 years old, is married to Bernardo who is 26 years old, and they have a little 2 year 7 month old child. 

Maria sells cell phones and also accessories for them. She began this business approximately 1-1/2 years ago. Before that she worked at a major financial institution. Upon leaving the company, with the help of her husband, she was able to start a business that grew little by little and which today has an important clientele. She says that the sale of cell phones and accessories provides a good income, because they are always in high demand, but she also says the market is very competitive. 

Her goal is to be able to continue growing and expanding locally, or if possible to open more stores. She is asking for a loan in order to buy telephone accessories such as cases, hanging holders and keyboards for resale. She is grateful for the opportunity that the Foundation is giving her.

loans.use: to purchase telephone accessories for resale

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr:
Koffi est  un homme âgé 51 ans. Il est marié å une institutrice qui est à la retraite. Il a 4 enfants, dont 2 à l’école. Le premier a 24 ans et le dernier a 18 ans.  
Koffi travaille comme directeur d’une école primaire depuis 2009. En ce moment, les toits de son école sont vieux.
Koffi a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin de refaire le toit de sa maison. Il veut en profiter aussi pour construire d’autres salles de classe.
Il dit qu’avec les profits, il prévoit de subvenir efficacement aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Koffi is a 51-year-old man. He is married to a retired teacher. He has 4 children, including 2 in school. The oldest is 24 years old and the youngest is 18 years old. 

Koffi has been working as the director of an elementary school since 2009. At this time, the roof of his school is old. Koffi has requested his first loan from WAGES in order to redo the roof of his house. He wants to use it to build other classrooms. 

He says, with the profits, he plans to effectively meet the needs of his family.

loans.use: make the roof of a new classroom

loans.name: Merling Jamileth

texts.es: Merling de 36 años de edad es soltera, tiene 3 hijos, 2 mayores y la menor de 7 años.  Esta solicitando su 4to credito con el proposito de comprar productos para su pequeño negocio de venta de oro y plata.  Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien asume los gastos del hogar.  Su mayor sueño es poder incrementar su negocio para asi obtener ingresos adicionales para su familia.
texts.en:
Merling is 36 years old and single.  She has three children, two are grown and the youngest is seven years old.

She is requesting her fourth loan to buy products for her small business of selling gold and silver.  Her husband supports her; he takes on the household expenses. 

Her biggest dream is to be able to expand her business in order to get additional income for her family.

loans.use: to buy products for her small business of selling gold and silver.

loans.name: Marusya

texts.en: Marusya is 57 years old and lives with her two children in a ger, a Mongolian yurt in Ovorhangai province of Mongolia. Her son makes wooden furniture and other things at home, and her daughter works at the Unitel LLC in Southgovi region. Marusya started her business in 2006 by selling food and other products from her house. She has many years of business and work experience. She is planning to expand her business. She is a hardworking and diligent woman who says "I want to expand both my and my son's businesses. I think my son's business has a bright future." She is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to buy foods and other products for her shop and wood materials for her son's business.

loans.use: To purchase inventory of food for her shop and wood materials for her son's business

loans.name: Dopoi

texts.en:
Dopoi is 30 years old. He is married and blessed with two children. He is a farmer and he has been doing this for the last seven years. His farm is in a productive area that has proved to be good for maize farming.

He learned about KADET through a marketing campaign done by KADET staffs in his area of residence. He has been a good client with KADET and this will be his first loan, with which he is planning to buy maize seeds and fertilizers. He hopes to use the profits from this loan to acquire more land for farming to increase his maize production and educate his children.

His dream is to become a large-scale farmer, and buy a bigger piece of land and build a permanent home. He is an industrious man who can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: to buy maize seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Vagharshak

texts.en: Vagharshak grows and sells mushrooms. He buys mushroom seeds, grows them and sells them. To increase the effectiveness of the production process, Vagharshak would like to grow mushroom seeds himself. With the requested loan he plans to purchase equipment to grow mushroom seeds. With the help of this loan Vagharshak will develop his business and increase his working capital. With additional income Vagharshak will ensure a sustainable future for his family. Vagharshak lives together with his wife, son and daughter.

loans.use: to pay for equipment to grow mushroom seeds

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia, age 33, is involved in two businesses: one is sewing and the other is animal breeding. She purchases animals such as goats and sheep in their early age and raises them to sell for profit. Razia's husband is a mason by profession and constructs buildings and housing on contract.

Razia is very efficient and performs her household duties very well along with maintaining her businesses. She is the mother of six children, three of whom are schooling and three of whom are at home.
  
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her animal sales business. With the loan, she will buy goats and sheep, raise them, and sell them to local butchers.
  
Razia has been operating her animal sales business for the past five years and is very confident that the loan investment will allow her to be successfully able to improve its earnings.

loans.use: to buy goats and sheep to raise and sell

loans.name: Dulzora

texts.en:
Dulzora is 65 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with 11 children.
 
Dulzora has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, detergents, noodles and shampoo. She has had this business for 2 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and shampoo.

Dulzora has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Dulzora hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and shampoo

loans.name: Sinavailemalama

texts.en:
Sivavailemalama is 29 years old, married with 4 children.

Sinavailemalama owns and operates a business venture planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. She has 2 years of experience in this business. Sinavailemalama needs a loan of 1,500 WST to purchase weed-killers, such as Gramoxome. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 600 WST or US $250 per week) to improve the general living conditions of her family.

In 2010, Sinavailemalama joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Sinavailemalama's second loan with SPBD. 

About  SPBD:

In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.

SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers. Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale out of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and thE. are averaged for the "overall social metric score".  For example, a 3 out of 3 on "level of education" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline 24, is a single woman, with one child who attends school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her biggest monthly expenses are food, rent bills and school fees.

For the past six months, she has operated a vegetable stall business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Caroline dreams of expanding her business to meet her customer's demand in the future.

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase bundles of vegetables, tomatoes, onions and fruits. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase inventory of tomatoes, onions and other fruits and vegetables for her stall.

loans.name: Herbalife Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “HERBALIFE” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Santiago II, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Verónica. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de productos de belleza Herbalife, venta de comida

La señora Verónica,  indica que es la primera vez que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de sus amigas y vecinas. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de productos de belleza, (Herbalife) que viene trabajando hace algún tiempo.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de productos Herbalife) que adquirirá de la Ceja, por mayor, y posteriormente lo implementara a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación en crédito y salud.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Herbalife” is starting its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Santiago II Community Center. This group consists of six members and is led by a Board of Directors headed by Sra. Verónica. The members of this Communal Bank engage in various businesses in order to get ahead such as selling Herbalife beauty products and selling food.

Sra. Verónica says that this is the first time she has worked with Pro Mujer. She joined the organization after being invited by her friends and neighbors. Verónica currently has a business selling Herbalife beauty products, which she has been doing for some time.

The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital for buying Herbalife products, which she will acquire in bulk in La Ceja. They will be used later on to fulfill her orders. Working in this manner enables her to generate income to support her family. Verónica is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Verónica said that she enjoys the loan training and the health services.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is a 53-year-old businessman. He is a widower with three children.  

He has been selling firewood for the past six years with a monthly income of KES 10,000, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his fourth loan with KADET after repaying the previous loans successfully. Simon will use the loan to buy more firewood for his business. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will open a retail shop for his son. His hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and build rental houses.

loans.use: To buy more firewood for his business.

loans.name: Vilma Maribel

texts.es:
La Señora Vilma es socia del banco comunal Nuevo Bankito la Ramada, vive en una comunidad en Cuenca, este lugar es de clima frió, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales, a la agricultura y muchos laboran en la ciudad en diferentes actividades, su gente mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.
 
Doña Vilma tiene 24 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 5 y 2 años de edad, su primer hijo estudia en una escuelita de la ciudad, está feliz ya que se encuentra embarazada de de 8 meses. Su esposo labora en el área de la construcción ya que es albañil, la casa en la que viven es de su propiedad.
 
La Señora. Vilma pasa en casa al cuidado de sus hijos y también se dedica a la agricultura, lo que cosecha es para su consumo y para la venta. Cría  y vende pollos, borregos y chanchos.
 
Se encuentra en su cuarto crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la construcción de un galpón para pollos.

Su meta es mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Vilma is a member of the communal bank Nuevo Bankito la Ramada. She lives in a community in Cuenca. This place has a cold climate. Her people raise animals, are farmers, and many work in the city at many activities. Her people retain the culture and traditions of their communities.
Vilma is 24 years old, is married, and in their conjugal union has conceived two children of five and two years old. Her first child is in a small school in the city. She is happy because she is eight months pregnant. Her husband works in the area of construction since he is a bricklayer. The house in which they live is their property.
Vilma cares for the children at home and she is engaged in agriculture.  The harvest is for her own consumption and to sell. She raises and sells chickens, sheep, and pigs.
She is currently in her fourth loan with the communal bank and she is going to invest it in the construction of a chicken coop.
Her goal is to improve her home.

loans.use: to build a chicken coop.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 34 years old and single. She sells mobile phones and accessories and has been in this business for the past two years.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a KADET client. This is her second loan with KADET. She repaid her previous loan successfully. She will use the current loan amount to purchase computer accessories for her business.

She hopes to open a computer college in the future.

loans.use: to buy mobile phone accessories in bulk for resale.

loans.name: Adijja

texts.en:
Adijja aged 42 years is married with four children who are all at school.

The client's business is retail with general merchandise that she sells to residents around the area where she lives.

She works 10 hours a day, six days a week. Her other source of income is agriculture, whereby she sells matooke (plantains) from her farm. The business was started in 1989, in the cell B Ishaka ward on the outskirts of town. The business was started for her to earn a living. The loan money will be used to buy more stock. Her customers are people staying around town more so students.

She has competitors all over with well-stocked shops and debtors who limit the growth of the business. She is honest and hardworking.

loans.use: To buy retail shop items to sell

loans.name: Dolgorsuren

texts.en: Borrower Ms. Dolgorsuren is a 41-year-old married woman who lives with her family in an outer ger district, which lacks basic city infrastructure. She works as an attendant and her hubby works in a private company. She lives with her husband, two daughters and a grandchild. The current house in which the family lives is very old and needs some repair work, so she is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase the necessary housing materials. She desires to finish her housing project this summer and live happily with her family there.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials and to finish her housing project

loans.name: Gbemevo Group

texts.fr: Le groupe GBEMEVO est composé de trois personnes qui sont dans amies. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Adjobignon Yvette, celle qui a la main levée sur la photo est âgée de 36 ans et est mariée à un bijoutier du nom de Germain. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Adjobignon Yvette vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la maison sont assumées par le couple. Adjobignon Yvette n’a pas fréquenté l'école. Pour y arriver, Adjobignon Yvette vend des crevettes fraîches dans un marché. Adjobignon Yvette s’approvisionne au bord d’un lac au Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire sa clientèle, Adjobignon Yvette ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe GBEMEVO, sollicitent un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des crevettes fraîches.

loans.name: Lenny

texts.en:
Jenny is a single mother with 3 children. She owns a small shop where she sells snacks and other foods. When her husband left her he gave her $500 for the kids. Combined with her savings Jenny was able to set up her business in the front of her home. At first she relied heavily on the local loan sharks but now she realizes their rates are not fair. As a side job she knits children’s clothing for a local store. She’s been knitting and sewing for over 10 years but her primary source of income is her microbusiness. She needs the loan in order to invest in new products to sell at her shop. She is hopeful that these investments will result in a better life for her and her children.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Increase and diversify inventory

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Lom Nava Spot is a place where workers and the general public have their meals and refreshments. It is operated by Madam Rebecca. She sells locally cooked foods such as banku, fufu, omo tuo and soft drinks. Demand is on the increase, and so she is asking for a loan of $800 from Kiva to enable her meet her customers' demands.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Jane would like to buy a dairy cow and animal feeds

loans.name: Jeoffery

texts.en: "I have a business that is presently worth about US$ 1500 (Nigerian Naira 200, 000)," says Mr. Jeoffery O., "and I hope to expand my inventory with a Kiva loan." Jeoffery is 53 years old and father of six children. He is requesting a loan of $625.

loans.use: To buy more provisions for his inventory

loans.name: Halima

texts.en: Halima, is a 42-year-old mother of 3 and a resident of Buguruni area in Dar Es Salaam. She has two school-aged children, both in secondary school. Halima runs a grocery business strategically located in the Buguruni area. She and her husband (seated) have been doing business for the past twenty years. She is a recipient of the Youth Self Employment Foundation business trainings and this knowledge has helped her to improve her business. She has agents up country who supply her with food items, and she sells as retailer. She also sells pumped water at her home, which adds to her income. She is requesting a loan of $550, which will enable her to increase her stock and expand her business.

loans.use: To increase stock and expand business

loans.name: Elba Lucinda

texts.es:
Elba is an enterprising woman who works hard everyday to be able to generate sustenance for her home along with her husband. The difficult financial situation has motivated her to sell refreshments at local events for the past 11 years. On the advice of an aunt, she went out on business on her own. Every day she prepares the beverages in her kitchen, and currently her business has allowed her to contribute significant sums of money to the family income, mostly going toward educating her four children at a prestigious center in her city. They are the motor the drives her every day and keeps her going because her husband works temporary jobs and household necessities can be urgent. Elba dreams of one day having her own home since her family leases the one they live in now, and that motivates her to keep working hard every day. She's requesting a loan of $375 to purchase ingredients and utensils to increase the quality of her delicious drinks. Help this fine woman who searches for a better life for her family every day. She thanks you in advance for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Elba es un a mujer empeñosa que cada día se esfuerza para poder generar el sostén de su hogar en compañía de su esposo, la difícil situación económica la ha motivado a desempeñarse en la venta de refrescos para las ferias comerciales y artesanales hace ya 11 años, por consejo de una tía que la animo a valerse por sí misma.Cada día en su cocina prepara los refrescos para poder comercializarlos y en la actualidad su pequeño negocio le permite poder aportar significativas sumas de dinero a la economía de su hogar, sobre todo por educar a sus 4 hijos que están estudiando en un prestigioso centro educativo de su ciudad, ellos son el motor que impulsa cada día su vida y seguirá haciéndolo porque su esposo tiene trabajos eventuales y las necesidades aún apremian en casa.Elba desea poder tener algún día su propia casita ya que la que habita es por determinado tiempo, por este motivo se ha propuesto seguir trabajando a diario con mucho empeño; solicita un préstamo de 375 dólares que los invertirá en la compra de insumos y utensilios para incrementar la calidad de sus deliciosas chichas, por anticipado les extiende su agradecimiento por el apoyo que le puedan proporcionar.Ayudemos a esta noble dama que cada día busca lo mejor para su familia

loans.use: Purchase ingredients and utensils to keep preparing delicious beverages

loans.name: Janet

texts.es:
Everyone who comes to Janet's community is charmed by the variety of high-quality crafts offered for sale. Janet especially is well-known for the skill she has been perfecting since she was a girl working alongside her parents. She hopes to make and sell enough work to finish building her shop and diversify into groceries and drinks. She works hard to fulfill the needs of her beloved family. Please help this hard-working woman realize her dreams.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Todo visitante que llega a la comunidad de la señora Janet, siempre se muestra encantado de la variedad y diversidad de productos debido a la calidad y diversidad que encuentran al llegar a este lugar; pero sin duda Janet ha sabido ganarse la confianza y reconocimiento de sus clientes, gracias al gran trabajo que realiza en la elaboración de artesanías, en la que vierte toda su experiencia y arte adquirido desde su niñez, gracia a las instrucciones de sus padres. Ella elabora diligentemente estos productos para comercializarlos y ahorrar lo suficiente para terminar la construcción de su kiosco e el que anhela vender abarrotes y bebidas; sabe que todo su esfuerzo es con un fin enorme ya que desea firmemente brindar a su amada familia lo necesario para su desarrollo personal.Todos nosotros podemos participar en la realización de estas metas, contribuyamos en esta noble tarea y atendamos su solicitud.

loans.use: To buy craft materials.

loans.name: Claudia Guadalupe

texts.es:
In 1995, because of the need to offer her children a better future as a single mom, Claudia started her general store. In 1996 she added a small cart for selling tacos, which Claudia prepares very well because her parents work preparing and selling tacos too. By 2002 she started selling new shoes as a distributor, by them she could count with the help of her eldest son, who helped his mother paying for his college and offering his sister the same opportunity.

However, Claudia thinks it is time to renovate her locale, so her customers feel more comfortable when they come shopping, and she wants to buy a metal curtain to protect her products. Claudia is requesting a loan for US $ 750, which she is willing to pay in 6 months. With your help, Claudia will be able to buy what is necessary to protect her merchandise as well as fixing up her store, and with this pay for her children's education.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

En 1995 tras la necesidad de ofrecer un futuro mejor a sus hijos, ya que es madre soltera, Claudia inicia con el negocio de abarrotes, en 1996 pone una pequeña carreta de tacos que Claudia sabe elaborar muy bien ya que sus padres también se dedican a eso. Para el 2002 comenzó con la venta de calzado nuevo mediante vales, como distribuidora, contando ya con el apoyo de su hijo mayor y así el ayudarle a su madre a costearse los estudios universitarios y al mismo tiempo poder ofrecerle la misma oportunidad a su hermana.

Sin embargo Claudia considera que es momento de renovar su local, para que sus clientes se sientan más a gusto al ir a comprarles y poder comprar una cortina metálica para proteger sus productos. Claudia está solicitando un crédito de US $750 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses con tu ayuda Claudia podrá comprar lo necesario para proteger su mercancía así como para arreglar su local, y con esto pagar los estudios de sus hijos.

loans.use: Buying a metal curtain to protect her store and remodeling her locale (Comprar una cortina metálica para proteger su negocio y remodelar su local)

loans.name: Thi Hanh

texts.vi:
Mrs. Hanh, 36 years old, has a son who is stil in school. She tries to do a lot of jobs at a time to increase her family income, such as farming, breeding pigs, lending stuff for wedding or funeral (including bowls, plates, canvas, tables, chairs, sound equipment, etc). In order to buy those stuff to lend, her family used to borrow money from their relatives, and they almost paid back all the loan. This time she would like to borrow $150 from Binhminhcdc (Kiva's partner in Vietnam) to have more fund to buy equipment for rent.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong N., Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Hạnh, 36 tuổi, có một con trai còn đang đi học. Chị Hạnh làm rất nhiều việc để tăng thu nhập cho gia đình như làm ruộng, chăn nuôi lợn, cho thuê đồ phục vụ đám hiếu, hỉ: bát, đĩa, phông bạt, bàn ghế, loa đài... Để mua đồ cho thuê, gia đình chị cũng đã từng phải vay họ hàng nhưng đã trả gần hết. Nay, chị tham gia vay vốn 2006000đ của Chương trình Tài chính vi mô Binhminh cdc để bổ sung vốn mua đồ cho thuê.

loans.use: to lend canvas

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.en:
Juan Carlos is a carpenter. He has worked 15 years in the business and has worked hard to save enough money to buy the house where he lives now. Currently, he has the necessary materials he needs to make furniture, windows, and doors.

The only thing that he lacks which would make his business prosper is a truck to transport his goods. With the investment in a truck, he will be able to expand his area for attracting customers and facilitate his business by delivering the furniture he makes.

However, he is taking small steps first and will use the money that he is asking for to buy the necessary amount of wood needed to continue making his furniture. After a little time, Juan Carlos feels sure that he will be able to obtain the truck that will help his business grow.

loans.use: to buy wood for building furniture

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr:
Born on December 31, 1973 in Lomé, Mr. Koffi S. is married and the father of two children who are both enrolled in school. Since 2005, he has been selling construction materials in his shop named "Ets. Dieu Est Vivant", located in Adidogomé. His income from this business permits him to pay his children's school fees.

His customers sometimes request certain supplies that he does not have available for sale, however.

For this reason, he is presently requesting a loan in the amount of US$ 1200 which will allow him to purchase 90 cans of paint, 10 kilograms of nails, and thirty locks. Thus, he will be able to supply all the needs of his customers.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Né le 31 décembre 1973 à Lomé, Monsieur S. Koffi est marié et père de deux enfants qui vont tous à l’école. Depuis 2005, il vend des matériaux de construction dans sa boutique « ETS DIEU EST VIVANT » située à Adidogomé. Il assure la scolarité de ses enfants à travers le revenu provenant de cette activité.

Toutefois, certains matériaux sont désirés par les clients mais que Monsieur S. Koffi ne dispose pas dans sa boutique.

A cet effet, il sollicite un crédit d’un montant de 500.000 FCFA pour acheter quatre vingt dix boîtes de peintures, dix kg de pointe et trente serrures ; Ainsi il pourra répondre à toutes les demandes de ses clients.

loans.use:
Expand his inventory of hardware

Augmenter son stock de quincaillerie

loans.name: María Dolores

texts.en:
Maria Dolores R. (44) lives in San Lorenzo in a neighborhood called Cerrito. She is married to Pastor Severiano Vergara (64) and both have 4 children; each one of them works independently.

As the owner of DESPENSA ÑA MARIA, Maria Dolores plans to enlarge her grocery store in order to offer a wider variety of products and attract more customers. The difference between Maria Dolores’s grocery store and the competition is that since she is a lovely person, everyone in the neighborhood knows her and wants to help her. Consequently, they prefer to buy goods from the Despensa Ña Maria instead of others' grocery stores. In rural areas in Paraguay, the Despensas could be considered as a meeting point, where people not only buy products but also gather and gossip. That is why is Despensas are a very profitable business in those areas.

loans.use: to enlarge her grocery store

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 39 year-old Eva M.. She is married, and has three children aged 8, 10, and 16. In 2000, Eva established her rice and used clothing business. She has applied for this loan in order to purchase additional stocks of rice and used clothing in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

Second-hand clothing arrives in Dar es Salaam from America and Europe. It is then washed, ironed and sold in bulk by wholesalers to retailers. The retailers re-wash and re-iron the clothing in preparation for sale on the streets of Dar es Salaam and the surrounding towns and villages. These clothes are becoming increasingly popular, especially amongst the younger generations, because of their low cost and the general appeal of anything western or modern.

Some argue that the popularity of cast-offs from the West is damaging the local cloth and garment industry. There are many people who still appreciate the beauty of traditional Tanzanian dress, however the growing market in used clothing and its importance to many micro-entrepreneurs cannot be denied.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of rice and used clothing

loans.name: Argentina

texts.es:
Mrs. Argentina A. is dedicated to selling basic staples and grocery products, as well as meat and all things associated with a general grocery store. She has a great deal of experience since she has been running the business for four years. She has two children and is responsible for maintaining them and providing for all of their needs.

Currently Argentina is asking for a loan through Kiva from the micro-lending group Ceprodel in order to purchase products that she can sell in her grocery store. It is important to emphasize that her dream is to improve her business and thereby distinguish herself as an important businesswoman in the Somotillo sector of Chinandega, Nicaragua, where she is from.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Argentina A. se dedica a la comercialización de productos como son granos básicos abarrotaría , y carnes en general y todo lo concerniente a lo que es una pulpería teniendo gran experiencia ya que tiene 4 años de tener el negocio. Es madre de dos hijos cuyo deber es el de mantener y brindarles todas las condiciones necesarias.

Hoy en día busca el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener un crédito con el cual adquirir su mercadería para continuar comercializándola en su pulpería. Es necesario destacar que sus sueños son mejorar el negocio y así destacarse como una gran comerciante en el sector de Somotillo de la ciudad de Chinandega de donde es originaria.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for a general store

loans.name: Uguloy

texts.en:
Uguloy K. is 51 years old, married and the loving mother of three children. For the last seven years, she has made a living selling cottonseed oil in the local market. Her son helps Uguloy with this business. In traditional Tajik cuisine, most meals are fried or cooked using cottonseed oil, especially the national dish known as Oshi palov,  which needs a lot of cottonseed oil to be especially delicious. So Uguloy's goods are high demand among local people.

Uguloy is working hard to increase the size of her business. To make this possible, she has applied for a loan of $1,000 which she will repay in four months. She will use the loan to buy additional cottonseed oil to sell to her customers. Uguloy is counting on your help and wishes to thank you for your support.

loans.use: To buy cottonseed oil to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma is 27 years old. She is married with 3 children, between 9 and 6 years old. She has been a cloth seller (khanga and vitenge: decorative cotton cloth garments common in Eastern Africa) since 2007. Every day, she works from 8am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about US$ 165 from her sales.

In the past, Fatma has taken out 1 successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Fatma now hopes for another loan to buy more cloth (khanga and vitenge) for her business.

loans.use: To buy more cloth (khanga and vitenge) for her business

loans.name: Salama's Hakuna Kulala Group

texts.en:
Evelyne is thirty years old. She's married with three children, aged two, three, and four. She also cares for two other children, aged six and eight. She became a food seller in 2004. She works every day from 8 am to 6 pm at her business, and can earn a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

Salama is now requesting a loan to buy more clothes and perfume for resale to expand her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses selling clothes, firewood, charcoal, perfume, and potatoes.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and prefume for resale.

loans.name: Moeng

texts.en: Mrs. Moeng O. is a farmer in Prey Khla Tboung Village in Takeo Province. In this plantation, she now faces an obstacle because her field is infertile which has a bad effect on her crops. To solve this problem, Mrs. Moeng O. is requesting a loan to purchase more fertilizer to improve her field to make her crops more productive. Her husband, Mr. Un Thol, is a pig breeder. Mrs. Moeng O. is 42 years old and the mother of three children, all enrolled in the local school. Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: To purchase more fertilizer to make her crops more productive

loans.name: Thu

texts.vi:
Chị Tạ Thị Thu năm nay 26 tuổi. Chị tham gia Quỹ tìnhthương từ đầy năm 2007. Hiện nay công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chủ yếu cho gia đình  chị là từ  buôn bán quần áo. Ngoài thu nhập từ buôn bán  hàng tháng gia đình  chị còn có thêm nguồn thu nhập từ lương thợ xây của chồng nên kinh tế rất ổn định. Với mức thu nhập 4.000.000đ/ tháng cuộc sống của gia đình chị Thu đang ngày càng được cải thiện hơn.
 Vòng vốn tới chị Thu mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư thêm vốn vào công việc kinh doanh quần áo
texts.en:
Ms. T. Thi Thu is 26 years old. She joined TYM fund in 2007. Her family's main source of income at the present time is from her clothing store. In addition to her clothing store, she has additional income from her husband's job as a construction worker, and thus her family's income is very stable. With an average income of 245 USD per month, her family's life is improving every day. For this next loan, she wishes to borrow 550 USD to invest in her clothing business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Korng

texts.en:
Korng K. T., 51, is married and resides with one of her children and her husband in the Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. Since 1979, she has been working as a village doctor making around $10 a day, while her husband Porn Phan, 55, works breeding pigs on a plot of land behind his house. Every month, Korng spends $60 on food, $30 on her children's education, and $30 on transportation. 

Korng K. T. would like to take out a loan of $1000 to purchase a motorbike to use commuting to work. This will reduce her daily transportation costs. (Her husband is pictured.)

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane A. is a 45 year-old widow who has 6 children, 2 of whom are in school. Jane has a retail kiosk in the Rongo District of southwest Kenya. She specializes in selling kerosene and cooking oil and has been running the kiosk for less than a year. 

As a widow, Jane relies on the profits from her kiosk to support her family. She uses the money she makes for all household expenses. 

The retail kiosk is a young business, and Jane is looking to increase her stock. To do so, she has applied for a small loan of KSH 5,250 (approximately USD 75). With the loan money, Jane will purchase additional items to sell at the kiosk, as well as increase her stock of kerosene and cooking oil.

loans.use: To purchase kerosene and cooking oil

loans.name: Liz

texts.es:
LIZ Z. GUERRA, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Solidarias” ubicado en el Jr. Nemesio Cacedo Mz. 17, Lt. 13, AA.HH. “José Olaya” del Distrito de Yarinacocha, ella tiene 40 años, 03 hijos, es madre soltera.

El primer préstamo que recibió fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, utilizó en tramitar sus documentos y servicio varios en la extracción de maderas.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,200.00 Nuevos Soles, compró madera, realiza trámites documentarios forestales, envía a lima.

Muy agradecida de Manuela Ramos por darle la oportunidad de trabajar y así mantener a sus hijos.
texts.en:
LIZ Z. GUERRA, belongs to the “Mujeres Solidarias” Communal Bank located at Jr. Nemesio Cacedo Mz. 17, Lt. 13, AA.HH. “José Olaya” in the Yarinacocha District. She is 40 years old, has 3 children and is a single mother. The first loan that she received was for S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, which she used to process her documents and for various services related to wood extraction. With this loan of S/.1,200.00 Nuevos Soles she buys wood, she carries out forestry work and sends it to Lima. She is very thankful to Manuela Ramos for giving her the opportunity to work and support her children.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buys wood, carries out forestry work and sends it to Lima.

loans.name: Sa Aem

texts.en: Mrs. Sa Aem S. is a villager in Pich Entrea village in Takeo province. She is employed in a garment factory. Her husband, Mr. Deib Siha, is a firewood seller. Since his business is doing well, he wants to expand it. Thus, Mrs. Sa Aem S. decided to ask for a loan to buy more firewood to resell to earn more profit. She is 30 years old and the mother of two children; one attends the local school and the other is too young to work or study. Her husband is shown on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more firewood to resell

loans.name: Ikromidin

texts.en:
B. Ikromidin is 37 years old. He lives with his wife and has two children. Like his parents, who cultivated large crops, he has been a farmer since he was a boy. He enjoys being a farmer. Like his brother, he plants crops and then eventually he or his wife takes the products directly to market to sell. This way, he does not have to give away any of his efforts to middlemen.

Farming brings Ikromidin good earnings. He tells us that to succeed, you only need to know how to take care of what you plant and to pay attention to what the crops need. Therefore, he fertilizes his crops so that he has a good harvest.

This is his fourth loan with IMON International and he is responsible with his payments. The money he is requesting will be invested in high-quality seeds and fertilizer. Ikromidin is very grateful to everyone who is helping him to achieve his goals with this loan.

More about Tajikistan

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and being the location of the end of the rule of Alexander the Great. It is also known for its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi, and many others. The country, filled with epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and boasts a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 percent of the country is mountainous and only 7 percent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need.
