To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj.

loans.use: Purchasing seed and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn E. is a resident in the village of Rizal in Santiago City. She is 30 years old and married to Ronal who works as a security guard. The couple was blessed with two healthy children: Ardie - 9 years old, presently in elementary level; and Angelo - 6 years old, also in elementary level.  

Arlyn manages her own village store and she has been in this business for less than a month. She is hoping to improve her business by seeking financial assistance from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP4, 000. She plans to use her loan to purchase stock in bulk for her store. 

She is so excited to see developments in her business. She believes that through hard work and patience, she will be able to sustain her business for a long time. She is thankful that her husband is very supportive and their children also do well in their studies, thus Arlyn is inspired to work harder.

loans.use: To purchase stock in bulk.

loans.name: Abiba

texts.en:
Abiba I. is 35 years old. She is married and has two children. Currently her children are in school in the community where they live. She lives with her husband who is a farmer. Abiba never had the opportunity to attend school when she was a child due to financial challenges. It is her dream to see her children in tertiary education through her and her husband's efforts.

She prepares and sells kose in a nearby porridge joint where most people buy the porridge and the kose. Porridge is one of the local foods enjoyed popularly as breakfast by almost all Ghanaians. It is prepared from milled maize or millet grains, boiled and taken with sugar, milk and bread or taking with what we call kose. Kose is prepared from milled beans and it is fried with cooking oil so in just about 20 minutes it is ready to be served with the porridge.

With a large customer base, Abiba wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, millet, beans, vegetable oil, pepper etc. to increase production. She hopes to make a good income to support her kids in school. She treks to tachiman in the Brong Ahafo region to buy her supply of goods. Abiba belongs to a village bank called 1st Kings.

loans.use: Ingredients for porridge and kose

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.en:
M. Phạm Thị (802990047) is a 46-year-old woman living in the town of Nam Định. She is married and has 3 school-aged children. To making a living, M. owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. M. has been engaged in this business for over 8 years and earns approximately 4,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 1999, M. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. M. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. M. is now requesting a new loan of 20,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. The loan will be the 10th loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. M. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business

loans.use: used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Ian

texts.en:
Ian G. lives in the village of Cabungaan Clarin Misamis Occidental. He is 30 years old, married and has three young children. To make a living, he owns and operates a farm whose main crop is coconuts. Ian has been in his business for more than three years.

In 2008, Ian joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services that could improve his living standards and ability to engage in business activities. Ian has successfully repaid previous loans from GDMPC, and is requesting a new one to invest in expanding his business. This loan will be his fourth from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue made possible by this loan to meet his growing family's basic needs. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to expand and improve his farm

loans.name: Jeannine

texts.en: Jeannine B. has a dinnerware business, selling plates and other dishes and glassware. She is twenty-eight years old and married with one five-year-old child. Jeannine and her husband both work to earn a living for their family. Working from 7am to 8pm every day, she currently makes an income of 327,000 FRW (~ USD $654). Jeannine has requested a 500,000 FRW (USD $1000) loan to help expand her business. She also has plans to begin saving money from the profits of the loan. Jeannine has had two previous loans with Vision Finance Company since she started up her business in 2006. She has since hired two employees.

loans.use: To buy dinnerware to sell

loans.name: Lok

texts.en:
Mrs. Lok L., 29, lives in a rural area of Siem Reap Province. She currently earns her daily revenue by selling fresh fishes and some meats to villagers in front of her home. Her husband, Mr. Tun Pouv, age 28, works in building. The couple has one young child who is of school age.

This family faces difficulty with transportation because they have no own vehicle. Therefore, Lok L. would like a loan to buy a used motor for her family’s traveling needs; it will be used to support her business as well.

loans.use: To buy a used motor for her family’s traveling needs and for her business

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth E. owns a small rice farm in Bunawan Agusan Del Sur. She helps her husband till the land. Farming is their only source of income. Their harvest is intended for family consumption. The excess of their harvest is sold to the neighbors.

She is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy complete fertilizer and rice seeds. She thinks that this move will help increase her harvest and income. In that way, she believes, she will be able to provide the needs of their home.

Now she is actively participating in the CEVI credit program. She receives loans, training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy complete fertilizer and rice seeds

loans.name: Georgina

texts.es:
Préstamo anterior: http://partners.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id= 102239&_tpos=7&_tpg=1
Georgina es socia del Bancomunal El Triunfo. 
Georgina  tiene su hija de un año y esto le impide trabajar a tiempo completo en el negocio por que tiene que cuidar a su hija todavía esta muy pequeña y  trabaja vendiendo  por pedidos loceria y útiles de limpieza.     
 Georgina  necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles,   para la compra de loceria, tazas, platos cubiertos.
El préstamo le ayuda por que ella compra al contado y da facilidades de pago a sus clientas.
El sueño de Georgina es poner una tienda.
texts.en:
Click HERE to see the previous loan.

Georgina is a member of El Triunfo (The Triumph) Communal Bank. She has a one year old daughter, which prevents her from working full-time. Since she has to care for her daughter while she is still young, she sells utensils and cleaning supplies upon order.

Georgina needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy dishes, cups, plates, and cutlery. The loan will help her pay cash for the merchandise so that she can allow her customers to purchase on credit. She dreams of opening her own store.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase dishes, cups, plates, and cutlery

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Mrs. Editha C. is residing at Migcanaway Tangub City, blessed with 4 children. Her husband just passed away in June 2009 due to cardiac arrest. In spite of the adversity that arises, she still pursued to handle their business of buying and selling fish, shrimp and crab as their source of living.

She started their business 25 years ago, together with her husband, and this was their source of income to educate their 4 children. She joined PMPC last January 2008 because she admires the programs and services that the coop offered to the members like savings, insurance and loan products.

This is her second loan and her first loan was P 50,000.00 with a good record of repayment. Right now she is applying for her second loan in the amount of Php 40,000.00 as additional capital for buying and selling her fish, shrimp and crab.

Her future plan for her family is to be able to finish their house and have a provident living.

loans.use: Additional capital to purchase fish, shrimp and crab

loans.name: Musoto Nelima Petwa Group

texts.en: N. Petwa is Musoto group’s chairperson; she is aged thirty-three years and married with three children all going to school and looking after six dependents. She deals with local brew business which she has been selling for over ten years. She is using the loan to purchase maize flour, millet, and yeast for formation of local brew and more so she buys crates of beer, sodas, water, etc to cater for the demands of her customers. She is a promising lady whose dream is to construct a house.

loans.use: To purchase maize flour, millet, and yeast for formation of local brew and more so she buys crates of beer, sodas, water, etc to cater for the demands of her customers.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina P. is from the village of Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 40 years old. Rosalina is married and has seven adult children. To make a living, Rosalina owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Rosalina has been in business for over three years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month.

In 2009, Rosalina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalina is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Rosalina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La señora FRANCISCA C. D. C. , tiene 55  años, vive en el distrito D. Trujillo, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco Comunal BELLAVISTA.
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 6to  D. Primaria  refiere que ella es D. Contumaza y que antiguamente no iban muchos profesores a enseñar por eso no culmino sus estudios.
La socia es casada  y tiene 7 hijos D. los cuales 3 dependen económicamente D. ella.
FRANCISCA se dedica a la venta bebidas y golosinas D. forma ambulatoria.
El primer crédito D. 300 nuevos soles lo invirtió en la compra D. más golosinas y bebidas como; gaseosas, jugos, refrescos, etc.
Este crédito D. 500 nuevos soles lo utilizará en la compra D. mas productos (bebidas y golosinas)y una vitrina para su negocio.
La empresaria sueña aumentar sus ventas y así poder obtener más dinero.

loans.use: compra de mas productos (bebidas y golosinas) y una vitrina

loans.name: Francis Kamau

texts.en:
Francis Kamau K. is 63 years old, and married with 8 children.

Twenty one years ago, Francis purchased a plot of land and over the years he has developed his housing-rental business.

This is his 6th loan from KADET and with it he will buy materials (cement, sand, stones) and labor to expand his rental building.

Francis has recently diversified his income sources by expanding into farming (wheat, maize and beans). His next venture, he hopes, will be the transportation industry

About KADET
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their families across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: Buy materials and labor to expand his rental building.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es: El señor Vicente F. vive con su esposa y familia, su esposa la señora Norma Alicia Medrano labora para un editorial desde hace 1 año como gerente de recursos humanos, el señor Vicente tiene su propio negocio de venta de muebles seminuevos establecido desde hace 11 años. Y están tramitando este crédito para la inversión al negocio en compra de más mercancía como pedidos de muebles que sus clientes le han solicitado.
texts.en:
Mr. Vicente F. lives with his wife and family. His wife Mrs. Norma Alicia Medrano has worked for an editorial company as a human resources manager for the last year.

Mr. Vincente runs his own business selling pre-owned furniture and has been in this business for 11 years. He is asking for a loan that will be invested to buy more merchandise that his customers have requested.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
La señora  ANA MARIA L. C., tiene  37 años, vive en el distrito de BUENOS AIRES provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal MUJERES EMPRENDEDORAS II.  Ella presenta estudios hasta 3ero de secundaria, refiere que dejó de estudiar porque se casó a la edad de 18 años, es conviviente y  tiene 2 hijos quienes dependen económicamente de ella. La socia se dedica  a la venta de leche y de menús (alimentos).
Este es su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles y lo utilizará para comprar arroz, azúcar, fideos y alimentos para las vacas para que así produzcan mayor cantidad de leche y aumentar  sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Sra. Ana Maria L. C. is 37 years old and lives in the District of Buenos Aires, Trujillo Province, Department of La Libertad – Perú. She is a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres Emprendedoras II” (Enterprising Women II). Ana Maria completed her education through the third year of secondary school. She left school because she got married when she was 18 years old and now has two children who are financially dependent on her.

Ana Maria sells milk and prepared foods. She is receiving her first loan in the amount of 300 soles and will buy rice, sugar, noodles, and feed for her cows so that they can continue producing large quantities of milk. This will enable her to increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, noodles, and feed for her cows

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 49 years old and is married with three children. Her husband sells beef to support the household. 

Grace owns a restaurant where she sells groceries, Nigerian cooked foods and drinks to make a living. Her primary customers are residents, neighbors and friends. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase more drinks and foodstuffs to cook and sell. 

She wakes up daily at 4:30 am to start the preparation of her cooked foods. She sells for long hours to enable her to meet the basic needs of her family members. 

Grace is a committed LAPO client. LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. 

She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and drinks to sell

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
El cliente tiene la actividad de guia de turistas actividad que desarrolla  realizando viajes a distintos lugares  de nuestro departamento como el lago titicaca que se caracteriza por ser el lago mas alto del mundo y por tener mucha historia,Las ruinas de la cultura Tiahuanacota, El Nevado del Illimani, etc ya que nuestro Pais tiene distintos lugares turisticos.

El Sr. Julio vive en casa de sus padres es por esta razon que parte del credito sera para ayudar a su mamá en el equipamiento de su peluqueria, el  nucleo familiar esta compuesta por el y sus tres hijos 						
							
Para tener mayor informacion sobre el Lago TITICACA visita la siguiente pagina http://www.caminandosinrumbo.com/bolivia/titicaca/index.htm						
						
Para tener mayor informacion sobre la cultura tiahuanacotas visita la siguiente pagina:  http://www.gabrielbernat.es/peru/preinca/cultpreincaicas/dregionales/TIAHUANACO/tiahuanaco.html						
						
Para tener mayor informacion sobre el nevado del illimani visita la siguiente pagina: http://es.wikipedia.org/wiki/Illimani
texts.en:
The client is a Tourist Guide who creates trips to various places in our state like Lake Titicaca, which is the highest lake in the world and has a lot of history, the ruins of the Tiahuanacota culture, Illimani mountain, etc. as our country has many tourist destinations. Julio lives in his parent’s home and part of the loan will be used to help his mom equip her hair salon. His family consists of himself and his three children. For more information about Lake Titicaca visit the following page: http://www.caminandosinrumbo.com/bolivia/titicaca/index.htm For more information about the Tiahuanacotas culture visit the following page: http://www.gabrielbernat.es/peru/preinca/cultpreincaicas/dregionales/TIAHUANACO/tiahuanaco.html For more information about Illimani mountain visit the following page: http://es.wikipedia.org/wiki/Illimani

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy camping equipment for tourism business

loans.name: Luz De Bendicion 3 Group

texts.en:
Mabel, 23, is a borrower who lives in Los Alcarrizos, Dominican Republic. She is the coordinator for her group, Luz de Bendicion (Light of Blessing), and her story is representative of those in her group and other Dominican and Haitian borrowers at Esperanza International.

Mabel is a single mother of three and runs a nail salon from her home in Los Alcarrizos. Los Alcarrizos is a community on the outskirts of Santo Domingo, the capital of the Dominican Republic. Those living in the Dominican Republic have no access to running potable water, and electricity and healthcare are unreliable at best. Despite these difficulties, Mabel is taking out this loan, her first with Esperanza International, in hopes of improving her life and the lives of her children.

Specifically, Mabel will be using this loan to purchase equipment for her nail salon. She hopes to make something of herself through her work while giving “a future to her children so they can become useful to society”. She hopes to one day buy an inverter for her home; power outages are a daily occurrence in the Dominican Republic (if one has power to begin with), and an inverter would give her family power when there is no electricity. Mabel has high hopes for her nail salon, and with your loan she can attain those hopes. Thank you for lending to Mabel and the Luz de Bendicion group!

loans.use: Beauty supplies, nail equipment

loans.name: Yashar

texts.en:
Yashar A. is a young man, 32 years old, who is married and has one child. He and his family live in Fuzuli region.

Yashar has been in his clothing business for six years. Now, he needs a loan of 2,000 AZN to expand his sales area to improve his business.

loans.use: To expand his sales area

loans.name: Kudirat

texts.en: Kudirat sells body cream and groceries at retail prices. She loves this business because it is highly profitable. She is 50 years old and married with two children. Her husband is a businessman, and he also supports their home. She has been in this business for a long time. She is requesting a loan of N80,000 to purchase more body cream to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more body cream to sell

loans.name: Teresita's Group

texts.en: Teresita D. is from the village of F.. She is 45 years old and is the group leader of a twenty-one-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Teresita D.’s Group. Teresita is married and has three adult children. She owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling used clothes in the local community. She is just starting this business. In 2010, Teresita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from ASKI. Teresita plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Phoebe

texts.en:
Phoebe B. is from the village of San Antonio. She is 29 years old and married with 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Phoebe runs a general store selling a variety of different products to the local community. Phoebe has been in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

Phoebe joined PMPC in 2007 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Phoebe has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC which she used to purchase additional products to sell. Phoebe is now requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to be used to purchase new items, expanding her product offering. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Phoebe from PMPC and the second through KIVA.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand the product offering in her store.

loans.name: Ramón Ignacio

texts.es:
En el barrio Germán pomares  Municipio de Somotillo 
El señor R. M.realiza su trabajo como recolector de los impuestos de los pagos de bienes y muebles dándoles atención a todos los clientes de las comarcas y alos del casco urbano.
 El quiere el crédito para comprar una puerta de hierro para su casa de habitación y de esta manera dar seguridad a su familia
texts.en:
In the Germán Pomares neighborhood in the Somotillo municipality. Mr R. M.works as a property tax collector covering all regional clients and those in the urban area. He wants the loan to buy an iron door for his home so that his family is more secure.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy an iron door for his home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of peanut

loans.name: Pedro Antonio

texts.es: Don Pedro es padre de familia de tres hijos, estudiantes, tiene 61 años de edad, comerciante su negocio es la venta de granos básicos como: frijoles, arroz, azúcar, maíz, pollo, apoyándolo su esposa con las ventas. Inicio con dinero de ahorro y su liquidación de su trabajo anterior. Cuando lo hizo comenzó con una pulpería, pero luego giro el negocio mas a la venta de granos básicos en cantidad, como la venta de pollo, es por eso necesita comprar otro freezer para poder cubrir la demanda de la venta de pollo, a si como la compra de una vitrina para lucir sus productos. Con esto espera aumentar las ventas, e invertir en más productos de consumo diario. El beneficio de estos financiamientos es que ha logrado aumentar las ventas como equilibrar su negocio.
texts.en:
Don Pedro is the head of a family of three children, all in school. He is 61 years old and operates a business selling basic staples: beans, rice, sugar, maize, chicken. His wife helps him with sales. He started the business with savings and a redundancy payment that he received from a former employer. He started with a small grocery, but then switched to selling larger volumes of basic staples. Chicken, for example, and it's for chicken sales that he needs a loan because he wants to buy another freezer to store enough chickens to meet demand. He also wants to buy a display case for his products. He hopes to increase his sales and invest in more supplies of basic staples. The advantage of these loans is that he has been able to use them to rebalance the business as well as increase his sales.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a freezer to increase chicken sales.

loans.name: Jose Martin

texts.es:
Jose Martín tiene 26 años de edad, es casado y vive junto a su familia en el caserío La Pava del distrito de Mochumí, un distrito agrícola que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y que se encuentra ubicado a cuarenta minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de un año a brindar servicio de transporte en una mototaxi (vehículo para transportar carga y pasajeros que consiste en una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina) el suele brindar su servicio cubriendo las rutas que unen a su caserío con el pueblo de Mohumí, esta actividad goza de muy buena acogida ya que el caserío donde vive se encuentra alejado del pueblo y además porque consta de varios grupos de viviendas alejadas entre sí. 

Adicionalmente el se genera mas ingresos vendiendo productos de primera necesidad en una bodega instalada en casa de su madre, por otro lado también se dedica a la agricultura, los ingresos que percibe de estas actividades le sirven para solventar los gastos diarios de su familia y sacarlos adelante.

José desea brindarle mantenimiento a su vehículo y comprar mas productos de modo que pueda ampliar su bodega, por ello ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su meta.

José es trabajador, emprendedor y siempre se encuentra buscando nuevas formas de sacar a su familia adelante. El ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
José Martín is 26 years old. He is married and lives with his family in the La Pava hamlet in the Mochumí district, an agricultural district in the Lambayaque province, 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. He has been a mototaxi driver for more than one year. (A mototaxi consists of a motorcycle with a compartment to transport passengers and cargo.) He provides service along the routes between the hamlet and the town of Mohumí. This business does well, especially since the hamlet is located far from the town and there are several neighborhoods there. He also earns additional income by selling basic need items from a store that he runs out of his mother’s home. He also farms. The money from these activities help him afford his family’s daily expenses and help to move them ahead. José wants to provide maintenance on his vehicle and buy more products to be able to expand his store. He is requesting a loan of 1,500 PEN ($525) through Edpume Alternative to help him to reach his goal. José is hard working, enterprising, and always seeking new ways to move his family ahead. He has worked with our institution in the past and he has shown great responsibility in making his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Confiando En Dios Group

texts.es:
el grupo Confiando en Dios esta integrado por tres personas, vecinos del barrio Alto Verde de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, se han constituido como grupo para solicitar un credito, a continuacion se detallan las diferentes actividades que ellos realizan:

la señora Asuncion Agustina F. H. tiene 38 años de edad, vive en union libre con el señor Sebastian Morales, dependen de ellos tres hijos, no tienen casa propia,  alquilan el lugar en donde viven, la señora Asuncion se dedica a elaboracion y venta de golosinas como ser tajaditas de platano con chismol, pastelitos, tacos etc. esta solicitando el credito para compra de la materia prima para elaborar las golosinas. 
su mayor sueño es tener su casa propia.

el sr. Carlos Agusto M. H. tiene 31 años de edad, es soltero y vive con sus padres. se dedica a moler maiz, tiene un molino con motor, tiene 6 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad.
el credito lo va a utilizar para la compra de repuestos para el molino.

la señora Santos Francisca F. H. tiene 33 años de edad, vive en union libre con el señor Juan Manuel Cruz, dependen de ellos 2 hijos, Santos Francisca se dedica a la venta de refrescos, charamuscas, churros, etc. el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas refrescos, churros y materiales para fabricar las charamuscas.
texts.en:
The "Confiando en Dios" ("Trusting in God") group is made up of three individuals who are neighbors in the Alto Verde neighborhood in the city of San Lorenzo. They have come together as a group to request a loan. Details of their different activities are as follows: Ms. Asuncion Agustina F. H. is 38 years old and lives in a common-law marriage with Mr. Sebastian Morales. They have three children and they do not own their own house, so they rent their living space. Ms. Asuncion makes and sells snacks like sliced banana with chismol (salsa), pastries, tacos, etc. She is requesting a loan to buy ingredients to make her snacks. Her greatest dream is to own her own house. Mr. Carlos Agusto M. H. is 31 years old, single, and lives with his parents. For the last six years, he has worked milling corn flour. He has a motorized mill and he will use this loan to buy spare parts for his mill. Ms. Santos Francisca F. H. is 33 years old and lives with her common-law husband, Mr. Juan Manuel Cruz. They have two children. Santos Francisca sells sodas, charamuscas (plastic bags of frozen juice or soda), churros, etc. She will use this loan to buy more sodas, churros, and materials to make charamuscas.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood, sugar, bananas, butter, vegetables, sodas, corn flour, oil, spare parts for a flour mill, plastic bags, fruit, and artificial flavors

loans.name: Bun

texts.en: Mrs. Bun T. started selling fish in her busy local market a number of years ago and has gained a lot of customers from this business. She is a single mother blessed with four teenage children; most of them help meet the family’s expenses by working in a restaurant. With this loan, Bun T. hopes to be able to buy fish in greater quantities for resale. With the extra profits, she hopes to improve her family's standard of traveling by buying an old motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy fish in greater quantities for resale

loans.name: Siguidiale 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe Siguidialé 1 sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans, en moyenne 4 enfants et  vivant majoritairement dans des familles polygames à Koba, un des villages de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités hivernales. 
Les spéculations sont l’arachide, le petit mil, le maïs et le haricot. Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne, les prêts passés se sont bien dénoués.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, DJENEBA F. compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir 1hectare d’arachide et de haricot.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du village de Nangola et environnants et la ville de Dioïla après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 45.000FCFA en fin de campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Siguidialé 1 group are married women with an average age of 45 and an average of four children. Mostly, they live in polygamous families in Koba, a village in the prefecture of Dioila, Koulikoro region (Mali's Second Administrative District). They work with Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of better organizing their activities as the rainy season begins. They grow peanuts, millet, corn and beans. This will be their third seasonal loan. Their previous loans have been fully repaid. With this new loan, Djeneba F. will buy fertilizer and small tools and pay for hired labor to work one hectare of peanuts and beans. The harvest will be sold in the village of Nangola and the surrounding area and in the town of Dioila to both men and women. The group members hope for an average profit of CFA 45,000 at the end of the season.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay hired labor, buy fertilizer and small tools

loans.name: Lene

texts.en:
Lene A. is a 53-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating 2 business ventures:  general store and food vending businesses. She lives in Brgy. Magballo, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental.

She is a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store and food vending businesses, Lene is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 6,000 Php. 

Lene is now borrowing PHP 25,000 so that she can buy more stock for her general store, and she also intends to use part of her loan to buy fishing gear to start a fishing business.  This will be her 13th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of P19,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Lene aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  'Dungganon' way. 

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the  NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Jeffer Alcides

texts.es: El señor Jeffer, se dedica al servicio de transporte colectivo en una unidad de bus, por más de siete años, es casado y tiene un hijo de un año, con las ganancias de este servicio mantiene su hogar y su familia, pues él trabaja muy duro para proporcionarle a su familia el alimento diario. Solicita un nuevo financiamiento para poder darle mantenimiento a la unidad de transporte como: tapizado a los asiento, chequeo de la unidad y un poco de pintura. Todo esto para brindar una mejor comodidad a sus clientes y buscar cómo obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Jeffer has been a bus driver for more than seven years. He is married and has a one-year-old son. He uses his earnings to support his family and cover their household expenses. He works very hard to provide his family with their daily bread. He is requesting a new loan to be able to do some maintenance work on his bus, such as reupholstering the seats, a tune-up, and a new paint job. This will provide his customers with more comforts and will enable him to increase his income.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Naser

texts.en:
Naser is a 42-year-old father of four daughters and one son. Naser started a shop selling poultry in Ramallah city. He slaughters and prepares chicken for cooking. Naser also works in the Ministry of Labor. Naser received a loan from FATEN before and has repaid it fully, Naser needed to fix the shop and make a few changes, therefore he took a $1,500 loan from FATEN.

Naser has noticed an increase in his income since starting the shop where he appears in the picture. This has helped him provide his family's needs.

loans.use: To fix the shop

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en: Alejandra G. is from the village of Burgos. She is 52 years old and is married with two adult children. Alejandra owns and operates a business raising pigs for fattening and sale. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP whenever she sells a raised pig. In 2009, Alejandra joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. Alejandra is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. This loan will be her 3rd from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Jenie

texts.en:
Jenie C. is 32 years old, married and has two school-aged children. She is from the town of Banga in South Cotabato province on the Mindanao islands. Jenie raises pigs for fattening and sale.

Jenie joined CEVI to gain access to its financial services. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Jenie is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase piglets to raise and sell in the future. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase piglets

loans.name: María Graciela

texts.es:
La Señora María A. es socia del banco comunal La Paz, vive en la parroquia de Quinta Chica en donde su población se dedica a la cría de animales, mucha de su población emigra a la ciudad o al exterior en busca de un trabajo que les ayude a mejorar la economía de sus hogares.
 
Doña María se encuentra en su segundo crédito en la banca comunal, fue invitada por una amiga a formar parte de este gran grupo de mujeres luchadoras. Nuestra socia se dedica a la elaboración y venta de comida rápida, actividad que la viene realizando hace 16 años, trabaja de lunes a sábado desde las 7 de la noche hasta las 11 de la noche, dedicándose el resto de su tiempo a los quehaceres de su hogar.

La Señora. María tiene 45 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos de 26, 24, 22 y 17 años de edad, el primero y tercero de sus hijos son casados, su hija casada vive en su casa y comparten gastos, su segundo hijo trabaja y está  ahorrando para sacar su titulo de Ingeniero en Sistemas y su ultimo hijo estudia en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo trabaja como empleado privado. No tienen casa propia por lo que viven en casa de un familiar que le ha prestado.

El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de papas, tarinas, pan, etc. para elaborar su comida rápida.
 
Su meta es comprarse un vehículo.
texts.en:
Mrs. María A. is a member of the La Paz Communal Bank; she lives in the Quinta Chica area where most of the people breed animals. Most of the population emigrates to the city or abroad to find work so that they can improve their household income.

This is Mrs. María’s second loan in the communal bank, she was invited to be a part of it by a friend, and they are a group of hardworking women. Our member works making fast food, work that she has been doing for some 16 years, she works from Monday to Saturday from 7 p.m. until 11 p.m. the rest of the time she dedicates to housework.

Mrs. María is 45 years old, is married and has 4 children of 26, 24, 22 and 17 years of age. The first and third of her children are married, her married daughter lives with her and they share in the household expenses and the second son works and is saving up to have his Computer Science degree, her youngest son is attending high school in the city. Her husband works as a private employee. They don’t own their home and live in a house that a relative loaned them.

The money from the loan will be used to buy potatoes, tarinas (middle-sized plate for meat), bread, etc. to make her fast food.

María’s goal is to buy a car.

loans.use: To buy bread, potatoes, meat, tarinas, etc.

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is a widowed woman with one child who attends school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, electricity, the water bill and school fees for the family.

For over eight years, she has operated a restaurant and fresh water sale business from home. Her potential customers are neighbours and passersby. Mwanaisha faces the challenge of competition from other restaurant operators. She hopes to open her own hotel in the future. 

Mwanaisha decided to join Yehu to access loans. With the 15,000 KES she wants to purchase wheat flour, baking flour and cooking oil for her restaurant.

loans.use: To purchase flour and cooking oil for her restaurant

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline C. is from the village of Tabon. She is 36 years old, married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Evangeline owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling seafood products  including fish and shrimp in the local community. Evangeline has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Evangeline joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evangeline has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Evangeline is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Evangeline from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es: Hugo, de 37 años, convive con Encarnación de 25 años. Ambos tienen 3 hijos: Yelsi, de 14, Nicol, de 12 y Paola, de 4 años de edad. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad de Sanchirio el palomar (selva central peruana). El trabajo que realiza, Hugo es la siembra de café y plátano, ya tiene 7 años dedicándose a ello, y según afirma lo que más le gusta a él es poder limpiar su terreno agrícola, “me divierte, quitar la maleza de la tierra”, menciona. Cada 15 días viaja a la ciudad de La Merced, donde vende los plátanos que cosecha, pero su producción de café, los vende a los acopiadores que constantemente visitan sus cultivos. A Hugo le falta capital, para mejorar la calidad de sus plantaciones, por ello más adelante quiere abrir un negocio de comestibles en su comunidad, con el que piensa generar nuevos ingresos y así invertir en la agricultura. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, y le agrada el trabajo que desarrolla junto a su banco comunal, pues en este corto tiempo pudo lograr mejoras en sus cultivos. De adquirir el crédito solicitado tiene pensado comprar 13 sacos de abono orgánico, para sus plantaciones de café, que en esto meses cosechará.
texts.en:
Hugo is 37 years old.  He lives with 25 year-old Encarnación and they have 3 children: 14 year-old Yelsi, 12 year-old Nicol and 4 year-old Paola.  They live together in their own home in the community of Sanchirio el Palomar (central Peruvian jungle).

Hugo's work is growing coffee and bananas.  He has been in this business for 7 years and he says that what he most likes is cleaning his farm lands. “I enjoy getting rid of the weeds”, he says.  Every 15 days, Hugo travels to the city of La Merced where he sells the bananas which he harvests.  However, he sells his coffee production to traders who constantly visit his crops.

Hugo lacks capital to improve the quality of his plantations.  In the future, he would like to open a food business in his community to make more income and thereby be able to invest in his farming.

This is Hugo's third loan from MFP and he likes the work that he does together with his community bank because in this short period of time he has managed to achieve improvements in his crops.  He will use his loan to buy 13 sacks of organic fertilizer for his coffee plantations which he will harvest in the coming months.

loans.use: To buy 13 sacks of organic fertilizer

loans.name: Mujeres Inteligentes 4 Group

texts.en:
Antonio is the coordinator of his group Mujeres Inteligentes 4, or  "Smart Women." This is a group of Haitian citizens who are now located in an area of  Puerto Plata, a port town on the north coast where the economy is based on tourism. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable electricity and running water.  The water is not potable.

Antonio makes his home in a simple structure with his long-term partner and  4 children. He says that his most difficult challenges have been settling in a foreign city and helping his family.  He plans to continue doing business and enjoying the time he spends with his children.

Antonio is excited to be taking out his third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid his previous loan and growing his business. He has had his business for 8 years, starting with a candy stand. He plans to use this loan to purchase 3 bags of rice, 2 bags of sugar, 3 big cans of oil and beans for his business. He will use the profits to paint his home and to cover some expenses with his partner for Christmas. He is dreaming of improving his business and returning to Haiti to do a good business there.
 
This Esperanza associate began with us because his Colmado (a small food market) needed capital to grow in products. His story is representative of his group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally.

loans.use: To buy rice, beans, oil and sugar

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 27-year-old man engaged to be married. He is from Lebanon. He has been working in the agriculture field for ten years, and he has been running his own farm since 2003. He works independently in his business and he lives on his own.  

He cultivates vegetables and he purchases agriculture products from a local agriculture shop. He works hard to earn a good income to be able to prepare for his wedding and a home for his soon-to-be wife. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l.  to purchase additional agriculture tools needed to improve his business level and so his lifestyle. He estimates that the loan will help him increase his harvest for the coming season.

loans.use: to purchase additional agriculture tools

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 49-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and one young child who is attending school. He has been working as a freelance construction agent since 1992. He is the only income source in his family. He works closely with some contractors. He is very positive about his future and hopes to take more profitable construction projects. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase an air compressor and a crane to expand his business operation, allowing him to increase his income.

loans.use: To purchase an air compressor and a crane

loans.name: Niyasbek

texts.en:
Niyasbek D. is a 55-year-old farmer who lives in the north of Kyrgyzstan. He is married and has two children. 

Niyasbek has been engaged in cattle breeding for 23 years. He started this activity with the initial capital of only 1,500 KGS, which he used to purchase three sheep.  Owing to his persistent and hardworking personality, Niyasbek has managed to multiply his investments. Today, his farm brings in 20,000 KGS per month in profit through the sale of meat and milk products. With the revenues from his business, he has been able to give his children a good education. 

Niyasbek plans to use this loan of 70,000 KGS to increase the number of cattle to fatten and resell.  

About Bai-Tushum and Partners
Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Sergio Antonio

texts.es: El  Sr S.  labora como fontanero es casado tiene  tres persona a su cargo, es el primer crédito que CEPRODEL le otorga, agradece el apoyo que  brinda esta institución con  este  desembolso para realizar  compra de  materiales  de construcción bloque, cemento, arena, hierro, piedrín, estribo, alambre y pago de mano de obra para construir baño en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Sr. S. works as a plumber. He is married and has three people for whom he is responsible. This is his first loan from CEPRODEL.

He is grateful for the support CEPRODEL has provided so that he can buy construction materials such as blocks, cement, sand, iron, gravel, brackets, and wire. Sergio will also pay for labor to build a bathroom in his home.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials & pay for labor to build a bathroom

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married woman with four children, two of whom attend school while two have already graduated from school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Mariam has operated a business selling clothes from home for the past three years, selling to her neighbors, especially women. Mariam hopes to establish a clothes wholesale shop in the future. She plans to use this KES 40,000 loan to purchase bundles of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu because of the simplicity of becoming a member.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of clothes for resale

loans.name: Henry Antonio

texts.es: Henry de 45 años de edad casado, labora para ALcaldia de Juigalpa como maestro de Obra desde hace 2 años. Esta solicitando su 2do credito con el objetivo cambiar el techo de su casa que esta en mal estado, pues como estamos en verano es mas facil cambiarlo para cuando llegue el invierno evitar que se le moje su casa. Cabe señalar que el credito anterior lo utilizo para cercar su propiedad.
texts.en: Henry, who is 45 years old and married, has worked as a project supervisor for the Mayor's Office of Juigalpa for the last 2 years.  He is requesting his 2nd loan with the purpose of replacing the roof of his house which is in bad repair.  Since it is currently summer, it it easier to replace it now than when winter comes and his house would get wet.  It is worth noting that the previous loan was used to fence in his property.

loans.use: to replace his roof.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice lives in the Sémé-Podji district of Cotonou, Benin's largest city. She lives with her husband Léonard and their four children. All of their children are schooled.

For the past 8 years Anita has sold condiment products from her stall in her district. This is her fourth loan with ALIDE following successful past repayments and will allow her to purchase stock in bulk from Tokpa, Benin's largest market. Her aim is to strengthen her business in the short term.

loans.use: to purchase stock of condiments

loans.name: Marelly Cristina

texts.es:
Marelly  tiene 28 años de edad, de estado civil casada tiene dos 2 hijos (esposo trabaja para La Junta de Usuarios Chancay Lambayeque). Vive en casa Propia  en el distrito de Picsi ciudad pequeña en vías de crecimiento.  Distrito ubicado en la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del departamento de Lambayeque.

La actividad que desarrolla el titular es la venta de ropa y calzado en la modalidad reparto a pedidos, desde hace mas de 5 años, el préstamo lo solicita para aumentar su capital de trabajo, específicamente para comprar vestimenta de campaña escolar. Esta actividad es de mucha ayuda para la economía de su familia y gracias a ella ayuda a su esposo con el mantenimiento de la economía diaria.

Marelly desea adquirir más mercadería para ampliar su negocio y aumentar su nivel de ventas y ganancias, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en: Marelly is 28 years old, married, with two children. Her husband works for the “The Chancay Lambayeque User’s Board”. She lives in her own house in the Picsi District, a small city that is growing. The district is located in the in the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque Department. For the past five years Marelly has been selling clothes and shoes that are pre-ordered by her customers. She is asking for this loan in order to increase her working capital, specifically to buy school clothing. This business is very helpful to the finances of her family, as it helps her husband pay their bills. Marelly would like to buy more merchandise in order to expand her business and increase her level of sales and earnings. With this in mind, she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1500 new soles, which will help Marelly reach her objectives.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
Este comité se formó gracias a la señora Olga R., ella es una señora muy amable y activa, vive en su propia casita, es soltera pero siempre supo salir adelante a pesar de todo.
Ella es modista y solicitó el crédito para poder agrandar su negocio ya que eso le ayudaría bastante, comprando telas, lienzos, tijeras, y todos aquellos materiales de trabajo que le hacen falta.
Este comité es un grupo antiguo que a pesar de tener pequeños problemas supieron salir siempre adelante. La señora Olga al empezar el grupo fue una integrante más sin destacarse, pero luego la eligieron como la presidenta del grupo y supo llevar muy bien al grupo por el camino de la perseverancia y prosperidad, se enteró por medio de otros grupos acerca de Kiva y le interesó bastante comunicandose con la fundación, ella recorrió casa por casa en su barrio para conformar el grupo. 
Este es un grupo muy unido, juntas decidieron realizar actividades cada mes para obtener su caja chica, todas ellas tienen su micro-empresa.
Ellas son del Barrio Villa Bonita  de la Ciudad de Villa Elisa, sus metas son sacar siempre adelante al grupo, a sus micro-empresas y también a sus familias.
texts.en:
This committee was founded thanks to Olga R..  Olga is a very kind and active woman who lives in her own small home.  She is single but has always known how to get ahead in spite of everything.

Olga is a dressmaker and she requested this loan so that she could expand her business since it would help her a lot.  She will buy fabrics, linen, scissors and other work materials that she needs.

This committee is a long-standing group which, in spite of the small problems that they have had, have always known how to get ahead.  When Olga started the group, she was just another member and didn't stand out at all.  However, she was elected president of the group and has led the group very well along the road of perseverance and prosperity.  She found out about Kiva through other groups and was interested.  She spoke with Fundación Paraguaya and went house to house in her neighborhood to form a group.

This is a very united group.  Together they decided to carry out activities each month in order to add to their petty cash.  Each member owns her own small business.

The women live in Villa Bonita neighborhood, in the city of Villa Elisa.  Their goals are to always work in order to get ahead with their group, their small businesses and also their families.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, linen, scissors and other dressmaking supplies

loans.name: Luis Alfonso

texts.es:
Luis es un hombre de negocio, de profesión mecánico, que con esfuerzo, logro poner su propio negocio con más de ocho años de experiencia en las ventas de piezas de vehículos usados como nuevas.
Atreves de los préstamos compra más productos de oferta, el cual da a precios accesibles a sus clientes. Lo que le ha generado mayores ventas al vender más barato. Gracias Afodenic ha logrado el objetivo.
Hoy en día como padre esta satisfecho por poder dar a su familia un poco de estabilidad. Sus tres hijos estudian para un porvenir mejor.
Las piezas a comprar: puertas delantera y trasera de carros, stop variado, bomber trasero y delantero. Teniendo en existencia mucho productos. Y que espera seguir aumentando
texts.en:
Luis is a businessman who is a mechanic by profession. With effort, he was able to establish his own business. He has more than eight years of experience selling new and used vehicle parts.

Luis utilized his loans to buy more products to offer so that he could keep prices affordable for his customers. By selling goods at a cheaper price, he has been able to generate more sales. It was with the help from AFODENIC that he was able to achieve this goal.

As a father, Luis is pleased that today he can provide his family a little bit of stability. His three children are studying so that they can have a better future.

Luis plans to buy front and rear car doors, various types of brakes, and front and rear bumpers. He has many products in his inventory and he hopes that it keeps growing.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of new and used vehicle parts.

loans.name: María Rosalina

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal Las Cumpliditas, vive en el cantón Girón que es visitado por sus cascadas, su naturaleza y su rica gastronomía, su gente mantiene su cultura y tradiciones.
 
Doña María tiene 72 años, es viuda y tiene 4 hijos mayores de edad, tres de ellos son  casados e independientes, comparte los gastos con su hijo soltero. Con su sacrificio y trabajo ha logrado construir su casa propia.
 
La Señora. María se dedica a la venta de alimentos desde hace 55 años, vende todo tipo de granos secos como frejol, lenteja, garbanzo, habas, etc. labora de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo, tiene un puesto propio en un mercado de la ciudad.

Se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y su crédito lo va  a invertir en la compra de granos secos.
 
Su meta es crecer más en su negocio.
texts.en:
Señora. María is a member of the Las Cumpliditas (Little Bouquets) communal bank. She lives in the Girón canton, which is visited because of its waterfalls, natural beauty, and tasty cuisine. Her people maintain their culture and traditions.

Doña María is 72 years old. She is a widow with 4 grown children. Three of her children are married and independent. She shares household expenses with her unmarried son. As a result of sacrifice and hard work she has succeeded in building her own house.

Señora. María has been engaged in the sale of food for 55 years. She sells all types of dry grains, such as beans, lentils, garbanzos, faba beans, etc. She works seven days a week without a set schedule. She has her own stall in a market in the city.

This is the second loan she has had in the communal bank, and her loan will be invested in the purchase of dried grains. Her goal is to increase her business.

loans.use: to purchase dried grains such as beans, faba beans, garbanzos, lentils, etc.

loans.name: Maria Ines

texts.es:
Maria Ines tiene 55 años, es soltera, vive con los hijos  con 2 en el Recinto Agua Clara Perteneciente al Cantón Chillanes.

Los miembros de la V.R.C SANTA ROSA DE AGUA CLARA, está ubicada a 20 minutos de la oficina en Chillanes, esta constituida por 20 socios es el segundo crédito que solicitan a la cooperativa, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura siembran cacao y yuca, además se dedican al comercio.

Maria se dedica al comercio de venta de comida en el que vende desayunos, almuerzo y meriendas y platos a la carta. Las compras las realiza en Chillanes  y las vende todos los dias en un local arrendado.

El crédito le ayudará en la compra de alimentos para cocinar, el crédito le apoyado de manera que han incrementa las ventas de comida. Ha enfrentado desafíos como enfermedades de Maria Ines la falta de gente que le ayude en la cocina y los precios de la competencia. Su sueño es poder tener salud y vida para seguir trabajando y salir adelante.

En los tiempos libres o sea por las tardes conversar con las amigas para jugar cartas.
texts.en:
María Inés is 55 years old, single living with her two children in Agua Clara which is part of Chillanes Canton.

The “Santa Rosa de Agua Clara” communal bank is located 20 minutes from the Chillanes office.  It has 20 members and this is the second loan they’ve requested from the Cooperative.  The members of this communal bank farm cocoa beans and manioc and also are merchants.

María sells prepared meals; she sells breakfasts, lunches, dinners and a la carte items.  She does her purchases in Chillanes and her sales take place daily in a rented locale.

The loan will help her buy food to cook.  The loan has helped her in such a way that her food sales have increased. She has faced challenges such as her own illnesses, lack of help in the kitchen, and competitive prices.   

Her dream is to have health and life to continue working and getting ahead. In her free time, that is, in the afternoon, she chats with her friends to play cards.

loans.use: to buy meal preparation ingredients.

loans.name: Andre

texts.fr:
Homme marié de 44ans ayant deux enfants dont l'âge varie entre 03ans et 21ans. Il exerce son activité depuis 1985 et avait commencé avec un capital de dix mille Francs CFA, il est vendeur des sacs de voyages, des sacs scolaires pendant la période scolaires et des sacs à main au marché Total à Bacongo, qui est le plus grand marché de Brazzaville. 

Il va utiliser ce prêt pour l'achat des grands stocks de sacs. Pour la croissance de son activité il est toujours à la recherche des produit de la dernière mode au prix bas ensuite il fait des livraisons et vente au domicile de certain client en dehors de son étalage du marché. 

Ses ambitions s'est d'aller à l'étranger pour s'approvisionner afin d'être grossiste. IL veut aussi que ses enfants fassent des grandes études et qu'ils bénéficient d'un héritage. 

IL est très ouvert et gentil avec son entourage et contribue à l'épanouissement de ses voisins.
texts.en:
He is married, 44 years old and has two children who are three and 21 years old. He has been in business since 1985 and started the business with ten thousand cfa francs. He sells luggage, school backpacks during the school year and handbags at the Total market in Bacongo, which is the largest market in Brazzaville.

He is going to use the loan to buy a large quantity of bags. In order to increase business, he is constantly looking for the latest products at a low price and also makes deliveries to certain clients outside of the market. 

His goal is to go abroad to purchase supplies so that he can be a wholesaler. He also wants his children to attend college and benefit from an inheritance.

He is very open and kind to his staff and has contributed to the success of his neighbors.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of bags

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort is married and has four children. Her husband is a farmer. Comfort makes palm oil for sale at Abura. She has been a palm oil extractor for three years. She supports her husband to feed, clothe and educate her children. Her loan will be used to buy large quantities of palm fruit to process for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards building on land.

loans.use: to buy large quantities of palm fruit to process for sale.

loans.name: Richar

texts.es: El señor Richar es empleado  en una empresa maderera como encargado de negocios. El crédito lo requiere para la compra una computadora portátil para realizar mejor su trabajo. Vive en casa de sus padres ubicada en la zona La Lomas en  la ciudad de la ciudad de La Paz; es soltero  y no tiene hijos. Esta es la segunda vez que su solicitud de crédito es canalizada a través de Kiva. Richar sigue estudiando en la Universidad de La Paz ya que con el anterior préstamo de Kiva pudo pagar la matrícula y mensualidades.
texts.en: Richar is employed by a lumber company as the business manager. He requires the loan to purchase a laptop computer to help him do his job. He lives in his parents' house which is located in the region of Las Lomas in the city of La Paz. He is single and he does not have children. It is the second time he requests a loan from Kiva. Richar continues to study university in La Paz. His previous Kiva loan was used to pay for his application and to make the monthly payments.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop to help him do his job.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase baby calves to raise and sell in future.

loans.name: Esforzados Y Valientes Group

texts.en:
Yohanna is the coordinator of the Group Esforzados y Valientes (Hardworking and Brave), located in the city of Samanan. She lives in the beautiful town of Samana with her only child. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity. Yohanna sells clothing and handbags. With this new loan, she is planning to invest in both to expand her inventory.

Yohanna is very excited to receive her first loan from Esperanza International after having successfully repaid her previous loan and thus having taken a step toward expanding her business. Her challenges are to have a successful business and her own house. She is planning to save her profits.

Yohanna is hoping to make her dreams come true, have a prosperous life and a good business. She thanks all of you for your support!

loans.use: to buy clothing and handbags.

loans.name: Flor Margarita

texts.es: La Sra. Flor es casada, tiene 2 hijos de 12 y 8 años de edad; se dedica a la venta de abarrotes ya que cuenta con su propia tienda, empezó este negocio por medio de su cuñado, ya que él le dejo su casa para que vivan en ella; ya cuenta con 4 años en el negocio. El crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de un lote urbano para construir su propia casa; su sueño es ver crecer su negocio y tener su casa propia. La Sra. Flor está muy agradecida por el crédito otorgado.
texts.en:
Flor is married and has two children, ages 12 and 8.  Flor has her own store, and she sells groceries.  She started in this business due to her brother-in law.  He left her his house so that she could live in it.  She has had the business for four years.

The loan is to buy an urban lot in order to build her house.  

Her dreams are to see her business grow and to have her own house.

Flor is very grateful for the loan.

loans.use: to buy an urban lot in order to build her house.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy  tiene 32 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona la actividad que desarrollan es la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.

Nancy desde hace 2 años se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado vacuno (vaca), su corral se encuentra en la parte externa de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos naturales para que tenga una buena producción de leche, la que ofrece a los mismos pobladores de la zona o lo lleva a vender al mercado de Piura, cuenta con clientela fija por la buena calidad de leche que tiene, con sus ingresos solventa sus obligaciones familiares.  

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar más alimentos balanceados para que se incremente la producción de la leche de vaca y así podrá ofrecerlo aun mejor precio para poder cubrir su crédito otorgado y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Nancy es una persona trabajadora y responsable que lo único que quiere es que con el negocio que tiene poderle brindar a sus hijos otras oportunidades académicas.
texts.en:
Nancy is 32 years old. She lives with her husband and children in their own home, which has water and electricity.  Their home is located in the rural area of Tambogrande, which belongs to the department of Piura.  People in this area are engaged in agriculture, raising livestock, and artisanal activities. 

For the past two years, Virginia has been raising and selling cattle (cows).  Her corral is located outside her house.  She feeds them nutritionally balanced feed and natural grasses to promote good milk production.  She sells the milk to residents of the area and also sells it at the Piura market.   She has regular customers due to the good quality of her milk and uses her income to pay for her family’s expenses.

She is requesting a loan of 1000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy nutritionally balanced feed in order to increase the production of cow’s milk.  This will enable her to sell it at an even better price in order to cover the cost of the loan as well as improve her family’s quality of life.  Nancy is hard-working and responsible.  The only thing she wants is to be able to use the income from her business to provide more academic opportunities for her children.

loans.use: to buy more nutritionally balanced feed for her animals.

loans.name: Eloisa

texts.es:
La señora Eloísa es socia del banco comunal Los Manguitos del Distrito Yarinacocha, Departamento D. Ucayali, tiene 54 años D. edad, está casada y tien cinco hijos, solo uno D. sus hijos se encuentra a su cargo.
Es fundadora D. este banco comunal, se dedica a la venta D. productos D. belleza por catálogo y lo viene haciendo desD. hace muchos años.  Su préstamo inicial fue D.  S/.300.00 nuevos soles.
Con su nuevo préstamo D. S/. 1,500.00 nuevos soles  comprará: 3 shampoo, 2 talcos, 2 cremas para manos, 2 perfumes para damas, 2 lápiz labiales, 2 lápiz delineadores, 1 crema liporeductora, 3 perfumes para hombres.
Su esposo es mecánico D. profesión y es el que mantiene el hogar, los ingresos que genera con la venta D. sus productos son para ella y lo distribuye como lo crea conveniente, D. ésta forma ayuda económicamente a su esposo.
Manuela Ramos le ayudo para comenzar su negocio y está contenta porque tiene su pequeño capital y lo está sabiendo invertir.
texts.en:
Eloísa is a member of the 'Los Manguitos' community bank which is located in Yarinacocha district, in Ucayali department.  She is 54 years old, married, and has five children.  Only one of her children is still in her care.  Eloísa is a founding member of her community bank.  Her business is selling beauty products through a catalog and she has been in the business for many years.  Her initial loan was for 300 soles.

With this new loan for 1,500 soles, Eloísa will buy: 3 lots of shampoo, 2 lots of talcum powder, 2 lots of handcream, 2 lots of ladies' perfume, 2 lots of lipsticks, 2 lots of lip pencils, 1 lot of lipo-reduction cream and three lots of men's perfume.

Eloísa's husband is a mechanic by traD. and he supports their household.  The income that Eloísa makes from selling her products is for her and she uses it as she sees fit.  In this way, she helps her husband financially.

Manuela Ramos helped Eloísa to start her business and she is happy because she has her small amount of capital and she is investing it wisely.

loans.use: to buy talcum powder and creams

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Mrs. Ly is a 51-year-old low-income woman who lives in Kompong Speu province.  Mrs. Ly is married with three children, one of whom is single and works as a driver in Phnom Penh city. The other two are already married and have started new homes. 

To earn a living, Mrs. Ly has been planting rice on her existing farmland for years. Mrs. Ly can generally earn an income of about $0.75 USD per day. She also depends on an income from her husband and her son. To increase her profit, Mrs. Ly would like to request a loan from Kiva to buy some pigs for breeding for future sale. In the future, she wishes to increase her income from her pig-raising business.

loans.use: to buy some pigs for breeding.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add stock of clothes

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 23 years old and has three children. She has a common-law husband and has two children who are in school.

Myrna is in the agricultural business farming vegetables in the Philippines. Myrna requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Myrna has been farming vegetables for a year now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain her little business.

In the future, Myrna would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Tausi

texts.en: Tausi used the previous loan progressively and managed to buy hair dryers and cosmetics which she has been using in her salon. However, she has a challenge of limited capital. Her dream is to have the most popular beauty parlor. Tausi needs the loan to buy cosmetics to use in her salon as we approach the Christmas season when she is targeting many customers.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to use in her salon.

loans.name: Juan Ruperto

texts.es:
El Señor Juan, tiene 64 años de edad, es casado desde hace 30 años, tiene 3 hijos, reside en la comunidad rural de Bella Vista del Municipio de San Marcos, Santa Bárbara.
Vive en compañía de su esposa y sus 3 hijos, su hijo menor esta estudiando la educación primaria. Don Juan se ha dedicado toda su vida a la agricultura, produciendo granos básicos y hortalizas.
Él ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de insumos como fertilizantes y pesticidas para brindarle un mejor manejo a sus cultivos y mejorar la calidad de la cosecha de maíz y frijoles.
Don Juan espera aumentar sus ingresos al mejorar  su producción y vender a un buen precio sus productos.
texts.en:
Juan, 64, has been married for 30 years; he has three children and lives in the community of Bella Vista in San Marcos Municipality, Santa Bárbara, with his wife and three children.  His youngest son is going to elementary school.  Juan has been a farmer his entire life growing basic grains and vegetables.

He has requested a loan to buy supplies like fertilizer and pesticide to provide better crop care and improve his corn and bean harvests.  Juan expects to increase his income when production improves and he sells his products at a good price.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.name: Sinuu

texts.en:
Sinuu, 52, is a married woman with nine children.

Sinuu owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale. She has two years of experience in this business. Sinuu needs a loan of WST 1,500 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 500 WST or US $208 per week) to improve the general living conditions of her family.

In 2010, Sinuu joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Sinuu's second loan with SPBD. 

*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers. Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale out of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the overall social metric score.  For example, a 3 out of 3 on "level of education" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.  

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on Kiva to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.

loans.use: To purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxone.

loans.name: Bernadeta

texts.en: Bernadeta is married to Samuel, and they three children.  She has been operating a retail shop in Kitengela for the past year, and earns a monthly profit of KES 10,000. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend, and has applied for her first loan of  KES 20,000.
