She plans to use the money to buy stock for her shop like maize flour, wheat flour, rice, and soft drinks.  She will save the anticipated profits, and hopes to expand her business and open a big wholesale shop in the future.

loans.use: to buy stock for her shop like maize flour, wheat flour, rice, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Clarisse Ursule

texts.fr:
Cliente âgée de 37 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants, elle a deja  bénéficié de plusieurs crédits qui lui ont permis d'être autonome , elle ne prend plus a crédit, elle a son propre capital, elle achète ses cartons de poissons sales chez les grossistes Ouest Africains et parfois elle fait ses commandes a Pointe Noire.

A l'heure actuelle, les difficultés qu'elle rencontre c'est la hausse des produits  et la concurrence rude sur le marche.

Avec ce nouveau prêt , elle va renforcer son stock en ajoutant de 10 cartons de morues, 10 cartons de soles, 5 cartons de thons et de capitaines.
Tres combattante, elle veut commencer a faire la vente de poissons en gros et demi gros.
Elle continue d'épargner et contribue largement a l'épanouissement de sa famille.
texts.en: This client is 37 years old, married, and the mother of three children. She has already had several loans that enabled her to be autonomous. She is no longer buying on credit. She has her own capital. She buys her boxes of salted fish from West African wholesalers, and sometimes she makes special orders at Pointe Noire. Currently, the difficulties she encounters involve the rise in [the price of] products and the rough market competition. With this new loan, she is going to bolster her stock by adding 10 boxes of cod, 10 boxes of sole, 5 boxes of tuna, and some capitaines (a kind of river fish). With a fighter’s spirit, she wants to start selling fish wholesale to retailers and wholesale to the pubic. She continues to save money and greatly help her family to thrive.

loans.use: to buy boxes of salted fish: sole, cod, and tuna

loans.name: Turizeranye Group

texts.fr:
Isadora est une commerçante de boutique (savons, riz, sel, haricôt, etc) depuis4 ans, âgé de54 ans.
Il habite à Songa et il est marié à Juvénal. Le couple a 1 enfant de 28 ans, il est fonctionnaire. Isadora a étudié jusqu’en 6è  année primaire.
Avant de se lancer dans son activité actuelle, elle était vendeuse de bière industrielle et Fanta.
Le crédit kiva qu’il bénéficie, lui permet d’augmenter son capital, il pourra augmenter la quantité d’articles de sa boutique (savons, riz, haricôt, sel, etc)
Il est membre du groupe communautaire « Turizeranye ».
texts.en:
Isidora has been a shopkeeper (soaps, rice, salt, beans, etc.) for 4 years. She is 54 years old. She lives in Songa and she is married to Juvénal. The couple has one 28-year-old child who is a civil servant. Isadora studied up to the 6th year of primary school. Before beginning her current business, she sold industrial beer and Fanta. 

The loan from which she is benefitting will allow her to increase her capital. She will be able to increase the number of items in her shop (soaps, rice, beans, salt, etc.). She is a member of the Turizeranye community group.

loans.use: to increase her capital and be able to increase the number of items in her shop (soaps, rice, beans, salt, etc.).

loans.name: Srey's Group

texts.en:
Srey is forty, married and has three children. She lives in a village in the Sa Ang district of Cambodia.

Srey is a farmer who has grown rice for nearly twenty years. She has been with VisionFund for two years and has successfully paid back her loans. The loans have helped her create a better life. Her group of two members is now applying for a 2,000,000 KHR loan with VFC.

As the leader of the group, Srey plans to use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to grow her rice healthfully and so increase its yield.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: Maribel es socia del Banco Comunal Paloma, tiene 25 años, se dedica a la venta de cereales y siembra en la chacra, es madre de 1 hija, Maribel es hija única, y siempre apoya a su mamá porque es analfabeta, Maribel viaja con ella para ayudarle, se siente muy bien en Finca Perú ya que le ayuda a ella como a su mamá, los préstamo que les dan les enseñan a que sea invertido con sabiduría, aprende mucho, así como la forma de criar a su hija, gracias a Finca Perú y los préstamos recibidos pudo comprar un terreno, ahora con el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de cereales.
texts.en: Maribel is a member of the Paloma community bank.  She is 25 years old.  Her business is selling cereals and sowing crops on her farm.  She has one daughter.  Maribel is an only daughter and she always supports her mom because she is illiterate.  Maribel travels with her mom in order to help her.  She feels very happy to be part of Finca Peru as they help both her and her mom.  They teach her to invest the loans that they give her wisely.  She learns a lot, including how to raise her daughter.  Thanks to Finca Peru and the loans she has received from them, she has been able to buy a plot of land.  She will use this loan to invest in buying cereals.

loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: Fanta's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est créé depuis novembre 2012.Il est composé de membres qui habitent le même quartier,elles ont comme activité le commerce.

ADJI qui se trouve à droite de la photo et levant le bras est la responsable du groupe,elle est mariée et mére de 03 enfants.

Son activité est le commerce de chaussures  et de parfums.

Avec son prêt,elle compte acheter 15 paires de chaussures  pour une valeur de 26500f et du parfum pour une valeur de 23500f.

Son objectif est d'augmenter son épargne et de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
This group was established in November 2012. It is made up of women who live in the same neighborhood. Their main business is retail.

Adji is responsible for the group. She's the woman raising her hand on the right in the photograph. She's married and the mother of three children.

Her business consists in selling shoes and perfumes. She intends to use her loan to buy 15 pairs of shoes for XOF 26'500, and perfume for XOF 23'500.

Her goal is to increase her savings and provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy 15 pairs of shoes and perfume

loans.name: Maria Reyna

texts.en:
Maria Reyna is from Queretaro and her business is perfume sales. She sells her products door to door and gives credit to her clients. Maria has business with more than 50 people and they buy her merchandise frequently. She has two years of experience in this business.

Maria is married and has one daughter who has juvenile diabetes (she is 14 years old). This causes Maria to be dependent on the health of her daughter and also requires her to buy insulin for her daughter monthly.

Maria Reyna is requesting a loan of US$ 925 to invest in more merchandise in order to be prepared for the upcoming Christmas season. She has in mind a project to establish her own store because she is currently working at home.

**This text has been translated from the original business description.**

María Reyna es originaria de Querétaro y se dedica a la comercialización de Perfumes y esencias. Ella trabaja vendiendo casa por casa, su mercancía en abonos, y cuenta con una cartera de más de 50 clientes, a quienes le surte sobre pedido la fragancia a veces perfume de marca, en ocasiones esencia de perfume. Cuenta con mas de 2 años de experiencia como comerciante, esta casada y tiene una hija con diabetes juvenil (14 años), esto ha ocasionado que María Reyna, tenga que estar al pendiente de la salud de su hija y tener que gastar mensualmente en la compra de insulina. María Reyna esta solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US$ 925 a 6 meses para poder surtirse y estar preparada para las ventas de la temporada navideña que se avecina. Tiene como proyecto a futuro poder establecerse mas formalmente pues ahora trabaja en su propio domicilio y vende casa por casa su mercancía.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Mama E. has a stone-cracking site with employees who help her to crack stones in large quantities. She sells the cracked stones to constructors and individuals. She has a problem with buying stones in bulk for cracking. This has led to her employees leaving the job. She is in need and seeking a loan of $1000 from Kiva to enable her to buy more stones.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Teresia Njambi Kamau would like to buy six bales of clothes

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth U. is a woman of integrity. She honours what Lift Above Poverty Organization has done in her life, especially for her family, making her able to pay her rent and her children's school fees. Elizabeth sells fairly used clothes to the public. She hopes to be able to expand her business if given a Kiva loan of $400 to buy more bales of used clothes for resale.

loans.use: To buy more fairly used clothes for resale

loans.name: Kofissi

texts.fr:
Mrs. Kofissi G., 33, is mother of four children and has five other people for whom she is responsible. Her husband is without viable financial resources, so the whole burden of providing for the family rests with her.

A courageous and enterprising woman, Kofissi works hard every day to support her children. Her first two loans were reimbursed without problem. As micro-businesses, she raises farm animals and sells basic grocery products. Her great ambition is now to open a little grocery store. Since she has no capital for this micro-business, she is now asking for a loan of US$ 1000 to allow her to make her dream a reality.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Agée de 33 ans, Madame G. Kofissi est mère de quatre (4) enfants et a à sa charge cinq (5) autres personnes. Le mari étant sans emploi rémunérateur viable, toute les charges de la famille se repose sur la femme.

Femme courageuse et entreprenante, elle se bat au quotidien pour nourrir ses enfants. Ses deux premiers crédits ont été bien remboursés sans aucun incident. Elle fait de l’élevage et le commerce des produits d’alimentation générale. Aujourd’hui son ambition est grande : ouvrir une boutique d’alimentation générale. Faute de moyens, elle sollicite un crédit de $1000 pour la réalisation de ce projet.

loans.use: open a little grocery store selling basic necessities

loans.name: Fuatia Ah

texts.en:
Fuatia is living near the town area, and she is one of the new members in the program. This is her first loan, and she is very proud to be one of the 3,000 ladies within the program that run their own businesses.

The husband does not work, and he is the one who is going fishing. She is 37 years of age, and she is supporting four kids that are all in school. One of her dreams is for her kids to have better education and have good futures.

loans.use: To buy a torch, hooks, strings and other supplies for her fishing business.

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.es:
Her hard-working and energetic business spirit urged Benedicta to open a small shop where she sells sweets and beverages in her town’s plaza. She sells a wide variety of products to the crowds that pass through the city’s main streets every day. Both natives and tourists of the city frequently travel through Santa Ana plaza, where her store is located; realizing this, Benedicta’s wish is to broaden and increase the variety of her merchandise, so that she can provide better and more complete services to her customers. Having done this, she hopes to open a food store in the same area in the future. To reach this goal, she is turning to your selfless support and requesting a loan that she will invest in widening and broadening her stock of merchandise so that she can improve her family’s economic situation a little at a time and, above all, support her youngest daughter with her education.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Su espíritu de trabajo y su animosidad en el comercio, impulsaron a Benedicta a abrir un pequeño puestito de venta de dulces y bebidas en la plaza de su localidad, en el que ofrece variedad de productos para la multitud de personas que transitan diariamente por las calles principales de su ciudad.La plaza de Santa Ana, lugar en que el está ubicado su acogedora tiendita, es muy concurrida y visitada por los pobladores y también por los turistas, esto ha sido muy bien percibido por Benedicta, razón por la cual su deseo es ampliar y aumentar aún más la variedad de su mercadería, con el afán de brindar un mejor y completo servicio a sus visitantes; para que en el futuro pueda aperturar un puesto de comida en esta misma zona. Para alcanzar este propósito recurre a vuestro apoyo desinteresado y solicita un préstamo que los invertirá para ampliar y aumentar el stock de su mercadería y así poco a poco busca mejorar su situación económica familiar y sobre todo apoyar a su hija menor en su formación académica.

loans.use: Purchase greater variety and quantity of products to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Gloria Leticia

texts.es:
Gloria A. is the mother of a 10-year-old boy. She is currently separated from her husband since he would hit her and her son. This is why she had to start a new life with her son, selling shoes among her family members, neighbors, and others. This is how she makes money to support her son.

However, the car in which she travels to sell her products had its tires punctured, so she can't go out anymore to sell shoes. She also lives with her sister-in-law, and she would like to move out because she feels like a burden. This is why she is requesting a loan of $750 that she will repay in 6 months. With this money, she will be able to repair her car so she can go out to sell shoes. She will save the profits she makes to rent a room where she can live with her son. With your help, Gloria will be able to rise above this problem.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Gloria A. es madre de un pequeño de 10 años, y actualmente se encuentra separada de su pareja, puesto que ésta los golpeaba, es por eso que Gloria tuvo que comenzar una vida nueva con su hijo, vendiendo zapatos entre sus familiares, vecinos y recomendados, y así poder sacar dinero para los gastos de su hijo.

Sin embargo el carro en el que sale a vender sus productos se le poncharon las llantas y por lo tanto no puede salir a vender los zapatos. Además de que vive con su cuñada, lo cual ya quiere dejar de hacerlo puesto que se siente una carga. Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $750 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Gloria podrá reparar su carro para así poder salir a vender zapatos, y con las ganancias obtenidas poder juntar dinero para poder rentar un cuarto para que vivan Gloria y su hijo. Con tu ayuda Gloria podrá salir delante de este problema.

loans.use: To repair her car so she can sell shoes

loans.name: Thi Bich Thuy

texts.vi:
Mrs Thuỷ is 31. She is a teacher at a primary school in Trung Nghĩa village. Her husband, Vinh, owns a shop that fabricates wooden furniture. They applied to Binh Minh cdc (SEDA) for a loan because of the possibility to pay back in installments. This loan, 150 USD, will be used to buy woodworking tools. They will be able to pay back the loan with the income from this business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Thuỷ, 31 tuổi, là giáo viên cấp 1 tại 1 trường thuộc xã Trung Nghĩa. Anh Vinh, chồng chị là chủ xưởng sản xuất đồ thủ công mỹ nghê. Số tiền 2006000đ vay được dùng để mua dụng cụ làm nghề cho anh Vinh. Gia đình chị rất thích vay vốn ở Chương trình Tài chính vi mô Binhminh cdc vì được trả góp hàng tuần. Với số tiền lãi thu được từ việc bán sản phẩm, anh chị có thể dễ dàng trả nợ.

loans.use: To buy woodworking tools.

loans.name: Cruz Luciano

texts.es:
Cruz Luciano is 34 years old, married, and has one 4-year old child. He lives in Villa Reconciliación, a poor, semirural area with unpaved streets. 10 years ago he began a business selling car parts, and with the income he was able to expand his service. Today he sells lubricants, rims, tires, and has a tire service, where he repairs rims and tires. This business has enabled him to pay his household expenses. His wife helps by selling refreshments (beverages) from their home.

The business has a good location which enables him to get a good number of customers. The products Cruz offers are in high demand by taxis, buses, trucks, and cars, so he should have an amply supply on hand to meet the demands for his services. This loan will help him maintain his business and meet his customers’ demands.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Cruz Luciano tiene 34 años de edad, es casado, tiene 1 hijo de 4 años, habita en el asentamiento de Villa Reconciliación, siendo esta una zona semirural, pobre, con calles sin pavimentar. Hace 10 años, inicia su negocio de venta de repuestos de vehículos, con el tiempo el mismo negocio le permitió expandirse, hoy en día cuenta con venta de lubricantes, llantas, neumáticos y tiene el servicio de vulcanización, en donde reparan llantas y neumáticos, esta actividad económica le ha permitido cubrir todos los gastos del hogar, su esposa para ayudarlo con todas las obligaciones que tienen que cumplir, vende refrescos en su vivienda.

El negocio se encuentra en una buena ubicación, lo que le permite captar un buen número de clientes. Los productos que ofrece el señor son bien demandados por taxis, buses, camiones y carros particulares, por lo tanto debe de contar con un buen numero de existencia para poder satisfacer la necesidad de dicho servicio, este préstamo le ayudara a mantener su negocio con lo que los clientes requieran.

loans.use: Buy lubricants, brake fluid, tires and rims

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es:
Lucy is a 36-year-old mother of three. She provides services in her beauty center. She is very grateful to the practice and experience she has gained. It has allowed her to create her own work space in her home. There is a great demand for her services, and thus she has decided to relocate to establish a comprehensive center that will meet her clients' needs.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Lucy de 36 años es madre de tres hijos, se dedica a brindar servicios en su centro de belleza e imagen personal, gracias a la práctica y experiencia que ganó puso en su propio domicilio su centro de trabajo.Posee una gran demanda y ha decidido mudarse para poner un centro de belleza integral, con todos y cada uno de los servicios que hoy en día solicitan sus clientes.

loans.use: To rent a larger space to establish her new work center

loans.name: Cori Sandra

texts.es:
The lady Cori belongs to “Las Shipibas” Communal Bank, located on Jr. Calleria 445 of the District of Calleria of the Department of Ucayali. She is 20 years old and a single woman. With the first loan of 300 soles received from Manuela Branches Cori decided to invest in a small store of hair colors.

Currently her business has grown. She rises very early to attend her business. With the cordial and kind treatment that she gives her clients, they remain very satisfied.

With this loan of 800 soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy colors of different brands, shampoos, creams, cosmetics, etc.

Cori is a very enterprising young woman. With her loans she is paying for her studies and capitalizing on her business in order to be able to continue progressing.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Cori pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Shipibas, ubicado en el Jr. Calleria 445, D. Distrito de Calleria D. Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 20 años, es soltera. Cori con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en una pequeña tienda de tintes para el pelo.

En la actualidad su negocio ha crecido, se levanta muy temprano para atender su negocio, con el trato amable y cordial que da sus clientes quedan muy satisfechos.

Con este préstamo de S/.800, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará tintes de diferentes marcas, champús, cremas, cosméticos, etc.

Cori es una joven muy emprendedora, con sus prestamos esta pagando sus estudios, y capitalizándose en su negocio para así poder seguir progresando.

loans.use: To buy hair colors, cosmetics, creams, shampoo, etc for her business.

loans.name: Nimu

texts.en:
Mrs. Nimu A., 40 years old, is a tailor in the town of Kulashwor in Kathmandu. She opened her tailoring shop 4 years ago. Her specialty is making custom-fitted ladies dresses and school uniforms for both boys and girls. She prefers to make popular dresses like Kurta Sulwar, Blouses, Ladies long dresses, Makhshi (long ladies’ dresses) and others. Before starting her own business, Mrs. A. took a 6 month training course in tailoring.

Mrs. A. plans to use the loan of Rs 15000.00 to buy raw materials for her tailoring work. She wants to add to her family's income and support her children's education. Her husband's name is Kapil Dev A. and he is a taxi driver. She has two daughters.The youngest daughter is in grade 2 and the oldest daughter is in grade 4.

loans.use: Nimu would like to buy raw material for her tailor shop.

loans.name: Numon

texts.en:
B. Numon is 53 years old. He is married with 5 children.
Numon provides taxi services with his car. He has been in this business for about 20 years and it is the main source of income for his large family. Numon works hard, he gets up early and goes to bed late, trying not to lose any client. The business is successful and generates stable income for Numon's large family and his mother and father. However, the business also needs some funding. Numon plans to fix his car to provide higher quality services to make more profit in order to send his daughter to university. Numon requests 2000 Somoni ($600 USD) for the term of 9 months. He is planning to purchase spare parts for his car. He thanks all for supporting him and promises to manage the loan with accuracy in time.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for the car.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase clothing to add to her stock.

loans.name: Alawia

texts.en:
Alawia is 30 years old, married, and has three children aged 6, 4, and 7 months. She has sold juice since 2006. She works every day from 8 am to 8 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $25 from her sales.
 
Alawia is now requesting a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Amina's Mkorofi Si Mwenzetu Group

texts.en:
Amina, 47, married with five children ranging in age from 24 to 14, has been a milk seller since 2001. She works daily from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. and can earn a monthly profit of about $125 from her sales.

Amina is now requesting a loan to buy more milk for resale in order to expand her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members who have businesses in clothing sales, juice sales and tailoring services.

loans.use: To buy more milk for resale in order to expand her business.

loans.name: Chen

texts.en:
Chen H. is a widowed farmer and lives with four of her children in the Prey Veng, Cambodia. She grows various kinds of vegetables to earn a living and is able to make about US$8 each day. She is aided by two of her children who are employed by an organization in the village. Two other children are students. She said on average, she spends around US$45 on food and US$25 on children's education.

Chen H. has requested a loan from Kiva via CREDIT, a local partner, for US$1200 to breed cows for sale. For her future plans, she wants to breed more cows for sale, as well as to produce baby cows. She said she will work hard for her children's education. She also plans to build a new house.

loans.use: To breed cows for sale.

loans.name: Utkir

texts.en:
A. Utkir is 28 years old, married and has two kids. Utkir was born and raised in Shahristan, Tajikistan, where he cultivates wheat and different kinds of vegetables. He has worked in agriculture for many years and gained much experience. Utkir's large family helps him with his business. He lives with his parents, brothers, and sisters. Utkir dreams of having his own house as his children are growing up. He worries about their future. 

He will invest his loan of 500 (150 USD) in buying fuel, lubricants, and bags for the upcoming potato planting season. With the help of a loan he can earn more income and make his dreams come true.

loans.use: to purchase bags, fuel, and lubricants

loans.name: Olesya

texts.en:
Olesya is 28 years old, married, and has one small son. She sells women's underwear and bathrobes at Vasilievka market. Her working capital is 16,000 UAH.

Olesya is new to business. She only started six months ago. She was advised to start business by her sister, who sells her goods in the next booth and has more experience in business. Her sister helped her to get the loan and gives some advice as to what to buy and how to sell. 

Olesya is a hardworking and responsible person. She believes she can make her business grow. Olesya would like to get a loan of 1,500 UAH for six weeks to buy more women's underwear to sell during the Christmas season. She hopes to receive additional income and better provide for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory

loans.name: Ildephonse

texts.en:
Greetings from Ildephonse M. in Rwamagana, in the Eastern province of Rwanda! Ildephonse is 40 years old, married with 4 children.

Mr. M. operates a shop selling various food items such as beans, maize, etc. This entrepreneur hires a small truck, which helps him to carry his products to his store.

He is requesting a loan worth 500,000 Rwf that will help him to increase his stock because he has got new customers in town. Furthermore, he says that this loan will increase his profit and will enable him to satisfy the needs of his customers.

loans.use: Increase his inventory of food products

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
ROSA R. D. R., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Sol Naciente”, ubicado en el Jr. Jhon F. Kennedy N° 1085 del Distrito D. Callería, tiene 62 años D. edad, 01 hijo, su esposo compra madera y venD..

Su primer préstamo D. S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró un poco D. triplay confeccionó esteras y ponía a la ventalos pollos que criaba, poco a poco sus clientes solicitaban más el producto.

Con este préstamo D. S/.2,000.00 compró 500 pollos bb y sus alimentos, virutas, para que se calienten los pollitos, pero continúa con la confección D. esteras.

Agradece a Manuela Ramos por el gran apoyo que le brinda.
texts.en:
ROSA R. D. R. is a member of the “Sol Naciente” microfinance institute, located on John F. Kennedy Street N° 1085, in the district of Callería. She is 62 years old, has 1 son, and her husband buys and sells lumber for a living.

With her first 300.00 PEN loan, she purchased a bit of three-ply, maD. mats, and sold the chickens that she was raising. Little by little, her customers kept requesting her products.

With this 2,000.00 PEN loan, she purchased 500 chicks and wood shavings to keep them warm. She is still making mats as well. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for its support.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase 500 chicks and wood shavings

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en: Mercedita C., 40, married, is a residnet of  Laligan, Valencia City, Bukidnon. She is engaged in fish vending for the past two years.  Her business started with a small amount of money she borrowed from her relatives. Later, she was  able to access  a loan from HSPFI.  Mercedita needs additiona capital amounting to  PHP11,000 to increase the volume of her sales. She aspires to become a rice trader and a soft-drink dealer in the future.

loans.use: To purchase  fish  for  sale.

loans.name: Cordelia

texts.en:
Cordelia sells foodstuffs and drinks. She hopes to expand her business and meet the demands of her customers.

She needs the loan amount of N70000 to purchase a generator and a deep freezer. This, she says, will enable her meet the demands of her customers.

She is 38 years old and married with four children. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase a deep freezer and a generator

loans.name: Remalyn

texts.en:
Remalyn C. is a young business woman who perseveres a lot in order to have a progressive life. She is 23 years old and manages a hog raising business. Aside from that, she also engages in direct selling to further support the feed supply of her hogs.

She strives so hard so she can help her parents send her other siblings to school. Now, for the continuous operation of her small enterprises, she requests a loan of PHP 4,000 for additional business capital. She is very optimistic that she will become successful in the business even though there are many competitors.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.en:
Charlotte A. is 22 years old. She is single and she lives with her mother and younger siblings in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town called Achiase, near Akim Oda, in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Charlotte works to make some income to provide for the family.  She supports her mother financially and helps meet her younger siblings’ demands.

She is a trader. She prepares and sells pastries such as meat pies, doughnuts, and chips. Charlotte distributes to retailers in her community. She procures her goods from wholesalers in Oda and other nearby towns. She has been in business for two years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To procure food in bulk for distribution to retailers

loans.name: Neema

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 31 year-old Neema N. from Mwanza. She is married with four children between the ages of 5 and 11 years old. Neema has been running a maize business since 2007. Neema’s business is to sell maize from the village to town at a higher price. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 6 days per week. Neema currently earns about 159USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400USD in order to purchase maize and to increase her stock. In the future, she plans to open another business. Neema thanks you for her support!

ABOUT SELFINA!
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase maize to increase her stock.

loans.name: Sehar Zafar Asghar Group

texts.en:
Zahida baji wants a loan to buy vehicle spare parts to sell. Parveen akhtar baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Another Parveen akhtar baji wants a loan to buy fruits for her fruit-selling business. Ameer baji wants a loan to buy material (beads, colored thread and clothes) for her decorative embroidery business.

Sehar baji is the group leader of these above mentioned ladies. They all belong to a city named Multan, Pakistan. Multan city is famous for its shrines. They all are very responsible and hardworking ladies. They handle their own businesses and support their families. Sehar baji operates a business sewing clothes to pay for utilities. Her husband works in a factory for a monthly wage. Sehar baji wants a loan to buy an electric sewing machine so that she is able to complete orders on time and earn a good income.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy an electric sewing machine for sewing clothes

loans.name: Philomina

texts.en: Philomina sells eggs and sarongs. She is 41 years old, married, and has four children. She hopes for a loan of NGN 80,000 to purchase more eggs and sarongs to sell. She is thankful for Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more eggs and sarongs to sell

loans.name: Reine

texts.fr:
KOUSSOUHO Reine est mère de deux enfants, âgés de trois ans et de  six mois.  Reine est mariée à NOUDJENOUNME  Jean, qui est chauffeur de taxi.  Reine habite avec sa famille à Cotonou, la ville la plus grande du Bénin.  

À Cotonou, Reine vend  de tomates, piments, oignons, légumes, qui sont utilisés pour préparer les sauces des plats Béninois.  Reine vend dans sa boutique au bord de la rue.  Reine achète ses produits au Marché Houejbo à Cotonou.  Dans le future, Reine voudrait vendre ses produits en gros, mais actuellement Reine n’a pas les moyens financiers nécessaire.  Pour augmenter le volume de son activité, Reine cherche un prêt de ALIDé.
texts.en:
KOUSSOUHO Reine is the mother of two children, ages six months to 3 years old. She is married to NOUDJENOUNME Jean, a taxi driver, and lives with her family in Cotonou, the largest city in Benin. In Cotonou, Reine sells tomatoes, chili peppers, onions, and legumes that are used in making sauces for Beninese dishes. She sells in a shop on the roadside. She buys her goods at the Houejbo Market in Cotonou. In the future, she would like to sells her goods wholesale, but currently she does not have the necessary financial means. To increase her business volume, Reine is seeking a loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tomatoes, chilis, onions, etc.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret G. is married and has three children. She has received schooling through junior high school. Margaret sells clothes and shoes in Abura, which she has done since 1991. She carries the clothing on the head and moves from place to place selling them. Her husband is a driver. Margaret uses her income to pay fees and buy clothing for the children. Margaret will use the loan to buy more shoes and clothes for resale. Margaret plans to re-invest the new profits from her expanded business.

loans.use: To buy more shoes and clothes to sell

loans.name: Leone

texts.en:
Leone I. is a 34-year-old woman living in the town of Satapuala. She is married and has 3 young children. To make a living, Leone makes and sells baked goods in the local community. Leone has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 400 WST a month from these activities.

Leone joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leone has successfully repaid a previous loan from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Leone is now requesting a new loan of 1500 WST which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be Leone's 3rd loan from SPBD. Leone plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Olímpia Vânia

texts.pt:
Olímpia Vânia nasceu na cidade de Maputo, tem 24 anos de idade, freqüentou a 10 classe, solteira e mãe de um filho de 6anos. Para alem do filho, sustente seu sobrinho e uma irmã sob sua responsabilidade.  

Em 1992 saiu de Maputo para viver na Matola juntamente com sua família, onde se encontra até então.
Olímpia é comerciante a tempo inteiro, dona do seu negócio. Trabalha a 4 anos sozinha e sem empregados.

Aprendeu através de uma Senhora amiga em Maputo já tem 8 anos de experiência de. Vende roupa de cama e outros artigos de tecido (Duves, lençóis, cortinas e outros artigos). Compra uma parte dos produtos na áfrica do sul a 1.500,00MT e vende a 3.000,00MT. O seu rendimento mensal é de 12.000,00MT que aplica no sustento da família e ainda poupa algum valor no final de Mês. Não tem casa própria.

Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku-Adsema no valor de 11.000,00MT. Pretende comprar diversos artigos de tecido (lençóis, duves, cortinas e outros). Nunca teve outros empréstimos noutras instituições, conheceu a Hluvuku-Adsema graças a uma amiga que tinha levantado Credito na instituição. Ela acha que o seu negocio poderá crescer com o aumento de volume de mercadoria.

 São desafios os custos aduaneiros bem como os próprios funcionários das alfândegas que podem desviar seus produtos quando ela não tem valores para poder pagar. Propõe se a pagar o empréstimo sem problemas. Com o sucesso do negocio pensa em construir casa própria e responder as necessidades da família que tanto precisa e para tal conta com kiva para mais empréstimos.
Projeta, para futuro, r ser médica e proprietária de um salão de cabeleireiro.
texts.en:
Olímpia Vânia was born in the city of Maputo. She is 24 years old. She attended school until 10th grade, and she's the single mother of a 6-year-old boy. In addition to her son, she also supports her nephew and a sister. In 1992 she left Maputo to live in Matola with her family, and she's still there. Olímpia is a full-time shopkeeper, owner of her own business. She's worked for four years by herself, without any employees. She learned business from a friend in Maputo and has 8 years of experience. She sells bedsheets and other cloth goods (duvets, handkerchiefs, curtains, etc.). She buys some of her products in South Africa at 1500 meticals and sells them at 3000 meticals. She earns 12,000 meticals a month, which she uses to support her family. She is also able to save a little each month. This is her first loan with Hluvuku-Adsema, in the amount of 11,000 meticals. She will use it to stock her store. She's never had loans from other institutions. She heard about Hluvuku-Adsema through a friend who had received a loan from the organization. She believes her business will be able to expand with an increase in the quantity and variety of goods she stocks. Customs fees are a major challenge, since customs officials can send deny her products entry when she doesn't have the money to pay them. She intends to pay back her loan in full without any problems. With her business's success, she hopes to build her own house and meet her family's needs. She is counting on Kiva for additional loans. It the future, she'd like to be a doctor and own a beauty salon.

Translated from Portuguese by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her shop

loans.name: Akkajja Omunaku Nabojjo Lonah Group

texts.en:
Lonah N. is forty-five years old. She is married and has seven children. She also cares for four dependents, three of whom go to school. 

Lonah has been selling rice for over three years. She is requesting a loan to add capital to her rice business so she can increase her stock and her profits. She is a promising, hard-working businesswoman whose dream is to construct a house.

loans.use: To buy rice

loans.name: Poni

texts.en:
Poni C., age 42, is a vendor of various food items, such as tomatoes and paste. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase onions to sell in addition to her current offerings. Poni's husband is a businessman. They have nine children, all of whom go to school. With the extra profits she expects from her loan, she hopes to be able to continue to be able to pay tuition fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase onions to sell
